body: On November 10, 2014 at approximately 2222 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance.  When I arrived on scene the victim stated that her live in boyfriend punched her in the face twice then left her residence. Warrants were taken out on the suspect at this time.

On 11-10-2014, at 0238 hours, I was dispatched to Moses Cone Hospital in Greensboro in reference to an assault that occurred in High Point around midnight.  I made contact with Jodie Mcdade who stated that she was assaulted by her former boyfriend, Everett Beck, while she was dropping him off at his home located at 1047 E Springfield Road in High Point.  Mcdade sustained minor injuries to her face and neck.  A warrant for arrest was obtained on Beck, for assault on a female, and he was arrested outside of the E Springfield address.  Beck is also wanted out of Danville, Virginia for shooting into an occupied dwelling, and is being held in the High Point jail on a fugitive from justice warrant.  Beck`s bond is $100,000 secured.
On 11-09-2014 I responded to 516 Cable Street in reference to an assault.  Upon arrival I spoke with April Love who advised she had been assaulted.
On 11/09/14, I responded to 223 Dorothy in reference to a possible burglary in progress.  A warrant was obtained for the suspect.

On 11-08-2014, I responded to 711-A Chandler in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.When I arrived I met with Warren Covington and Shelly Baldwin who were in a verbal argument. Baldwin was arrested and there were no further issues.

On 11/7/2014 at approximately 1700 hours, officers responded to the intersection of Ennis St and Tryon Ave reference a domestic disturbance with assault. Both the victim and a witness gave near identical accounts of the incident that the suspect grabbed, punched and tried to choke the victim. Warrants were obtained for Thompson for assault on a female.

On November 6, 2014 at approximately 21:02hrs I responded to 820 North Main Street in reference in domestic dispute. Upon arrival I found that Ms. Amesha Ingram had assaulted her husband in the face by punching him in the face.

On this date, police were dispatched to a domestic disturbance on the southside of the city. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed that an assault had occurred between a husband, and wife. it was determined that the husband was the aggressor in this incident, and he was subsequently arrested, and charged with an Assault on a Female. He was taken infront of a Judicial Official, who found probable cause for the arrest, and placed him into the custody of the Guilford County Jail on No Bond.

On November 4, 2014 at approximately 17:52hrs, I responded to 511 Westwood Avenue in reference to a domestic dispute. Upon arrival I found the offender Mr. Tkorey Pittman had assaulted his girlfriend.

On 11-4-14 at approximately 0746 hours I responded to 3012 Manchester Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance call.  Upon arrival I spoke with the subjects involved, who were both arrested for assault.

On 11/3/14 at approximately 2345 hours, I responded to 303 Oakwood St in response to a domestic disturbance. I arrived on the scene and made contact with the caller, a Ms. Olivia Stanback, who informed me that she and her boyfriend, a Mr. Elton Sanders, had been involved in an argument. She advised that he had struck her in the face. Upon further investigation, I made contact with Mr. Sanders who advised that Ms. Stanback had scratched his face and chest. Mr. Sanders had visible injuries on his body and was bleeding. Ms. Stanback did not have any visible marks or injuries on her body and was arrested for the assault against Mr. Sanders.

On this date, I responded to the above address in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Mr. and Mrs. Rice who stated that they had been in a verbal argument.  No charges were pursued, however, two firearms were confiscated from the residence.

On 11/02/2014 around 0318 hours officers responded to 1602 Fowler Pl on a reported Domestic Disturbance.  Officers arrived on scene and made contact with the involved parties, Bridgett Lemmings and Perry Mallory, and observed injuries to Lemmings consistent with an assault.  Officers arrested Mallory on scene and transported him to the Magistrate where he was held on a Domestic Hold.

On 11-02-14 at 0131 hours I responded to 1610 Lincoln Drive in reference to a domestic disturbance.  At the conclusion of my thorough investigation both involved parties were arrested for assaulting each other.  They were brought before a Magistrate and placed in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.
On this date I responded for a domestic disturbance.  During the investigation, Connie Hess, was arrested for domestic assault and held without bond.
On 10/31/2014, at approximately 2100 hours, I responded to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I conducted an investigation and made an arrest.

On 10/30/2014, at approximately 2210 hours, I responded to the ER reference to an assault. Upon my arrival I met with the victim and took a report. I then obtained a warrant and the subject was arrested.

On 10-30-2014, I responded to 1507 Darden St in reference to residential burglary. Upon my arrival I spoke with the complainant,  who advised her ex-boyfriend had kicked the front in to her residence and entered without her permission.

On 10/29/2014 at approximately 1521 hours, officers responded to the area of W Kivett Dr and N Elm St reference a public disturbance with an assault. The call was later reclassified as a domestic disturbance involving dating partners. The suspect, Otis Allen, assaulted his girlfriend. His previous assault convictions made Otis Allen eligible for felony habitual misdemeanor assault. He was charged with same and given a $25,000 bond.
On 10/28/14 at approximately 2102hrs I responded to a reported assault on Kirkstone Dr.

On 10-28-2014, I responded to 2519-D Suffolk Av apartment D in reference to a trespassing situation.  Upon my arrival I was met by Mr. Wilson outside of his apartment. He informed me that his ex girlfriend, Ms. Green, was in his apartment and refusing to leave.Ms. Green was again told by Mr. Wilson to leave in my presence and refused to do so.She was arrested and charged with Domestic Criminal Trespassing.
On 10/27/2014, I responded to 6348 Mary Lee Wy in reference to a domestic disturbance.  One person was arrested and charged with assault pursuant to the investigation.
On October 27, 2014 at 0500 hours, I was dispatched to High Point Hospital Emergency room #7 reference  Assault with a Deadly Weapon. The victim knows the suspect.

I was dispatched to 2419-2D Francis St in reference to a domestic assault by a third party caller.  Upon arrival, I made contact with several subjects out in the parking lot advising the suspect was still on hand and had assaulted his girlfriend.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 10/26/2014 I initiated a traffic stop at S College Dr and Kivett Dr.  Upon my approach of the vehicle I obtained the names of the Driver and the occupants of the truck. Upon further investigation I found that the driver and one of the passengers had a no contact order issued from the judge. The driver and the passenger were arrested without issue.
On 10/26/14 I responded to 6145 Red Cedar Dr, Apt 1H in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I arrived and located the suspect inside the residence.  He was arrested without further incident.

On 10-26-2014, officers were dispatched to 223 Dorothy Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.Upon arrival, officers encountered Nyrobi Good and Kissy Crump at the residence. Good had a scratch on his left cheek. Good advised Crump scratched him during the domestic disturbance. Crump did not have any injuries and advised Officer M Leonard that Good did not assault her.Crump was placed under arrest and charged with simple assault.
On the above date and time I responded to the pd lobby for a report of a juvenile assault.

On this date I responded to this residence on a report of a disturbance. Upon arrival contact was made with Mr. McCall and Ms. Quick who were boyfriend and girlfriend for the last 2 months. Ms. Quick was extremely intoxicated and admitted to assaulting Mr. McCall several times. She also ransacked the residence, destroying most of the furniture. In the process, Ms. Quick cut her right foot and needed 4 stitches  for the injury.Ms. Quick was arrested for Assault, and Malicious injury to personal property.

On 10/24/2014, at 20:31 hours, I responded to 601 Sunset Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I met with the victim who stated that she was assaulted by her husband.  The victim stated that she was pushed down and hit with a small folding table.  The suspect was taken into custody and charged with domestic related assault and battery.
On October 22, 2014, Clayton Matthews reported his wife missing.  She was later located after returning home.
On 10/21/2014, at approximately 2115, I responded to a call regarding trespassing. Upon my arrival I conducted an investigation and made an arrest.

On October 21, 2014 at 12:27am I was dispatched to Boundary Av at Ashburn St in reference to a disturbance.  The victim was thrown to the ground during an argument with her husband.  The suspect was arrested and charged with assault on a female.

On Tuesday, October21, 2014, I responded to 3236 Timberwolf Ave in reference to a Vandalism to a motor vehicle.  Upon my arrival, I spoke with the victim, Cynthia Cash.  She told me that she came home on October 20, 2014 at approximately 4:15pm, and remained home until the following day.  On October 20, 2014, at approximately 4:00pm, Ms. Cash picked up her child from school and her child saw damage to the right side rear quarter panel.  I estimated the damage to be $150.00

On October 20, 2014 at approximately 1618 hours, I responded to 300-A Phillips Avenue in reference to a Domestic Disturbance Intimate Partner call.  Upon arrival, I met the parties involved who both displayed signs of injury.  Both parties admitted to assaulted each other.

On Monday, October 20, 2014, I responded to 704 Kent Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I spoke with Renita Barnes, who told me that her boyfriend, Travis Edmond, broke into her residence and stole two pair of tennis shoes.  Edmond fled the scene prior to police arrival.  Warrants pending on Edmond.

On Sunday, October 19th, 2014, at 1342 hours, I responded to 1102 Garrison Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Mrs. Vada Pigg and Mr. Ricky Honeycutt both of who were intoxicated.  I noticed a cut on Mr. Honeycutt`s lower right lip which had dried blood on same and a cut in front and above his left ear which also had dried blood on it.  Mr. Honeycutt stated Mrs. Pigg was mad about him not giving her enough money and she punched him with her fist in the face and head.  Mrs. Pigg advised Mr. Honeycutt was extremely intoxicated, was tearing up the residence, and threatening and yelling at her.  Mrs. Pigg was arrested for assault and confined in the Guilford County Jail with no bond.  Mr. Honeycutt was arrested for violating his pre-trial release conditions.  Mr. Honeycutt was transported to the High Point Regional Hospital emergency room for medical treatment and then confined in the Guilford County Jail under a newly set $1,500 secured bond.

On this date, I responded to a report of vandalism at the above address.  Upon further investigation, it was discovered that Michael Smith was knowingly in violation of an active Domestic Protective Order.  I arrested Smith for violaton of a 50-B order as well as vandalism to a vehicle of the protected party in the order.

On this date, I responded to a domestic disturbance at the above address.  Upon further investigation, it was discovered that Thomas Logan had struck his girlfriend in the face during an argument.  Logan was arrested and charged with assault on a female.

On October 18, 2014 at approximately 1133 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance call on East Commerce Avenue.  When I arrived on scene, the victim stated that her boyfriend assaulted  her.  The victim was crying and her two young sons also stated that her boyfriend assaulted her.
On Friday 10-17-14, at approximately 2130 hours, I responded to a domestic call at 1411  Green Drive. Upon my arrival I spoke to Anthony Pearson; he stated that a female broke his house window.
On this date, I responded to this residence in reference to an Assist EMS call regarding an attempted suicide.

On 10/14/14 at approximately 2304 hrs I responded to an address on Hodgin St. regarding a domestic disturbance.  Only one party was present when I arrived and he claimed that he had been assaulted with a knife by his girlfriend.  The subject was highly intoxicated and retracted the statement as soon as he made it.
On 10/14/14, at approximately 0030hrs, I responded to a reported domestic disturbance on Wright St.  An intoxicated man pushed his girlfriend, and then took her vehicle without permission.

On October 13, 2014, at approximately 2158 hours, I responded to 2311 Purdy Avenue in reference to an armed subject call. Upon arrival, I spoke with Ms. Misty Collins, who stated that her boyfriend, Mr. Dwayne Buchanon, had just damaged a wall and door inside the house with a machete.

On 10-13-14 at approximately 1740 hours I responded to 1105 E Green Dr in reference to an assault call.  Upon arrival I spoke with the complainant who stated that she was assaulted by a former boyfriend.  The complainant then went to the Magistrates Office and swore out a warrant on the suspect.

offense: OFFENSE AGAINST FAMILY CONTRIBUTE DELINQUENCY MINR
body: On October 13, 2014, the complainant reported a runaway juvenile.

On October 12, 2014 at approximately 1729 hours, I responded to 713-A Scientific Street in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, Conitcha Bethea stated that her boyfriend, James Nick, Jr., had just assaulted her. Mr. Nick was arrested and charged with assault on a female.
On 10-11-2014 at 2350 hours, I responded to 3634 Sunset Hollow Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.  One person was arrested and charged with simple assault.

On 10/11/2014, at 23:43 hours, I responded to 506-A E Fairfield Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I met with the victim who was refusing to show Officer`s the injury to her face.  The suspect gave a false name and date of birth to keep from getting arrested for an outstanding order for arrest and this domestic assault.  This subject ran from the scene through the back door and left the area.  Officers were unable to apprehend the suspect at this time.  It was discovered that the victim was in fact punched by the suspect several times on her face.  I responded to the Magistrate and took out a warrant for arrest for assault inflicting serious injury, resisting a public officer and identity theft.
Ms. Cottrell contacted the police department to report a possible assault that occurred at the date and time listed.

On 10/11/2014 at approximately 0401 hours I responded to High Point Regional Emergency Room, Room #6 reference an assault. The victim had been assaulted by her boyfriend. A warrant was obtained on the suspect. Unable to locate subject at this time.

On 10-10-2014, at 7:08pm I responded to 2826 S Main St in reference to an assault call. Upon arrival I located the vehicle said to be involved. The driver of the vehicle stated she was assaulted by her boyfriend, who was sitting in the passenger seat at the time. David Baxley was arrested for assault on a female.

offense: OFFENSE AGAINST FAMILY CONTRIBUTE DELINQUENCY MINR
body: On October 12, 2014, a juvenile was encountered that was missing from home since October 10, 2014.  The defendant admitted to not knowing where the juvenile was located during that time and failed to report him as missing.

On 10-09-2014 I responded to a domestic disturbance at 1506 Hidden Creek Te. Upon arrival I spoke with the victim who stated he had been assaulted. Through further investigation the details were detemined of the assault and warrants were taken out on the offender. At this time an arrest has not been made.

On 10-09-2014 at 0040 hours, I responded to 832 Ferndale Blvd in reference to a disturbance.  When I arrived, I could hear yelling coming from the house.  When I got to the door, I could see Christopher Isley standing inches from Chelsea Martin, screaming in her face and pointing his finger in her face.  Chelsea`s mother, Jennifer Ball, had called 911 and she told me that he had assaulted Chelsea.  The two other subjects in the house, Montel Pratt and Zachery Contouris, stated that Chrisopher had assaulted Chelsea by pushing her very hard in her chest.  The force of the push was so hard that it pick Chelsea off her feet.  Chelsea was emotional and crying and unable to talk at the moment.I detained Chrisopher at this time.  Chelsea was able to calm down and told me that Chrisopher had returned from an earlier disturbance and was wanting in the house.  She was trying to keep him out when he pushed her.  Once inside Christopher pushed Chelsea again and Montel and Zachery attempted to stop him and a scuffle ensued.I arrested Christopher for Assault on Female and he was placed in GCDC.

On 10-08-2014 at approximately 2254 hours, Officer M Leonard and Officer Bundy were dispatched to 218-I N Lindsay Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.Christopher Maney was arrested for assault on a female following a brief investigation.

On October 8, 2014, I responded to 1314 Franklin Av in reference to a vandalism complaint. Leainna Grimes-Lennon reported that her vehicle had been vandalized. The complainant witnessed the crime, is familiar with the suspect, and intends to obtain a warrant.

On Tuesday, October 7, 2014 I responded to a domestic disturbance at 4406-1A Feldspar Court.I arrived on scene and spoke with Steven Jones.  Mr. Jones stated that he and his daughter Ashleigh Jones had got into an argument which quickly turned physical.  During the course of the investigation it was determined that both parties had been the aggressor and both assaulted one another.  Both Steven Jones, and Ashleigh Jones were arrested and transported to the magistrates office where probable cause for the arrest was found.

On 10-07-2014, at 1613 hours, I responded to the parking lot of Polo Ralph Lauren, 4100 Beechwood Dr., in reference to a vandalism.  An employee at the business had his vehicle vandalized between 0700 hours and 1530 hours.    After reviewing the surveillance footage, the suspect was identified.  The suspect, who has no right or reason to be on the secured premises, was observed entering the security gate at 1330 hours, and left at 1336 hours.    Based on the evidence collected at the scene, the suspect will be charged with injury to real property and operating a vehicle on a suspended license.  I have not made contact with the suspect in person, but I spoke with them over the telephone.  The suspect admitted to damaging the vehicle and I informed the suspect of the charges that will be issued.    I informed the suspect that I will meet to discuss the incident further on 10-08-2014, and advised her that a citation will be issued for both charges.    I obtained surveillance footage from the Asset Protection Office at Polo Ralph Lauren.
From October 7 through October 12, 2014, the parents of two children displayed extreme paranoia, so Child Protective Services was notified to ensure the safety of the children.

On October 5, 2014, the defendant was arrested for attempting to rob his ex-girlfriend of her car with a knife.  The defendant stole the victim`s car several days ago in Greensboro and a warrant was issued for the felony larceny.  The victim located her car in High Point and retrieved it.  The defendant attempted to steal it from her again by threatening to stab her and tried to pushing her out of the car on N Main St while she was driving.The defendant fled and was found hiding under a bush nearby.  The defendant refused to surrender and since he was believed to be armed with a knife, a police K-9 captured him.   The defendant was treated and released from the ER and incarcerated under a $95,000 secured bond.

On 10/5/2014 at approximately 0130 hours, officers responded to 2429-131 W Green Dr reference a disturbance. Both parties, Sharon Mitchell and Nathaniel Griffin, were in a verbal argument and each assaulted one another. Griffin was charged with violating a DV protection order, assault with a deadly weapon and resisting public officer. Mitchell was charged with simple assault. Both were given no bond under domestic hold.

On October 3, 2014 at approximately 11:50am I was dispatched to 301 Oakwood St. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The victim`s face was bloody, and she indicated her boyfriend punched her repeatedly in the face and kicked her in the back.  The boyfriend arrived back on scene and was arrested for assault on a female.  The victim refused medical treatment.

On 10-02-14, a juvenile was peacefully removed from the custody of their mother by the paternal grandfather under the strength of a court order out of Virginia.   This court order was later discovered to be based on falsified information and it was determined that Guilford County Court in North Carolina has jurisdiction in this matter.   Offender #1 was ordered to surrender the child back to the mother on 10-06-14 and failed to comply.  This matter is still under investigation.

On 10-02-2014 Officer M Leonard and Officer Bundy were dispatched to a domestic disturbance at 803-A Carr Street.Upon arrival, Officers encountered James Howard and Ashley Roper. Howard and Roper were both highly intoxicated and belligerent.Howard had an obvious injury to his left eye and advised Roper punched him. Roper had an obvious injury to her right arm and advised Howard grabbed her, causing the area of redness.Howard and Roper were both arrested for simple assault and transported to the Magistrates Office. Howard and Roper were both placed in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On 10-2-2014, I investigated an assault that came into the emergency room.The victim stated that she was assaulted by her boyfriend.  The victim would not give information about what happened and was uncooperative.  The victim only gave us the first name of the suspect but could not tell us where it happened.

On 10-02-2014 at approximately 0927 hours I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I spoke with the victim who stated that there had just been an argument between herself and her boyfriend Paxton Miller. Through further investigation and speaking with the reporting party, Miller was placed under arrest.

On 10/02/2014, at 0630 hours, I responded to 115-1D E Swathmore Ave in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I found signs of vandalism to the apartment, and I communicated with the victim.

On Thursday October 02, 2014 at 0203 hours I responded to 6462 Flintlock Ct. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I spoke to Ms. Tammy Pounds.  Ms. Pounds told me that on the same date, her boyfriend Mark Yetso accused her of cheating on him.  He then grabbed her by the arm leaving two small bruises and a scratch on her inner bicep.Mr. Yetso was arrested for assault on a female.  Mr. Yetso was processed and taken before the Magistrate.  He was placed in the Guilford County Jail in High Point.Ms. Pounds` injuries did not require medical attention.Officer Calvillo photographed the injuries.
On October 1, 2014 I responded to 1412-A E Commerce Av in reference to a domestic dispute. It was determined that an assault had occurred and an arrest was made.
On Tuesday, September 30, 2014, I responded to the north side of High Point regarding a suicide complaint.

On October 3, 2014, I spoke with Mr Wallace in reference to a residential burglary. Mr Wallace reported that several tvs and other items had been taken from his house. This burglary report was filed as a walk in report. The scene was not processed. There is at least one possible suspect at this time.
On 09/29/14 at approximately 0207hrs I responded to a home on  Ridgewood Dr. regarding an assault in progress.

On Sunday September 28, 2014, at 8:01 pm, a call was dispatched to 3760 Windstream Way in reference to a domestic disturbance.Upon arrival contact was made with the victim, Mr. Marshall Lively.  Lively stated that his former spouse came over to the house earlier today, and that she would not leave after being asked repeatedly to do so.There was not a physical altercation, only an argument about the former spouse not leaving.Mr. Lively was given a copy of the City of High Point Domestic Violence Initiative Paperwork.

On 09-28-2014 I responded to a 911 call at 1104 Enterprise Dr. Upon my arrival a subject was standing outside with her clothes torn and blood on her face and she stated her and her boyfriend were fighting before we arrived.

On 09/28/2014 at 0740 hours, I responded to 103 Gaylord Ct in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Ms. Karen Robinson who had been involved in a dispute with her husband Michael Lee.  After the investigation, the victim declined to press charges.  There were no injuries.

On 9-28-2014, at approximately 1600 hours, I responded to 1221 Montlieu Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  During the call, I discovered that the male party had assaulted his girlfriend the night before.  He was arrested for Assault on a Female.  No further information at this time.

On Saturday, September 27, 2014 at about 8:30 A.M. I was dispatched to the parking lot of 4475 Mica Court via departmental radio in regards to a domestic dispute with an assault. Upon my arrival I communicated with the victim via cell phone because she was not at the location. She stated that her boyfriend punched her in the mouth causing her lip to bleed and swell.

On Wednesday, 9-24-2014, at approximately 0036 hrs, I responded to 1340 Crosswinds Drive for a domestic violence call. Upon arrival, the victim stated that she had been in a verbal argument with her husband which turned physical. She stated that her husband struck her in the face which left marks. The husband had already left the residence prior to my arrival. He was arrested after being found driving his vehicle on a nearby street.

On 09-23-2014, officers responded to 105 Hodgin Street in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, Mr. Pennell advised his live in girlfriend assaulted him. Mr. Pennell had obvious injuries to his left forearm and right thumb.Ms. Hunt was arrested and charged with assault and battery.

On this date, a southside resident reported damage to her front door of her residence. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed that the complainant  found wood chipped to the inside of her door frame. The damaged wood was at the lower portion of the door, and not along the door knob or locking mechanism. She advised she first noticed the damage a week ago. The complainant suspects her ex-husband of tampering with her door. She further advised that he has a drug dependency, and has recently broke up with his girlfriend.
On 09/23/2014 I spoke with  Andrea Thomas from Child Protective Services who advised she had information on an assault on a child.

On 09/22/2014 at approximately 1533 hours I responded to 1310 W Green DR in reference to the report of a domestic disturbance involving intimate partners.  Upon my arrival in the area, I contacted one of the involved parties, identified as Mr Milton Webster, walking N bound on Ennis ST near Redding DR.  Mr Webster was subsequently detained.  After speaking with the victim, Miss Autry Polk, Mr Webster was arrested for assault on a female.

On September 19, 2014, I was dispatched to 115 Bellevue Dr. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I contacted the caller, Eshay Bethea, who advised that her boyfriend, Brandon Black, came home drunk and she wanted him to leave.  Mr. Black threatened to kill Ms. Bethea in front of me.
On Friday September 19, I responded to the Bank of America at 115 W. Fairfield in reference to a reported assault.

On September 19, 2014, officers responded to a domestic disturbance at 404 Vine Street.  The disturbance was between brothers.The defendant was arrested for an outstanding warrant for Communicating Threats against his mother the night before.  The brother obtained additional charges after the defendant was arrested.  The brother charged the defendant with Simple Assault, Injury to Personal Property and I also charged Interferring with Emergency Communications.The defendant was incarcerated under a $1000 secured bond.

On Friday September 19, 2014 at 12:54 am a call was dispatched to 3865 John Gordon Ln in reference to a domestic assault.Upon arrival contact was made with Vickie Ann Smith and Jose Angel Rodriguez Jr in the parking lot of 3865 John Gordon Ln.  As a result of the investigation Smith was arrested for simple assault.  At the time of the report Smith is in the Guilford County Jail with a $500.00 secured bond.

On 09-18-2014 at 2135 hours I responded to 2429 W Green Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I located the victim in room 218.  The victim stated that he was assaulted by his live-in girlfriend who then fled the scene.  The victim had did have several facial injuries.
On 9/18/2014, at approximately 2100 hours, I responded to a call regarding a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I conducted an investigation and made an arrest.
On 9-16-2014 I responded to 3997 Fountain Village Ci in reference to an assault.  Upon arrival it was determined that one subject had assaulted her mother.  The female was charged accordingly.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 09/16/2014, at 16:13 hours, I responded to the 200-Blk of E Parris Av in reference to a traffic accident.  During the investigation, I checked all the subjects for warrants.  I was informed through the PIT that the passenger of the vehicle was in violation of his pre-trial release for having contact with the driver of the vehicle.  The suspect was arrested from the scene and brought before Magistrate Kokajko where he was charged with violation of pre-trial release.  The suspect was then placed in the Guilford County Jail under a $3000 secured bond.

On 09-16-2014 at about 1951 hours, I responded to 300 2C Oakwood Street in reference to an assault call. Upon arrival, I spoke with the victim, Ms. Paige, and she said that her boyfriend, Mr. Commander-Brown, had hit her in the face, neck and ribs. There were visible signs of an assault and Mr. Commander-Brown was taken into custody and charged with Assault on a Female.At the magistrate`s office he received no bond due to it being domestic related and he taken to the Guilford County Jail.

On 09-16-2014 at approximately 1:00 am, I responded to 1154 Roberts Lane Apt H, in reference to an assault.  Upon my arrival I met with the victim, Mrs Chasity West.  Mrs West advised on the dates and times listed above an unknown suspect pushed her into her residence and assaulted her.

On 09/13/2014, at 21:07 hours, I responded to 205 Druid St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I met with the victim who stated that she was assaulted by her boyfriend.  The victim had signs that she was assaulted and a warrant for arrest was obtained for the suspect.  A BOL was issued for the suspect at this time.
On 09/13/2014, I responded to 309 Earle Pl in reference to a domestic dispute.  Upon investigation 3 subjects were arrested and taken to jail.

On Saturday, September 13, 2014, I responded to 624 Park Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon police arrival Prasafany Outlaw advised that her boyfriend, Roy Brown had hit her and cut her.  Brown ran back into the house and locked the door when police arrived.  Police made entry into the residence and arrested Brown on charges of assault with a deadly weapon, assault with a deadly weapon with a minor present, and resisting public officers.  Brown is confined in the Guilford County Detention Center under a domestic hold and is scheduled to appear in court on October 17, 2014.

On September 12, 2014 at approximately 2243 hours, I responded to 314-B North Hall Street in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, I spoke with Debra Watson who stated that Michael Beck had just assaulted her and left the scene. Michael Beck was located and arrested for simple assault.
On 9/12/2014, at approximately 2000 hours, I responded to an assistance  call. During the course of this call I made an arrest and wrote this report.
On 9/10/2014, at approximately 2200 hours, I spoke to the victim of this crime. I conducted an investigation and drew out a warrant.

On 9-10-14 I was dispatched to 104-A Lassiter Dr. in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I spoke with Nicole Arneson. Arneson stated that her live in boyfriend  had shoved her to the ground during an argument. He fled the scene prior to police arrival. Arneson had an abrasion on her left knee from where she hit the ground. I obtained a warrant for arrest against the suspect for assault on a female.
On September 10, 2014 at 2320 hours, We were dispatched to 1939-(C) Eastchester Dr. reference unknown disturbance. Domestic related call no arrest made.

On 9-10-2014, at approximately 2210 hours, I responded to 3215 Quail Run Drive in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Two parents had gotten into an arguement and the son had come to the defense of his mother.  The victims took out warrants on the offender.  These warrants were served.  No further information at this time.
On 09/10/2014, I responded to 115-G Oakwood St in reference to a domestic dispute.

On 09/10/2014 I responded to 181 Hedgecock Rd. in reference to an assault. The listed suspect got into an argument with the listed victims and assault them by placing his hands around the victim`s throat. The suspect was arrested later at his home on Bracknell Dr.

On 09-08-14, at approximately 1546 hours, Officer Treadway and I responded to 315-B Henley in reference to an assault. Upon our investigation, Robert Livingston was charged with Assault on a female and Communicating Threats.

On 9-7-2014, I responded to 2221 Shadow Valley Rd. in reference to a domestic disturbance.When I arrived, I met with a party in the 2221 building and was advised an assault had taken place. The male party was arrested without issue.

On 09/07/2014, I met with the victim in the parking lot of 1813 S Main St.  The victim claimed she was assaulted by her ex-husband after a party on the way back to Archdale.  Warrants were taken out on the suspect.

On September 6, 2014, I was dispatched to meet with Timothy Albert at 1507-A Waverly Street for a reported possible kidnapping he witnessed.  This case would later be reclassified as domestic disturbance IP.On arrival, I made contact with Albert who told me that he was sitting on his front porch when he heard a lady screaming and saw a truck coming down his road (Waverly Street).  Albert told me that he ran to the street and jumped in front of the truck and it stopped.  Albert could only describe the driver as a black male and the truck as an "old Ford".  Albert stated the white female passenger was screaming repeatedly, "Call 911!"  The truck then drove around Albert and sped off towards East Lexington Avenue.Shortly afterwards, a call came out at 2428 East Lexington Avenue wherein a white female was reportedly thrown out of a truck.  I went to that address and made contact with Bailey who reported that she was in the truck with her on again/off again boyfriend (and she even told me that they were married at one time), Raymond Neal.  They had been together for the past couple of days and this evening got into an argument over Neal`s cell phone.  As a result, Bailey said that Neal threw her from the truck, along with her belongings, while they were stopped at the stop sign at Waverly Street and East Lexington Avenue.  This assault (throwing Bailey from the vehicle) was witnessed by Johnson, who lives at 2428 East Lexington Avenue.Bailey was checked for visible injuries and there were none.I was then informed over police radio that Officer Dustin Felde was in contact with Neal at 820 North Main Street.  I asked Bailey if she wished to seek a warrant for domestic assault and she did.  I transported her to the Magistrate`s Office, taking her before Magistrate Price, who found probable cause to issue a warrant for assault on a female.  I advised Felde who arrested Neal and took him to the police department for processing.I transported Bailey to a friend`s house at the corner of West English Road and Chestnut Street and then met Felde at the police department to take over the arrest of Neal.  The warrant was served on Neal.  After reading the warrant, Neal did admit he pushed Bailey from the truck because "she is crazy".  Neal was processed by Lab Tech Bartorelli.  Felde told me that Neal`s truck was secure and allowed by the business to remain in the pva of 820 North Main Street (Kangaroo Express).I then took Neal before Magistrate Price where he was given a domestic hold and placed him in jail at 2355 hours.

On 09/06/2014 at approximately 1700 I responded to 1307 Ragan Avenue in response to a domestic dispute. I arrived on the scene and made contact with a Ms. Deborah Andrews (W/F 05-23-1966 who gave me the alias Debra Wadsley) who advised me that two of her roomates had been involved in a dispute and that they had been drinking. She reported that a female living in the house (later identified as a Ms. Ronda Jean Shaw (W/F 02-10-1966)) had assaulted a male also living in the house (later identified as Calvin Hunt (B/M 11-7-1962)). I made contact with Ms. Shaw, who had visible injuries to her hands, who advised me that she had "gotten rough" with Mr. Hunt because Mr. Hunt and Ms. Andrews had been seeing each other behind her back. I made contact with Mr. Hunt who had a visible injury to his nose. I asked Mr. Hunt if Ms. Shaw had assaulted him and he said that he preferred not to say. I arrested Ms. Shaw for the assault of Mr. Hunt.

On 9/6/14 around 1105 hours, I responded to 501 W Ward Ave, Apt A in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I made contact with Cynthia Whisnant, who advised me that her daughter had been causing problems at the house and had just left a few minutes before I arrived on scene.

On 09-06-2014, at approximately 4:30 am, I responded to 115 E Swathmore Avenue, in reference to a vandalism.   Upon my arrival I met with the witness, Mr Lance Milks.  Mr Milks advised on the dates and times listed above, a white male, around 5`9-6`0, medium build, short dirty blond hair, between the age of 25-30, wearing light khaki cargo shorts, bluish green shirt with a collar, damaged the above listed vehicle.

On 09-05-2014 at approximately 2050 hours Ms. Keopansent contacted High Point Communications and advised her husband assaulted her.Upon arrival, Officer Garrett observed marks on Ms. Keopansent`s neck. Ms. Keopansent advised her husband placed his hands on her neck, causing the marks.Officer M Leonard spoke with Mr. Keopansent and he admitted to pushing Ms. Keopansent.Mr. Keopansent was placed under arrest for assault on a female and transported to the police department. Mr. Keopansent was photographed and fingerprinted. Mr. Keopansent was then transported to the Magistrate`s Office and placed in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On 9-5-14, I spoke with a DSS worker, Ms. Sa, who advised she needed to report an incident of child abuse.  At this time, she had not spoken to the family in person and advised she would contact me when she received the parents` information.  As of 9-6-14, I have not been able to make contact with Ms. Sa about the information on the family.  There is no further information available.

On Thursday, September 4, 2014, I responded to 912-A Grace Street in reference to a disturbance.  Upon my arrival, I spoke with Kay Thompson who advised me she had been assaulted by her brother.  Kay Thompson was arrested and served with two orders for her arrest.  Timothy Thompson II was arrested and charged with assault on a female and misdemeanor breaking and entering.  Timothy was transported to the High Point Emergency Room where he was treated for injuries obtained prior to arrest.  Both subjects were confined in the Guilford County Detention Center.
I reponded to the 315 Park St in reference to a domestic dispute.
On September 3, 2014, the victim reported that her ex-boyfriend assaulted her while standing at a bus stop.  The ex-boyfriend left the scene before police arrived.
On September 3, 2014, the victim reported being assaulted by her boyfriend.  During the investigation, it was determined that the boyfriend acted in self-defense and did not assault the victim.

On Tuesday, September 2, 2014, I responded to 812 Carter Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I spoke with Angela Black, who advised that she and her boyfriend, Antroin Titus had gotten into an altercation.  No crime had taken place.
The reporting party in this case reported her daughter and two grandchildren as missing.  All three have been entered into NCIC as missing.  This investigation is on-going.

On 09/01/2014 at approximately 21:33 hours I responded to 418 Brentwood st. in reference to a bleeding subject needing assistance. The call was related to a disturbance call at 906 Worth St. I spoke with the victim Mr. Sanders, who advised he was assaulted and bit by a dog at 906 Worth St. during a domestic argument. As a result of my investigation Ronald Antonio Johnson was arrested for simple assault.

On 9/1/2014 at approximately 11:30am I responded to an address in the NE part of the city on a reported public disturbance.  Upon arrival I spoke with the complainant,  who said a male and female were having a verbal argument at a nearby address.

On 08/31/2014 I responded to the address above for a report of a domestic disturbance. The suspect fled prior to my arrival in an unknown direction. The victim refused EMS and charges have been filed at this time.

On 8-31-2014 at 1:09pm I responded to the Magistrates Office, 505 E. Green Dr. in reference to Assault.Upon arriving at the above location I made contact with the victim, TAKARA MONIQUE WASHINGTON, who advised her husband had choked her, and assaulted her by pointing a gun at her face.

On August 31, 2014 Officer C. Bartlett and I responded to 1816-D Guyer Street for a reported domestic disturbance.Upon our arrival, we immediately noticed that Briley was agitated, pacing back and forth, going room to room.  He was cursing and refusing to talk to us, stating "it`s my house, I`ll do what I want!".  I located Briley`s wife of 7 months (also pregnant for 7 months) in the back of the house and spoke with her.  I asked if Briley hit her, she nodded and showed me a busted bottom lip.  I signaled Officer Bartlett and we arrested Briley for domestic assault without incident.  Briley stated his lip was busted also, but upon inspection, nothing was seen.In taking Briley to my car, he yelled at Jones, "I hope you kill yourself and die, bitch!"Officer Bartlett handled getting information from Jones, taking photos of her injuries and giving her the domestic violence resources paperwork. I transported Briley to the Police Department where he was processed by Lab Tech Parrott and then taken before Magistrate Billips.  Briley was then placed in jail under a domestic hold.

Donald Fletcher, boyfriend of 5 years, stole Ms Chong`s red Honda Civic out of their driveway. He stole the keys in the early morning hours of 8/31/14. He does not have permission to drive the car. He also removed a Hyundai from the residence that he has been driving with permission to go only to and from work. The Hyundai is registered in Ms Chong`s name also. Ms Chong will seek her own warrants for unauthorized use of the Hyundai.

On 08/30/2014, at 23:23 hours, I responded to 6320 Long Leaf Ct in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, it was discovered that no domestic assault had taken place and both parties involved were advised to take out warrants.  When I arrived on the scene, the suspect was sitting in her vehicle with her two young children.  The suspect was heavily intoxicated on alcohol and prescription medication.  The suspect was not able to care for children at this time and even had an open container of alcohol and schedule IV controlled substance in the vehicle.  This subject was arrested from the scene and charged with two counts of contributing to the neglect of a child and misdemeanor possession of schedule IV.

On August 31, 2014 at approximately 0236 hours, I was dispatched to an assault call on Blair Avenue.  When I made contact with the victim on Tipton Street., she  stated that she was assaulted by her boyfriend who just recently got out of prison.

On August 30, 2014 at approximately 2222hrs I responded to 1600 Boundary Avenue in reference to a domestic dispute. Upon arrival I found the victim had a bloody lip. The victim stated she had been stuck in the face by Mr. Therdore Anothny. I then placed Mr. Anthony under arrest for assault on a female.

On 8-30-2014  I responded to 1120 Cleveland St. in reference to standing by while someone  retrieved property.  Upon further investigation it was discovered an assault occured.  The victim  was transported to the magistrate and took out warrants.  The offender was arrested on the warrant.

On 08-30-2014 at 0734 hours, I responded to 204-B Druid Av., in reference to a domestic disturbance involving an assault.  The victim advised that she was assaulted by her boyfriend shortly before calling the police.  The offender left the residence on foot prior to our arrival.  The victim sustained minor visible injuries from the assault, therefore a warrant for assault was obtained.    I was unable to locate the offender at the residence provided by the victim.  A lookout was issued for the offender.  An outstanding warrant for assault on female was entered into NCAWARE.

On 08/30/2014 at approximately 0030 hours, I responded to 501-A Wise Avenue in response to a domestic dispute. I arrived on the scene and could hear loud yelling from within the residence. I knocked on the door and made contact with a Mrs. Shaquita Ingram, who advised me that she and her husband, Mr. Rashawn Ingram, had been arguing. The two were actively arguing upon my arrival and were separated for their safety. I made contact with Mr. Ingram who informed me that he had been struck repeatedly in his face by Mrs. Ingram, who was using her closed fists to strike him. Mr. Ingram had a visible injury to the back of his neck consistent to a cut, there was blood coming from his neck. I made contact with Mrs. Ingram once again in a separate room who informed me that she did in fact strike Mr. Ingram and cut him with her wedding ring. Mrs. Ingram advised me that Mr. Ingram had not struck her. I arrested Mrs. Ingram for Simple Assault who was placed on a domestic hold in the Guilford County Jail.

On 08/29/2014, at 01:50 hours, I responded to 6145-2F Red Cedar Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I met with the victim who stated that she was assaulted by her boyfriend.  The victim had signs that she was assaulted and the suspect was taken into custody at 6145-2F Red Cedar Dr.  This suspect was then charged with assault on a female and placed in the Guilford County Jail under a $2000 secured bond.

On August 27, 2014 at approximately 11:08pm I was dispatched to 900-K Lakecrest Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The caller and her husband had an argument that escalated into a physical altercation.  The male subject admitted to hitting the female, and had scratches on his arms from the female subject.  The husband was arrested for assault on a female.  The wife was issued a citation for simple assault.

On 08/26/2014, around 1126 hours, I was dispatched to 1461-A West Av in reference to an assault on a female.  Upon arrival, I made contact with the victim, Ms. Jasmene Williams, who advised that Mr. Damon Smith had assaulted her.  Warrants were obtained on Mr. Smith for Assault on a Female.
On Tuesday, August 26th, 2014 at 0843 hours, I responded to 3715 Village Springs Drive in reference to an unknown white powdery substance in the driveway of the residence.

On 08/26/2014 at 2:32 am, I was dispatched to 304 Woodbury St in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I made contact with the victim who had visible injuries who stated that her boyfriend had assaulted her. The suspect was arrested on scene.
On Monday August 25, 2014 I responded to 1521 Birkdale Ct. in reference to a domestic disturbance between a mother and her 15 year old son.

On 8-24-2014 I responded to an information call to be handled over the phone.Upon call back i was advised by the requesting party that she was having an issue with her husband that was starting to get out of control. I advised same it would be smart if she took out a report and listened to advice I had regarding the situation. A report was taken for her and she was given a case number and asked to call with any questions or anymore information.

On Sunday August 24, 2014 I responded to 1713 Welborn Street in reference to a Domestic. Upon my arrival I spoke with the caller Jennifer Davis, who advised during an argument her boyfriend John Rogers had pulled a box cutter on her.

On Sunday, August 24, 2014 I responded to 1407 Furlough Avenue in reference to an assault.  Upon my arrival Tita Lufudu had been stabbed several times by his brother, Jerry Lufudu.  Jerry Lufudu was placed under arrest for assault with a deadly weapon inflicting serious injury.  Both subjects were treated for injuries.  Lufudu is confined in the Guilford County Detention Center under a $15,000.00 secured bond and is scheduled to appear in court on October 6, 2014.

On Sunday, 08/24/2014, at approximately 0336 hours I responded to the apartments located at 6140 Red Cedar Drive in reference to a Domestic Disturbance IP. Upon arrival on the scene I made contact with the victim who advised me that his ex-girlfriend punched him in the head and put her hands around his throat. The victim had slight swelling around the temple on the right side of his head and red marks on his throat. There were several witnesses on the scene that observed the incident as well. The suspect was arrested on the scene and charged with Domestic Simple Assault.

On 08/23/2014 at approximately 2113 hours I responded to 70 Clinton AV in reference to a domestic disturbance involving intimate partners.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the reporting party and victim, Mr Wade Tyner, who advised that his girlfriend, Mrs Deborah Wadsley (aka Deborah Andrews), had struck him with a frying pan on the head and had fled the residence.  Mr Tyner sustained a "goose egg" on the right side of his forehead as a result of the aforementioned assault.  A warrant was obtained for misdemeanor AWDW and Mrs Wadsley was arrested at her residence at 2202 hours.

On 08/23/2014 at 2041 hours, I responded to 270 Bedington Street to speak with a subject in reference to a report of a domestic disturbance with an assault.  The incident had taken place at W Market Center Drive near Prospect Street.  The suspect was not at the scene when I arrived and warrants were obtained for the assault.

On 08-23-2014, at approximately 1:45 pm, I responded to 2321 Purdy Ave in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival, I made contact with Mrs Nicole Dorsey.  Mrs Dorsey advised on the dates and times listed above the suspect assaulted her.

On 08-23-2014 at 12:53 hours I responded to 1207 West Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arriving on scene I made contact with Ms. Lotoriaya Bostic.  Ms. Bostic reported she was assaulted by Mr. Michael Gaddy.  Ms. Bostic left the scene and went to the magistrate`s office to take out a warrant on Mr. Gaddy.  When the warrant was issued, Mr. Gaddy was arrest for domestic assault on a female.

On Sunday August 24, 2014, Tamika Denise Little reported that her house had been broken into on Saturday August, 23, 2014.Little stated that she was in her bedroom when her former boyfriend entered her bedroom demanding to know why she had taken out warrants against him.  Little stated that she was not harmed as a result of the incident, but did report that the suspect had also slashed the right front tire on her vehicle.At the time of the report, Warrants are pending on the suspect.

On 8-22-14, I responded to 1613-B Brockett Av for a domestic disturbance. While investigating the argument between adults I witnessed the suspect shove her daughter in the face causing her to stumble backwards.  The suspect was immediately taken into custody. After being processed at the police department, she was transported to the Magistrates office and was given a $500 secured bond. The suspect remains in jail at this time. DSS was contacted and made aware of the situation, and the child was place with a family member for the evening. The child suffered no injuries from the assault. There is no further information available.

On 08-21-2014, I responded to 2416 E Lexington Ave in reference to an assault. Upon my arrival, I made contact with the victim, Erica Lackey, who was upset with her boyfriend, Reggie Shore. Erica stated that Reggie got upset because she would not buy him a beer with the money she was going to use for her doctors visit, she had later that day. Erica stated that she got into a verbal argument with Reggie, and then the argument became physical. Reggie Shore was arrested for assault on a female. He was placed in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On 08/21/14, at 0030 hours, Officers responded to a domestic dispute at 306 Avery Av.  Upon the Officers arrival, they met with the Offender, Victim and witnesses.  The victim and witnesses story matched.  The victim stated that the suspect pushed their head against the wall and came at them with a vacuum cleaner.  The offender was arrested and charged.

While on routine patrol, on 8-19-2014, at approximately 1315 hours, I reponded to the corner of Kivett and Hamilton in reference to a disturbance.  Two persons had gotten into an arguement and it had become mobile when one party attempted to leave.  One party was arrested for disorderly conduct.  No further information at this time.
On Monday August 18, 2014, I responded to a report of a suicide.

On Monday 8/18/14, at approximately 1537 hours, Officers responded to 312 Ardale Dr in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  Upon arrival Officers made contact with Ms. Tomlin, who advised that her ex boyfriend was causing a disturbance and she wanted him to leave.  Ms. Tomlin left while the ex boyfriend was still on scene, and he ransacked the apartment.  Lab arrived and processed the scene.  There is no further information available at this time.

On Sunday, August 18, 2014 at about 12:07 A.M. I was dispatched to Food Lion, 3935 Brian Jordan via departmental radio in regards to a domestic dispute. Upon my arrival I spoke with a juvenile male who stated he was assaulted by his father. Based on the visible injuries I transported the juvenile to the hospital for medical attention.
On 08-17-2014, I responded to a vandalism. Upon arrival I spoke with the victim, who stated her child`s father had punched her windshield on her vehicle and shattered it.

Ms. Wright stated that she was traveling with Mr. Morgan in his pickup truck when an argument ensued.  Ms. Wright said that Morgan stopped the vehicle and forced her out, then punched her repeatedly in the head.  Wright had a laceration over her right eye as well as an injury to her hand.  Wright was transported to HPRH by PTAR to receive treatment for her injuries.

On Sunday, August 17, 2014, I responded to 2628 South Main Street, Walmart, in reference to an assault.  Upon my arrival I spoke with Sara Hunt who advised me she was assaulted earlier this morning by her boyfriend, Jamie Oxendine at 106 North Hall Street.  The residence was then checked and Oxendine was not there.

On 8/16/14, Officers responded to 2415 E Lexington Ave. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  After arriving on scene and speaking to the reporting party, Mr. Robert Jessup, and victim Ms. Anne Spaugh, it was determined an assault took place and one individual was arrested.

On 08/15/2014 at approximately 2340 hours I responded to a public disturbance call at 1314 Franklin Av. As I arrived I was given additional information over the police radio that a female subject was armed with a knife. I made contact with the victim who stated the suspect was still inside with the knife and had just tried to assault her with the knife. The suspect was unarmed when I made contact with her and she was taken into custody. The victim did not receive any injuries at the time of the incident.

On 08/16/2014 at approximately 1615hrs I responded to 1207 Tipton St. regarding a reported domestic disturbance that had happened on 08/15/2014.  The reporting party advised that his wife was upset with him over some marital issues and had struck him and damaged his property during an argument.

On August 15, 2014 at approximately 0020hrs I responded to Marlboro Street in reference to a domestic. Upon arrival I found the victim on the front porch bleeding. The victim had been pushed down by the suspect. The suspect had already fled the scene upon arrival. I took warrants out on the suspect for assault on a female.

On August 14, 2014 at approximately 0230 hours, I observed Angela Hayes pushing the victim in the street.  Upon further investigation, I determined that Ms. Hayes and the victim lived together.  Ms. Hayes was placed under arrest without incident.
On this date, I responded to 1304 Worth Street in reference to an assault to inflict serious injury by using a knife which had just occurred.
On 08-12-2014 I responded to 151 W Hartley Dr apt K in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I spoke with Reporting party that stated she was assaulted by her boyfriend.

On 08/11/2014, at 2259 hours, I responded to 501-A Saunders Pl in reference to a vandalism call.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Ms. Tamika Saunders, who advised that her boyfriend, Michael Dingle, damaged her property.  No charges have been made at the time of the report.

On this date, police were dispatched to a southside residence reference to an assault. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed that a female had a verbal altercation which escalated into a physical assault. The female`s father of her child, punched her in the face with a closed fist, resulting in a laceration to the right side lower lip. She was transported to High Point Regional Hospital for the treatment of an unrelated injury, a broken right ankle, which occurred more then a month ago.The suspect was not on scene, WFA, Assault on a Female was drawn on the suspect.

I was dispatched to the High Point Regional Health System, 601 N. Elm Street, regarding a child abuse.  As a result of my investigation, Kelly Mateo Barrera and Antonio Comacho Gonzalez were arrested and charged with the assault.

On Thursday August 07, 2014 at 2220 hours I responded to Chilis at 920 Mall Loop Rd. in reference to an assault upon my arrival I spoke to Mr. Dwayne Glover.  Mr. Glover advised he witnessed an Asian male strike a little boy in the head with his forearm.  He stated the Asian male then took the juvenile into the bathroom and then they came back and the juvenile appeared afraid.  Mr. Glover pointed at the suspect and the little boy who were sitting in a booth in the restaurant.Officer Crisco went over and made contact with the juvenile and I spoke to the suspect, Mr. Bailey Le.As a result of the investigation Mr. Le was charged with assault on a handicapped person.Lab Technician Meldrum responded and took photographs of the juveniles injuries.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 08/07/2014, at 16:13 hours, I responded to Festival Park located at 1917 Eastchester Dr in reference to a traffic related call.  Upon arrival, I made contact with the vehicle, which had two occupants inside the vehicle.  Upon first approach of the vehicle, I smelled the strong odor of marijuana and could see open containers of alcohol inside the vehicle.  A search of the vehicle was conducted and marijuana and drug paraphernalia were located in the vehicle.  It was also discovered that there was an active 50-B against the suspect, and he was not supposed to have contact with the other subject in the vehicle.  The suspect was arrested from the scene for 50-B violation, misdemeanor possession of marijuana and possession of drug paraphernalia.

On 08-07-2014 at 1005 hours, Victim 1 came to the police department to report a sexual assault which occurred sometime after 0000 hours and 0600 hours today in N.W. High Point.The victim stated that she was sexually assaulted by her husband in their home while she was sleeping.
On August 6, 2014 I responded to a public disturbance at 1211 E. Russell Ave. One party and one Officer were assaulted in the altercation. Ms. Myeshia Carter was placed in jail under a $10,000 bond.

On 08-05-2014, at approximately 5:30 pm, I was dispatched to 1104 Hickory Chapel Road, in reference to a larceny.  Upon my arrival I met with the victim, Mrs Betty Safriet. Mrs Safriet advised on the dates and times listed above, the suspect stole the above listed items.
I responded to a Domestic call at 600 Mint Av. Upon arrival I spoke to the victim, Charlene Gidderon. Gidderon was assaulted by her boyfriend, Alexander Easterling.

On 08-04-2014 a refused caller contacted Communications and requested a welfare check on Aeysha Joyner at 208 Whittier Avenue. The refused caller advised that Joyner and her boyfriend, Anthony Lyles, were involved in a domestic disturbance and that Joyner may need assistance.Upon arrival, Officer M Leonard and Officer Bundy located Joyner at the residence. Joyner provided information regarding the domestic disturbance that indicated an assault took place. Lyles was not home at the time contact was made with Joyner.Officer M Leonard provided probable cause to the Magistrate and a warrant was issued for Lyles. Lyles was arrested a short time later at 2200 Westchester Drive.Lyles was placed in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On Sunday, August 3, 2014, I responded to Sharky`s, 2615 South Main Street, in reference to an assault.  Upon my arrival I spoke with Jeremy Crotts who told me that he had been assaulted.  No other information available.
On August 3, 2014, at approximately 0416 hours, I responded to the 900 block of Gordon Street in reference to a residential burglary that had already occurred.
On 10/03/2014 at 0945hrs I spoke to a representative from the Department of Social Services in reference to an alleged assault.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On the date and time listed above, Officers were dispatched to 1804 Drew Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival Officers discovered that the victim had an active 50B against the suspect.  The suspect came to the victim`s residence prior to Officers arriving.  The suspect then stated that he was there to see his child and that no court could tell him otherwise.  The victim shut her door and called the Police at this time and the suspect left the scene.Officer Moss obtained a warrant for DV Protection Order Violation and as of this report the warrants are still active.  A BOL was issued for the suspect.
On 01-08-2014 at 12:45pm I responded to 2008-E Stoneycreek Dr in reference to disturbance. Upon arrival I spoke with victim who stated she was struck by her boyfriend several times

On Friday August 1, 2014 I was dispatched to the Emergency Room at Moses Cone medical center in Greensboro in reference to a possible domestic assault that may have occurred.  When I arrived I spoke with all parties involved and determined that there is no evidence to support a domestic assault actually occurred.  I recommend this case be closed and cleared unfounded.

On 7/31/2014 at approximately 2320 hours, officer responded to 1807 Chestnut Dr reference a domestic disturbance between the caller and her 17 year old granddaughter. The 17 year old got into a verbal altercation with her grandfather and assaulted him. The 17 year old was arrested and charged with simple assault. She was given a custody release and was picked up by her grandmother.

On Thursday, July 31, 2014 at about 7:37 A.M. we were dispatched to 4111 Jeffrey Lane Point via departmental radio in regards to a domestic dispute. Upon our arrival we discovered that Mrs. Callahan was pushed by her husband and struck her head during a domestic dispute.

On 07-30-14 at 0713 hours I responded to 511 Westwood Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  A neighbor had called 911 to report a disturbance between the Offender and Victim.  Upon my arrival I contacted the Offender who resisted, obstructed, and delayed my investigation.  Force was used on the Offender to affect an arrest.  The Offender was charged with assault on a female, resisting a Public Officer, and possession with intent to sell and deliver a schedule IV controlled substance.

On 07/30/2014 at approximately 0042 hours I was dispatched to the intersection of E Commerce Av and Winslows St reference an unknown individual laying in the roadway. Upon arrival a black female was laying in the roadway, the victim of an assault by her boyfriend. She was treated by EMS and the suspect was arrested on scene.
On 07/29/2014 at 03:54 hrs, I responded to 1415 West Av, Apt C, in reference to a domestic dispute. Both individuals involved were arrested for assault and various other charges.

On 07/28/2014 at approximately 04:53am I responded to a call at 310 Guilford Av. where the victim stated her ex boyfriend had entered her home pointing a gun at her in her kitchen and refused to leave. When the victim called 911 for police help, the suspect fled on foot.  When the suspect fled, he kicked a large dent in the drivers side of the victims vehicle while it was parked in the driveway.The victim was met at the magistrates office and warrants were issued for assault with a deadly weapon, trespass and damage to personal property. The suspect had a prior outstanding warrant for assault on a female on the same victim.No arrest have been made at this time.

On 07-27-2014 at approximately 1310 hours I responded to 802 E Dayton Av in reference to a domestic related assault. Warrants were taken out on both subjects involved. One warrant was served on one subject, the other is unserved at this time.

On the above date and time, I responded to the incident location for a reported assault. Upon my arrival I met with Mr. Norris, who stated that he witnessed an assault by a black male on a black female. The male had left in a gold Honda Accord and the female had run upstairs to Apartment 3E. I made contact with the victim, Wanda Cook, who confirmed that she had been assaulted by her fiance, Warren Hilliard. Ms. Cook had visible injury to her right knee and some minor swelling to her face consistent with her account of the assault. Lab responded for photos. Warrants were issued for assault on a female. Ms. Cook refused medical treatment. All applicable DV paperwork provided to the victim.

On 07-25-2014, I responded to 1420-D E. Commerce Avenue in reference to a burglary and assault.  The victim, Lukeitha Sims, said that her ex-boyfriend came to her home, forced his way into the residence and assaulted her.  Warrants were obtained for the suspect by the victim.  The suspect has not yet been located.

On 8/1/2014 at approximately 2045 hours, officers responded to 531-C Flint Av reference a domestic disturbance involving a female victim and her ex-boyfriend. The victim advised her ex-boyfriend has been communicating with her electronically and harassing her since 7/25/2014. She showed me evidence of the emails. Warrants have been obtained for the suspect for cyberstalking.

On this date I responded to a domestic call.  Upon arrival I spoke to reporting party who stated it was only a verbal argument with no assault therefore the man  left the residence.  After the male left, both the female reporting party and a neighbor made me aware of guns inside the residence which led to the seizure of two shotguns.  Warrants are pending for the suspect.

On 7-24-2014, at approximately 1730 hours, I responded to 701 Carr St in reference to a Vandalism.  The suspect spent several hours tearing up the victim`s house and belongings before fleeing the scene.  He was no longer present upon my arrival.  No further information at this time.
On 07/22/2014, I responded to 410 W. Ray Av in reference to a disturbance.

On 7-21-14, I responded to 3802 N Main St for a domestic disturbance in the parking lot. We received multiple calls from the children involved and the witness inside the store. The suspect was arrested and no injuries occurred. DSS was contacted and made aware of this incident due to children being present. At this time, there is no further information available.

On 07-20-2014, at 1128 hours, Victim 2 reported that he was in a domestic disturbance with his girlfriend, Victim 1, at Victim 2`s residence which is located at 3838 Tarrant Trace Circle.During the disturbance, Victim 2 damaged the windshield of Victim 1`s Toyota, which Victim 2 claimed to be in retaliation for Victim 1 throwing a small trash can through an upper bedroom window, causing damage to the glass.  Victim 2 stated that Victim1 had also thrown his laptop, but he does not know if it is damaged at this time.I asked if either parties wanted to seek criminal charges for the damages and both declined.No assault was reported, nor was there any evidence of one taking place.
On July 20, 2014 around 1110hrs I responded to a Domestic Disturbance. Upon arrival a suspect ran from Police. Suspect was charged with Assault with a Deadly Weapon and Resist, Delay, and Obstruct.

On 07/19/2014 at 0755 hours, I responded to 501-I Academy Street in reference to a report of a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival signs of an assault were noticed to the victim of the domestic disturbance.  Shannon Wright, the suspect was arrested and transported to the magistrates office where she was placed on a domestic hold.

On 07/17/14 at approximately 2358hrs I responded to a residence off of Dorothy St. regarding a reported domestic disturbance.  The male suspect had thrown a barbell at his girlfriend`s vehicle because he was upset she did not return a text message quick enough.  He then fled the scene.

On 7/18/2014 at approximately 2200 hours, officers responded to 1605 Fowler Pl reference a disturbance disturbance/assault that occurred at 1101 Young Pl shortly before the call. The victim was assaulted by her boyfriend, Richard Hotaling. A warrant was issued for his arrest for assault on a female.

On Friday 7/18/14, at approximately 0247 hours, Officers responded to 507-A W Ward Av in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  Upon arrival Officers made contact with the Victim, who advised that her Husband who did not live at this residence kicked the back door in and stole her cell phone.  A warrant was issued and there is currently no further information available at this time.
On 7/18/2014, at approximately 740 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding an Overdose. After an investigation, I discovered Mr. Hill was trespassing on the property.
On 07/18/2014 I investigated a harrassing phone calls from the victim.  She stated her boyfriend was calling her from jail, even though she has a 50B order against him.

On 7/15/2014 I responded to the listed location for a report of a disturbance.  Once on scene I made contact with the listed Offenders.  I was given two different version of events but both parties stated they had been assaulted.  Both parties claimed to have injuries.   One Offender was given a citation prior to be transported to the hospital at their request.  The second Offender was arrested and taken before the Magistrate.

On 7-15-2014 at 2:10am I responded to 510 Ferndale Blvd in reference to Domestic Disturbance IP.Upon arriving at the above location I made contact with the victim, CORINA MICHELLE JOHNSON, and the suspect, LINWOOD BURNS INGRAM JR., who were engaged in a verbal dispute in the parking lot.JOHNSON advised INGRAM had assaulted her while she was trying to leave his apartment causing laceration and abrasion to her right arm when he grabbed her right arm trying to pull her back into the apartment preventing her to leave the dispute.

On 07/14/2014 at approximately 2115 hours I responded to 624 Park St. in reference to a domestic assault.  Upon arrival I spoke with Prasafany Outlaw, the victim, who stated that the father of her children had struck her and pulled her hair out.  Mr. Roy Brown was arrested for assault on a female and battery of an unborn child.

On 07-14-2014 at 0108 hours, I responded to 3736 Georgia Pond Ln., in reference to a possible overdose/attempted suicide.  I remained with the individual until Guilford County EMS arrived.  It was determined that the individual had consumed several pills with the intentions of possibly harming herself.  The individual was transported to High Point Regional Hospital for additional treatment and to undergo a mental health assessment.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 07-12-2014 at approximatley 0059 hours James Bondurant called High Point Communications in reference to a domestic disturbance. James Bondurant was arrested at the conclusion of the investigation for violating pretrial release conditions.

On July 10, 2014 Officers responded to Hickory Ct in reference to a disturbance. Upon arrival Officers spoke with Ms Dow in reference to an assault.    Ms Dow said that she had an argument with her boyfriend starting on Dallas Av. The argument became heated. The argument as well as an affray between the two continued as they left in an suv, continuing on I74, and finally ending on Hickory Ct.   A warrant and lookout has been issued for the boyfriend for assault on a female.
On this date, I responded to a domestic dispute between mother and son at the above-listed address.  When I arrived on scene I observed the son assault the mother.  The son was taken into custody.

On 07/10/2014 I responded to 2537 Ingleside Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance between Mother and Daughter. The listed suspect assaulted the victim by punching her in the face with a closed fist. The victim had visible signs of injury to her face. The listed suspect was arrrested on scene.

On Thursday 7/10/14 at approximately 1217 hours Officers Responded to 1412-C E Commerce Av in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  Upon arrival I made contact with the Victim who advised she was cut with a sharp object after an argument. She was treated on scene for her injuries. The suspect fled from the scene prior to Officers arrival and a warrant was taken out. There is no further information available at this time.

On July 10, 2014, at approximately 1700 hours, I responded to 601 North Elm Street (High Point Emergency Room) in reference to an assault. The victim, Juan Peraza, had been taken to the ER by his daughter for his injuries. Peraza advised he was at his residence (1828 Morgans Mill Way) when his live-in girlfriend`s son, Armando Lopez, had assaulted him by striking him in the face. Perzaz sustained serious injuries from the assault. ER staff advised he suffered an "extensive comminuted displaced fractures involving the left maxillary sinus, left orbit and left zygoma". Due to his injuries, I swore out an assault inflicting serious injuries warrant for Lopez. At the time of this report, Lopez had not located.

On 7/10/14, Officers were on a call at 608 Fairview and witnessed Mr. Morris (Offender) assault his girlfriend Mrs. Smith (Victim).  Morris tried to flee on foot but was soon apprehended.He was processed at the PD and then booked into the High Point Jail without incident.
On 07/10/2014, I responded to 150-2c James Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance.  As a result of the investigation, one subject was arrested on assault related charges.

On 07-10-2014, at 0325 hours, I responded to a domestic related call at 210 Westview Pl.  The victim, Mr Gary Bryson, resides in a garage apartment behind this address.  Sometime after falling asleep, somebody locked Mr Bryson inside his apartment.  Mr Bryson suspects that his estranged wife is responsible for locking him in the apartment.  High Point Firefighters responded and gained entry to the apartment.  Mr Bryson was able to get out unharmed.

On Wednesday, July 9th, 2014, Officer Dyles and myself responded to Crestwood Suites, located at 2860 North Main Street, in reference to a reported domestic assault.  Upon our arrival there we met with the two involved partied and determined that an argument had ensued and one of the partied had been assaulted.  The other person was placed under arrest for simple assault (Domestic) and later placed into the Guilford County Jail under a Domestic Hold.

On 7-9-2014, at approximately 0415 hours, I responded to 848 Dogwood Circle in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arriving, I found the suspect had assaulted his wife and fled the scene prior to my arrival.  The suspect, Christopher Lloyd, was located a short time later and charged with Assault on a Female and Communicating Threats.  No further information at this time.

On 7/8/2014 I responded to the listed location for a report of a intimate partner domestic disturbance.   When I arrived on scene I made contact with the victim, Ms. Mobley.  Ms. Mobley had visible injury to her face where she had been assaulted.  The suspect in the assistance is the father of Ms. Mobley`s child.  I responded to the Magistrates Office where I swore out charges against the suspect.

On Tuesday July 8, 2014 I responded to 845 Dogwood Circle in reference to a Domestic. Upon my arrival I spoke with Jackie Blue, who advised her boyfriend Alec Gardner had assaulted her and held her on the ground. Officer Slaton who also was on scene spoke with Alec Gardner, who advised he had told Blue he no longer loved her and that`s when she began to assault him leaving marks.

On July 8, 2014, Officers were dispatched to an assault call. The assault had taken place between a separated husband and wife. A daughter was also assaulted during the same event.   Upon arrival, Officers spoke with Mr Hunter, Mrs Hunter, and Ms Collins. It was determined during the course of the investigation that Mrs Hunter and Ms Collins had been physically assaulted by Mr Hunter.     Shortly after the assaults took place, Mr Hunter was locked out of the house. Later Mr Hunter forced himself into the house by kicking in the back door.  Mr Hunter was arrested for assault  as well as several other charges. See the arrest sheet for further.
Ms. Beale stated that she had a domestic dispute with her boyfriend, and that her boyfriend assaulted her.
On 7/7/2014, at approximately 1600 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I met with the victim and took a report.
