On Tuesday July 15th 2014 I was advised of a child abuse case that occurred in the eastern part of High Point. The case was brought to our attention by Guilford County Child Protective Services. The victim involved did not contact the police department in fear of retribution from the perpetrator.
On 7/7/2014 I responded to a reported assault at 1002 Barbee Ave.  Upon arrival I spoke with the complainant who said her friend had been stabbed with a knife.

On July 6, 2014, at approximately 0349 hours, I responded to 2738 S Main in reference to an assault that already occurred at 309 W Fairfield. Upon arrival, Lindsay Scarbrough advised that she was assaulted.

On 7-5-14, I responded to 534 Forrest St for an assault with a deadly weapon. The suspect was taken into custody and EMS responded and transported the victims to High Point Regional Hospital for treatment. The injuries sustained were minor. The suspect was taken to the Guilford County Juvenile Detention Facility. His mother was present at the time of his arrest. Juvenile petitions were completed and a secured custody order was obtained, all paperwork was forwarded on the Juvenile Court Counselors. There is no further information available.

On 07-04-2014 at 23:25 hours I responded to the 1600 block of Bolingbroke Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon investigating this call, Ms. Higgins was arrested for simple assault on Mr. Hamilton.

On 07-04-2014 at 21:57 hours I responded to 2414 Dallas Av in reference to a fight in progress.  Upon arriving on scene I made contact with the residents.  Both subjects were injured and a warrant was obtained on the male subject involved.  Both the male and female subject were uncooperative and did not want to provide names of subjects present at the scene when the incident occurred.

On 07/04/2014, I responded to a domestic disturbance call. The victim stated that the suspect broke into her home and stole items and cash from her. The suspect fled prior to my arrival, but was located a short time later and arrested.

On 07/04/2014 at approximately 1820 hours I was dispatched to 519 Manley Street in reference to a domestic related assault.  I met with the complainant, a Ms. Mary Mack, who stated she had been in an altercation with a Mr. Randy Hargraves.  Mr. Hargraves was served with a criminal summons in reference to the call.

I was dispatched, along with Officers J. Jacobs, to 2519-E Ambassador Ct. for a reported domestic violence call.Upon arrival, I made contact with Annie Perry, who was highly intoxicated.  She told me that she was next door at 2517-A Ambassador Ct. with her boyfriend she only knew as "Fred". They had been drinking most of the night into late morning when she decided to go home.  The two got into an argument about Perry possibly seeing another man, and she reported he pushed her.  There were no signs of injury at all.In speaking with "Fred" (determined to be Fred Hooker telling me of a 6 month relationship knowing her only as "Ann") he stated he was ready to go to sleep and wanted her to leave.  She refused to leave at first, but ultimately left the apartment where she called Police.  I explained to her how to obtain a criminal process once she has sobered for the assault she alleges occurred.

On Thursday July 3rd 2014, at 2353 hours, I was dispatched to 503 E Lexington Av in reference to a violation of a restraining order.Upon my arrival, a male subject was located in the residence and was in violation of a restraining order.  Same subject was arrested.

On July 3, 2014 around 1835 hrs. Officers responded to 3910 Stafford Run Court on a report of a domestic disturbance.  Officers arrived on scene and located Paul and Nora McAdoo inside the residence engaged in a verbal dispute. Officers separated the couple and obtained statements and observed injuries to the right tricep of Ms. McAdoo. Officers placed Paul McAdoo under arrest for assault on a female and transported him to the High Point County jail where he was held on a domestic violence hold.

On 07/02/2014, I was dispatched to 1411 E. Green Dr in reference to a domestic dispute. Upon arrival I made contact with the victim who stated that her child`s father had assaulted her and left the scene. The victim had signs of physical injury. Warrants were obtained for David Hunter for assault on a female.

On July 1, 2014 at approximately 7:11pm I was dispatched to 710 Fairview St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The victim was assaulted by her ex-boyfriend, who fled the scene prior to my arrival.  A warrant was obtained on the suspect for assault on a female.  The victim suffered minor injuries.

On Tuesday 7/1/14 at approximately 1122 hours Officers responded to 1713 Gavin Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival Officers arrested Mr. Antonio Johnson in reference to the disturbance.  Ms. Sheconda Douglas was treated on scene by ems for injuries and pictures were taken. There is no further information available at this time.

On 6-30-2014, I responded to 1127-b Campbell St. in reference to a disturbance.When I arrived I came in contact with the homeowners who were yelling at each other. The girlfriend assaulted the boyfriend, as a result she was arrested and taken to the High Point Jail. No further issues.

On Monday June 30, 2014 I responded to the High Point Hospital in reference to an Assault. Upon my arrival I spoke with the victim Jessica Watts, who advised this morning when her boyfriend Michael Carter seen she had her cell phone, he became irate. Watts advised Carter began to assault her for having her cell phone with her. Charges were taken out on Carter for assault and he was later arrested.
On 6/30/2014, at approximately 1910 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding a break in. Upon my arrival I spoke to the victim and made a report.

On Monday, June 30th, 2014, at 0552 hours, I responded to 2508-D Ambassador Court in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Vanessa Ramey and Mr. Morlai Lawson.  Ms. Ramey stated Mr. Lawson refused to allow her to leave the apartment during an argument by grabbing her by her shirt, arm, and bag ripping her shirt sleeve during the altercation.  Ms. Ramey advised while trying to leave the apartment Mr. Lawson slammed the apartment door closed on her head cutting her forehead in two places.  Mr. Lawson was arrested for Assault on a Female and confined in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic violence hold with no bond.

On Sunday June 29, 2014, I responded to 2109 San Fernando Dr in reference to a possible ExParte order violation.  The complainant in this call stated to police dispatch that his wife, with whom he has an Ex-Parte order against, was at his residence and he was back enroute.  When I arrived I spoke with the complainant and pulled up his restraining order on my mobile, and also saw where his wife had an Ex-Parte order against him.  Both orders were showing served and entered into NCIC indicating validity.  I then went to the residence where I encountered the female.  After a brief interview, it was determined that she was in violation of the complainants Ex-Parte order.  I placed the female under arrest and transported her to the magistrates office.  Prior to reaching the magistrates office, I had Guilford Co Sheriffs office fax me both copies of the Ex-Parte orders.  Magistrate Garber looked at the paperwork and it was discovered that the complainants Ex-Parte had never been signed by a district court judge and was deemed invalid.  The female was then un-arrested and she was taken back to the residence to gather her vehicle and children.  This Ex-Parte order has been brought to the attention of Chief district court judge Jarrell, who advised he would look into the matter.  At this time this case is closed/cleared unfounded.
On June 29, 2014 I responded to 601 N Elm St in reference to investigating a potential domestic assault.
On 6/29/2014, at approximately 300 hours, I responded to a call of an armed subject. Upon my arrival I looked for the subject and conducted an investigation.
On 07-04-2014 I responded to the northside of High Point in reference a rape that occurred on June 28th.

I responded to 3602 Broadstone Village Dr, Apt 3E in reference to a disturbance. Upon arriving officers found that a male had been assaulted by his girlfriend. The female was arrested without incident and transported to High Point Jail.

On 06/27/2014, I responded to 3860-1D Smokey Quartz Ct in reference to a subject who had been shot.  Upon arrival, it was discovered the subject had apparently committed suicide.  Phillips responded and recovered the body.  Next of kin is believed to be living in a different part of this state.  The appropriate sheriff`s department is currently working on notification of next of kin.

On 06-27-2014 at 23:20 hours I responded to 1638 Carthage Lane in reference to a domestic disturbance IP.  Upon arriving on scene I spoke with Ms. Campbell.  Ms. Campbell stated she was assaulted by an acquaintance.  A warrant was sworn out for the subject.  At the time of this report, the subject had not been located.

offense: ALL OTHER - HIT AND RUN (PROPERTY DAMAGE)
body: On Friday June 27, 2014 at 1434 hours I responded to Walmart at 2710 N. Main St. in reference to a Hit and Run with Property Damage.  Upon my arrival I spoke to Ms. Heather Allen.  Ms. Allen advised she backed out of a parking spot in the pva of Walmart and another vehicle backed into her vehicle.  The other vehicle then pulled forward and backed into he vehicle a second time then sped off.No DMV 349 was completed for this incident.

On Friday, 6/27/14, at approximately 1045 hours, I responded to 308 Newview Street regarding a Vandalism.  Upon my arrival I met with the resident, Jonathan Ervin, who told me he caught his ex-girlfriend damaging the windows to his mother`s vehicle with a hammer.  Ervin advised that Jenkins left prior to my arrival.  I obtained a Warrant for Arrest against the suspect for Injury to Personal Property and Violation of a Domestic Violence Protective Order.

On 06-26-2014 at 2200 hours High Point Communications dispatched Officer M Leonard and Officer Bundy to a possible domestic dispute in the area of Oakwood Street and W English Rd. Upon arrival, Officer M Leonard and Officer Bundy located Masango in the parking lot at the corner of Oakwood Street and W English Road. Upon further investigation, Masango was arrested for simple assault.

On 06/25/2014 at 17:55 hours I responded to Tan Lines located at 2705 N Main St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I met with the victim who stated that she was assaulted by her boyfriend behind YMCA located at 150 W Hartley Dr.  The victim had scratches on both her upper thighs that showed she had been recently assaulted.  The suspect was located near the scene and taken into custody without incident.  This suspect was charged with assault on a female and placed in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On 06/25/2014, I responded to 400 N. Main St in reference to a domestic assault. Upon arriving I spoke with both parties involved and noticed that the victim had a small laceration to the right wrist. The suspect was arrested without incident and transported to the High Point Jail.

On Tuesday, June 24th, 2014, at 2312 hours, I made contact with Ms. Cassandra Salas by telephone in reference to a vandalism that occurred at Outback Steakhouse at 260 East Parris Avenue.  Ms. Salas advised during her shift working at Outback Steakhouse her front and rear passenger side tires were slashed, and she located a long scratch in the paint extending along her passenger front and rear doors of her 2003 Dodge Intrepid (CFJ-5600).  Ms. Salas advised she suspects her ex-boyfriend, Mr. Brent Coggins, to be responsible for the damage due to a recent vandalism to her vehicle in Davidson County.

On 06/24/14 at approximately 1329hrs we received a 911 call regarding an assault in progress on Adams St.  Upon investigation it was determined that a female resident had been kidnapped and asaulted by her intimate partner.

On 06/24/2014, at approximately 1746 hours, I responded to High Point Regional Hospital located at 601 N Elm Street in reference to an assault. Upon arrival I made contact with the victim, Miss Inez Tyler, who advised me that she was assaulted the night before by her boyfriend. Miss Tyler had visible bruising on her face while at the hospital. Miss Tyler was given the victim`s rights form for Domestic Violence. A warrant for arrest was obtained on the suspect and he was later located and arrested at his residence.

On the 23rd day of June, 2014 at approximately 1430 hours, I responded to 2401 Van Buren St in reference to a domestic disturbance involving intimate partners.Signs of assault were seen on both subjects. Both subjects have been charged.

On 6/23/14, Officers were contacted by Mrs. Felicia Wilson in reference to her son forcing her to give him all her money.  After meeting and interviewing Mrs. Frazier further, it was determined the offender, Mr. Justin Wilson in fact stole her money.Mr. Wilson was contacted at the City Bus Terminal and arrested without incident.

On 6/23/2014, at approximately 1200 hours, officers responded to the Open Door Shelter, 400 N Centennial, reference to a female victim reporting a burglary that occurred at 1009 Sharon around 0100 hours on the same day. The victim`s ex-boyfriend forced entry through her front door and stole her cell phone. Warrants have been obtained on the suspect for first degree burglary and larceny after breaking and entering.

On Sunday June 22, 2014 at 2035 hours, I responded to 1150-D Roberts Ln in reference to a domestic assault that occurred between husband and wife.Upon officers arrival and further investigation, it was determined the husband (Chakra Magar) assaulted his wife (Binu Magar) by kicking her in the leg which led to her cutting her finger with a kitchen knife while she was preparing dinner.Chakra Magar was arrested for Assault on a Female and placed into the High Point Detention Facility under a domestic hold issued by Magistrate Gillespie.  The defendants wife was treated by medical personnel at the residence but refused EMS transport to the hospital.

On 06/22/14 at approximately 1210hrs I was dispatched to respond to a domestic disturbance on Allred Pl.  The female complaintant advised that her fiance` had assaulted her.  Upon my arrival, the male subject had left the area on foot.  The female had physical evidence of assault, so a warrant was obtained for the male subject.  He later turned himself in at the police department.
On Saturday June 21, 2014, I responded to 404 E. Lexington Ave. in reference to a vandalism.

On Saturday June 21, 2014 I responded to 2310-B Shadow Valley Road in reference to a Domestic Assault. Upon my arrival I spoke with the victim Dominique Mccorkle, who advised her boyfriend Nigel Pegues had punched her in the face and also had hit her one year old daughter in the head with a cell phone, causing injuries to both. Pegues had left prior to my arrival.

On 06/21/14 at approximately 1058hrs I responded to 820 South Rd. regarding a reported domestic disturbance in progress.  The reporting party alleged that his girlfriend had held a knife to his throat.  Upon investigation it was determined that both parties had assaulted one another and both were arrested.  CPS was notified because children were present in the home at the time of the disturbance.

On 6/21/2014 at 0400 hours I met with Willie May Horne at 1009 Leonard Av, the High Point Police Department, in reference to her reporting a domestic assault. Through further invetigation a WFA was obtained against Dwight Ingram in regards to the assault.

On 6-21-14, I responded to 1000 Gordon St for a domestic disturbance.  The victim advised she and her husband got into a verbal altercation and he spit in her face. I spoke with the suspect and he advised it was an accident. A third party witness inside the residence advised the assault was intentional and in the heat of the argument. The suspect was arrested for assault on a female and transported to the police department for processing and then to the county building where he was held on a 24-hour domestic hold. The victim was provided with domestic violence information. No photographs were taken.

On 06-20-2014 at approximately 1734 hours communications broadcasted a lookout in reference to a mobile domestic dispute leaving 2310 N Main St (Home Depot).  The domestic involved a male and a female in a gray Nissan Versa displaying NC license plate CAS8613.  I located the vehicle on N Main St and the passenger was arrested for simple assault.

On September 3, 2014, at approximately 1700 hours, I responded to 2630 Willard Dairy Rd (Moses Cone Medical Center) in reference to a two year old child that had been abused. The incident did not occur in High Point. It appears that the abuse occurred in Georgia. The father of the child brought his son to the hospital for treatment after getting him back from the mother.

On 06-20-2014 at approximately 11:00 am, i responded to 505 E Green Drive, the Magistrates office, in reference to a domestic assault.  Upon my arrival I made contact with the victim, Mrs Jamie Horne-Davis.  Mrs Davis advised on the dates and times listed above, she was assaulted by the suspect.

On 06/20/2014 at approximately 0048 hours I responded to the magistrate`s office located at 505 E Green DR in reference to a domestic disturbance involving intimate partners.  Upon my arrival I made contact with the reporting party and victim, Mrs Ashley Davis, who advised that at or about 0030 hours while at the Motel 6 located at 120 SW Cloverleaf (room #225), that she was assaulted by her ex-boyfriend, Mr William Coble.  Mr Coble was said to have struck Mrs Davis several times about the face/head before she fled from the motel room.  Mrs Davis had injuries consistent with the aforementioned assault which included swelling around her right eye and forehead, in addition to a few, minor abrasions under her right eye.  An arrest warrant for assault on a female was issued and Mr Coble was subsequently arrrested at 0355 hours in the pva of the HPRH.

On June 19, 2014, at approximately 1133 hours, I responded to 2102 Briarcliff Drive in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, I made contact with all subjects involved. The female half, Sharonica Watson, drove to her estranged husband`s location (above location) with their child in the vehicle. An argument ensued and Mrs. Watson drove her vehicle onto the property in a reckless manner as their daughter tried to get out of same. The daughter sustained minor abrasions to both knees as a result. Mrs. Watson was arrested for child endangerment and transported to the County Building without problem. The child was left with her father.

On 06/19/2014 at 03:33 hours I responded to 102-F WoodValley Ct in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I met with the victim who stated that she was assaulted by her girlfriend.  The victim had signs that she was assaulted and the suspect was taken into custody in front of 102 Woodvalley Ct.  This suspect was then charged with simple assault and possession of drug paraphernalia.

I was dispatched to a domestic violence (IP) involving a male and a female at 2918-D E Kivett Dr.  Contact was made with both parties.  The female had been assaulted but EMS was not needed.  The female victim obtained warrants at the magistrate`s office.

On 6/17/2014 at approximately 0000 hours, officers were flagged down at 506-A E Fairfield Rd reference to an assault with a deadly weapon. One of the residents, Larry Martin, assaulted the victim by pointing a gun and attempting to shoot him. The victim was not reported to be injured. There were several witnesses to the incident. Martin is a convicted felon and he was charged with possession of a firearm by a convicted felon. He was given a $30,000 secured bond.
On 6/16/2014, at approximately 2100 hours, I became aware of a domestic disturbance at the listed location. After an investigation I took a report.
On June 16,2014 at 1333 hours, We were dispatched to 1004 Tesh Ct. reference an assault. Both parties were arrested.

On June 15, 2014, at approximately 2144 hours, I responded to 1606-A Long Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke to the female half, Amy Lambeth, who was standing outside in the parking lot. She advised that she was assaulted by her live-in boyfriend, Calvin Spears. Mrs. Lambeth had a swollen right eye. Mr. Spears stated that he did not assault Mrs. Lambeth. He said he was the one that was assaulted and she hit herself to cause her injuries. Mr. Spears was arrested and transported to the Magistrates Office without problems.
On June 15, 2014, officers responded to a domestic disturbance and found the victim`s daughter crying outside.  The defendant was arrested for assault on a female and incarcerated.

On Sunday, June 15th, 2014, at 1327 hours, I responded to the High Point Police Department at 1009 Leonard Avenue in reference to an assault that occurred at 101 Marywood Drive.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Amanda Suggs who advised her live-in boyfriend, Mr. Stephen Mattson, pushed her into the kitchen wall and pushed her into the floor during an argument.  Mr. Mattson was arrested for assault on a female and confined in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold with no bond.

On 06-15-2014, at 1114 hours, I responded to 1310 W Green Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The victim stated that the father of her child assaulted her.  A warrant was obtained on the suspect.
On 6/15/2014, at approximately 520 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding an assault. Upon my arrival at the ER I spoke to the victim and took a report.
On 6-15-14 I was dispatched to the police department in reference to a female victim that wanted to report a rape that had occurred in southeast High Point.

On June 15, 2014, at 1:20am, I was dispatched to 1114 Biltmore Av in reference to a breaking and entering that had just occurred.  The victim stated her neighbor, and former boyfriend, had first attempted to gain entry through her bedroom window, and then pushed past her and came in through the front door.  The suspect denied all allegations, and the victim was advised to seek warrants.  No arrests have been made at this time.

On Sunday, June 15th, 2014, at 1002 hours, I responded to 1860 Yates Mill Court in reference to an assault that occurred on Saturday, June 14th, 2014.  I made contact with Ms. Audretta Hall who advised she had taken out warrants against Mr. Ronnie "Lamat" Kelly for pushing her with his hands around the residence, slapping her in the face with his open hand, and numerous threatening text messages.  Mr. Kelly was arrested at the residence and confined in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold with no bond.

On Friday June 13, 2014 I responded to 3913 Melco Court in reference to a Domestic. Upon my arrival I spoke with the victim Anupa Koirala, who advised her husband Kalyan Koirala had assaulted her. After speaking with both parties Kalyan was placed under arrest for assault on a female.

On the 13th day of June, 2014 at approximately 1548 hours, I responded to 109 Edgeworth St in reference to a domestic disturbance. There were signs of assault on both parties. Both parties were placed under arrest.

On 06-13-2014 at approximately 0132 hours I arrived to 601 N Elm St in reference to an AWDW stabbing. Upon arrival I met with Germaine Jackson who had lacerations to his right hand and above his left eye. Through further investigation Oneeka Jackson was charged with AWDWISI.
On June 12, 2014 I responded to 803-A Carr St. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  After an investigation was conducted Ashley Roper was arrested for assault.

On Thursday, June 12, 2014, I responded to 319 Avery Avenue regarding a domestic disturbance between mother and son that resulted in the male juvenile running away.I spoke with the reporting party, Tereathea Canty, who advised she and her son were involved in a disturbance over her not getting him any Mcdonald`s.  The reporting party stated her son was being disrespectful and got upset and ran out of the rear door not to return.

On 6-10-14, I responded to 1007 Shepard Pl for a domestic disturbance. The male subject left prior to my arrival. I spoke with the victim, and she advised her boyfriend came to the house after they had been arguing on the phone. He forced his way into the residence and began assaulting her. The victim advised her daughter, who owns the residence, stepped in to help her and was assaulted as well. Photographs were taken of the injuries, and paperwork containing domestic violence assistance information was provided to the victims. The suspect was not located at this time. He left on foot in an unknown direction.  Warrants were obtained for breaking /entering, assault and battery and simple assault on a female. At this time, the suspect has not been located. There is no further information available.

On June 9, 2014 at approximately 2049 hours, I responded to 208-D Taylor Avenue in reference to a Domestic Disturbance Intimate Partner call.  Upon arrival, I met the victim who advised that the suspect assaulted her, then left before the police arrived.  Warrants were drawn on the suspect and service was attempted.  However, the suspect was not home at that time.

On 06/09/2014 at approximately 1551 hours I responded to 232 Brentwood St reference a domestic assault in process. Upon arrival I noticed a female subject with cuts and bleeding to her face. EMS was called and she was treated and released on scene. The male subject was arrested on scene.
On 6-8-2014, at approximately 1115 hours, I responded to 501-A Saunders in reference to a larceny call.  The victim reported her debit card had been stolen.  No further information at this time.

On Saturday 6/7/14 at approximately 1503 hours Officers responded to 2429 W Green Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival Officers made contact with both parties involved.  Disturbance was over a phone call. There is currently no further information available at this time.

On the above date and time I responded to 602 W Main St in reference to a domestic assault. Upon my arrival I spoke to Sara Saunders. She advised she was out at the pool with her kids and her exboyfriend  came out to the park also. They got into a disturbance and she advised he assaulted her. She went to the magistrate and took out warrants. The suspect had left before my arrival.

On June 7, 2014 at approximately 0657 hours, I responded to 616 Caudell Place in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, I spoke with Mr. Gregory Benthall who stated that he and his wife, Ms. Evelyn Hodge, had just been in an argument. Ms. Hodge stated that Mr. Benthall assaulted her. Ms. Hodge had injuries consistent with her statement. Mr. Benthall was arrested at the scene and charged with assault on a female.
On 6/7/2014, at approximately 345 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I conducted an investigation and made an arrest.

On Saturday, June 7, 2014 at about 1:30 A.M.  We were dispatched via departmental radio to 3737 Pemberton Way in regards to a domestic disturbance. Upon our arrival we spoke to the caller, Mr. Sorgius and he informed us that his wife struck him several about the face and body.

On 6-6-14 at approximately 1255 hours while on uniform patrol I responded to 1298 Vernon Pl in reference to a domestic violence call.  There was no evidence of an assault and no subjects were arrested.

On June 6, 2014, at approximately 1037 hours, I responded to 603 East Commerce Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, I spoke with Ms. Carol Coachman, who stated that someone had just broken the front passenger side window on her vehicle. The scene was not processed due to a lack of evidence. Ms. Coachman advised that she knew the person who broke her window and she would pursue a warrant.

On 06/05/2014 at 2329 hours, I responded to 1706 Edmondson Pl in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Ms. Monae Sturdivant who advised that she was assaulted by her boyfriend and the father of her child, Damorius Fuller-Ali.  Ms. Sturdivant received minor injuries and was checked out by EMS.  Ms. Sturdivant obtained warrants for Mr. Fuller-Ali and they are still outstanding at the time of the report.
On 6/5/2014, at approximately 2300 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I met with the victim and took a report.

On Friday June 6, 2014, at 0935 hours, I responded to the Police Department in reference to a female reporting items stolen from her purse and money taken from her bank account.  Upon arrival, I met with Laura Williams, who stated her ex-boyfriend, Jonathan Grant, withdrew $450.00 from her bank account, along with stealing $30.00 in cash currency from her purse.  Williams was advised of the warrant process and stated she wished to seek charges against Grant.  I later learned that the Magistrate issued a criminal summons against Grant.

On 6/4/2014 I responded to 801 Gordon Rd. in reference to assault.  After an investigation it was determined that the victim was assaulted.  Officer Finn located the subject and arrested him  on outstanding warrants and I further charged him with assault.

On 6/3/2014, a report was taken by telephone reference a larceny of several items and damage to property that occurred at 209 Snider St on 6/2/2014 at approximately 2200 hours. The victim`s boyfriend is the suspect. No charges have been filed at this time.

On 6-2-2014 I responded to 111 N Hoskins St. in reference to a domestic assualt. Upon arrival I spoke with the victim who stated her boyfriend and children`s father who lives at the house came back and broke in the kitchen window.  The victim stated that the suspect reached in and grabbed a can of grease and threw it and hit her in the face.

On 6/3/2014, a report was taken by telephone reference a larceny of cash that occurred at 209 Snider St between 06/01/2014 at 2200 hours and  06/02/2014 at 1300 hours. The victim`s boyfriend is the suspect. No charges have been filed at this time.

On this date, police were dispatched to a person needing assistance at a southside residence. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed that a couple, both extremely intoxicated, had gone to a party earlier in the evening. Upon returning home, they got into a verbal argument which escalated into a physical altercation. The female advising she had been assaulted by the male due to another male making unwanted advances on her. The female was holding two infant children in her arms, and was directed to hand the children to a friend, who was sober. The female asked for police escort to an address to pick up children`s supplies in an effort to stay somewhere else for the evening. I visually inspected the female`s face, arms, and neck for any sign of assault. No sign of assault was visible. I then took the female to the residence for pickup of personal belongings.There were other females at the residence, and by the time the female exited the house she was saying she had been, "pistol whooped about her face", by her boyfriend. She then stated her mother was present during the assault. I obtained the mother`s phone number from the victim, and advised her I was going to call her to verify the firearm being involved. She pled with me not to ask her about the gun, and I asked if she was being truthful about the gun, and she stated no gun was involved. I called the mother, and asked what happened, and she verified that her daughter, and her boyfriend had infact fought, and the boyfriend slapped her daughter about her face, in the presence of their two children in common together. I advised her mother that the boyfriend would be arrested.Upon returning to original location I placed the boyfriend under arrest for assault on a female. He was processed and placed into the custody of the Guilford County Jail.

On May 31, 2014 I was dispatched to High Point Regional Hospital at 601 N. Elm St. in reference to a possible rape.  I contacted the victims mother at the hospital who advised that she was made aware of her daughters condition by the ex-boyfriend.  The ex-boyfriend had to be coaxed into calling EMS by the victims mother.  Davidson county EMS transported the victim to the hospital.  A rape kit was done by the SANE nurse at the hospital.
On 5/31/2014, at approximately 130 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I conducted an investigation and made an arrest.

On 05/30/2014 I was dispatched to 605-E Granby Ave in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I made contact with the victim and the suspect. Both parties stated they were in a verbal argument that turned physical. The suspect was arrested and charged with assault on a female.

On 5-30-2014 I responded to 203 Dorothy St. in reference to a disturbance.When I arrived I met with the homeowner who advised her boyfriend had punched her in the face. A report was taken and warrants were taken out for the boyfriend.
On this date I responded to 601-A Kent Street in reference to a vandalism that had already occurred.

On 6/3/2014, a report was taken by telephone reference a larceny of cash that occurred at 209 Snider St on 5/30/2014 between 0400 and 1300 hours. The victim`s boyfriend is the suspect. No charges have been filed at this time.

Om 5/29/2014 at approximately 2150 hours, officers responded to 3303 Crestview Pl reference a domestic disturbance that occurred at 3014-F Sherrill Av. The victim advised that her and her husband, Bryant Jacobs, got into an altercation that led to an assault with visible injuries. Jacobs` two children and his brother-in-law were also assaulted during the incident. Jacobs was charged with assault on a female, two counts of assault on a minor under 12 and assault inflicting serious injury. He is being held on a domestic hold until first appearance.

On May 26, 2014 at approximately 8:50pm I responded to 2012 Carlisle Wy in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The victim was assaulted by her husband, causing minor injuries and not requiring medical attention.  Warrants were obtained on the suspect, and the suspect was later arrested.

On 5-27-14, I spoke with Ms. Jones she advised that her daughter assaulted her on 5-26-14. She was advised by court counselors to contact the police department for charges. Juvenile petitions were filed for assault and damage to personal property.  The juvenile was aware of the charges, and the petitions were sent to the court authorities. There is no further information.

On 05-26-2014 at around 1542 hours I was dispatched to 204 -A Taylor Av in reference to a Domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I spoke with the victim, Michael Smith, who advised that Wannetta IJames assaulted him.

On May 25, 2014 I was dispatched to 402 Ridgecrest Drive for a domestic disturbance.Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Dunbar in the front yard who reported that she and her girlfriend, Ms. Simmons got into an argument about Ms. Dunbar being out all night the night before.  As a result of the argument, Ms. Dunbar reported that Ms. Simmons punched her in her right eye.  There was visible redness and swelling underneath Ms. Dunbar`s right eye (I took digital photos).  Ms. Simmons wouldn`t cooperate to give her side of the story.Ms. Simmons was arrested for assault and taken before Magistrate Gillespie where she was ultimately jailed under a $250 bond (non-domestic simple assault).  Officer Bundy gave Ms. Dunbar appropriate domestic violence paperwork.  Ms. Simmons` son was taken to the grandmother`s house by Officer Bundy.

On 05-25-2014 at 16:50 hours I responded to 101 Gordon St in reference to an assault on a pregnant female.  Upon arriving on scene I made contact with the victim, Ms. Nialoni Daniels.  Ms. Daniels had obvious injuries from being assaulted by Mr. Evan Gainey.  Ms. Daniels was transported by EMS to High Point Hospital.  A warrant was obtained for Mr. Gainey and he was arrested on 05-25-2014 at 22:22 hours.

On May 25, 2014 at approximately 1310 hours, I responded to 310 Druid Street in reference to a Domestic Disturbance Intimate Partner call.  Upon arrival, I met the parties involved who advised that they both assaulted each other.

On 05/25/2014, at approximately 22:20 hours, I responded to 210 Fraley Rd. in reference to a vandalism. When I arrived I spoke with Mr. Castellanos, he stated that after the church service he went outside to his vehicle and found that it had been vandalized.
On Saturday, May 24, 2014, I responded to the 500 block of East Fairfield in reference to an assault. Upon my arrival I spoke with Emily Hill who advised me that she had been assaulted.

On 5-24-14, I responded to 2321 Purdy Avenue for an attempted suicide. The victim used a razor blade to scratch herself. She was transported to High Point Regional Hospital and stayed for a psychiatric evaluation. There is no further information available.

On May 23, 2014, I spoke with Mr WIlliams in reference to a disturbance with a former girlfriend. Mr Williams reported that his former girlfriend came over to his house after being told not to do so. She became angry when she was not allowed inside the house. The woman then took a tire iron and broke the two left side door windows, the rear window, and cracked the windshield on his Yukon.    The suspect has been arrested.

Ms. Little stated that between the times listed, someone broke into the residence and took the TV`s.  Ms. Little said that the residence was that of her cousin, Ms. Ledbetter, but that she had been staying at the residence for the past two weeks.  Lab personnel responded to the scene and took photographs.  The lab personnel also collected several latent prints from the scene.

offense: ALL OTHER - HIT AND RUN (PROPERTY DAMAGE)
body: On 5-23-2014 I responded to a public disturbance at 115 Westchester Dr.When I arrived I was advised a hit and run had taken place. The offender was located and cited, no injuries.

On 5-20-2014, at approximately 1630 hours, I responded to 505 S Bunker Hill Road in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  Mr. Richard Brightwell had gotten into an arguement with his girlfriend, Lori Mason.  Both had minor injuries sustained during the physical altercation that followed.  Both were arrested and charged with assault.  No further information at this time.
On Wednesday, May 21, 2014 at approximately 1115 hours, it was reported that a juvenile had been assaulted.This incident is still under investigation.  No arrest have been made.

On 05/19/2014 I responded to 409 White Oak in response to a public disturbance.  Upon arrival I observed a black female repeatedly striking a black male in the face and about the shoulders.  I arrested the female for simple assault, and through investigation learned that the two had children together and reclassified the call as Domestic Violence between Intimate Partners.  The Victim was offered the DV-IP paperwork, but refused to accept it.

On 05/20/2014 at approximately 0115 hours, I responded to the High Point Regional Emergency Room in reference to a domestic assault that happened on Dorothy Street.  Upon my arrival, I spoke to the victim who advised that she was assaulted by her child`s father.  The victim received medical treatment and a warrant was obtained for the suspect.

On 05/19/2014 at 09:18 hours I responded to 611 Three Oaks Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance that already occurred.  Upon arrival I met with the victim who stated that her husband assaulted her.  There was no signs of physical injury so the victim, so she was advised to take out warrants on her husband.  This victim proceeded to the Magistrate`s Office and took out a warrant for assault on a female.  When Officer`s attempted to serve this warrant, the suspect barricaded himself in the residence and refused to come out of the house.  After a standoff with the suspect, the suspect came out of the residence and was taken into custody without incident.

On 05/18/2014 around 0128 hours, I responded to 913 Park Street in High Point in reference to a domestic assault involving intimate partners.  The female subject was later determine to be the aggressor and was arrested for domestic assault.

On 5-16-2014, at approximately 11:34pm, I was dispatched to 119 Orville Dr in reference to a domestic situation.  The suspect was in violation of a domestic violence protection order and was arrested.

At approximately 2122 hours on 5/16/2014, the victim was sitting in the bar area of Applebee`s when his girlfriend, arrived and told him to go outside.  When the victim exited the front of the restaurant, she  began assaulting him by striking him in the face.  Another subject pulled her off of the victim and then the two subjects left in a vehicle.  The incident was witnessed by the restaurant manager ) and a customer in the parking lot   The victim did not have any visible injuries.  An arrest warrant was issued .

On May 16, 2014, I spoke with on the phone with Erica Kay Lindiment and ultimately met her at the Magistrate`s Office parking lot.  Once there, she explained to me that she and the suspect have been together on and off for 10 years and have three children together (and that she is possibly pregnant with his fourth).  He is reported to be a truck driver and is gone most of the time, but when he is in town, he stays with Lindiment at 2706-A Annmoore Circle.On this particular date, both parties had met next to McDonald`s (1901 North Main Street) as the suspect had come into town and wanted to see Lindiment.  An argument ensued and the suspect reportedly struck Lindiment several times in her face.  As a result, there were visible injuries in the form of a red and swollen left cheek, scratches on the bottom left jaw and a scratch on her right middle finger.  I took digital photos of these injuries that will be placed into our crime lab as evidence.I drafted an NCAWARE warrant on the suspect for the charge of assaulting a female (domestic related) and Magistrate Gillespie activated it.  I issued a lookout for the suspect in regards to the warrant.  It should also be noted that I gave Lindiment the appropriate domestic violence assistance paperwork.

On 5-15-2014, at approximately 1745 hours, I responded to a Domecstic Dusturbance at 1422-B E Commerce Avenue.  Mr. Christopher Coleman had assaulted his wife, Edtrina Jackson.  Mr. Coleman was arrested and charged with Assault on a Female.  No further information at this time,

On Thursday, May 15, 2014, at about 2:22 P.M., I was dispatched to 2424 E. Lexington Ave via departmental radio in regards to a domestic dispute. Upon my arrival, I spoke to Mr. Malik, and he stated that his ex-girlfriend kicked open his side door. She then entered without permission or authority and removed property.

On the above date and time, I responded to the incident location for a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I met the victim, Chazmen Tate. Tate stated that she had been assaulted by her ex-boyfriend Robert Napper. Lab responded to the scene for photographs and evidence collection. A warrant was issued by Magistrate Landen for Assault on a female and 2nd degree trespass. The suspect had not been located at the time of this report.

On 5/13/2014 at approximately 0045 hours, officers responded to 501-A Wise Av reference a domestic disturbance that had just occurred involving an assault. The victim was assaulted by her husband, Rashawn Ingram and the injuries were apparent. Ingram left the scene before officers arrived. Warrants were issued for him and served shortly after for assault on a female. He was held under no bond for the domestic related charge.

On 05-12-2014, I responded to 610 Hines St. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I witnessed a physical assault and placed Danika King in custody.  She was taken before a magistrate and then placed in the High Point detention center.

On 05/12/2014 at approximately 0146 hours I responded to 1211 E Russell Av reference a domestic disturbance intimate partner. Upon arrival I made contact with the offender and he was subsequently taken into custody. The victim cooperated with the investigation and had visible signs of injury.
On May 12, 2014 I responded to 1607 Brockett Av. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  After arriving and investigating the scene, Annette Smith was arrested for simple assualt.

On this date I responded to 604-3H Clara Cox Way for a reported Assault.  I spoke to the victim, Deja Dawkins, who had visible injuries to her left eye including a laceration and swelling.  She stated her boyfriend stuck her several times with a closed fist.  A warrant was obtained for his arrest for Assault on Female.

On 05/10/2114 around 2111 hours, I was dispatched to 1101 Young Place in High Point in reference to a domestic disturbance involving intimate partners. According to the Police dispatcher, the call was initially dispatched to Guilford County EMS as a medical assistance call.  Upon my arrival I spoke with Officer Manzo who was already at the scene. Officer Manzo advised me that the male subject at the residence had brutally assaulted his girlfriend, Alberta Rose Andrews. The male subject was identified as Richard Vernon Hotaling and was placed under arrest for felony assault inflicting serious bodily injury. Andrews sustained a laceration to the back of her head and bruises on her right fingers and right foot. She was treated at the High Point Regional Emergency Room for her injuries.
On May 10, 2014, I responded to 511 Ridgecrest Drive for a reported domestic disturbance.

On 05/10/2014 at approximately 0611 hours I responded to the Bizzy Bee grocery located at 1611 Prospect ST in reference to a domestic disturbance involving intimate partners.  Upon my arrival I made contact with one of the involved parties, Mrs Eden Amick, and the reporting party/witness, Mr James Bryson.  Mrs Amick and Mr Bryson reported that Mrs Amick had been assaulted by her ex-boyfriend, Mr James Arvil Shoun JR, in the pva of the service station.  Mr Shoun was said to have struck Mrs Amick several times about the body and in the face.  Mrs Amick suffered a busted lip and possibly a sprained ankle as a result of the assault.  EMS was refused and Mrs Amick responded to the county building where she obtained an arrest warrant for domestic assault on a female.  A BOL was issued and forwarded to Archdale & Davidson County.

On 08/20/2014, at 12:23 hours, I responded to the Victim`s Justice Center at 401 Taylor St in reference to a sexual assault that occurred in the northern part of the city.  The victim reported being sexually abused and raped by her husband numerous times since May 9, 2014.
I responded to 511 Manley St on a reported domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I spoke with Ms Wall.  She said that her boyfriend had taken her purse during an argument and left the house.

On Thursday May 8th 2014, at 2059 hours, I was dispatched to 1604 Eastchester in reference to a vandalism.Upon my arrival I made contact with the caller, who advised his son punched out his window and then fled the scene.

On 5-8-14, I responded to 910-A Jefferson Av for an assault between siblings. Two sisters were arguing over a phone and the altercation resulted in a physical assault. The oldest sibling was arrested and charged with assault on a juvenile petition.  The paperwork was completed and sent to the juvenile courts. Photographs were taken of the injuries. There is no further information available.

On 5-7-2014, at approximately 1700 hours, I responded to the area of Deep River Road and Hickory Lane in reference to a Domestic Dispute.  Mr. Darius Thomas had assaulted his girlfriend.  No further information at this time.

On 5/7/2014, at approximately 1130 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding a disturbance at Oak View Elementary. Upon my arrival I determined the same to be a child custody issue and the child left with his father.

On 05/07/2014, I was dispatched to 713-A S. Scientific St in reference to a domestic dispute. Upon arrival I made contact with the victim, who stated that her ex-boyfriend had broke into her house and later assaulted her. The suspect was no longer on scene. Arrest warrants were issued for the subject.

On May 5, 2014 I was dispatched to 502-B Newton Pl. in reference to an assault with a deadly weapon.  I contacted the victim, Ervin Rice, who advised that his girlfriend, Shirlene Horne, hit him with a brick.  I took Mr. Rice to the magistrates office and swore out a warrant on Ms. Horne which I later served.

On 05-05-14, at approximately 1506 hours, Officer Moss and I were dispatched to 704 Kent St in reference to Chavis Edmond being back on the property after I banned him for unauthorized live in earlier today. Warrants have been obtain on Mr. Edmond for Misdemeanor Breaking and Entering and Misdemeanor Larceny.

On 05/05/2014 Traffic Units were dispatched to I-74 and E Green Dr in reference to a traffic crash involving a rollover.  As we arrived at the scene it was discovered that the driver had fled the scene after the impact.  The passenger was located a short distance past E Green Dr after she fled the crash site on foot.  The passenger, Jasmine White, did not want to identify the driver to us at first.  The driver was quickly identified as Cornielus Leach by the owner of the vehicle, Jasmine White and documents inside the vehicle.  A DMV349 report was also completed for this incident.

On 05-05-2015 at 0452 hours, Patricia Watts reported that her live in boyfriend, James Eleby Jr, assaulted her during an argument.After interviewing both probable cause was developed to charge James Eleby Jr with assault on a female and Patricia Watts with simple assault.Watts did not have any visible injuries.  Eleby had a minor scratch to his upper stomach area.Both admitted to assaulting the other.Both have been placed in the High Point Jail under a domestic hold.

On 5/5/14 at 0050 hours, Officers responded to 105 Chase Ave. in reference to a disturbance between Ms. Robin Brown and Ms. Patricia McClure.  After arriving on scene, it was determined that both parties had assaulted one another and both parties were arrested.
On the 4th day of May, 2014 at approximately 2134 hours, I responded to Morgan Pl and Brockett Av in reference to an assault with a deadly weapon that had occurred.The suspect was arrested.

On Sunday, May 4th, 2014, I responded the southside of the city in reference to a vandalism. Upon arriving, it was discoved to be a domestic incident. A report was generated with further action to be taken at a later date.

On May 03, 2014, at approximately 1741 hours, I was dispatched to an assistance call on Banbridge Drive.  When I arrived, the caller stated that he wanted his son to leave his residence.  His son was previously banned from the property, but the caller allowed him back inside the house.

On 05-02-2014, at around 2348 hours, I was dispatched to 311 Ridgeland Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance IP.  Upon arrival I spoke with the victim, Whitney Gunter, who advised that her husband would not leave.

On May 2, 2014 at approximately 1802 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic violence call on East Green Drive.  When I arrived the reporting party stated that her boyfriend assaulted her by pushing her inside of her home.

On Thursday, 05/01/2014, at 1814 hours, I responded to a Domestic Disturbance between Intimate Partners at 400 Montlieu Ave. Upon my arrival, I met with the victim who was bleeding from a visible head wound.
I met with Tikita Tyson reference a burglary to her apartment by her ex-boyfriend while she was gone.  The suspect also damaged a vehicle belonging to her friend.

On the above date and time, I responded to 504 E. Dayton Ave. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Ms. Leak advised that she and her ex-boyfriend had been in an argument during which the ex-boyfriend had taken her cell phone.
On 4/30/2014, at approximately 2200 hours, I was dispatched a call about a disturbance. Upon my arrival I discovered the same to be a domestic dispute and made 2 arrests.

On 04/30/2014 around 1550 hours officers responded to Guilford County EMS base 2 on a reported assault call where the victim walked to the base for assistance.  Officers arrived onscene and spoke with EMS who related that the subject had some type of chemical sprayed in his face.  EMS transported to the ER and it was discovered that the subjects wife had sprayed him with mace.  Officers were unable to locate the wife and the subject was not being cooperative.
On 4-29-14, at approximately 2231 hours, I responded to 1011 Park St in reference to a domestic disturbance call.  Upon arrival, I met the victim who stated they had been assaulted.

On 4/29/2014 at approximately 1100 hours, officers responded to 1800 S Main St, Sonic reference an assist EMS call. A male subject was reported to be passed out and not responding. The subject was the driver of the vehicle and was impaired. Search of the vehicle revealed drug paraphernalia. There was a one year old child in the back seat. The driver was cited and released on scene for misdemeanor child abuse.

On 4-27-2014, at approximately 2115 hours, I responded to 1703 Welborn in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  Mr. Antionio Perez had assaulted his girlfriend after the two had gotten into an arguement.  Mr. Perez was charged with assault on a female.  No further information at this time.

On 04-26-2014 at 2151 hours, I responded to 404 Vail Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Both parties had left the scene when I arrived.  The victim called police later to report an assault.  I then obtained warrants on the suspect.

On April 26, 2014 at approximately 6:00pm, I was dispatched to the police department in reference to a domestic disturbance that occurred approximately 30mins earlier at 1446 Bailey Cir.  I met with the victim, who informed me her ex-boyfriend had pushed and shoved her down multiple times at a friends residence.  The victim had bruises and scrapes from the incident, but did not require medical treatment.  A warrant for assault on a female was obtained on the suspect.
On the 26th day of April, 2014 at approximately 1400 hours, I responded to 203-A N Hall St in reference to a domestic disturbance.The suspect was arrested and placed in the High Point Jail.

On 4-25-14, I spoke with a concerned third party about a domestic violence related situation. The concerned party requested that I check on the residence and make sure the family is not in danger.  I contacted the family and at this time, there is no physical violence and the victim refused any assistance. There is no further information available.

On 4/27/2014, at approximately 0830 hours, officers responded to the Police Department reference to a burglary that occurred at 1503 Graves Ave. The victim reported that her laptop was stolen from her house by her boyfriend. The laptop was recovered at USA Pawn 1033 S Main St where it was sold by her boyfriend. Warrants were obtained and served on Demetrius Farlow for felony breaking and entering, felony larceny and obtaining property by false pretense. He was given a $8,000 unsecured bond.

On April 25, 2014, at approximately 0930 hrs I responded to 136 Old Winston Rd in reference to an assault that was occurring. I was notified that a neighbor in the apartment complex was hearing a male and female fighting in another apartment.  During the course of the investigation Mr Garish was arrested and charged with assault on a female.

On Friday, 4/25/14, at approximately 0300 hours, I responded to 227 Fisher Avenue regarding a Domestic Disturbance involving Intimate Partners.  Upon my arrival I met with Marta Rendon and Florentino Vasquez.  Vasquez admitted to having assaulted Rendon by pulling her hair and pushing her to the floor.  Vasquez was taken into custody without incident and charged with Assault on a Female.

On 4-24-2014 at 8:15pm I responded to 502 Steele St. in reference to Domestic Disturbance IP.Upon arriving at the above location I made contact with the victim, Ms. ANGELA CAUDLE, who advised her boyfriend, JULIAN SHOFFNER, had assaulted her in the bedroom of the residence.SHOFFNER was arrested on site and confined under domestic hold.Photographs were taken of CAUDLE`S injuries.

On 04/23/2014 at approximately 2210 hours I responded to 204-A Taylor Av. in reference to a domestic assault.  Upon arrival I spoke with Mrs. Ijames who stated that the father of her children had struck her in the face following an argument over cleaning the kitchen.  Mr. Smith has warrants for Assault on a Female and Battery of an Unborn Child.  A BOL was given in reference to this case.
On April 23, 2014 at approximately 0133 hours, I responded to 221 Dorothy in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, Antoinette Fowler advised that she was assaulted.

On 4-22-14, I responded to 1505 Graves Av for a domestic disturbance between mother and son. I arrived and spoke with Mr. Posey in the front yard; he was irate and concerned about his child`s welfare in the house. I went inside to check on the child and spoke with Ms. Cook. She was holding the child while the child slept. Ms. Cook advised her son came home and accused her of harming the child. I saw no visible marks on the child. The child`s mother, Ms. Wall, was contacted and she sent the maternal grandmother to the residence to retrieve the child. DSS was contacted and made aware of the incident. At this time, no charges have been pursued.

On 4-22-14, I responded to 910-A Jefferson St for a runaway juvenile. I spoke with the mother who advised her daughter has not returned home from school. This has occurred several times in the past. The juvenile was entered into NCIC and a lookout was given. It is unknown at this time where the juvenile may be staying.

On April 21, 2014, I responded to 404 Grand St in reference to a domestic disturbance that had occurred earlier in the evening.  The victim was assaulted, forced to stay in her residence, and threatened by her boyfriend.  The suspect then took the victim`s vehicle and left the residence.  Warrants were obtained and the suspect was arrested later that night.  The victim suffered minor injuries and did not require medical treatment.

On 4/21/2014, at approximately 7:50am, I responded to a domestic disturbance at 1318 Camden Av.  Upon arrival I spoke with the complainant, who said Raymond Willis came into her house through the back door.  Once inside he tossed some clothes around and then left.

On 4-20-2014, at approximately 2315 hours, I responded to 904 Gordon Street in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  Ms. Carol Bostic had gotten into an arguement with Mr. Calvin Alexander.  Ms. Bostic assaulted Mr. Alexander during the argument.  Ms. Bostic was arrested and charged with assault. No further information at this time.
On April 20, 2014, at approximately 1503, I responded to 135 Underhill Street in reference to an unknown trouble call involving several subjects in a fight.Five arrests were made in this incident.
On this date I responded in reference to a report of a domestic disturbance that occurred at 4443 Garden Club Street.

On 04/17/2014 at approximately 0120 hours I responded to the ER of High Point Regional in reference to a domestic assault.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Mrs. Tina Jackson who stated that her boyfriend and father of her unborn child had pushed and struck her about the face causing injury.  Mrs. Jackson`s injuries were photographed and all parties involved were interviewed.  Mr. Christopher Simmons, Mrs. Jackson`s boyfriend, was arrested for Assault on a Female and Battery of an Unborn child.

On 04/16/2014 at approximately 2120 hours I responded to 506 Newton Pl. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I spoke with Officer Scott Morgan who stated he observed a black female strike another black female.  Upon interviewing the two participants, Jessica Jenkins was arrested for assault.

On April 16, 2014 at approximately 1757 hours, I responded to 1007 South Road in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I met the victim who advised that her brother assaulted her by striking her on the forehead and lip with a closed fist.

On 4-16-14, I responded to 703 Habersham Rd for a disturbance between a brother and sister. The disturbance involved child custody issues.  After the investigation was completed, Ms. Price was arrested and taken before a Magistrate where she was issued a $500 unsecured bond. Ms. Price was driven to her residence and left in the care of a friend. The child involved remained with a family member. Photographs were taken of the injuries and logged into evidence. DSS was contacted throughout this process and are aware of the situation.  At this time, there is no further information available.

On Wednesday April 16, 2014 around 1000 hours I witnessed a mutual fight between a brother and sister.  The incident occurred in the street in front of 1411-C Bergamot Loop.  Ms. Jessica Ervin attempted to assault Mr. Christopher Ervin by throwing a pot of grits at him.   I also saw Mr. Christopher Ervin attempt to assault Ms. Jessica Ervin by attempting to strike her with his hand.Mr. Ervin and Ms. Ervin were both arrested and charged with assault.
On April 15, 2014 at approximately 1644 hours, I was dispatched to a child abuse case on Marlboro Street.  The child of the suspect, called 911 and stated that her parents were abusing her.

On 04/15/2014, at approximately 0649 hours, I responded to 228-E Brentwood St reference a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I was informed the suspect kicked the front door in and fled out a bedroom window prior to my arrival. Warrants were obtained on same.

On 04/14/2014 at approximately 1850 hours I was dispatched to 817 Mark Street in reference to a domestic related assault.  I made contact with a Ms. Yalonda Ashworth who stated she had been assaulted by a Mr. Franklin White.  Ms. Ashworth had injuries that were consistent with an assault.  These injuries were documented.  Mr. White was arrested for one count of assault on a female.  Mr. White was turned over to the High Point Jail under a domestic hold.

On 05/03/2014, at approximately 1514 hours, I spoke with Mr Alex Warren via public service in reference to the report of a motor vehicle theft.  According to Mr Warren, an unknown suspect stole his blue, 1994 model BMW (bearing NC registration plate #ZXB-6690) from the pva of the courthouse (located at 505 E Green DR) sometime between 1815 hours and 1915 hours on 04/14/2014 while he was in police custody at the county building.  A possible suspect has been identified.  There is no witness information.  A BOL has been issued and the vehicle has been entered as stolen into NCIC.

On 04/14/2014 at approximately 1643 hours I responded to 907 First Tee DR in reference to a domestic disturbance involving intimate partners.  Upon my arrival I made contact with the involved parties, Mrs Darrena Strawder and Mr Alex Warren, near the roadway in front of the residence.  Subsequent to investigation, Mr Warren was arrested for assault on a female and transferred into the custody of the Guilford County jail.

I responded to 1109 E Russell Avenue in reference to an assault that had already occurred.  I met with Charles Legrande that was assaulted with a stick by his son.  Mr Legrande was taken to the hospital with injuries sustained from the assault.

On April 13, 2014 at approximately 0418 hours, I responded to 1023 Asheboro Street in reference to a domestic disturbance that had already occurred. Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Jamey Dunlap, who stated that her husband, Mr. Wiliam Perez had punched her in the lip during an argument. Mr. Perez was arrested and pictures were taken of Ms. Dunlap`s injuries.

On Sunday, April 13th, 2014, at 0403 hours, I responded to 741 Celtic Crossing Drive in reference to a burglary.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Mrs. Kristy Allen (victim) and Mr. Franklin White (witness) who advised Mr. Wesley Zimmerman (Mrs. Allen`s ex-husband) kicked in the front door to the residence and entered the residence displaying a small black revolver with a white handle.  Mr. Zimmerman cornered Mrs. Allen and Mr. White stating "I`ma kill you."  Mr. Zimmerman fled the scene on foot and possibly left the area in a white 2011 Toyota Camry (CAL-4579).  I observed a foot print of a tennis shoe on the front door and the inside of the door frame to be torn from the wall.  Warrants for arrest were issued for Mr. Zimmerman for breaking and entering with intent to injure the occupant, injury to real property, two counts of communicating threats, and assault by pointing a gun.
On 4-12-14 I responded in reference to a report of a domestic disturbance that occurred at 2103-C Aileen Court.
On 4-12-14 at approximately 0007 hours I received a domestic violence call from 510 Walnut St.  The victim and the witness responded to the Police Department to report what happened.

On Friday, April 11, 2014 at about at 7:53 P.M.  We were dispatched to 4359 Twisting Creek Drive  via departmental radio in regards to a suicide. Upon our arrival we were informed that the listed offender was found hanging and was unresponsive. Upon our investigation and first aid by EMS the listed subject was pronounced dead at 8:43 P.M. from an apparent self manipulated hanging.

On the listed date I responded to Bellemeade st in reference to an assault.  Once on scene I made contact with Ms. Nutting who advised she had been assaulted by Mr. Nutting.  During the assault Mr. Nutting threw a rock at Ms. Nuttings vehicle, causing property damage.

On 04/09/2014 at approximately 7:47pm I was dispatched to 2400-F Gordon Rd in reference to a domestic dispute which was in progress to include an active assault. Once on the scene, signs of a physical assault were apparent, the aggressor was arrested and placed in High Point Jail on a domestic hold without bond. Lab responded to photograph the injuries of the victim as well as the offensive wounds on the knuckles on the fist of the aggressor.

On 04/09/2014, at 02:46 hours, I responded to 511-H E Commerce Av in reference to a domestic disturbance that already occurred.  Upon arrival I met with the victim, who stated that her boyfriend assaulted her at her residence.  After the initial assault occurred, the suspect left the area, but came back to the residence a short time later.  When the suspect came back to the residence, he kicked the front door causing the door frame to split, and gained access to the residence.  The suspect was unable to get to the victim the second time, and ended up leaving in an unknown direction.  The suspect was later found walking in the 500-BLK of E Commerce Av.  This subject was then placed under arrest for assault on a female, breaking and entering with intent to injure occupant and injury to real property.

On 04-09-2014, at 9:30am, I responded to 2208 E Green Dr in reference to a motor vehicle theft. The reporting party stated her vehicle have been stolen during the early morning hours. No arrests have been made at this time.

On 04-09-14 at 0106 hours I responded to 2727 Alpha Street in reference to an assistance call.  The Offender called 911 to ask for Officers to stand by while her daughter removed property.  Upon arrival the incident turned into a disturbance.  The Offender told Officers she was going to harm the Victim with a knife and made an effort to grab a knife.  The Offender was arrested without incident.

On Tuesday April 08, 2014 at 2206 hours I responded to 300 Fourth St. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I spoke with both parties involved.  As a result of my investigation Mr. Tyrone Gibson was arrested and charged with assault on a female.Mr. Gibson was placed in the High Point Jail in Guilford County under a domestic hold.

On Tuesday, 04/08/2014, at approximately 2124 hours I responded to 115-3A Chestnut Drive in reference to a Domestic Disturbance IP. Upon arrival on the scene I made contact with witnesses who advised that the suspect, Angel Marshall, had threatened her boyfriend with a steak knife. The victim, Mr. Fred Lee, advised me that Miss Marshall had threatened to stab him with a steak knife because of an argument they were having over possible infidelity. Miss Marshall was arrested on scene without incident and was placed in the High Point Jail under  Domestic Hold for Misdemeanor Assault with a Deadly Weapon.

On 4/07/2014 around 1600 hours, I was dispatched to the Guilford County Magistrate Office in High Point, North Carolina, 505 East Green Drive, in reference to domestic assault that had occurred at 1310 Bencini Place. Upon my arrival, I spoke with the victim who advised that her boyfriend brutally assaulted her with a wooden table leg. The victim sustained a fractured finger and several cuts to her hands. The suspect was later arrested at the above address and charged with felony assault with a dangerous weapon inflicting serious bodily injury, second degree kidnapping and larceny of a cellular phone.

On 04/06/2014 I responded to 402-A Cable St reference a domestic disturbance involving two female subjects later identifed as two sisters. My investigation concluded with charges being filed against one subject and same being placed into the High Point Jail.

On this date, police were dispatched to a southside domestic. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed that a husband assaulted his wife. He subsequently was arrested, and charged with Assault on a Female. The Magistrate placed him in custody of the GCSD on a 48 hour hold.

On 4/5/2014 at 1844 hours, Officers responded to 504 Everett Ln. Apt. B in reference to an assault that had just taken place.  After arriving on scene, Officers met with the witness, Mrs. Emma Robinson who advised that two individuals were just at her residence fighting.  Both parties were eventually located in Winston Salem.
On 4/5/2014, at approximately 330 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding a domestic dispute. Upon my arrival an investigation was conducted, and 2 arrests made.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On April 5, 2014, the defendant was arrested for violating a Domestic Violence Protective Order by showing up at his ex-girlfriend`s place of employment.

On this date, an Archdale resident reported she had just been assaulted by her boyfriend, behind a southside business. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed that the female was just picked up from the Guilford County Jail by her boyfriend. While they traveled back to their Archdale, NC address, the boyfriend stopped his moped, and had the victim also get off, then commenced to assaulting the victim with his hands and feet.The victim could provide no reason for the assault, and stated her boyfriend, "just went crazy".
The victim had a cut on the left top portion of her head, which was bleeding. The victim stated that the suspect sped away on his black in color motor-scooter, with the words, "Hemi-Powered", painted on same. He was last seen heading for Archdale.The victim was transported to the High Point Regional Hospital for treatment of her wounds. EMS personnel felt her head wound may require sutures. The victim was provided with a High Point Police Dept. Victim Information sheet. I drew WFA for the suspect, Assault on a Female,  and placed a BOLO for the suspect.

On April 3, 2014 I responded to 626-B Hendrix St in reference to a domestic dispute. I spoke with Montrose Banks who reported that her husband, Titus Johnson, had assaulted her. From the investigation it was determined that an assault had occurred and Johnson was arrested.

On 04/02/2014 at 2007 hours, I responded to 1801 Brooks Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I determined that Thomas Brown (Father) and Tommy Harper (Son) were involved in a mutual affray and struck each other with hammers.  Both were charged with Misdemeanor Assault with Deadly Weapon.  Both were treated and released from High Point Regional Hospital with minor injuries.

On 4-2-2014 at approximately 1440 hours, I responded to 1518 Valley Ridge in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I arrived and detained Mr. Cory Lane.  I learned that he and his wife had gotten into an argument during which Mr. Lane assaulted his wife.  Mr. Lane was arrested and charged with Assualt on a Female.  No further information at this time.

On 4-1-14, I responded to 506-A E Fairfield Avenue for a domestic disturbance. When I arrived, I could hear the disturbance from outside the residence. I knocked on the door and Ms. Matthews opened it. She began yelling that her boyfriend assaulted her. She was extremely upset and holding her two year old child. Mr. Ledbetter advised they had been arguing but he did not assault her. Mr. Ledbetter had obvious visible scratch marks on the left side of his face near his eye. After a thorough investigation, Ms. Matthews was arrested for simple assault. She was transported to the police department for processing. While en-route to the hospital Ms. Matthews complained of stomach pains and requested to go to the hospital. She was transported there for observation. I left Ms. Matthews in the care of the emergency room staff and Officer Knight. I responded to the county building and transported Magistrate Newman to the hospital where Ms. Matthews was released after her bond was made.Ms. Matthews remained in the care of High Point Regional Hospital at the time of her release from custody. There is no further information available at this time. Mr. Ledbetter received copies of the domestic violence information and photographs of his injuries were taken. DSS was contacted and a report was filed.

On Tuesday, 04/01/2014, at approximately 2232 hours I responded to 917 South Road in reference to a Domestic Disturbance IP. Upon arrival at the scene I made contact with the victim and reporting party of the crime, Miss Jammia Frazier, who advised me that her boyfriend had punched her in the face during an argument. Her boyfriend, Deonte Bates-Booker, fled the scene prior to Police arrival in the victim`s van. A warrant for arrest was issued on Mr. Bates-Booker for Assault on a Female. Later on that night the suspect returned to the residence and Mr. Bates-Booker was then located hiding on Moreland Avenue in the victim`s van. Mr. Bates-Booker was arrested for the Assault on a Female charge and was also put in jail under a Fugitive Warrant because he is wanted out of Virginia.

On 4-1-14, I spoke with Ms. Waddell about a vandalism that occurred. She advised an ex-boyfriend came to her apartment, and while she was watching him, he threw a brick through her window. She also stated he sent her threatening text messages.  Ms. Waddell was driven to the magistrate`s office where she obtained warrants for communicating threats and injury to property. I contacted the suspect by telephone and advised him he had warrants and to turn himself in. He called communications back and asked to have an officer meet him down the street to turn himself in. Mr. Dessio was located at 825 Washington Street.  He was arrested without incident. 	Crime lab responded and took photographs.  The victim was given copies of the domestic violence information.

On Sunday, 03/30/2014, at approximately 2212 hours I responded to 214 N Ward Avenue in reference to a Domestic Disturbance IP. Upon arrival on the scene I made contact with the victim of the crime, Miss Amber Schimmelpfenning, who advised me that her boyfriend had assaulted her and fled the scene prior to our arrival. The suspect, Mr. Darryl Cole, punched the victim several times in the face during in argument over a tax refund. The suspect, Mr. Cole, has an active warrant for his arrest for Assault on a Female.

Officers responded to a disturbance call at 1638 Carthage Ln and located Michael Hannah on the property.  Officers stopped Hannah and determined that he was trespassing on the property of his exgirlfriend who he has a child with and no longer lives with.  While speaking with Hannah officers observed him drop a piece of white paper that contained .07grams of marijuana.  Hannah was arrested for Domestic Criminal Trespass and simple Possession of Marijuana.
On Sunday, March 30, 2014, I responded to 1810 Guyer Street in reference to an assault. Upon my arrival I spoke with Joyce Cecil who told me that she had been assaulted.

On 04-06-2014, at 1515 hours, I spoke with an individual regarding a domestic related assault.  The assault took place at 4012 Tutbury Dr., on 03-30-2014 at approximately 1400 hours.  With the information obtained, along with evidence to support the allegations, an arrest was made.  The victim had already been treated for injuries pertaining to the assault.    The offender was taken into custody at 1630 hours, this date, and subsequently charged with assault on a female.

On 03/30/2014 at approximately 0925 hours I responded to 1422-B E Commerce Av. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I spoke with Edtrina Jackson, the victim, who stated that her husband Christopher Coleman had struck her.  After speaking with both parties, Mr. Coleman was arrested for assault on a female.

On March 30, 2014 at approximately 0324 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance call at Centennial Avenue and East Green Drive.  When I arrived, the victim stated that her ex-boyfriend assaulted her.

On 03-30-14 at 0413 hours I responded to 708 Denny St. in reference to a domestic disturbance IP.  Upon my arrival I met with the Victim.  The Offender had already left the scene.  The Victim had visible signs of injury from the assault.  The Victim obtained a warrant for arrest on the Offender.

On 3-29-14, I responded to the 800 block of Hines St for a domestic disturbance. I arrived and was stopped by the female involved, Ms. Lucas standing outside holding her baby. She advised her boyfriend and baby`s father had choked her. I observed her neck and she had no marks, and the skin was not red. I could smell the strong odor of alcohol about her and she was swaying while she stood still.  I walked down the street and spoke to the male involved, Mr. Heilig. He was bleeding from the scratch marks on his face and showed me a bite mark on his leg that broke the skin and was bleeding. After the investigation was completed, Ms. Lucas was arrested for assault inflicting serious injury and taken to the police department for processing. Ms. Lucas was very emotional and stated that she would cooperate but she was mad that she had been arrested. After Magistrate Billips found probable cause for the charges, she was walked to the jail where I began to take the handcuffs off her. Ms. Lucas became belligerent and turned around to face me. At this time, three jailors came into the holding area and took her into the jail. Ms. Lucas was held without bond for a domestic related assault inflicting serious injury. Photographs were taken of the injuries and placed into evidence. DSS was called and a report was filed.  The victim received paperwork regarding the domestic violence initiative. There is no further information available.

On 03/29/2014 at approximately 1220 hours I responded to 1308 Boundary Av. in reference to a domestic disturbance.
