Upon arrival, I spoke with Mr. Alexander Harris Jr., the victim, who stated that his girlfriend had entered into an argument with him through his livingroom window which ended in her kicking the front door and causing damage.  Mr. Harris was also injured during the vandalism.  Warrants were taken out for Ms. Tamera Graves.  BOL was placed for Graves.

On April 01, 2014 at 1100 hours a report of child abuse was open. The case involves a child at Penn-Griffin School for the Arts but same is possibly occurring off campus. HPPD Detectives and Child Protective services will continue the investigation.

On March 26, 2014 at approximately 10:06pm I was dispatched to 2602 Ty Cir in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The offender struck her boyfriend repeatedly in the face, causing minor visible injuries.  The offender was arrested for simple assault.  The victim did not require medical attention.

On Wednesday March 26, 2014 at 2:12 pm Lt. B Roberts witnessed a domestic assault.Roberts was off duty at the time when he saw who was later identified as Hazel Marcial chasing Andy Granados down Johnson St.  Marcial was throwing hubcaps at Granados while she was chasing him almost causing an traffic accident.  Roberts stated that he almost struck Granados because he ran out in the street trying to dodge a flying hubcap.Marcial was arrested and charged with simple assault.

On Wednesday, March 26th, 2014, at 1333 hours, I responded to the Hunter Point Apartment office at 2231 Shadow Valley Road in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Mrs. LaDonna Eubank (reporting party) and Ms. Ashley Eubank (victim) ,who advised Mrs. LaDonna Eubank`s estranged husband, Mr. Wally Burrell, came to the office asking her for money.  Ms. Ashley Eubank advised when her mother denied Mr. Burrell money and refused to allow him back into the office, Mr. Burrell used a razor blade to cut the driver`s side front tire of Ms. Ashley Eubank`s 2003 Ford Mustang (LUG982, Mississippi issued).  Mr. Burrell fled the scene in an unknown direction of travel.

On 3/25/2014 at approximately 1700 hours, officers responded to 930 Norton St reference a domestic disturbance. Florence Zimmerman and her son were involved in an argument. Ms. Zimmerman assaulted her son in the midst of the argument and was arrested for simple assault inflicting minor injuries. She was given a written promise to appear by the magistrate.
On March 25, 2014 at 0733 hours, We were dispatched to 234 Willowood Dr. reference an assault. The suspect is related to the victim.

On 03/25/2014 at 01:57 hours I responded to 237-C Northpoint Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I met with the victim who stated that she was assaulted by her boyfriend.  The victim had signs that she was assaulted, so a warrant for arrest for assault on a female was taken out on the suspect.  The suspect was located shortly after this incident occurred and placed in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.
On Tuesday, March 25th, 2014, at 0606 hours, I responded to the north section of the city in reference to a rape and an assault on a female.
On 03/25/2014, I spoke with the victim who stated that on the date and hours provided, her ex-boyfrined, John Little II, came to her house and attempted to gain entry.

On March 25, 2014 at 1426 hours I was informed of an assault that occurred the previous day in the 700 block of Lakecrest Avenue.  The assault was between family members. Investigation pending. No charges have been filed at this time.

On 03-24-2014 at approximately 1046 hours I arrived to 425 Tate St in reference to a domestic disturbance. Through further investigation Travis Little was charged with assault on a female and confined to the High Point Detention Facility on a domestic hold.

On March 23, 2014 at approximately 2225 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance on Worth Street.  When I arrived, the victim stated that his niece assaulted him in his bedroom and bit his nose.

On this date, an assault was reported at an educational institution in the city. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed an assault on a female had occurred, and the boyfriend was the suspect. The victim had visible injuries, the boyfriend was located, and placed under arrest for the assault. The suspect was taking infront of a Magistrate, charged with Assault on a Female, and placed on a $1500.00 unsecured bond.

On 03/22/2014 round 2114 hours, I responded to 522 apartment (A) Cable Street in High Point in reference to an assault. Upon arrival, I observed a black male subject sitting on a chair that was on the front porch near the door of apartment (A). The black male subject was applying pressure to the right side of his face with a white wash cloth. I also noticed that the white wash cloth was saturated with blood. Moreover, I noticed that there was blood on the front porch near the black male subject`s feet.  The subject sustained a laceration to the right side of his face and was transported to the High Point Regional Emergency Room to be treated. A female subject was later arrested for cutting the subject and she was charged with assault with a deadly weapon inflicting serious bodily injury.

On 3-22-2014, at 1:26pm, I responded to 2529 White Fence Way in reference to an Assault.Upon arriving at the above location, I made contact with the victim, Ms. ANGELA MARIE JOSEY.JOSEY stated that during an argument with her husband, CHRISTOPHER ALAN JOSEY, she was choked, punched in the face, and her hands twisted.  Her injuries were photographed.Mr. JOSEY was arrested at the scene and confined under a domestic hold.

On 03/19/14, at approximately 1915hrs, I responded to a reported domestic disturbance at 2010 W. Rotary Dr.  A juvenile female and her sister were attempting to break the windows on the residence to gain entry and fight a female that was inside.  The juvenile female was a temporary resident of the home, but is not on the lease and has no authority in regards to the property.
On March 19, 2014 at 0659 hours, I was dispatched to 120 Sunview Av. reference an assault. The suspect is known. No warrants have been issued at this time.
On 03/18/14 at approximately 1718hrs I responded to a reported domestic assault in progress near the intersection of W. English Rd. and Griclar St.

On March 18, 2014 at approximately 1428 hours, I responded to 618 East Kearns Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, I spoke with the victim, Ms. Quinyetta Page who stated that her boyfriend, Mr. Jawahrial Caldwell, had just punched her in the head and eye and then fled the scene. Pictures were taken of Ms. Page`s injuries. Mr. Caldwell could not be located.

On 03/17/2014, I was dispatched to 809-C E. Green Dr. in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I made contact with both parties involved. After speaking with both parties I was able to place the offender under arrest.

On 03-16-2014 at 1155 hours, a staff member at the Moses Cone Medical Center in High Point called to report that they had a patient in the emergency department who had requested police assistance because of being assaulted with a knife by his ex-wife.I made contact with the victim, Steven Matthews in room 12 of the emergency department.  Mr Matthews had a small cut to his left wrist that required two stiches to repair.Matthews told me that the incident occurred at 2521-A Suffolk Avenue around 11:00am where he and his girlfriend are staying with Matthews ex-wife.  I later arrested Matthews ex-wife for an outstanding assault warrant that Steven Matthews obtained at the Greensboro Magistrate`s office concerning an incident that occurred 6:40am at a hotel in Greensboro.Rosa Matthews was charged with AWDW.

On March 16, 2014 at approximately I responded to 2843 Mossy Meadow Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.  During the course of the investigation Ms Davis was arrested for assault  and transported to the police department.

On 3-15-2014 at 4:04pm I responded to Sears Operations Center, 921 Eastchester Dr. in reference to Assault.Upon arriving at the above location I made contact with the Victim who advised she had been assaulted by her boyfriend during an altercation in the parking lot.

On 03-15-14 at 1412 hours I responded to 300-D Taylor Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I met with the Victim.  The Victim stated that the Offender pushed his way into her apartment, held her down by the throat, and struck her several times.  The Victim had a visible injury to her right hand.  The Offender was not on scene when I arrived.  He called 911 several times to speak with an Officer.  Telephone contact was eventually made with the Offender.  He stated that he would meet me at the Magistrate`s Office to discuss what happened.  He never showed up.  The Victim obtained a warrant on the Offender for assault on a female and injury to real property.

On 03-15-2014, at 1400 hours, a refused caller called High Point Communications to report a disturbance at 2357 Alderbrook Drive, which is the home of Monica Bennerman.  The caller stated that the estranged husband of the home owner had backed his vehicle into the closed garage door causing damage and had been pounding on the front door.Bennerman`s husband left prior to our arrival.Monica Bennerman did not make contact with her husband while he was at the residence. Bennerman is going to seek charges at the magistrate`s office.
On Saturday the 15th day of March 2014 at approximately 1000hrs, I responded to a domestic violence call.  Both participants were arrested.

offense: ASSAULT ON A FEMALE BY MALE OVER 18 YEARS OF AGE
body: On 3/14/14 at 11:27am I responded to a domestic disturbance at 239 Northpoint Av. The victim was located with minor injuries and advised that the suspect had left the scene. A warrant for arrest was obtained on the suspect. At this time the suspect has not been located.
On Friday, March 14, 2014, I responded to 1220 Guilford Avenue in reference to an assault. Upon my arrival I spoke with Shana Benjamin who told me that she had been assaulted.
On 3-14-2014 I responded to 2429 West Green Drive in reference to a assault.  Upon arrival I spoke with Kimberly Spencer who had been assaulted.

On Thursday March 13th 2014 around 1151 hours I responded to 4624 Chesterfield Pl in reference to an attempted suicide. The caller advised that a subject at this residence had overdosed on pills. Guilford County EMS was already en route to this location.

On March 13, 2014 at approximately 1055 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance on Brentwood Street.  When I arrive the reporting party stated that the suspect assaulted her and damaged property in her residence.
On 03/12/14 at approximately 2232hrs I responded to a reported domestic assault.

On 03-11-2014 I responded to 608 Barbee Av in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I was met by the victim, Ms. Little. She stated that she was assaulted by her child`s father, Byron Reid.

On Tuesday March 11, 2014 I responded to 1446 Bailey Circle in reference to a Domestic. Upon my arrival I spoke with the victim Kimberly Howard who advised while talking with her boyfriend Zachary Hall about their relationship, he got upset and punched her in the face. Hall was placed under arrest at the scene for Domestic Assault.

On 03/11/2014 at approximately 0230 hours, officers responded to 1306 Filbert Pl reference a 911 hangup. Officers discovered there was a disturbance inside of the residence between a mother and her daughter. Both were arrested for assaulting each other. They were each given an unsecured bond of $1,000.

On Tuesday 3/11/2014 at approximately 0025 hours I responded to 417 Cable St in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  Upon arrival I made contact with the Victim who advised that she was assaulted by her boyfriend who was later arrested. There is currently no further information available at this time.

On Sunday 3/9/14 at approximately 2227 hours I responded to 709 Chestnut Dr Apt A in reference to an Assault.  Upon arrival I made contact with the Victim who advised she was assaulted by her boyfriend.  The Victim was transported to the Magistrates Office where charges were taken out.  The Suspect has not been located at this time.  There is currently no further information available at this time.

On this date, a southside female reported she had a domestic disturbance with the father of her unborn baby. The domestic resulted in the vandalism of her vehicle. The suspect threw a rock through the left rear passenger window after she accused him of infidelity. The suspect fled the area prior to police arrival. The damage was valued at approximately $200.00. No assault occurred. The victim was provided information of the Guilford County Warrant Process, which she stated she was aware, and was going to obtain a WFA, Vandalism on the suspect.
On Monday March 10, 2014 I spoke with the complainant via telephone in reference to a child abuse issue.
I met with Ms Cross at the Magistrate`s Office in reference to a trespassing that occurred at her house involving her ex-husband.

On 03-09-2014 I responded to High Point Regional Hospital in reference to an assault.After investigating the assault it was found that the offender seriously assaulted the victim and was in violation of a 50B.Suspect was arrested and placed in the Guilford County Jail.

On 3-8-14, I responded to the 900 block of Sharon Street for a domestic disturbance in the roadway. I arrived and spoke with the caller who lives at 914 Sharon Street. He stated that a male and female were arguing in his yard and on his porch and he called the police, by the time he got off the phone with communications the couple was gone.  As I was leaving the house, a female approached me and stated she was the female involved in the domestic. She advised her boyfriend got mad at her and hit her in the face. She also stated he damaged her vehicle. She asked for a ride to the Magistrates office to obtain warrants. After the warrants were obtained, I returned the victim to her house at 1007 Sharon Street and took photographs of the vehicle and the marks on her face. At this time, the suspect has not been located. There is no further information available.

On 03-07-2014, at approximately 9:21pm, I was dispatched to 206-F Taylor Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  When I arrived, I spoke to a female who said her ex-boyfriend had broken out her front window. He was not on scene when I arrived.  I explained how the victim could obtain a warrant.

On 03-07-2014 at 1719 hours, I responded to 2240-1C Copperstone Dr., in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I discovered that an assault took place and the offender had already left the residence.  The offender resides outside the city and I was unable to locate him at his residence.  A warrant was obtained for assault on a female and a lookout was issued listing the offender`s vehicle.  At this time the warrant is still outstanding.
I responded to 610 Vista Cir on a reported domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I spoke with Mr & Ms Nesbitt.  They were both intoxicated and had assaulted each other.
On Thursday, March 6, 2014, I responded to 501 Hayworth Circle in reference to an assault. Upon my arrival I spoke with Rachelle Burns who told me that she had been assaulted.

On 3-6-14, I was dispatched to the police department for a domestic disturbance involving a road rage incident. I met with the victim, Ms. Green in the parking lot of the police department and she advised her ex-boyfriend, Mr. Dines has been following her in his vehicle throughout the day and tried to run her off the roadway. At some point, he yelled threatening comments to her. Ms. Green advised she was willing to obtain warrants and followed me to the Magistrate`s office.  While Ms. Green was completing the paperwork for warrants Mr. Dines was located in the 1900 block of E. Kivett Drive. He was still in the vehicle she described. Officer Goins and Officer Mills searched the vehicle for weapons and none was found. Mr. Dines was arrested for driving with a revoked license. Mr. Dines arrived at the magistrates building and was served with the warrants Ms. Green obtained and Officer Goins charged him with driving with a revoked license.  Ms. Green`s warrants were issued as domestic related because they have a child in common and lived together in the recent past.  Mr. Dines was given a $200,000 secured bond and remains in jail at this time. Officer Goins and Officer Mills towed Mr. Dines` vehicle. Ms. Green was given a copy of the victims` rights form; she was not injured during this incident. There is no further information available.
On 03/03/14 at approximately 0510hrs I responded to a reported domestic-related assault.

On Sunday, March 2nd, 2014, I responded to 208 East Peachtree Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  upon my arrival I was advised by an individual that an assault had taken place during an argument and that the aggressor had left the residence.

Myself and other officers responded to an armed subject call at 2729 Alpha St.  Communications advised that a subject armed with a knife was threatening subjects at that location.  Ofc. Brancaccio arrived on scene and observed the suspect walking away from the scene and detained him.  I made contact with the victim and witnesses, and after obtaining statements from them concerning the incident, I directed Ofc. Brancaccio to place the suspect, Cassaman Logan, under arrest.
On March 2, 2014 at approximately 0321 hours, I responded to 813 Pineburr Road in reference to a domestic disturbance between intimate partners.1 subject has been arrested.

On Sunday, March 2, 2014 at about 12:02 P.M. I was dispatched tp 3809 Parkway Vista Drive via departmental radio in regards to domestic assault. Upon my arrival I spoke to Mrs. Negrete and she stated that her husband punched her in the head.
On Saturday, March 1, 2014, I responded to 808 Lakecrest Avenue in reference to an assault. Upon my arrival I spoke with Jennifer Waggoner who advised that she had been assaulted.

On February 26, 2014, at approximately 0823 hours, I responded to 301 West Broad Avenue (Hi Tran Bus Station) in reference to a domestic violence intimate partner call.  Upon arrival, I checked James Sanders for warrants and the same returned that his girlfriend had a domestic violence restraining order against Mr. Sanders.  Mr. Sanders was in her presence when I arrived at the scene.

On Tuesday 2/25/14 at approximately 0122 hours I responded to 1422-A E Commerce Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I made contact with the Victim who advised that she was hit by her husband.  The Offender had remained on scene and was arrested.  There is no further information available at this time.

On 02/24/2014 at approximately 1:36am I responded to a reported domestic disturbance at 2424 E. Lexington Av.  Upon arrival I spoke with the victim who said her boyfriend, Ali Malik came into her house and struck her several times in the head.Mr. Malik was arrested and charged with assault on female.

On 02-23-2014 at 1722 hours, I responded to a domestic disturbance in the parking lot of 110 E Fairfield Rd.  Both of the parties had been assaulted.  Both subjects were arrested and placed in the Guilford County Jail.
On February 23, 2014 at approximately 1508 hours, I responded to 1112 Camden Avenue in reference to an unknown trouble call.It was later reclassified as a domestic violence call
On Febuary 22, 2014, I responded to 313 - A Monroe Pl. in reference to a reported assault.

On February 21, 2014 at approximately 8:40am I responded to 412 Smith St. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  When I arrived the suspect was walking away from the residence down Smith St.  The suspect and victim had an argument, and the suspect punched the victim in the face.  The suspect was charged with assault on a female.

On 02/21/2014, at approximately 0500 hours, I responded to 1602 Franklin Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Angela O`Conner, the victim, who stated that her boyfriend, James Wilson, assaulted her by grabbing her by the chest, scratching her, and ripping her blouse.  After speaking with all parties, Mr. Wilson was arrested for Assault on a Female.

On 02/20/2014 at approximately 2350 hours I responded to 2520-2B Bellemeade St. in reference to a domestic assault.  Upon arrival I spoke with both parties who agreed that Jamesha Wall had struck her boyfriend Johnathan Grant in the face.  Mrs. Wall was arrested for Domestic Assault.
On Feb 19th 2014 around 1630 hrs at Cedrow Park, 1718 Cedrow Dr. A public disturbance occurred envolving 20-25 persons. two persons were issued citations.
On Wednesday, February 19, 2014, I responded to 604 Rolling Green Drive in reference to an assault. Upon my arrival Kelvin Middlebrooks told me that he was stabbed.

On Thursday, 02/20/2014 I responded to 131-3A James Road regarding a domestic disturbance.I arrived on scene and spoke with the victim, KY Earls.  The victim stated that she and the offender had been involved in a argument for the last several days because the offender believed she was cheating on him.  The victim stated the offender was standing behind her put his arm around her neck and threw her out of the way.  I examined the victim and observed a red mark on the left side of her neck.I spoke with the offender who advised that he and the victim had been involved in an argument because she was cheating on him.  The offender stated that the victim had assaulted him last night by scratching him on the neck and forehead.  The offender did have marks on his neck and forehead.The offender was arrested for assault on a female and the victim was cited not arrested because she was the primary care giver of her eight (8) year old daughter.

On Sunday February 16th 2014 around 2010 hours I responded to 202 Shadybrook Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I met the male subject, Presentino Matthews, outside in the driveway. I asked him what was going on and he stated that nothing was going on. He stated that he was just hanging out, Presentino was intoxicated. I stood outside and talked with Presentino while Officer Duggins went inside and talked to the female involved.After a few minutes we walked inside. The female, Stephanie Arnette, was telling Officer Duggins that she did not want Presentino at the residence anymore. She had already told Officer Duggins that they had been arguing most of the afternoon and he needed to leave. She did not want him to be arrested, she just wanted him to leave her alone. I checked Presentino for warrants and he did not have any, but he did have two release orders where he was not supposed to have any contact with Stephanie until the situations were resolved in court. The next court date for the charges was March 6th 2014. At that time I arrested Presentino for the violations of the release orders. I also had it put in his file that he was banned from 202 Shadybrook Rd. Presentino was transported to the magistrate`s office. Magistrate Gillespie put him in jail under a $5,000 bond for the pre trial release violations.

On Sunday, February 16th, 2014, at 2117 hours, I responded to The Pantry gas station at 295 East Parris Avenue in reference to an assault that occurred at 2136-J Chester Ridge Road.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Mr. Sammie Alnajjar who advised he got into an argument with his wife, Ms. Ebtehal Sudan, at their apartment.  Mr. Alnajjar stated during the argument Ms. Sudan slapped him and bit him on the chest.  Mr. Alnajjar stated Ms. Sudan left the apartment with his keys, cell phone, and Bank of America debit card.  A warrant for arrest was obtained against Ms. Sudan for simple assault.

On 02/16/2014 at approximately 12:00 am I responded to a reported public disturbance in the 1700 block of Brooks Av.  Upon arrival I spoke with the caller who said her boyfriend hit her in the face.  Both subjects were charged with assault.

On 2/16/2014, at approximately 1000 hours, officers responded to 517-C E Commerce Ave reference a domestic disturbance. The suspect kicked in his girlfriend`s door and assaulted her. The suspect was previously banned from the complex. Warrants were obtained for the suspect for misdemeanor breaking and entering, injury to real property, assault on a female and second degree trespass.
On Monday, February 17, 2014, I responded to 2908 apt A East Kivett Drive, in reference to an assault. Upon my arrival Whitney Griffin stated that she had been asaulted.
On Sunday, February 16th, 2014, I responded to 2600 North Centennial Street in reference to a possible assault.

On 2-14-14, at approximately 2324 hours, I responded to 1605 Oneka Ave in reference to a domestic disturbance call.  Upon arrival, I spoke with the victim who stated that her ex-boyfriend assaulted her.
On 2/14/2014, at approximately 1820 hours, I responded to a call of a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I conducted an investigation and made an arrest.

On the 14th day of February, 2014 at approximately 1040 hours, I responded to 2313-B Brentwood St in reference to a domestic disturbance involving intimate partners.The suspect left prior to our arrival, but charges have been filed against the suspect.
Alice Vanterpool called and reported that her daughter ran away today between 1200 and 1230 hours. The daughter was entered into NCIC.A look out was given for the daughter.

On Wednesday February 12th 2014 at 2348 hours I was dispatched to 2156-G Chester Ridge Dr in reference to a Domestic Dispute.Upon my arrival I made contact with the caller who advised his girlfriend had been drinking and would not leave him alone.  After further investigation it was determined that the caller used force in order to remove the female from the apartment.  He was arrested.

On Wednesday, 2/11/14, at approximately 2130 hours, I responded to 611 Westover Drive regarding a Domestic Disturbance involving Intimate Partners.  Upon my arrival, I met with Stuart and Courtney Hunter who both admitted to having assaulted each other.  Neither party had any visible signs of injuries.  EMS arrived at the scene and transported Courtney Hunter to High Point Regional Hospital.  I charged Courtney Hunter with Simple Assault and released her with a citation.  Stuart Hunter was arrested for Assault on a Female.

On February 10, 2014, at approximately 2335 hours, I responded to 2429 W Green cabana #4 in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, Christopher Mccullers was arrested for assault on female by male over 18 years of age.

On February 10, 2014 at approximately 0215 hours, Officers responded to 501-I Academy in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival and investigation, Jeffrey Morgan and Shannon Wright were both arrested.

On 2-9-14, I responded to a vandalism at 1610 E Commerce Avenue. The complainant advised his vehicle was scratched, his back door screen was cut and his back door had several dents in it.  The complainant felt like he knew who was involved, but advised he could not prove it.  He stated he wanted to make this report for documentation purposes and for his insurance. There is no further information available.

On 02/09/2014, I responded to the 131 Spring Garden Cir. for a report of a domestic/vandalism. The suspect fled prior to our arrival, but before doing so, he smashed out the front windshield of the victim`s car.

On the listed date/time, I responded to the listed address in reference to a house fire.  When I arrived, the suspect admitted to starting the fire.  He was detained and arrested at the scene.Clear by Arrest
On February 7, 2014, the defendant was arrested for assaulting his girlfriend.

On 02-09-2014 at 1800 hours, Carolynn Edwards reported that she was receiving harassing phone calls from her former boyfriend, Michael Smith.   Ms Edwards stated that Smith had been convicted of stalking her and was not to have any contact with her.Ms Edwards showed proof of Smith calling her both by caller i.d. and voicemail on February 7th and 9th.I obtained a warrant for arrest for harassing phone calls on Smith and served him at his home.  Smith is currently in the High Point Jail under a domestic hold.

On February 7, 2014 at approximately 5:27am I responded to 1013-A Roberts Ln in reference to a domestic dispute complaint. Upon arrival I spoke with Sucola Ledbetter who advised that her boyfriend, Jerry Douglas had assaulted. It was determined through the investigation that an assault had occurred and Douglas was taken into custody and placed in the High Point jail.

On February 6, 2014 at approximately 2013 hours, I responded to 1509 Franklin Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, I spoke with Ms. Chantel McCall who stated that her boyfriend, Mr. John Little, had assaulted her and broken the windows out of her car. Mr. Little was on scene and admitted to fighting with Ms. McCall and to breaking the windows out of her car. Mr. Little was arrested.
On above date and time, I responded to the incident location for a reported assault. The suspect was still on scene and was arrested without incident.

On February 6, 2014, at approximately 1448 hours, I responded to 310 Avery Avenue in reference to a report of an assault with a deadly weapon in progress. Notes advised that a black male was stabbing a black female multiple times. As I arrived on scene, I found the victim lying in the middle of the street (Avery Avenue). She was lying on her side but not moving. I stayed with the victim until EMS/Fire Department arrived. The victim was rushed to the High Point Emergency Room where she was later pronounced dead. The suspect was arrested on Roseland Street a short time after officers first arrived on scene. He was transported to the High Point Police Department to be processed and then transported to the High Point Jail without incident.
At 1400 hours on 2/10/2014, the reporting party came to the High Point Police Department to report that her husband punched their 5 year old son on 2/6/2014.
On 02-05-14 I responded to 1315-D Davis in reference to a domestic disturbance. Jessica Johnson was arrested and charged for Simple Assault. She was also issued a lease violation.

On 02/4/14, at 1730 hours, Officers were dispatched to a missing person at 2403 Eastover Pl.  Upon Officers arrival, the reporting party stated that the victim ran away and does this on regular basis.  The victim did return later on in the day.

On 2-4-14, I responded to 1614 Oneka Avenue for a domestic disturbance involving intimate partners. When I arrived, I saw the victim walking down the street. I stopped and she advised the suspect pushed her because she would not give her any money and she was walking to the Magistrates office to obtain a warrant. I advised the victim I would give her a ride.  Magistrate Garber found reason to issue a warrant for the assault.  The victim was given paperwork for our domestic violence program and returned home. The paperwork was served on the suspect a short time later.There is no further information available.

On 02-03-2014 at approximately 2016 hours I arrived to 3427-B E Kivett Dr in reference to an assault. Through further investigation Isaiah Mack was charged with assault by pointing a gun. Mack was confined to the High Point Detention Facility on a $1,000.00 secured bond.

On January 03, 2014 at approximately 1930 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance on Meredith Street.  When I arrived, the victim was bleeding from his mouth.  The victim stated that his girlfriend struck him in the face.

On 2/2/2014, I responded to 620-30B N. Hamilton St. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, both subjects were separated.  The female involved began gathering items to leave.  The female then smacked the male involved in the presence of officers.

On 02-02-2014 at around 8:50 pm, I responded to 1027 Apt B, Pegram Ave in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I made contact with the victim Mr Dustin Payne. Mr Payne advised he was struck by the suspect Mrs Sarah Payne. Mrs Payne was arrested on site for simple assault.

On 2-2-14, I responded to 2833 S Main St. for a domestic disturbance between spouses.  When I arrived, Lt. Johnson had the suspect in custody. I spoke with the victim who advised the altercation began at 2908 S. Main Street.  Both parties left that address and came to 2833 S. Main Street where the witnesses of the disturbance called the police. The suspect was arrested for assault on a female and is in jail under a domestic hold. There is no further information available.

On 02/01/2013 I was dispatched to a reported sexual assault in the Northeast area of High Point.  The victim was transported to Moses Cone for assessment/treatment.  CID was notified, and responded.  The case is under investigation.

offense: DRUG LAW SALE OTHER DANGEROUS DRUGS
body: On February 1, 2014 I responded to 1408 Hampstead Dr. in reference to a disturbance.  Upon my arrival and after an investigation Joe Nathan Baker Jr. was arrested for PWISD Crack Cocaine and Possession of Crack Cocaine.

On 1/31/2014 at approximately 0730 hours, officers responded to 1307 Cloverdale St reference a domestic disturbance between a male and female dating couple. James Wallace Young Jr assaulted his girlfriend causing minor injuries after an argument. Young was arrested and charged with assault on a female and was given a domestic hold with no bond.
On January 31, 2014, at 0054 hours, we were dispatched to 1420 Madison Ave. reference a domestic argument. The suspect is known and warrants have been issued.

On 1-28-14 at approximately 2140 hours I responded to 413 Friddle Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance call.  Upon arrival I spoke with the complainant who stated that she and her boyfriend had gotten into an argument.  No one was arrested at the scene.

On January 27, 2014 I was dispatched to 219 West Lexington Avenue for an assistance call.On arrival, Officer Todd and I spoke with the parties (Todd spoke with Monroe, I spoke with Lecompte).  After speaking with both parties and seeing the injury on Lecompte`s face, Monroe was arrested for domestic assault.  Domestic paperwork was given to Lecompte.Monroe was processed at the Police Department, then taken before Magistrate Kimel where he was placed in jail on a domestic hold.

On 01-26-14 at 2035 hours I responded to 400 Greer Avenue in reference to an unknown trouble call.  While en-route I was informed that the call appeared to be a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the Victim, Offender, and Witness.  At the conclusion of my investigation the Offender was arrested for assaulting the Victim with a broom stick handle.

On Sunday, January 26, 2014, I responded to 808-1405 Lakecrest Avenue regarding a domestic disturbance.Officers spoke with the victim, Vanesa Pedroza, who stated that she and her boyfriend had been involved in a argument and he damaged her vehicle.  The victim stated that the offender, Adrian Aviles, did not strike her, nor did attempt to strike her.  The victim stated that the offender got upset because she would not come inside his apartment, and he jumped on the roof denting the roof and kicked her drivers side mirror.I examined the vehicle and observed that the hood had been dented in and the drivers side mirror had been broken off the vehicle.
On 01-25-14 at 2319 hours I responded to 1209 S. Elm Street in reference to a missing person.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the Reporting Party.  The missing person was entered into NCIC.

On 1-25-14, I was given a child abuse case by communications and asked to contact the complainant by telephone.  I also spoke with communications who had contacted High Point Regional Hospital and made them aware we were starting an investigation concerning their patient.  Hospital staff advised they were also planning to call reference this incident. I responded to the hospital and spoke with the suspect and his son. The son was being treated for a fractured right arm. After investigating the incident and speaking with the hospital staff, I contacted another family member to come to the hospital to be with the child.  The father was obviously impaired on alcohol and was having mood swings. The father was arrested for child abuse and transported to the police department.  While en-route to the police department the father became belligerent and injured himself in the back seat.  He was transported back to the hospital and received treatment. After being released, he was brought before Magistrate Kokajko and he received a $2,500 secured bond for child abuse.  The suspect remains in jail at this time. I was not able to speak with the initial complainant at the time of this report.  DSS was contacted and made aware of the situation. Photographs were taken of the injuries to the victim and the self-inflicted injuries of the suspect. There is no further information available.

On January 24, 2014 at approximately 2024 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic assault call at on White Oak Street.  When I arrived, I could here the female party state "Why did you hit me in the face and stomach?"  The male party replied "Because you were in my way".  The male party opened the door and was very hostile.  The suspect was later placed under arrest for assaulting his wife.

On Thursday 1/23/14 at approximately 1949 hours I responded to 1809 E Commerce Av in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  Upon arrival I made contact with Mr. Michael Braswell who advised that he was assaulted by his girlfriend who had already left the scene.  A warrant was taken out on the girlfriend and has not been served at this time.

On 1-23-14 at approximately 1158 hours I responded to 1712 Lamb Ave in reference to a domestic disturbance call.  Upon arrival I spoke with the victim who stated that her and her boyfriend had gotten into an argument.

On 1-23-14, at approximately 0626 hours, I responded to 1419-B S Main St in reference to a domestic disturbance call.  Upon arrival, I spoke with the victim who stated that someone they had a Domestic Violence Protection Order against had been coming around their residence.  The suspect was arrested near the scene for related charges.

On Friday January 24th 2014, at 1322, I was dispatched to 1420 N Hamilton St in reference to a vandalism.Upon arrival I made contact with the caller, who advised his brother`s ex-girlfriend came over and smashed the windows to the house and also threw a brick through the window.Caller knew the suspect and was advised on warrants.

On 1/22/2014 at 1530 hours, Officers responded to 2419 Robbins St. in reference to a Domestic Disturbance between Intimate Partners.  After arriving on scene, it was determined that the suspect burned property of another in the roadway.

On January 22, 2014, at approximately 1052 hours, I responded to 1116-A Grace Street in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, I made contact with Rameshia La`Joy Anderson who stated that her boyfriend had just assaulted her.
On 01-22-2014 I responded to 314 Hobson St in reference to a domestic call. Upon arrival I spoke with subject that stated she had been hit by her boyfriend.

On 1/21/2014, at approximately 2210 hours I was dispatched a call regarding a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival we found that no charges were appropriate and Mr. Hunter left with the two minor children.

On 1/20/2014 I responded to the listed location for a domestic disturbance.  Once on scene I made contact with the victim, who advised she had been assaulted by William Anderson.  The victim had visible injury to her face and damage had been done to her residence.  William Anderson was arrested, charged and placed in the High Point Jail with no bond.

On 1-20-14, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance in the area of Charles Av and Grand St. Communications could not locate where the call was coming from and the parties on the line were yelling at each other. I heard the disturbance and located the address, 502 Grand St.  The female was outside yelling and walking towards the roadway and the male was standing on the front porch. After the investigation was completed, the female was arrested for assault with a deadly weapon (knife).  The victim and the other parties in the house were not injured.  According to the victim; the female was trying to leave and was upset over her phone when she grabbed a butcher knife from the kitchen and threatened to stab the victim.  The victim grabbed her and after she dropped the knife, he kicked it under the kitchen stove. The three children in the house were left in the care of their father.  He was given a domestic violence information sheet. Both the victim and the female are currently on the domestic violence offenders` D list, and have had ten field contact forms completed since 04/28/2012.  DSS was contacted and a report was filed with Key. There is no further information available at this time.
On January 19, 2014, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance on Brentwood Street.  When I arrived the reporting party stated that her live in boyfriend assaulted her and then left the residence.

On 1-19-14, I responded to 1405 Ragan Av for a domestic disturbance. The incident was not physical, however the suspect did take the victims key and cellular phone and left on foot before we arrived. The victim advised she has obtained warrants on him in the past in another county, and would do the same for this incident. There is no further information available.
The victim contacted the police department reference an on-going domestic situation with a ex-boyfriend.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On January 22, 2014, the victim reported his vehicle had been taken by a relative without his permission.  The vehicle was used in a shoplifting and later located at the relative`s house.  The victim was informed of the vehicle`s location and the relative was cited for Unauthorized Use of a Motor Conveyance.

On Monday, January 27, 2014 I responded to 3971 Park Springs Drive regarding a domestic violence incident.I arrived on scene and spoke with the victim, Caryn Valle, who advised while she was returning home from the grocery store this date her ex boyfriend, Mario Aleman, observed her vehicle, turned around on her and followed her home.  The victim stated she called the police, however the suspect had fled the scene prior to officers arrival.During the course of the investigation it was determined that the suspect had been stalking the victim.

On 01/17/14, at 0010 hours Officers were dispatched to a domestic assault.  Upon Officers arrival, they made contact with the three parties in the PVA of 2503 Ambassador Ct, next to Ambassador Ct (street).  The victim stated that he was trying to be left alone and attempted to close the door to get space between him and the offender.   The Offender then grabbed a knife and started towards the victim.  The victim then ran away.
On 01-16-2014 I responded to 120 Northgate Ct in reference to domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I spoke with both parties that stated each one had assaulted the other.

On this date I responded to 801 Sunset Dr. in regards to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival it was determined that a dispute between two siblings had occurred.  The victim and witnesses stated that Jonathan Paul Kelly III attempted to stab the victim with a kitchen knife.  A kitchen knife was found lying in the dining room floor of the residence and was collected as evidence.
On 1-13-14, I responded in reference to a report of a trespass that occurred at 3102 Rockingham Road.

On January 13, 2014 at approximately 12:45pm I was dispatched to 341 - B Henley St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The victim had been punched in the face by her ex-boyfriend and received medical treatment at High Point Regional Hospital for minor injuries.  The suspect was not on scene when we arrived, however, warrants were obtained for assault on a female.  No arrests have been made at this time.

On Sunday, January 13, 2014 at about 12:01 A.M. I was dispatched to 2441 Cypress Court via departmental radio in regards to domestic dispute by communicating threats. Based on Ms. Sharon Sampson`s statement she was taken to the magistrates` office to swear out a warrant on her husband, Russell Sampson. Due to nature of the crimes they all fall under domestic violence.

On January 12, 2014, at approximately 2323 hours, I responded to 207-L W. Hartley Drive in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, I made contact with both subjects involved. The male half advised he was assaulted by his live-in girlfriend. He had visible injuries to his mouth and neck. Female half advised she did put her hands on him but she was defending herself. She did not have any injuries. She was arrested and processed at the police department without problems.

On 1/12/2014 I responded to the ER for a report of an assault occuring at 1013-A Roberts Ln.  Once on scene I made contact with the victim.  I was advised that the victim had been feloniously assaulted by her ex boyfriend.  I observed obvious injuries to the victims person.  A BOL was put out for the suspects and Warrants for Arrest were issued by the Magistrate.

On January 12, 2014 I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance at 1023 Asheboro St. The caller had already told communications that she had been assaulted but EMS was refused. Upon arrival I spoke with Mr Perez and then Mrs Perez.   Mr Perez was arrested for assault on a female and placed in jail on a domestic hold.

On 01-12-14, at 0415 hours, I responded to 120 SW Cloverleaf Place (Motel 6) in reference to a domestic disturbance in the lobby of the hotel.  Upon my arrival, the Offender committed the crime of intoxicated and disruptive.  He was placed under arrest.  The Victim obtained a warrant on the Offender for assault on a female.  This warrant was served at the time the Offender was charged with intoxicated and disruptive.

On 1-10-14, while working patrol I was dispatched to the Magistrates Office to assist a female who was very upset about a domestic situation.  When I arrived and spoke with the victim briefly, and then asked if we could move our interview to the police department. She agreed and we resumed our interview there.

On 01/11/2014 I met with the victim who stated that she had been assaulted. I took her information and then obtained warrants on the suspect. The warrants have not been served at the time of this report.

At approximately 1751 hours on 1/10/2014, Kaur called 911 to report that her husband Kumar was inside of her residence.  Kaur was on her way to the residence after taking out a warrant on Kumar for a 50B violation approximately 2 hours earlier that day.  When officers arrived on scene Kumar was found inside of the residence in the master bedroom and arrested without incident.  While leaving the residence Kumar threatened Kaur with bodily harm.  Kumar was placed into the High Point Jail under a Domestic Hold.

On 1-19-14, I responded to 1415 Furlough Av initially on a criminal process. After I arrived, I learned the suspect had already left the scene. After speaking with the victim, I learned the suspect and victim were involved in a dating relationship in the recent past. The victims` father, against the victims` wishes, allowed the suspect into the residence to get his property. While inside, the suspect cut four tires located in a bedroom and as he was leaving, he cut the tires on her vehicle in the driveway. The suspect currently has unserved warrants obtained by an ex-girlfriend out of Davidson County.  Officers responded to other locations in the area looking for him but were unsuccessful. I obtained a warrant for injury to personal property for the damage to the victims` property on this date, at this time the warrants in NCAWARE are unserved.  The victim was given a copy of High Point Police Departments victims right information and photographs were taken of the damage. There is no further information available.

offense: ALL OTHER SHOOTING (NO CHANCE OF INJURY) INTO OCCUPIED PROP
body: On 01-08-2014 at approximately 1857 hours I was dispatched to 1215 Furlough Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  While en-route to the call Communications advised that shots had been fired.  I arrived on scene and made contact with the victim listed above and Ms. Medley.  No charges have been filed at this time.

On 01-08-2014 at approximately 1406 hours I arrived to the area of Triangle Lake Rd and Kroll Ln in reference to a domestic disturbance. Through further investigation Bradley Hunt was charged with assault on a female and confined to the High Point Detention Facility on a $2,000.00 secured bond.

On the above date and time I responded to the incident location for a disturbance. Upon my arrival I made contact with both parties. The resident, Mrs. Clark, explained that she is separated from Mr. Clark and he does not live with her at this location. She stated that he shows up uninvited while she is at work and is allowed into the residence by their children in common who also reside here. Mrs. Clark stated that she had repeatedly asked him to leave and he had refused. Mr. Clark was intoxicated and  was seen drinking from a bottle of liquor upon my arrival. He claimed that he lives at this address but could not provide any proof of that. His only belongings were a few items of clothing that were lying on the couch. He claimed to have been staying for several months. Clark admitted to not being on the lease and that they had been separated. Some of Mrs. Clark`s family was present and stated that he does not live here, only visits from time to time.  Their son was also present and made the same statement. They offered to take Mr. Clark from this location to their house to stay the night but he refused and stated he would rather go to jail. After Mr. Clark refused to leave several times he was placed under arrest for trespassing. No violence or threats of violence had occurred to this point. After being advised he was under arrest he turned to Mrs. Clark and said, "When I get out I am coming back to murder you bitch." Mrs. Clark trespassed him from the property in my presence. Clark was transported without incident and charged with 2nd degree trespass and communicating threats. During transport the suspect stated two more times that he would murder the victim upon being released.
On January 14, 2014 at 1030 hours, I took a report by phone from a Child Protective Social Worker. The suspect is known. No arrest have been made at the time of this report.

on 1-06-2014 at 04:30 I responded to 2701 Reginald Ct. In reference to a domestic disturbance. When I arrived I found a female subject bleeding from her nose and leg. Her boyfriend stated he had hit her and he was arrested and taken to the High Point Jail. Same is under a 48 hour domestic hold. The Female involved left with one of her friends and refused any medical attention.

On 01-05-2013, I responded to 1307 Thissell St. in reference to a disturbance.  Upon arrival, I found that the female resident had stabbed a male visitor with a knife.  The victim was transported to High Point Regional Hospital for treatment of his injuries.  The suspect was arrested and placed in the High Point Detention Center.

On 1/5/2014 at approximately 1837 hours, Officers were dispatched to 2738 S Main St. in reference to a domestic disturbance taking place in the parking lot.  Upon arrival, Officers located Mr. Adan Martinez (Offender) and Miss Marisol Torres (Victim) in the PVA.  After speaking to both parties involved, Mr. Martinez was placed under arrest for domestic assault.Martinez was transported to the PD for processing and then to the County Building where he was confined to the High Point Jail under a domestic hold.

On 01/05/14 at 0448 hours I was contacted by Officer Smith with Thomasville Police Department.  Officer Smith advised that he was at Thomasville Regional Medical Center with a female that had been assaulted in High Point by her boyfriend.

On 01-05-2014 at 1708 hours, I responded to the Palladium to meet with a victim of a domestic assault.  The assault took place earlier in the day at 3864 Range Crest Ct.  Due to the information obtained from the victim, warrants were obtained on the suspect for Second Degree Kidnapping, Assault on a female and Misdemeanor Larceny.

On Saturday January 4, 2013 I responded to 4144 Tecumseh St in reference to an assistance call (welfare Check).  This call was initiated after family members to the resident at this location were unable to reach her and were concerned for her welfare because of an ongoing domestic issue between the resident and an ex-boyfriend.  We were able to make contact with the resident and confirm her well being but while at the residence discovered that her ex-boyfriend had violated an existing 50B order against him by calling her.  I took out warrants on the suspect and he was arrested the same evening.  Audio recordings of voicemail messages and photographs of the caller ID will be logged in as evidence.
On January 4, 2014, the victim reported she and her child were assaulted by her boyfriend and was transported to HPRHS for treatment.

On 01/04/2014 at approximately 1:37am, I responded to an assault call at 1612 Guyer St. on arrival the victim and the suspect had left the scene.The resident at 1612 Guyer stated both men resided at 1700 Guyer St. The victim was located at 1700 Guyer, he had visible injuries to include, a black eye, abrasions, bruises as well as a small puncture wound to his left side at his ribs. EMS responded, the victim refused to be transported to the hospital and was uncooperative with his account of what had taken place. The suspect was located a couple of blocks from the residence, The suspect had visible injuries to include swelling and bleeding from his mouth, bruises and abrasions. The suspect was uncooperative and refused give an account of the incident.The resident of 1612 stated both men had been drinking liquor at his home, when the two began to argue. He stated he could not recall exactly what started the incident. He just remembered them punching each other and ending up in the kitchen where both grabbed kitchen knives. the resident did not see either actually use the knives on one another. The resident said he called 911 so both men left,  he picked up both knives and put them in the sink.Lab responded, photographed the scene to include a broken liquor bottle, the knives and a small amount of blood on the kitchen floor. The knives were collected, the victim and the suspects injuries were photographed.The suspect was arrested and charged with assault with a deadly weapon, he was transported to the police department where he was photographed and finger printed. The suspect was then seen by Magistrate Brannon who placed him under a $500 secured bond, his wife arrived at the county building and posted bond.The suspect stated while I was completing paper work, the victim had made a statement in reference to his child saying it was not his. The suspect said "That made me mad and I punched him, yes I hit him. I did not stab him but I did hit him".

On January 03, 2014 at approximately 0951 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance call on Granby Avenue.  When I arrived, I spoke to the sister of the victim who stated that she and her sister were assaulted by her nieces father.

On 01-02-2014, at approximately 8:10pm, I took a call from a female subject who advised that she had been beaten up by her uncle in the 300 block of Kennedy Av.  I gathered her information and completed my report.

On 01/03/2014 at 1149 hours, I spoke with Debra Dawkins in reference to a missing person.  Debra advised me that the missing left her residence at 1400 hours on 01/02/2014 and has not returned home or made contact with anyone in the family since that time.

At about 1020 hours on the above date I responded to the 200 block of Irbywood St. in reference to an assault.  The victim advised me that her ex-boyfriend, Maxon Rogers had assaulted her.  Rogers was arrested on an outstanding warrant and also charged with assault on a female.

On 1-1-14,I responded to a domestic assault at 916 Asheboro St. Upon arrival, I spoke with the victim who advised she was punched in the mouth two to three times.  The victim had a bloody lip and stated her tooth was broken from the assault as well.  The suspect was intoxicated and was arrested and charged with assault on a female.

On January 1, 2013 at approximately 1128 hours, I was dispatched to a missing person call at the police department.  I traveled to the missing persons residence and found the front door was slightly opened.  The victim`s mother responded to the residence and gave us consent to search the house for the victim.
On 01/01/2014 at approximately 0020 hours I responded to 2307 Fala St reference a domestic disturbance IP. Upon contact I spoke with both the victim and suspect and subsequently made an arrest.

address: SOUTH CENTRAL SECTION OF THE CITY
body: On 4/29/2014, at approximately 1300 hours, I investigated a report of a sexual assault that occurred in the south side of High Point to a 16 year old victim. The suspect is an acquaintance of the victim. The incident occurred over a period of about two months starting in the beginning of January 2014. No charges have been filed at this time.

On 1-1-14, I responded to 1218 E Green Dr.  for a vandalism that was a result of a domestic disturbance involving intimate partners.  When I arrived, Ms. Scurlock was waiting to show me the damage to her vehicle.  After speaking with her, I responded to the hospital to speak to the victim, Ms. Campbell. After listening to both parties, Ms. Scurlock was arrested for simple assault and assault by strangulation.  The victim received treatment for her injuries and released from the hospital. Ms. Campbell was given copies of High Point Police Departments victims` rights form and the domestic violence injury form.   The damaged vehicle located at 1218 E Green Drive was towed to another location for repairs by the owner. There is no further information available.

On Tuesday, 12/31/13, at approximately 1830 hours, I responded to 1019 Bridges Drive regarding an Assault with a Deadly Weapon.  Upon my arrival, I met with Scott Blevins who told me that his son, Brandon Blevins, had been stabbed in the leg by his girlfriend, who had left prior to my arrival.  I met with Brandon Blevins who denied having been stabbed and refused to cooperate with officers.  Blevins refused medical treatment.

On December 30, 2013, the victim reported being involved in a domestic violence incident with her son.  The victim was charged with assault and there is an outstanding warrant on the son for assault on a female.

On Monday 12/30/13, at approximately 2012 hours, I responded to 1227 Carter St in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  Upon arrival I made contact with both parties.  The female subject was placed under arrest. This case is closed/cleared by arrest.

On 12-29-2013 I responded to 2308-G Shadow Valley Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I was met by the victim, Mr. Prado.  He stated that his child`s mother, Ms. Shabazz, had assaulted him by scratching him on the face.  He had visible marks and Officer Duggins took pictures of his injuries.

On December 29, 2013 at approximately 8:47am I was dispatched to 205 Edgeview Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The disturbance was between a boyfriend and girlfriend at their residence.  Both parties had signs of assault, and both were arrested.

On the 29th day of December, 2013 at approximately 0120 hours, I responded to 1111 E Russell Av in reference to a domestic disturbance in the front yard.There were signs of assault on the male party and damage to his vehicle, so the female was placed under arrest.

On 12/28/2013, Officers were dispatched to 3113 Bowers Ave. in reference to a Domestic Disturbance between intimate partners.  Prior to arrival, Mr. Fields (Offender) had fled the scene.  Mrs. Dunn (Victim #1), advised that she had been assaulted and her husband, Mr. Dunn`s (Victim 2) vehicle had been damaged.Mrs. Dunn was escorted to the Magistrate`s Office where she took out a warrant for Assault on a Female.  Mr. Dunn also took out a warrant at the Magistrate`s Office for Injury to Personal Property.While the warrants were being issued, Mr. Fields was reported to be back at the residence on Bowers Ave.  Officers responded back to the scene at which point Mr. Fields was subsequently arrested and transported to the County Building.  Mr. Fields was then booked into the High Point Jail under a domestic hold.

On December 28, 2013, I responded to a report of a possible domestic disturbance. The call was made by an uninvolved third party. Upon arrival I spoke with a female and her friend. No active disturbance was observed. The female did not want police assistance initially.   No injuries were observed. EMS was not required. No suspects were on scene. The incident is under investigation.

On 12/27/2013 Officers responded to 3107 Woodview Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance. The listed victim had a visible broken ring finger on her right ring finger. The suspect was arrested on scene.

On 12-26-2013, at approximately 9:47pm, I responded to 310 Meadow Pl in reference to a domestic dispute that was going on.  Upon arrival, the male subject had assaulted the female subject and he was arrested.

On 12-25-2013, at around 7:30 pm, I responded to 700 Hines Av, in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I met with the victim, Mr Gainey.  Mr Gainey advised on the dates and time listed above, the suspect, damaged Mrs Robbin Warren`s BMW.
On 12-24-2013 I responded to 502-B West Ward Ave. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I spoke with Megan Demis who advised Datwan Cardwell had assaulted her.
On this date I was dispatched to the above location in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  Upon arrival the suspect was arrested.

On Monday, 12/23/13, at approximately 1915 hours, I responded to 245-L Northpoint Avenue regarding a Domestic Disturbance involving Intimate Partners.  Upon my arrival, I met with Kayla Wilson who told me her boyfriend Gerrell Horsley assaulted her.  Wilson had visible signs of injury in the form of scratch marks on her neck.  Horsley was taken into custody without incident and charged with Assault on a Female.

On 12-23-2013 I responded to 1021 N. Manor Dr. in reference to a disturbance.  Upon arrival it was determined that there was probable cause to believe that a male and female had assaulted each other.  Both would not give information as to what happened and both were arrested for assaulting each other.

On 12-23-13, I responded to 225 Model Farm Rd for a domestic disturbance involving two females. One party left prior to my arrival. The remaining party involved she and her girlfriend were in an argument that got physical. The party that left responded to High Point Regional Hospital with an injured right arm but later refused to stay for medical treatment. One party was arrested and charged with simple assault. She was released at the Magistrates office on a promise to appear in court and then transported to the Women`s shelter were they agreed to let her stay overnight. There is no further information available at this time.

On Monday December 23, 2013, I responded to 232 Willowood Drive in reference to an Unknown Disturbance. Upon my arrival I spoke with the caller, Regina White, who advised her ex-boyfriend, Aaron Ingram, had kicked her front door open. White advised once Ingram gained entry, a struggle occurred, where she received minor injuries.

On December 23, 2013 at approximately 1308 hours, I was dispatched to a child abuse call at the magistrates office.  When I arrived, the victim`s father stated that his son`s mother assaulted him and her friend assaulted his son.

On 12-22-2013, I responded to 1445-E West Avenue in reference to a domestic dispute.  Upon arrival I met with the residents of the apartment and learned that one of the subjects had been assaulted.  The female resident was arrested and charged with (M) Assault.

On 12/22/2013 Officers responded to 265 Eastchester Dr in reference to a Domestic Assault on the parking lot. The listed victim was assaulted by being scratched in the neck by the suspect. The suspect was arrested on scene pursuant to HPPD General Orders.
On December 19, 2013 at 2044 hours I responded to 1304 Worth Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.

On Wednesday, 12/18/13, at approximately 1930 hours, I responded to 4411-3G Crowne Lake Circle regarding a Domestic Disturbance involving Intimate Partners.  Upon my arrival I met with Justin Roberts and Zakirra Smith who had been arguing and advised they got into a physical altercation.  Neither party was seriously injured, but Roberts had a scratch on the back of his neck and had multiple video recordings of Smith assaulting him.  Smith was charged with Simple Assault.  Roberts was subsequently charged with Assault on a Female.

On 12-18-2013, at 19:01 hours, I responded to 300-1B Oakwood St., to a domestic disturbance call. Upon my arrival I made contact with the victim, Jennifer Garner. Ms. Garner stated that she had been assaulted by her boyfriend, Reece Campbell. Ms. Garner had signs of injury and Mr. Campbell was taken into custody and charged with assault on a female. There is no further information at this time.
On 12/17/2013 I was dispatched to 601 N Elm St in reference to assisting DSS.

On 12-17-2013 at approximately 1608 hours I arrived to 121 N Hall St in reference to a domestic disturbance. Through further investigation a WFA was obtained charging John Fuller with assault on a female and communicating threats.
On 12-15-2013 I responded to 2303 Van Buren Street in reference to a domestic dispute.  Upon arrival I spoke with Ebony Ervin who advised she had been assaulted.

On 12/15/2013 around 1409 hours Officers responded to a reported armed subject call near the intersection of E Kivett Dr. and Hendrix St.  The caller reported that her boyfriend, Jerry Douglas Jr. assaulted her by pointing a firearm at her and threatening to kill her.  Officers arrived on scene and located Douglas in the parking lot of his apartment complex.  Officers instructed Douglas to stop and he responded by running into his apartment attempting to hide.  Officers located Douglas in his kitchen, arrested him for Assault by Pointing a Gun, Communicating Threats and Resist Delay and Obstruct, and held on a Domestic Violence Hold until first appearance.

On December 12, 2013 officers were dispatched to the 400 block of N Centennial St to look for a domestic violence victim. The victim and suspect were not on scene. Eventually the mother of the victim showed up. A phone call to the victim from the mother revealed her location. The victim was on Steele St.    I spoke with Ms Thomasson on Steele St. She had been hit in the face and mouth. She also had some marks on her upper chest. Ms Thomasson went with EMS to the hospital as a precaution.   A warrant for assault on a female has been obtained for the suspect. A lookout has been broadcast. The victim`s injuries have been documented with pictures. She has been given domestic violence hand out information.

On December 11, 2013 Ms Stevenson reported that the father of one of her children assaulted her. Ms Stevenson said that she was hit in the face and mouth. Her hair was also pulled. EMS was offered but declined.   A warrant for assault on a female was taken out on the suspect. A warrant attempt has been made. The suspect has not been located. There is an active lookout for the suspect at this time.

On 12-09-2013, at 04:33 hours, I responded to 2309 Woodruff Av in reference to an attempted suicide. Upon my arrival, I spoke with Ronald Durst who advised that the victim made verbal threats to kill himself and set up the location for this event to occur.  The victim was taken into custody and transported to the emergency room for involuntary commitment.

On 12/09/2013, at 1442 hours, I spoke with Sharon Mitchell in reference to a report of a larceny from motor vehicle which had already occurred.  Sharon advised me that the incident took place between 2300 and 2330 hours on 12/08/2013 while her vehicle was parked at a friends house located at 207 Woodbury Street.  Sharon stated that at the time of the incident she was at the house on Woodbury with her friends, watching a football game.  While at the residence, a neighbor came to the door knocking, stating that a subject had broken into one of the vehicles in front of the house.  Sharon soon discovered that it was her vehicle and proceeded to inspect it for items missing.  Sharon stated that the drivers side, rear window of the vehicle was forced down and that the vehicle had been searched through by the suspect.  No items were stolen from the vehicle`s interior, however the license plate for the vehicle was stolen by the suspect.  Sharon did not report the incident at the time, but she advised me that in the time between the incident occurring and her reporting the incident, she did have possible suspect information.

On 12-08-2013, I was dispatched to 808 Lakecrest Apt. 404 in reference to a domestic disturbance.  When I arrived, I met with the victim, who had some minor scratches on his right hand as a result of the disturbance.The suspect had already left the scene.Charges for misd. breaking & entering as well as simple assault were taken out on  the suspect who lives outside the city limits.

On 12-08-2013 at 0425 hours, I responded to 900-311 Eastchester Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.  This is a dorm room at High Point University.  An argument between two students turned physical and the male party sustained injuries.  The suspect was placed under arrest for assault and battery and underage consumption of alcohol.

On 12-08-2013, at 0056 hours, I responded to 247-E Northpoint Av., in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with the residents.  After speaking with both individuals, it was determined that an assault took place.  The victim had visible bruising and swelling on her forehead from being punched repeatedly.    The offender was placed under arrest at 0120 hours and transported to the police department where he was processed for assault on a female.    The offender was taken before the Magistrate and subsequently charged with assault on a female.  He was released to the custody of the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold at 0210 hours.    Pictures were obtained of the victim`s injuries.

On Saturday, December 7, 2013, I responded to 818 Pine Circle Drive regarding a domestic disturbance.I arrived on scene and spoke with Kevin Whitaker who stated that he noticed that Mr. Thomas was watching half naked women on the television and told him to turn the channel.  Mr. Whitaker stated that Mr. Thomas refused to turn the channel and he turned the television off at that point.  Mr. Whitaker stated Mr. Thomas got upset and he decided to let Mr. Thomas` mother take care of the situation.I spoke with Catina Williams who advised her son, Raquan Thomas, got mouthy with her and then pushed her.I spoke with Raquan Thomas who stated that he was involved in a disagreement with his mother and her boyfriend and he took a swing at his mother.With the statement from the victim and the offender, I arrested Mr. Thomas and took him before a Guilford County magistrate who found probable cause for the arrest.

On 12/07/2013 at approximately 1918 hours, I was dispatched to 310 Meadow Place in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I arrived on scene and made contact with a Ms. June Roberts.  Ms. Roberts was reporting her live in boyfriend, Mr. Roberto Gonzales, had assaulted her.  As a result of the investigation, Mr. Gonzales was arrested and charged with assault on a female and communicating threats.  Mr. Gonzales was turned over to the High Point Jail under a domestic hold.

On December 7, 2013, at approximately 1833 hours, I responded to 1004 Hickory Chapel Road in reference to a domestic assault. Upon arrival, I made contact with both victims at the residence. They advised that the suspect had assaulted both of them and left on foot before police arrival. The female victim was treated at the scene by EMS. The suspect was not located and warrants were taken out for same.

On 12/07/13, at 1637 hours, Officers were dispatched to a domestic violence call near 2930 Waterstone Ln.  Upon their arrival, there was a female sitting on the ground and a male standing there.  The male advised that they arguing and then they started to wrestle each other, but no hitting took place.  The female then screamed at the Officers and the male party stating that she did hit him in the face.  The female was then arrested on scene.

On 12/09/2013, at 1612 hours, I spoke with Andrew Garrett in reference to a report of a larceny which had already occurred.  Andrew advised me that the incident took place sometime between 1400 and 1415 hours on 12/07/2013 at 203 Avery Avenue.Andrew stated that $425.00 and a EBT card were stolen from a table top while at the listed location on this report.  The suspect is one of Andrew`s former girlfriends who was also at the residence at the time.  Andrew advised me that the items were in his wallet, which was taken by the suspect.   No other items were stolen.

I responded to the Magistate`s Office where I met with Ms Bailey.  She said that her boyfriend had choked her and assaulted her earlier this morning.  Warrants were obtained and her boyfriend was arrested and placed in the jail on a domestic hold.

On this date, I responded to 1445-A West Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance IP.  The caller, Ms. Drawhorn, advised that her boyfriend, Charles Kearse, was trying to kick in her door.  Upon my arrival, I made contact with Ms. Drawhorn, but Mr. Kearse had already fled the scene.
On the 6th day of December, 2013 at approximately 0810 hours, I responded to 1101 E Kearns Av in reference to a DVIP call.The offender was arrested for assaulting the victim.
On December 06, 2013, at 1346 hours, at I met with the victim at Triangle Lake and Kivett Drive in reference to a fraud.

The victim parked her vehicle in the student parking lot on 12/5/2013 at about 0850 hrs.  When she returned to her vehicle at approximately 1305 hrs, she discovered the previously listed damage to her vehicle.

offense: ALL OTHER - HIT AND RUN (PROPERTY DAMAGE)
body: On 12-05-2013, at about 0300 hours, I was dispatched to the above location in reference to a hit and run that had just occurred. I spoke to the victim who advised a vehicle struck her vehicle and fled the scene.

On 12/04/2013 at approximately 8:35am I responded to a reported public disturbance at the intersection of N. Rotary Dr. and W. Parkway Av.  Upon arrival I spoke with the caller/witness who told me she saw a man and a women arguing outside of a vehicle.  She saw the man throwing the girls belongings out of the car and onto the ground.  He then grabbed the girl by the shoulders with both hands and violently shook her.  He also appeared to be trying to kiss her.  The girl was trying to pull away.I then spoke with the victim, Kalise Southerland who identified the suspect as Ahmed Hafez.  I transported Ms. Southerland to the Magistrates office where she obtained warrants.  Mr. Hafez was located and placed under arrest.

On Wednesday, December 4th, 2013, at 0436 hours, I responded to 2537 Old Mill Road in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Maranda Teague and Mr. Jonathan Thomas who got into a verbal argument which escalated into Ms. Teague striking Mr. Thomas on the head and biting him on the face.  Ms. Teague was arrested and charged with assault and battery.  A small clear plastic bag containing marijuana was located and seized during my investigation.  Mr. Thomas and Ms. Teague were both issued a citation for misdemeanor possession of marijuana.

On 12-03-2013, at 0138 hours, I responded to 3747-B Laurel Bluff Ci., in reference to a domestic disturbance.  After speaking with both parties involved, it was determined that both individuals played a part in the disturbance.  Both individuals sustained minor injuries inflicted by the other person.  Hence, each individual was charged with assault and released to the custody of the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On 12-01-2013 at 0838 hours, I responded to 1805 Country Club Dr in reference to an assault.  When I arrived, I spoke to Alexandar Bondurant.  She stated that at around 0100 hours on 12-01-2013 her estranged husband, James William Bondurant, came to her new residence and came in an unlocked door.  After he was inside, Mr Bondurant, assaulted John Culler, who is in a relationship with Ms Bondurant.  Mr Culler stated that he does not know Mr Bondurant.
On 11-30-2013, at 2:52am I responded to 610 Vista Cir in reference to a domestic disturbance. The reporting party stated her husband had hit her. The suspect was arrested for assault on a female.

On November 30, 2013, Officer Bundy and I were dispatched to a disturbance.  Upon our arrival, an assault was discovered to have taken place.  As a result, Don McNeill was arrested for assault on a female and jailed under a domestic hold.

On Friday, 11/29/2013, at approximately 2200 hours, I responded to 718-F Westchester Drive regarding a domestic disturbance involving intimate partners.  Upon my arrival, I met with Tiffany Correa who had visible signs of injury and advised that her husband, Julio Correa, had assaulted her.  A Warrant for Arrest was obtained for Julio Correa for Assault on a Female.

On 11-27-2013 at 2058 hours, I responded to 411 Ridgeway Pl in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The victim was punched in the face several times by the suspect.  I placed the suspect under arrest for assault on a female.  The suspect was placed on a domestic hold and transported to the Guilford County Jail.

On 11/28/2013, I responded to 3224 Wellingford Dr in reference to a vandalism. The listed suspect knocked the victims fence down using his vehicle without telling the victim. The suspect was arrested on scene.
On this date I responded to Bethany Medical Center, concerning a possible sexual assaut that occured on the West side of the city.

On 11/24/2013 at 2125 hours I responded to 1211 E Russell Av in reference to an armed subject.  When I arrived, Manager Blackmon was seated on his front porch holding a large, angry pit-bull in his lap.   A witness that was on scene gave evidence that Mr. Blackmon had assaulted his mother.  Mr. Blackmon was arrested for Assault with a Deadly Weapon.

On November 24, 2013 at approximately 1528 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance call on Brentwood Street.  When I arrived, the reporting party stated she and her daughter were involved in a verbal argument.  Her daughter left the house and did not return.

On 11/24/2013 I responded to 1829 C Johnson St at approximately 12:36pm in reference to a domestic violence call. On arrival the female on scene had apparent marks on her face from an assault. The female stated the male had struck her several times in her face and body with an open hand as well as a closed fist.
