The victim stated the suspect also spit in her face, the victims injuries were photographed.While interviewing the victim multiple drug paraphernalia items were located and seized on scene.The suspect was charged with assault on a female and possession of drug paraphernalia. The suspect was fingerprinted and photographed and placed in the High Point Jail under a $500 secured bond.

On Friday, 11/22/2013, at approximately 1911 hours I responded to 302 Taylor in reference to a possible Domestic Disturbance. Upon arrival on the scene I made contact with the victim, Miss Dijonae Stewart, who advised me that she was assaulted by her boyfriend. The suspect was located behind 302 Taylor Av and taken into custody. Guilford County EMS responded to the scene to check out the victim`s injuries. The suspect was placed in the High Point Jail under a 3500 dollar bond.

On 11/22/2013 at 1719 hours I responded to Saunders Place near Boundary Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I met with the victim who had evidence of an assault. I got statements from the witnesses and swore out a warrant for the offender.
On 11/22/2013 at approximately 1307 hours I responded to 316 Brentwood St reference a disturbance. Upon arrival I contacted the victim who advised of a disturbance between her and her baby`s father.

On 11/21/2013 at 1755 hours, I responded to 601 North Elm Street in reference to an assault. Upon my arrival I checked the area for the suspect. A short distance from the scene of the assault I spoke with a suspected offender. I arrested Alexander Easterling and charged him with the assault.

On November 19, 2013, at approximately 4:45pm, I was dispatched to 200 Henley St. Apt 2A in reference to a domestic dispute.  The victim and his girlfriend engaged in an argument prior to my arrival, and the victim had returned to remove his belongings from his girlfriends residence.  The victim had minor scratches above his eye.  The girlfriend was arrested and charged with simple assault.

On 11-19-2013, at approximately 0500 hours, I responded to 2629 Suffolk Ave, Apartment H, in reference to a call about a domestic disturbance.  The suspect, Katie Walker, had gotten into an argument with her boyfriend and struck him in the face with her fist.  She was arrested for assault after the investigation.
I responded to the Moses Cone Emergency Room on Willard Dairy Rd in reference to an assault.
On Sunday November 17 2013, I responded to 315 Monroe Pl. in reference to an assault that had just occurred.

On Sunday, November 17th, 2013, I responded to 201 West Hartley Avenue in reference to a possible domestic assault that occurred at another location in the city.  Upon my arrival I was advised that a female, who resides at another location, was assaulted by her live in boyfriend.  The assault occurred after an argument was had between the two persons.

On 11/16/2013 at approximately 8:00 pm I was dispatched to 2108 N Centennial St in reference to an assault which had already occurred. On arrival the victim stated his girlfriend had slapped him in the face and tore out his earring, There were no signs of a physical assault. While speaking with the suspect, she admitted she had slapped the victim on the should in order to retrieve her cell phone which the victim had taken and was going through messages on. The suspect was arrested and charged with simple assault, transported to 1009 Leonard Av where she was finger printed and photographed. The suspect was taken before the magistrate where she was given a written promise to appear.

On Saturday, 11/16/13, at approximately 1330 hours, I responded to the police department regarding a larceny at 237 - I Northpoint Avenue.  Upon my arrival I met with Melanie Kirkland who told me her boyfriend stole her television set, a tablet, and a generator.  I obtained a Warrant for Arrest on suspect for Felony Larceny.

On 11/16/2013 at 4:52 I responded to the scene of an assault. Upon my arrival I made contact with the victim who informed me that she had been assaulted. EMS transported the victim to the hospital for treatment. An arrest has been made at this time for the assault.

On 11-16-13 at approximately 0141hrs officers responded to 1419-2A S Main St in reference to a domestic disturbance IP.  The victim, Paula Skager, advised that her boyfriend, Tony Lisenby, had assaulted her.  Skager had injuries and Lisenby was subsequently taken into custody for Assault on a Female.

On 11-16-13 at 0034 hours I responded to 115 Oakwood Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I noticed that Officer Dodson had Mr. Doeden under arrest for intoxicated and disruptive.  Through further investigation it was determined that Mr. Doeden assaulted the Victim.  The Victim obtained a warrant for arrest on Mr. Doeden and the warrant was served.

On 11-15-2013 I responded to the intersection of Woodruff and Waverly in response to an assault.  Upon further investigation it was determined a male assaulted a female and took her pocket book.  Warrants were obtained for the suspect.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 11/14/2013 at 22:53 hours I responded to 808-915 Lakecrest Av in reference to a drug related complaint.  Upon arrival I smelled an odor of marijuana coming from inside the residence and was given consent to search.  While I searched the residence all occupants were checked through the PIT for warrants.  I was informed through the PIT that the suspect had a condition of release from a previous court case that stated he was not to have any contact with the victim.  The suspect was arrested from the scene and brought before Magistrate Landen were he was charged with failure to comply with a court order.  The suspect was then placed in the Guilford County Jail under a $1000 secured bond.

On 11/09/13, at 0220 hours, Officers were dispatched to a Domestic call at 2515-F Ambassador Ct.  Upon their arrival, the victim stated that her live in boyfriend had hit her and choked her.  There were signs of a fight against both parties on scene.

On 11-06-2013, at approximately 11:00pm, I was dispatched to the police department in reference to a female standing by in the PD lobby to report an assault that had already taken place. She did not require medical attention.Nicolo Montalto has been placed in the High Point Jail under a domestic hold.

On 11/05/2013 at 2320 hours I responded to 3219 Waterford Dr in reference to an assault that happened earlier in the evening. Upon arrival I spoke with the victim and was advised that the suspect assaulted the victim earlier in the evening. A warrant was obtained on the suspect.

On 11/03/2013, I responded to 3023-C Ingleside Dr in reference to an assault.  I was able to speak with both persons involved. On 11-04-2013, at approximately 0930, I responded to the Police Department lobby, 1009 Leonard Avenue, in reference to a domestic assault victim. No further information at this time.

On Saturday November 2, 2013 I responded to 3614 Running Cedar Trl in reference to a domestic disturbance.  When I arrived I spoke with the female victim who stated that her husband was very intoxicated and was tearing up the house in addition to throwing things at her and striking her.  I first encountered the male who was very visibly intoxicated and kept saying that he had done nothing wrong.  The male was stumbling around his house and only stating that the argument started over his wife going out drinking and alleging marital infidelity.  I then spoke with the female in this matter who stated that she and her husband had been arguing since approximately 1800 hours where she tried to ignore him but at approximately 2200 hours he came downstairs and while she was laying on one side of a sectional sofa, the male picked up the other side and turned it over onto her and then began jumping on her after placing a sofa cushion on her.  The female stated that the male then began trashing the house, I observed the state of the residence in disarray with the sectional sofa separated and the cushions removed.  The female stated that she then called in for police to respond and stated that while she was on the phone with police the male took her phone and broke same.  The female also showed me her phone which was cracked on the top and appeared to be smashed.  After speaking with both parties I determined there was enough PC to charge the male with assault on a female and interfering with emergency communications.  The male was booked into the High Point Jail with no bond.
On 11-1-13 I responded in reference to a report of fraud that occurred at 3725 Single Leaf Circle.

On 10/31/2013 at 1810 hours I responded to 4340 River Birch LP Apt 2F in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I spoke with the complainant who advised of a verbal disturbance between him and his girlfriend. Complainant had visible signs of a physical assault.

Mrs. Brittane Renee Lang, the victim, stated that her ex-boyfriend, Mr. Christopher Keil Jones, had come to her house, opened the rear window and entered her house while she was in the shower. The scene was processed, and photographs along with fingerprints were entered into evidence.  A BOLO was placed for Mr. Jones and his vehicle.

On 10-28-2013 I responded to 303 Friddle Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance between husband and wife.  When I arrived the male subject had already left the scene. The witness, Angela Winchester, who is Tykia`s teacher called 911 and came outside in time to see the victim on the ground and James running off. Tykia refused medical treatment but did wish to prosecute the suspect. She was giving the Victim information form and all DVIP paperwork. Lab responded for photos. A BOL was issued for the suspect and a warrant was issued for Assault on a Female.

On 10/13/2013 at approximately 1:30am I was dispatched to 2407 Clifton St in reference to an assault which had already occurred.A juvenile called in stating he had been assaulted by his mothers boyfriend.  The boyfriend had pushed his mother into the bedroom locking her in with him. The juvenile went to his sisters house a few blocks away in order to call for help.On arrival to the home of the offender all lights were out. After knocking repeatedly the mother came to the door and stated her boyfriend had kicked her thirteen year old son in the stomach and when she tried to go to her son the boyfriend pushed her into the bedroom causing her to fall to the floor and locked her in the bedroom with him. The victim further stated her boyfriend would not allow her out of the bedroom to check on her son, her boyfriend only unlocked the door when he realized police were at the door.The suspect admitted to kicking the juvenile stating he has problems with the child, he also stated he pushed his girlfriend into the bedroom where she fell to the floor. Stated he locked the bedroom door because it was time for bed and she needed to lay down.The suspect was arrested and charged with simple assault on the juvenile, assault on a female and kidnapping. Placed in the High Point Jail with no further incident.

On Saturday, October 12th, 2013, I responded to 2128-C Chester Ridge Drive in reference to an individual involved in a domestic situation where he was reportedly burning personal property. She did ask to be transported to the hospital to get cleared given that she was 7 months pregnant.  The hospital stated that she was healthy and the baby was fine.  The magistrate could find no probable cause for warrants and no warrants were taken out.

On September 21,2013, officers were dispatched to a fight call on Idol Street behind McDonald`s Restaurant.  Upon arrival of Captain S. Myers and C. Bartlett, Fuller and Craddock were in the pva of A-1 Alterations with injuries conducive of fighting each other (scuffed elbows and arms with asphalt abrasions).  Both subjects denied fighting, citing they "fell in a ditch".In talking with Angel Burgess, she reported that she has been having an affair with Fuller for about a month and they both live at 105 Idol Street.  Burgess decided this date to get back with her husband (who is in Chicago).  She told me that she was leaving in two weeks to go back to Chicago.Apparently Fuller took this news hard, so he went and got drunk at a local bar, then came back to argue with Burgess.  As a result of the arguing and the loud yelling, Burgess received scratches all around her neck.  Michael Blaze, who was just around the corner, came to assist when he heard the loud screaming and pulled Fuller off Burgess.  Once this was discovered, Officer Bartlett and I went into 105 Idol Street (where Fuller had gone in to pass out).Fuller was arrested for domestic assault on a female.  Due to his injuries, I requested EMS and they responded, tending to Fuller`s abrasions.  He was then taken to the police department where he was processed by Lab Tech Barterelli.  Fuller was then taken to the county building before Magistrate Kokajko where he was jailed under a domestic hold.Burgess was given the appropriate domestic violence paperwork by Officer Bartlett.

On 09/24/2013 at 1030 hours, I spoke with Scott Taylor in reference to a report of a larceny from his residence.  The suspect, Scott`s son in-law, possibly took the items from Scott`s residence sometime between 09/21/2013 and 09/23/2013 while Scott and his wife were out of town on vacation.  Multiple items were taken from the residence.  It is believed that the suspect may be taking the items and meeting a girlfriend of his in Alabama.

On this date, security at a High Point educational center reported an assault. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed that a female student admitted to slapping a male student, and he in turn slapped her back. This altercation was a result of an insult, verbalized, by the male student to the female. The female student revealed that a possible sexual assault may have occurred on an earlier date, and perpetrated by a male friend,  of who assaulted the female on this date. This incident will be further investigated.

On September 20, 2013 at approximately 1643 hours, I was dispatched domestic related call at Main Street and Plaza Lane.  When I arrived on scene, the victim stated that the father of her child struck her in the face and rib area.

On the date and time listed above, Officers Moss and Inthisane responded to 927-B South Road in reference to a possible child abuse.  Upon arrival it was discovered that the suspect struck the victim with a broom and a belt buckle several times.  The victim was treated at the High Point Regional Emergency Department and Child Protective Services were notified.  The suspect was charged with Misdemeanor Child Abuse and placed in the Guilford County Jail under a Secured Bond.

On September 19, 2013, Officers responded to 1600-E Long Street on three separate occasions regarding Paul Looper and Jessica Mazzarella (boyfriend and girlfriend for about 5-6 months).  All three incidents were concerning a debit card that Mazzarella reportedly refused to give Looper.  Despite appropriate advice given on the first two responses, Looper still felt the need to take matters in his hand and confront Mazzarella.  As the result of this argument, Mazzarella threw a set of keys at Looper, striking him in the top of the head causing a small red mark.  Mazzarella was arrested for domestic assault (both admitted living together exclusively at 1600-E Long Street) and taken before Magistrate Kokajko where she was jailed under a domestic hold.  Looper finally recovered his debit card at the apartment.  Looper was given the appropriate domestic violence paperwork for resource.

On 9-18-13 at approximately 1515hrs officers responded to 1005-A Wilson Pl in reference to a domestic disturbance.  A juvenile victim advised that her father had assaulted her by punching her in the face.  The juvenile had marks on her face and the father, Brian Wise, was taken into custody for Assault by Strangulation and Misdemeanor Child Abuse.
On 09/16/2013 I responded 2109 Friends Av in reference to a domestic dispute. Upon arrival I made contact with the victim and his mother who stated that the suspect assaulted the juvenile victim.

On September 14, 2013 at approximately 2305 hours, I responded to a domestic distubance on White Oak Street. Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Tori McLean and Mr. David Covington. Both parties, in a dating relationship, had gotten into an argument and struck each other in the face. Both parties were arrested.

On September 17, 2013 I spoke with Ms Jenkins in reference to an on going domestic issue. Ms Jenkins reported that a former boyfriend has been sending unwanted and threatening text messages to her phone. Ms Jenkins was familiar with the phone number through prior use, caller ID, and billing. Ms Jenkins received a threatening text message which put her in fear.   Warrants have been obtained for the suspect for communicating threats. A lookout has been broadcast. The suspect is transient. Several possible locations have been checked for the suspect including a vacant house. No arrests have been made at this time.   The suspect has also made threats toward a judicial official and a police detective. Warrants have been obtained for those charges as well.
On the listed date/time I responded to 3025-L. Ingleside in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  There were witnesses to the incident, as well as slight injuries to the victim.

On September 12, 2013 I was dispatched (along with Officer Gary Todd) to 417 Nathan Hunt Drive.   Upon arrival, I made contact with the victim, Ms. Thompson, who reported that her boyfriend and she had gotten into a fight this evening.  Reportedly, Ms. Thompson was at 511 Nathan Hunt Drive, where she lives, and her boyfriend grabbed her by the hair and dragged her across the front lawn.  He also punched her in the face with his fist and her cell phone, cracking the screen of the phone.  As a result, Ms. Thompson sustained abrasions to her forehead and a bloody nose, which she cleaned up prior to my arrival and her lip was busted.  I took digital photographs of the visible injuries.  I gave Ms. Thompson the domestic violence paperwork and went before Magistrate Billips.  A warrant for domestic assault on a female was issued.  I also issued a local lookout.

On September 12, 2013 at approximately 2216 hours I responded to 211-C Kendall Ave. Upon my arrival, I spoke with Teresa Craven who advised that her and her husband Timothy Corum had been involved in a physical altercation. Timothy Corum was arrested for assault by strangulation and disorderly conduct.

At approximately 0716 hours on 9/12/2013, I was dispatched to a Domestic Disturbance at 4017 Deerfield Street in which the victim, Sean Ashton Sauls, reported that he had been assaulted by his wife and was refusing EMS.  Upon arriving on scene about 4 minutes later, I made contact with both involved parties inside the front door of the residence.  The victim had multiple cuts to his face from being scratched and there was active bleeding from the injuries.  The suspect/wife, Maureen Murtagh Sauls, did not have any visible injuries and admitted to scratching the victim during a verbal argument.  Three minor children were present inside at the time of the assault and one of the children witnessed parts of the altercation.  After speaking with all parties present at the time of the assault, Maureen Sauls was arrested for Simple Assault - Domestic Violence and transported to the High Point Police Department for processing and then the  Guilford County Magistrate`s office in High Point where she was subsequently placed into the Guilford County Jail under a Domestic Hold.  DSS was notified of the incident and photographs of the victim`s injuries were taken.  At the request of Mrs. Sauls, the care and custody of the children was given to her father, Bill Murtagh, who arrived on scene after my arrival.

On 10 Sept 2013 I was dispatched to 400 S. Main St room 117 in reference to a domestic disturbance.  When I arrived, I knocked on the door and the offender answered the door and invited me in.  I observed the victim sitting on the foot of the bed and their 3 year old was in the bed asleep.  The victim stated that she wanted to leave and that`s all she wanted.  I asked both parties to tell me what happened.  The victim said she had come by trying to work things out but realized it couldn`t be fixed.  The offender stated that the victim had seen a text message from another woman and became angry.I gave the victim and her son a ride to 1802 Eugene Ave.
On this date I responded to 400 Anaheim Street in reference to a domestic disturbance in progress.

On September 10, 2013 at approximately 2:22pm I was dispatched to 1124 Textile Pl. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The victim and her boyfriend were having an argument when the boyfriend began hitting the victim in the face.  The victim stabbed her boyfriend twice to end the assault.  The boyfriend was taken to High Point Regional Hospital with non life threatening injuries and charged with assault on a female,

On 9/9/13 at about 4:30 PM I responded to 1102 W Green Dr for an in progress assault. Upon my arrival I saw the suspect, Joseph Paul Hicks, chasing his father, Arnold Hicks, and his girlfriend, Minnie Mickle, across the front yard of this residence. After a brief confrontation the suspect was taken into custody. The suspects mother, Enola Ruther, suffered severe injuries from the suspect punching her repeatedly in the face with a closed fist and was transported by EMS to the ER. Both Mr. Hicks and Ms. Mickle stated that the suspect had assaulted them in the house when they tried to intervene in the assault against Ms. Ruther. He then chased them both with the knife threatening to stab them. Lab responded to the scene for photos and collected the weapon.
On the 8th day of September, 2013 at approximately 1450 hours, I responded to 907-B Granby Av in reference to a DVIP call.The suspect was arrested and placed in the High Point Jail.
On September 08,2013 at 0050 hours, I was dispatched to 2427 Alderbrook Dr. reference a domestic assault. The suspect was arrested.

On September 9, 2013, at approximately 1219 hours, I responded to 505 E Green Drive (Magistrate`s Office) in reference to a rape that had occurred a couple days ago. Upon arrival, I made contact with the victim.She advised that her child`s father had sexually assaulted her. She left Magistrate`s Office on her own before I got any information about the incident. She stated she needed to  have a cigarette but left without telling officers.

On 09/07/2013 at 1029 hours, I responded to 241-A Northpoint Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I contacted the suspect, Rishawn Jones, leaving the scene in a vehicle.  Mr. Jones was arrested and served with numerous outstanding warrants.

On 9/7/13 at approximately 0707 hours, Officers responded to 2429 W Green Drive in reference to a Domestic assault that had just occurred.  Upon my arrival I spoke with Ms. Hall (Victim) who advised that she had gotten into a verbal altercation with Mr. Chapman (Offender).The argument escalated and Ms. Hall was assaulted.  After the assault, she contacted Police.  Mr. Chapman was placed under arrest and was taken to the High Point Jail.
On 9-7-13, William Anderson and Regina Tillery came into the magistrate`s office attempting to obtain warrants on one another in reference to a domestic dispute.

On Saturday September 7th 2013 around 0110 hours I was called to Village 2 at High point University in reference to a possible assault. Upon arrival I spoke to Gina Giammalvo. She had a busted lip and stated that the incident occurred earlier in the night.
On 09/06/2013 I responded to 605 Grayson St in reference to a disturbance upon arrival I made contact with the victim who stated she was assaulted by the subject. The victim had minor injuries.
On 09/06/2013, I responded to 2303 Van Buren St in reference to an arson. There is suspect information in this case.

On 09/06/13 at approximately 1428hrs, I responded to the area of 100 N. Elm St. to investigate a reported public disturbance.  When I arrived, several employees of the bank at 100 N. Elm St. advised that they had seen a black male subject striking a choking a black female subject in the parking lot across the street at 300 W. Broad Av.  I was able to locate the couple and determine that an assault had occurred.  The male subject was arrested.

On 09/06/2013 I redponded to 241-A Northpoint Av in reference to a domestic assault. When I arrived the listed victim had been assaulted by the suspect by slapping the victim in the face. The suspect was not located however warrants were obtained for his arrest.

On 9-6-13 at 0233hrs officers responded to 411 Woodbury St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The reporting party, Angela Black, advised that her boyfriend, Antrion Titus, had taken her phone but it had been returned to her.  Titus was taken into custody for domestic related warrants and placed in jail.

On 09-05-13 at 2128 hours I responded to 531-B Flint Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I met with the Victim and the Offender.  At the conclusion of the investigation the Offender was arrested for assault on a female.

On 09-05-2013 at approximately 6:20pm I was dispatched to 2514 E Lexington Ave in reference to a disturbance.When I arrived I spoke to a male who stated he had pushed his girlfriend after they had been arguing and she hit her head.  The female was inside and bleeding from the back of her head.  EMS looked at the female and she refused to go to the hospital.  The male subject was arrested for assault on a female.

On this date I was dispatched to the above location in reference to a domestic assault.  Upon arrival both parties were still on scene and the suspect admitted that he hit his wife in the face several times.  He was placed under arrest for same.

On 9-4-13 at approximately 0443hrs officers responded to 1220 Pearson Pl in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon officers arrival the victim, Tricia Caviness, advised that her husband, Gary Caviness, assaulted her by strangulating her.  Both Mr and Mrs Caviness nephew was present during the incident and stated Mr Caviness was the aggressor.Mr Caviness was taken into custody for Assault by Strangulation.  He was placed into the jail on a domestic hold.

On 09-03-2013 at approximately 7:06pm I was dispatched to 920 E Dayton Ave in reference to a domestic disturbance between a deaf couple.When I arrived I observed a deaf female and male that had been assaulted.  Inside of the house was a third person, he was a deaf male. After gathering as much information as possible from the three individuals one male was arrested for assault charges.

On 9-4-2013 I was flagged down at the intersection of West Avenue and Henly Street by James Price.  Price wanted to press charges on a juvenile who had flattened all the tires on his vehicle.  I met with Price and Keneisha Gillespie who was also involved with the incident. At the conclusion of the investigation the juvenile was charged with Injury to Real Property, Injury to Personal Property, Simple Assault and Communicating Threats.

On 09-02-2013 at approximately 7:24pm I was dispatched to 2104 Aileen Ct apartment D in reference to an unknown trouble.  When I arrived I spoke to a female who said her and her boyfriend had been in an argument and he pushed her.  The couple does not live together however they do live in the same complex.  The female did have signs of an assault.  She said he left on foot when she called the police.Warrants were obtained for the suspect.

On 09/02/2013, I responded to the address above for a report of a domestic disturbance. The victim stated that the mother of his new three-week-old baby showed up with two unknown males and smashed-in the windows of his car. The suspects left prior to my arrival.

On 09-02-2013 I responded to 3401 Peninsula Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I could hear yelling in the house and then a female voice said "I didn`t call the police".  I spoke with Mr. Assar and Mrs. Assar. Mrs. Assar said that her husband had struck her in the face, and I could see visible marks on her.  Mr. Assar was arrested and charged with Assault on a Female.
On 09/01/13 at approximately 1803hrs I responded to a 911 hangup call at 2429 Williams Av.  It was later determined that the call was regarding a domestic related assault.

On September 1, 2013 Ms Gibson reported that a former boyfriend drove her car without her permission. The man then bent her car key and threatened her. No assaults took place.   Warrants were obtained by the victim. The suspect was arrested without incident by the police.   The suspect, Richard Miles Jr., was placed in jail on a domestic hold pending first appearance.
On 9/1/2013, at approximately 0240 hours, I responded to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I conducted an investigation and made an arrest.

On 09/01/2013 I responded to the intersection of Elm and Vail St in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I made contact with the victim who stated that the suspect assaulted her and fled the scene.
On August 31, 2013, at 1500 hours, I spoke with Ms. Chambers, who advised sometime in the middle of the night her tires where slashed at 1603 Gavin Drive.
On August 30, 2013, I responded to 812 Miriam Av in reference to a domestic assault complaint. Upon investigation it was determined XXXX assaulted Tonya Davis. XXXX was arrested and placed in jail.
On 8-29-13 I was dispatched to the police department in reference to a strong armed robbery.
On 08/29/13, Officers were dispatched to a domestic dispute.  The victim reported that the suspect had assaulted them in the face.  The victim had minor injuries and did not want EMS.

On 8-28-13 at approximately 0237hrs officers responded to 1009 Granby Av in reference to an assault that had just occurred.  Victim, Tyson Bush, advised that his ex girlfriend, Tecolia Daughtridge, assaulted him.  Daughtridge was taken into custody and charged with simple assault.

On 08/28/2013 around 0227 hours, Officers responded to a Domestic Disturbance call at 313-E Henley St.  As officers arrived on scene, they were advised that the caller reported a male was actively assaulting a female inside the apartment.  Officers approached the front and rear of the apartment and observed a Hispanic Male run out the front of the apartment and down the hill.  Officers pursued and arrested the subject approximately five blocks away.  Officers located the female who had a bruise / red mark on her left breast.  Officers located 2 grams of marijuana and 2 grams of cocaine inside the apartment.  The male was arrested for assault on a female, and various drug charges, the female was charged with possession of schedule II and VI.  The male was held on a Domestic Hold and the female signed herself out on a written promise.

On 09/18/2013 at 1041 hours, I spoke with Cathy Dow in reference to a harassment situation that has been ongoing since August of 2013.  Cathy advised me that she has been receiving multiple phone calls from an unknown female that has been blocking her number, threatening harm to her person.

I responded to 3113 Bowers Ave on a reported disturbance.  Upon arrival I spoke with Ms. Dunn.  She said that her boyfriend had busted two windows out of her vehicle and a window out of the storm door.  Warrants were obtained and he was arrested.

On Monday, August 27th, at 12:54am, I responded to 2429 W. Green Dr. in reference to a vandalism. Upon arrival, I saw room 112`s front window was broken out. The location of the suspect was determined. Lawanda Green was discovered in room 206. Following two separate witness accounts, she was charged with Injury to Real Property.

On Sunday, August 25, 2013, at approximately 5:30pm, I responded to assist the Guilford Co Sheriff`s Department with a hit and run that occurred in High Point. Upon arrival I made contact with the victim who stated his ex-girlfriend rammed into the vehicle he was in on purpose and left the scene.

On 08-25-2013 I was dispatched to 1212 Delk Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance between the complainant and her granddaughter.When I arrvied there were three females in the yard in a physical altercation.  I separated the three and the granddaughter spit in the face of her grandmother in front of me.  The granddaughter was arrested and charged with assault.
On Sunday, August 25, 2013, at approximately 5:30pm I responded to a hit and run call which was the result of a domestic dispute between the two that occured before the hit and run.

On 8/25/2013, at approximately 0515 hours, I was dispatched to a call regarding an assault. Upon my arrival, I took a report from Ms. Ranson alleging an assault.  A warrant was taken out on the suspect.

On Saturday, August 24th, 2013, at 0700, I responded to 1431 Bailey Circle in reference to a vandalism.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Tynisha Fordham (the reporting party), who advised Ms. Kierra Allen used a sledge hammer to damage the front exterior storm door and the front exterior door.  Ms. Fordham stated Ms. Allen was upset because Mr. Edward Ross was at her residence.  Mr. Ross and Ms. Allen left prior to my arrival.

On 08/23/2013 at 1844 hours, I responded to 6406 Hedgewood Ln in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Mr. Billy Williams and Mrs. Atiya Williams who had been involved in a disturbance.  Both parties were arrested and charged with assault.
On the 23rd day of August, 2013 at approximately 1600 hours, I responded to 3232 Bowers Av in reference to a DVIP call.Upon arriving, the victim had signs of assault. The suspect was arrested.
On this date we received two separate calls reference a domestic dispute. Both callers were advised they could obtain warrants.
On 8/22/2013, at approximately 200 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I conducted an investigation and made an arrest.

On 08/21/2013 at about 10:00 PM I responded to 2908-A E Kivett Dr for a reported domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I made contact with the victim, Chazmine Tate, who stated that she had been assaulted by her boyfriend, Robert Napper. Tate had visible injuries from the incident and Napper was located and arrested nearby. Photos were taken of the victim and her injuries.

On Wednesday August 21, 2013 I responded to 216 Seashire Court in reference to a Domestic. Upon my arrival I spoke with the victim Tameka Moore, who advised her boyfriend Richard Western had assaulted her.
On August 22, 2013, both defendants were charged with assaulting each other over a domestic quarrel.

On 08/21/2013, at 0324 hours, I responded to 603-b Kent Street in reference to a vandalism of an automobile. Upon my arrival I spoke with the victim, who informed me that the suspect broke her front and rear windshield by jumping on it and throwing a bottle through the window. The victim knows the suspect.

On 08/20/2013 at 2119 hours I responded in reference to a sexual assault. Upon arrival at the scene I spoke with the victim who informed me that the suspect had physically and verbally assaulted her younger sister. The younger sister did not corroborate her story.

On 20 Aug 2013, the victim came out to her vehicle in the parking lot and found that someone had entered it.  The victim noticed the fuse box panel had been removed from its original resting area and appeared to be damaged.  Nothing was missing from the vehicle.

On 08/19/2013 at approximately 0217 hours I responded to 1406 Furlough AV in reference to the report of a domestic disturbance involving intimate partners.  Upon my arrival I made contact with one of the involved parties, Mrs Bernice Brown, who advised that her boyfriend, Mr John Ater, had assaulted her by striking her about the body & head with closed fists and a pair of crutches.  Mrs Brown sustained minor injuries as a result of the assault and was evaluated by EMS on scene.  Mr Ater fled the residence in an older model, gray or silver Lincoln Towncar prior to the arrival of officers.   An arrest warrant for assault on a female has been obtained and a BOL has been issued.
On August 19, 2013 at approximately 0137 hours, I responded to 118 Briggs Place in reference to an Assist EMS call.  Upon arrival, I met the victims who advised that they were assaulted.
On 08/19/2013 at approximately 2312 hours, officers responded to a report of a sexual assault in the southeast part of the city.

On Sunday, August 18, 2013, at approximately 5:06pm, I responded to a Domestic Disturbance call on 337 Henley St.  The victim, Kameshia Rorie, stated that her boyfriend assaulted her and then left her home before PD arrival.

On 08-18-2013 at 1036 hours, I responded to 1114 N. Hamilton St., in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The disturbance began as an argument over child custody issues.  I made contact with the victim and with the information provided an arrest was made.    The offender was taken into custody at 1132 hours, after he returned to the residence.  He was polite and cooperative.  He was charged with felony assault by strangulation and domestic criminal trespass.  He was released to the custody of the Guilford County Jail at 1250 hours, without incident.

On August 18, 2013, the victim reported being assaulted during a domestic altercation.  The victim received stitches above her right eyebrow, a bruise on her thigh and a scratch on her shoulder.A warrant for Assault Inflicting Serious Injury was obtained on the suspect.

On 08/17/2013, around 1710 hours, I was dispatched to 417 Nathan Hunt Dr in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with the victim, Erica Rasnick, who advised that her husband, Daniel Rasnick, had punched her in the face.  Mr. Rasnick was taken into custody and charged with Assault on a Female.

On August 17, 2013, at approximately 1100 hours, I responded to 2921 Archdale in reference to a vandalism that had already occurred. Upon my arrival, I spoke with Dustin Gailey, who advised that the windshield of his vehicle was damaged.
On August 16, 2013, the defendant was charged with Misdemeanor Child Abuse after assaulting her child.
On 8/16/2013, at approximately 0300 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I conducted an investigation and made an arrest for assault.

On 08/15/2013 I was dispatched to 1211 E Russell Ave for a domestic dispute. Upon arrival I made contact with the victim who stated that Manger Blackmon kicked in the door to their residence and threw her out of bed.

On Wednesday 08/14/13 at approximately 1627 hours I repsonded to 2625 Woodruff Av in reference to a possible disturbance. I made contact with the caller who advised that there had been a disturbance with herself and her brother. No further information available at this time.

On this date, a female reported a disturbance involving her ex-boyfriend. Upon police arrival, to the southside address, the victim reported that she had been pushed down to the ground by the suspect. The victim had an abrasion on her left knee consistent with her description of what occurred. I circulated the area unable to locate the suspect. I obtained a WFA Assault on a Female for the suspect.

On 08/13/13 at about 10:15 PM I responded to 2410 Bellemeade St for a reported domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I met with the victim, Kendra Trogdon, who stated that her boyfriend, Robin Teague, had pushed her out of a truck. Trogdon stated that she and Teague live together on and off and have a child in common. I saw visible injury to Trogdon that was consistent with a fall from a vehicle. Photos were taken of Trogdon`s injuries.

On 08/13/2013, at 1558 hours, I spoke with Cerrick Anderson in reference to a report of a larceny.  Cerrick advised me that the suspect was his girlfriend, and that she supposedly stole $3500.00 in cash from two separate envelopes which were located inside of Cerrick`s residence at the time.  The money was stolen between 0400 and 0430 hours on 08/13/2013 after Cerrick and his girlfriend were engaged in a domestic dispute.

On 08-11-2013 at approximately 5:40 am I was dispatched to 2514 Suffolk Ave in reference to a couple arguing in the parking lot for over an hour.  When I arrived there were four people standing around a white car in the parking lot.  There was a black female sitting in the driver`s seat crying and an agitated black male sitting on a car next to the female`s car.  The two had been in a verbal argument.  The male broke his conditions of release and was arrested.
On 08-11-2013 at approximately 0054 hours I arrived to 913 Park St in reference to a domestic disturbance. Through further investigation Carmella Lentz was charged with simple assault.

On 08/10/2013 at 1645 hours I responded to 601 N Elm St in reference to a possible sexual assault  on a juvenile. After extensive examination and investigation, it was determined that no assault took place. The victim was treated for minor medical issues.
On 08-10-2013 at approximately 0359 hours I arrived to 1301 Wise Av in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I interviewed Laqwanda Horne who had minor injuries.
On 08-09-2013 at approximately 2052 hours I arrived to 300-2E Ardale Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance. Through further investigation I obtained a WFA for simple assault on Helen Marsh.

On August 9, 2013, the police were sent to the Travel Inn Lodge in reference to an assault on a female in progress and a child present.  Officers found both defendants intoxicated and heard them yelling obscenities at each other in the presence of a 6 year old boy.  There was a strong odor of marijuana in the hotel room and marijuana was found on the child`s bed along with evidence that the drugs were being sold.  Both defendants admitted to assaulting each other and were jailed under a domestic hold.  Child Protective Services were contacted.
On 08/08/2013, I responded to the intersection of Westchester Dr and Burton Av in reference to a drug related situation.

On Thursday, August 8th, 2013, at 1703 hours, I responded to the parking lot behind 1203-B North Main Street in reference to a vandalism.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Mrs. Ann Witt, who advised her 2011 Volvo SUV (MSW-6539) was keyed on the front passenger side door.

On 8-21-13, I responded to 131-3A James Rd to investigate a larceny. I spoke with the complainant, who advised her ex-boyfriend removed the property from the house and pawned it in Asheboro, NC. At this time, there is no further information.

On Thursday, August 8th, 2013, I responded to 934 Forrest Street in reference to a disturbance between two brothers where one had threatened to shoot the other.  Upon my arrival, I spoke with the original complainant who informed me that his brother had came to the residence, entered into the complainant`s bedroom and assaulted him with his fists and possibly a household accessory.  The fracas carried out into the street where it is alleged that the suspect threatened the victim and stated that he was going to shoot him.  The suspect had left the scene prior to my arrival.

On 08/07/2013 at 0108 hours, I responded to 2130-D Crossing Way in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Ms. Carrie Burt who advised that her boyfriend, Talib Mayes, assaulted her.  Ms. Burt obtained warrants on Mr. Mayes for Assault on a Female.  I served Mr. Mayes with the warrants and he was booked into the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On this date, Officers were dispatched to 1903 Fern in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  After arriving, it was determined that two individuals had been assaulted and a vehicle had been damaged.  A suspect was identified and charged accordingly.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 08/06/2013, Officers responded to 1230 Turtle Rock Way in reference to a domestic disturbance. The listed suspect was found to be in violation of a valid domestic violence restraining order and was arrested.
On 08/06/2013 I was dispatched to 910-B Jefferson St in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I met with both parties who stated that Whitehead assaulted the victim.

offense: DRUG LAW POSSESSION OTHER DANGEROUS DRUG
body: On this date Officer Robbins and I were investigating an unrelated matter at 1407-A West Avenue.  Mr. Jones was inside 1407-A West Avenue and walked out and began walking down West Avenue towards Underhill Street.  As Officer Robbins and I were leaving Ms. Ezekiel approached us and advised that Mr. Jones left with her cell phone and wouldn`t give it back to her.  Officer Robbins and I made contact with Mr. Jones and he was in possession of Ezekiel`s cell phone.  Jones had an outstanding warrant and search incident to arrest produced an amount of "crack" cocaine on his person.
On 8-5-2013, I responded to 1802 Eugene Ave in reference to a burglary.  Upon arrival I spoke with Jamie Moore, who advised someone had attempted to gain entry to the residence.

On 08-04-2013 at approximately 0130 hours I arrived to 505 E Green Dr, magistrate`s office, in reference to a domestic assault. Through further investigation I obtained a WFA for assault on a female on Kevin Stanley.

On Saturday, 8/3/2013, I responded to 1801-B Brooks Av in reference to a report of a domestic dispute. Upon arrival, I made contact with the two involved in the argument. Ms. Rowe stated that she was hit in the face by Mr. Smith and she had a small cut on the side of her nose.Mr. Smith was arrested for assault on a female and was released on an unsecured bond.

On 08/03/2013 at approximately 1445 hours I responded to 806 S Elm ST in reference to the report of an affray between several females.  Upon my arrival I made contact with the involved parties, Mrs Dwanna Covington, Miss Haley Covington, and Mrs Penny Bethea in a grassy area on the S side of the residence.  Mrs Covington was holding Haley down on the ground while Mrs Bethea was standing close by.  Upon attempting to separate Mrs Covington from her daughter, Haley attempted to incite Mrs Bethea into a second affray and was subsequently taken into custody after a brief struggle.  Miss Haley Covington was charged with disorderly conduct and transferred into the custody of the High Point Jail under a custodial release hold.

On 07/23/13, at approximately 0458hrs, I responded to a reported public disturbance at Annmore Circle.  When I arrived, I was able to determine that it was a domestic dispute.  Both parties had been assaulted and both were charged.

On 07-22-2013 I responded to 1926 Cedrow Dr in reference to an assault that had occurred at 2316-K Shadow Valley Rd.  Upon my arrival I was met by the victim, Ms. Strickland.  Ms. Strickland informed me that her boyfriend, Mr. Woodberry, had grabbed her by the neck and slammed her on the ground.  She has visible signs of assault on her person.Warrant for Mr. Woodberry was obtained for Assault by Strangulation.  Bolo was issued for the suspect.

On 7-28-2013, officers were dispatched to assist a subject on obtaining personal property at his residence. Upon police arrival, to the police department, contact was made with a male subject who advised he wished to be escorted to his residence to recover property. Upon our arrival to the residence, the subject advised his wife was not there, he stated he had vacated the residence last week, the locks had been changed, and he had gotten most of his property on Friday July 26th, 2013. He advised his wife was at church, and then advised that he had just obtained a WFA for her for Assault. He showed me a bite mark to his right shoulder area, which appeared to be an old injury. I explained to him that no entry was going to be authorized by this officer, and that he could go through civil means if he like to obtain the property.I went by the residence periodically in an attempt to locate the suspect, however she never returned. On 7-29-2013, I drove by the residence and seen the suspect`s car in the driveway, along with the vehicle I recognized to be the victim`s also parked in the driveway. I then saw in call history that an officer had been at the residence earlier, in an attempt to serve the oustanding warrant on the suspect. I summoned an assist unit, and we returned to the house, the victim met us in the yard, and stated, that the suspect was not home. I felt this was a lie, I advised the victim that we had a warrant for arrest, and entry was going to be made into the residence. He stated he did not have a key, and I told him to get the suspect to the door, or force would be used. The suspect willingly opened the door and would be taken into custody, charged with Simple Assault, and placed into the custody of the Guilford County Jail.

On Sunday July 21, 2013 at 5:35 pm a call was dispatched to 901 N Main St in reference to a domestic assault.The victim Ms. Courtney Bone stated that her husband Christopher Lamont Jordan assaulted her in front of the High Point Public Library by shoving her against a wall.Warrants were obtained on Jordan for Assault On A Female that have not been served at the time of the report.

On June 29, 2013, at approximately 0447 hours, I responded to a public disturbance call on Hay Street. Upon arrival, I spoke with the victim who stated that his girlfriend had assaulted him. The victim had visible injuries. The girlfriend was arrested.
