When I arrived I spoke with Ms. McDowell and her friend, Luke Brannock.  Ms. McDowell stated her ex-boyfriend, Mr. Danny Baughman, had came to the residence uninvited and entered through an unlocked garage door.  Once inside, Ms. McDowell stated that Mr. Baughman began arguing with Mr. Brannock.  Mr. Brannock and Mr. Baughman began physically fighting, then Mr. Baughman left the residence.  Mr. Brannock reported that his nose had been injured in the fight and felt like it was broken, but refused EMS.  Ms. McDowell stated that she did not invite Mr. Baughman over to her residence and that they have been broken up for about 2 weeks.     While I was on the scene speaking to Ms. McDowell and Mr. Brannock, I was notified by communications that Mr. Baughman had called in wishing to speak to an officer.  I was able to make contact with Mr. Baughman by telephone, and he stated that he had been invited over to Ms. McDowell`s house following a telephone conversation they had the previous night.  Mr. Baughman stated that when he arrived at her residence he saw Mr. Brannock there and was displeased and began arguing with Ms. McDowell about her being involved with Mr. Brannock.  Mr. Baughman stated that Ms. McDowell and Mr. Brannock have been involved in several arguments prior to this incident and have a rocky history.   Mr. Baughman stated that Mr. Brannock then threw a punch at him and he began fighting back stating that he threw a blind  punch which he felt make contact, but did not know with what.  Mr. Baughman then left the residence as stated that Ms. McDowell chased after him telling him that Mr. Brannock was just a friend and it was not what it looked like.  Mr. Baughman also had minor injuries to his left wrist and facial area, along with a bloody nose.     Since Ms. McDowell stated that Mr. Baughman had not been invited over and had no business coming to her residence, I charged Mr. Baughman with misdemeanor B&E along with simple assault on Mr. Brannock.  Mr. Baughman was released on a written promise to appear since none of the charges required a domestic hold.  Ms. McDowell did not sustain any injuries and was not assaulted during this incident.     Photographs on Mr. Brannock and Mr. Baughman will be logged into the lab.  No other evidence was recovered.  This case is cleared by arrest.

On June 19, 2013 Officer M. Slaton and I were dispatched to 2451 Alderbrook Dr. in reference to a Domestic Disturbance IP.The call notes were as follows:In ref. to xxxx attacked him by punching him and trying to push him down the steps, caller has locked himself inside his bedroom.  Complainant, Todd Moyer, refused an ambulance, Unknown if intoxicated or any weapons involved.Officer Slaton arrived first and was talking to Mr. Moyer when I arrived.  I went to the kitchen and spoke with xxxx.  She advised Mr. Moyer is upset because he is having to sell the house and it might go into foreclosure.  xxxx advised her name is on the deed, but not on the mortgage.  They are not married, but are living together.  Mr. Moyer stays in Virginia some. Her daughter, Chaz Wade, age 18 resides with them.According to xxxx, Mr. Moyer came home and began slamming doors and was upset.  He hit her in the head with an open hand and she admitted she kicked him and hit him with her open hand on his right upper chest/shoulder area.  She said Chaz was in the shower when this occurred.  xxxx did not have any visible injuries.I then spoke with Chaz in the presence of her mother who stated she was in the shower and when she came out her mother and Mr. Moyer were pulling on each other`s clothes.Officer Slaton and I then went outside to discuss the call.  He advised Mr. Moyer has red marks around his neck and scratch marks. Mr. Moyer told Officer Slaton that xxxx jjumped on him and started hitting him.  He also said she tried to kick him in his privates.I then went upstairs to talk to Mr. Moyer. He said he has been staying in a separate room when he comes home.  He came home today and went to his bedroom.  She came in and started talking about their relationship.  She was talking about him seeing another woman. They started arguing and he tried to leave the room. When he did, xxxx jumped on his back and started scratching him and hitting him in the head. Mr. Moyer stated that Chaz was in the shower when this took place, but he was yelling for her and when she came out, he had his hands in the air and asked her to get her mother off of him.  I took photographs of Mr. Moyer`s injuries which I will download into the computer at the Police Dept.  I observed redness around the right part of his neck and scratches on left shoulder/chest area.  I asked Mr. Moyer if he ever struck xxxx and he said he did not. i  had Mr. Moyer write out a statement which I will have scanned into the report in Pistol.  I read the HPPD Victim`s script to him and gave him the Victim`s letter, State Victim`s Form and HPPD Victim`s Information sheet.  I also advised Mr. Moyer concerning a 50B order.I instructed Officer Slaton to arrest Ms. Wade.  He used my handcuffs and placed her in the back seat of my patrol vehicle while I was talking with Mr. Moyer.I transported xxxx to the Police Dept. for processing.  Chaz Wade came to the Police Dept. where I spoke with her without her mother being present.   I asked her was Mr. Moyer yelling for her while she was in the bathroom.   She replied, he was and was asking for her to get her mother off of him.  I explained to her that her mother would be held under a DV Hold.                                                                                                                                                                      I  obtained a Magistrate`s order on her for Simple Assault.  xxxx was placed in the Guilford Co. Jail under a DV Hold.  Due to the Judge`s Conference this week, she will remain in jail until Friday morning, June 21 when she will see a District Court Judge for first appearance.I recommend this case be cleared by arrest.

On 6/19/13 at approximately 1957hrs, I was assisting with a call at the Emergency Room when the nursing staff advised me that a stabbing victim had just come into the triage area.  I went to the triage area and made contact with the victim.  The victim initially lied about the incident, but then later admitted that she had been stabbed by her girlfriend during a domestic dispute.  The girlfriend later came to the Emergency Room to check on the victim and she was arrested there.  She was placed in jail under a secure bond.

On 06/18/2013 at about 9:30 PM I responded to 2320 Bellemeade St for a reported disturbance. Upon my arrival I was approached by the witness who took me to apartment 1F where I found the victim, Jennifer Shuford. Through statements from the victim and witness I determined that a domestic disturbance had occurred which had resulted in injuries to the victim. Warrants were issued for the suspect who had not been located at the time of this report.

Officers responded to a vandalism report at 1604 Eastchester Dr and made contact with William Johnson.  Johnson related that his ex-wife, Marsha Evans, and he had been arguing all day about Evans being unfaithful.  Evans came by the house tonight and broke the rear bedroom window out while Johnson was sleeping beside the window.  Evans admitted to breaking the window and Johnson obtained a warrant for damage to property.  Evans was arrested and held on a domestic hold.

On Monday, 6/17/13, at approximately 0800 hours, I responded to 215-K W. Hartley Drive regarding a Domestic Disturbance involving Intimate Partners.  Upon my arrival I met with Lauren Ashley Faulk, who told me her baby`s father, Byron Warner assaulted her.  A warrant for arrest for Warner was issued charging him with Assault on a Female, Interfering with Emergency Communication, Misdemeanor Larceny and Misdemeanor Child Abuse.

On 6-16-13 at approximately 2326hrs  officers responded to 313 Friddle Dr in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  Upon our arrival we spoke with both parties involved, Ms Ericka Johnson, and Mr Leterrius McNeil.  Both had been involved in an altercation and it was determined that Mr McNeil was the aggressor.Mr McNeil was taken into custody and charged with Assault on a Female and Assault by Strangulation.

On 06/16/2013 at 02:53 hours I responded to 202 Shadybrook Rd in reference to a domestic violence disturbance that had taken place.  There was no assault that took place but there was an active 50B between the suspect and victim.  The suspect was later apprehended for violating the 50B and placed in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On Saturday, 6/15/13, at approximately 1120 hours, I responded to 920-K Lakecrest Avenue regarding a Domestic Disturbance involving Intimate Partners.  Upon my arrival I met with Melynda and Paul Webster in the parking lot.  Paul Webster was taken into custody without incident and charged with Assault on a Female.

On Saturday, 06/15/13, at approximately 0038 hours I responded to 312 Oakwood Street in reference to an Assault with a Deadly Weapon. Upon arrival at the scene I made contact with the victim and reporting party of the crime, Mrs. Evelyn Kelly, who advised me that a good friend of her`s had thrown a brick through the window where she was seated at behind a computer. Mrs. Kelly had been arguing with the subject on the phone over their relationship. The suspect threw a brick from outside of the house through the living room window, striking the computer monitor that the victim was sitting behind. Warrants were issued on the suspect for Assault with a Deadly Weapon and Injury to Real Property. The suspect was located and arrested at his brother`s residence and placed in the Guilford County Jail.

On Saturday, 6/15/13, at approximately 1400 hours, I responded to 904 Pine Circle Drive regarding a vandalism.  Upon my arrival I met with George Salamalekis, who told me about a vandalism involving his vehicle that occurred at 321 Oakview Drive on 6/14/13.  Salamalekis provided the names of numerous subjects he claimed were responsible for the vandalism, and advised he would seek warrants.

On this date, a southside resident reported his girlfriend  vandalized his car, and stole personal property belonging from same.  The male was escorted to the Magistrate`s Office and was able to obtain  Warrants For Arrest, Vandalism, and Larceny on the suspect. Total value of theft and damage was approximately $500.00.

offense: ALL OTHER - HIT AND RUN (PROPERTY DAMAGE)
body: On Thursday, June 13th, 2013, at 1436 hours, I responded to Wise Avenue and Jefferson Street in reference to a hit and run collision with property damage.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Canicia Slaton (the victim), Ms. Sheayan McCoy, and Mr. Germaine Spring at 913 Richland Street.  Ms. Slaton advised Ms. McCoy and her boyfriend, Mr. Michael Chambers, got into a domestic dispute on Richland Street at Wise Avenue and Ms. McCoy got into her 1998 Honda Odyssey van (BFP-5674) to get away from Mr. Chambers.  Ms. Slaton advised she drove around the tan 2001 Nissan Sentra (AMH-9302) and Mr. Chambers got into the driver`s seat of the vehicle.  Ms. Slaton stated she made a left turn onto Wise Avenue traveling east.  Ms. Slaton stated she attempted to make a left turn onto Jefferson Street from Wise Avenue (traveling north) and Mr. Chambers side-swiped her vehicle as he passed her on the left.  I observed damage on the driver`s side front and rear door and a light color paint transfer.  Ms. Slaton advised Mr. Chambers drove away from the scene in an unknown direction.

On 06-13-13, 2:22 pm, I was at 602 W. Main St. Jamestown on routine foot patrol at the pool. I witnessed the suspect damage a vehicle. The scene was processed by Lab Tech Squires, and photos were taken as evidence. The suspect was arrested and placed in the Guilford County Jail under a $5,000 bond. Charges were DWI, Damage to real property and Disorderly conduct.

On 6/12/13 at about 8:45 PM I responded to 2311 Purdy Av for a domestic disturbance. There was  visible injury to the victim consistent with her statement. The suspect was arrested for assault on a female. Photos were taken of the victims injuries at the scene.  Domestic violence victim notification paperwork was provided to the victim.
On 6-12-13 I was dispatched to 406 Grand St. in reference to an assault.

On Monday June 10, 2013 at 7:28 am a call was dispatched to 2421 E Lexington Av in reference to an unknown trouble call.Upon arrival contact was made with the victim Ms. Voniette Tynes.  Tynes had visible abrasions on the right side of her neck where she had been assaulted by her child`s father Alphonso HoyAs a result of the investigation warrants were obtained on Hoy for Assault on a Female, Injury to Real Property, and Habitual Misdemeanor Assault.A lookout for Hoy was issued through communications in reference to the assault and warrants.  At the time of the report, Hoy has not been arrested.

On Monday June 10th 2013 around 0054 hours I responded to 913 E Dayton Av. in reference to a domestic disturbance. The caller had advised communications that a male suspect at this location pointed a gun at a female resident. The caller also stated that the disturbance was still active inside the residence.
On 06/18/2013, I responded to Moses Cone Hospital in Greensboro in reference to a Domestic Assault.

On 06-09-2013 at 0407 hours, Neha Bhatt reported that her son was out of control.  Upon arrival, I discovered that Bhatt`s son, Prithvi Tanna had assaulted her by pushing her to the ground.Tanna was charged with assault on a female and placed in the High Point Jail where he is being held until 1500 hours this date, at which time he will receive a written promise.

On June 9, 2013 at approximately 0425 hours, I responded to 2703-B Annmore Court in reference to an investigate call.  Upon arrival, I met the victim walking down Annmore Court with a severe laceration to the face and blood on their body.

On 06-08-2013 at approximately 1332 hours I responded to 500 Henley in reference to a domestic disturbance, the caller advised that a black male was trying to force a black female in a car with a gun. We were unable to locate the suspect, however warrants have been obtained. The victim did not have any injuries.

On 6/8/2013 I responded to 115-3A Chestnut Dr in response to a report of a domestic disturbance.  I made contact with the Victim who had clear visible injuries.  The victim advised she wanted to press charges against the suspect, who she had previously been dating.  The victim was transported to the Magistrates Office, where a warrant for arrest was issued.

On June 7, 2013, at approximately 2347 hours, I responded to 412-B Meredith Street in reference to a domestic dispute.  Upon arrival, I met the victim, who stated that the suspect threw a piece of concrete through the windows of the residence.

On this date, I was dispatched to a public disturbance call on Waverly St.  As I arrived on the scene communications called back indicating a male was being chased on foot by a female with a knife.  I made contact with both parties and learned that he had been cut with a box cutter by a black female still on the scene.

On this date, I spoke with the victim who advised her childrens father was at her house earlier for a cookout. They had an argument and he took her cell phone saying it belonged to him. After some deliberation, she advised she would seek warrants on her own for the larceny.

On 06-07-2013 at approximately 1945 hrs I responded to 3203 Pine Valley Rd reference a Domestic Disturbance IP.  Upon arrival I met with the victim who advised her husband shoved her to the ground and then left in his vehicle.  She advised the argument was over money.  Victim was taken to a safe place, and a warrant was taken out on the suspect.

On 6-7-13 at 1150 hours, I was dispatched to 303-B1 Oakwood St in reference to a domestic disturbance that was taking place.  When I arrived, I spoke to Connetta Yarborough about the incident.  She advised that she was an altercation with Hampton Bennett over the spanking of her child.  Hampton was not on scene when I arrived.  Charges have been taken out on Hampton in reference to this incident.
On 6-5-13 I was dispatched to 411 N. Centennial St. in reference to a domestic disturbance.

On 06/03/2013, I responded to 616 Caudell Place in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I made contact with the complainant, who stated that her daughter broke out a window in her house after an argument.
On 6-3-13, I was dispatched to 624-53C N Hamilton St. in reference to a domestic disturbance.
On 6-2-13, I responded in reference to a report of a domestic disturbance that occurred at 414 Smith Street.

On this date, Mr. Harris called the police in reference to being involved in a disturbance with his girlfriend. Once we arrived, we determined both parties had been assaulting one another and were in violation of court order to stay away from each other. Both were arrested, processed and jailed with no bond. Both sustained scratches but no medical attention was needed or requested.
On 06-02-2013 at approximately 0009 hours I arrived to 1418 Valley Ridge Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance. Through further investigation Brittney Oxendine was charged with simple assault.

On Saturday June 01, 2013 at 1818 hours I responded to a domestic assault that occurred behind the building at 706 Brentwood St. in Carson Stout.As a result of this call Mr. Evan Gainey was arrested for assault on a female.   Search incident to arrest of Gainey`s person I found 5.79 grams of marijuana (packaged weight) in a cigarettes box in his right sock.  Mr. Gainey was issued a citation for the marijuana.  The marijuana was seized and logged in as evidence.Ms. Nialoni Daniels was also arrested for simple assault, second degree trespass, and violating a Judges order not to assault Mr. Evan Gainey.Both subjects were processed and taken before Magistrate Garber before being placed in the Guilford County Jail in High Point.

On June 1, 2013 at approximately 1144 hours, I responded to the West Central section of the city in reference to a sexual assault.  Upon arrival, I met the victim who advised that her ex-boyfriend forced himself on her earlier that morning.
On 03Jun2013, this detective was notified of an ongoing stalking case in the North East side of the city.

On May 31, 2013 at approximately 1037 hours, I responded to a domestic disturbance on Cable Street. Upon arrival, I spoke with the victim who stated that her boyfriend had pushed her to the ground and punched her in the face.

On Friday, May 31, 2013 Officer Cheeks of the High Point Police Department responded to a domestic disturbance located at 247-L NorthPoint Avenue, High Point, North Carolina. Upon arrival Officer Cheeks spoke with Vitamuas who stated that she and her boyfriend of two years had gotten into an argument and as a result she was assaulted. After observing Vitamuas` injuries Sanders was located at a nearby apartment and taken into custody without incident. Sanders was confined to the High Point Jail under a domestic hold by Magistrate Landen and assigned a court date of July 12, 2013.

On 05/292013, around 2002 hours, I was dispatched to 607-3E Clara Cox Way in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with the caller, Ms. Ieesha Alston, who advised that her boyfriend, Brandon Little, and herself had been in an altercation and argument.  Ms. Alston advised that she had been struck in the face by Rabbit. Little and had a small laceration along with swelling to the right side of her face.  Mr. Little was taken into custody and charged with assault.

On 05-29-2013 at approximately 2135 hours I arrived to 506 Flint Av in reference to a domestic disturbance. Through further investigation Michael Hawkins was charged with assault on a female, injury to property, and assault on a law enforcement officer.

On May 29, 2013 at approximately 1340 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic assault call on Smith Street.  When I arrived the female suspect was standing outside speaking with another officer.  The male suspect was in the field beside the residence apparently looking for something.  At first glance neither party had signs of injury but both parties involved appeared disheveled.

On 05/29/2013 at 11:10 hours I responded to 217 Welch Dr in reference to a domestic assault that already occurred.  Upon arrival I met with the victim that stated that he locked the offender out of the house to stop the argument from escalating.  When he did the offender punched out one of the glass panes on the door to gain access to the residence.  The victim who was standing behind the door at the time received a laceration to his face from the glass.  I took out a warrant for arrest for the offender and a bolo was issued since she was not located at this time.

At about 1745 hours on the above date I responded to 810 S. Main St. in reference to a disturbance between a man and a woman.  Upon my arrival the male party had already left the scene.  I spoke to the female party invovled, she advised that she had been assaulted by her boyfriend.

On 05/28/2013 at 2131 hours, I responded to 2306-D Shadow Valley Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, Ms. Rosalind Townsend advised that she was assaulted by her boyfriend, Thomas Logan.  Warrants were obtained by Ms. Townsend on Mr. Logan.

On 5/27/13 at approximately 2230hrs I responded to a reported public disturbance on the 300 block of Pickett Pl.  While investigating the disturbance, I learned of an unrelated domestic assault that had also just occurred in the same area.  I made contact with the reported victim and found her to have injured lips.  The suspect was arrested at his home.

On 05/25/2013 at approximately 2100hrs I responded to a reported domestic disturbance at 2111 Candelar Dr.  Upon arrival I spoke with the complainant who advised she and her husband were involved in a verbal argument that turned physical.  She stated he headbutted her in the face.
On 05-25-2013 Michael Smith was charged with assault on a female stemming from a domestic disturbance that occurred at 1804 Wade Pl.

On 5-24-2013 at 5:55pm I responded to 805 Central Ct. in reference to Domestic Disturbance.Upon arriving at the above location I made contact with the victim, Francine Fleming, who advised her son had assaulted her during an argument, knocking her to the ground and choking her.I made contact with Terry Allen Fleming in the front yard of the residence where he was arrested without incident.

On the date/times listed the victim & suspect got into an argument at the suspect`s mother`s residence.  As the victim was trying to console and calm down the suspect, he got upset and punched and kicked the victim.

On Sunday, 5/25/14, at approximately 1600 hours, I responded to 6040-2C Red Cedar Drive regarding a larceny.  Upon my arrival, I met with Robbie McKinney, who advised that his ex-girlfriend stole furniture and a firearm from his apartment while he was incarcerated.
On 5-23-2013 I responded to 601 N. Elm Street, High Point Regional Hospital in reference to a sexual assault.

On the date and time listed above, officers responded to 600-B Anaheim Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, officers made contact with the caller who stated that her child`s father and she got into an argument.  Officers made contact with the other party who was inside the residence.  The subject had an Order for Arrest for Failure to Appear and was taken into custody.After further investigation, the subject was also charged with Interfering with Emergency Communications when he grabbed her cell phone and separated the screen from the keypad.  While doing so, he said to the victim, "You aint calling no police".He was placed in the Guilford County Jail under a $50.00 cash bond.

On May 22, 2013 at approximately 1040 hours, I observed a black male and a black female arguing at Dorothy Street at Moreland Avenue. Upon investigation, I found this to be a domestic disturbance and the female was arrested for simple assault.

On 05-22-2013 at approximately 0800 hours Officer Mills and I responded to 4321 Piedmont Parkway in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon our arrival we spoke to Tony Ray Johnson and his manager. Ms. Kristy Brown was arrested and charged with simple assault.

On 05-22-2013, at approximately 11:34pm, I was dispatched to 1419 2A S. Main Street in reference to a domestic disturbance that had already taken place.    When I arrived, I observed a white female standing outside visibly upset.   I asked the female what had taken place and she responded with she was assaulted by her fianc_.   I noticed visible marks on her right neck area as a result of the recent assault.   As a result of the assault, Mr. Tony Lisenby was arrested and charged with Assault on a female.   Lisenby was placed in the High Point jail under a domestic hold.  Digital photos of injuries to both involved parties were taken by crime lab M. Squires.

On Tuesday 05/21/2013 at 10:30 pm, I responded to 2605 Carsten Av in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival, I was approached my Mrs. Clodfelter who stated that her ex husband had came over to her house and assaulted her. Mr. Clodfelter was arrested and confined at the High Point jail.

On 05/21/2013, at approximately 1900 hours, I responded to 2429 W Green Dr. in response to a public disturbance.  Prior to arrival, I was notified via dispatch that the suspect, "Sundance", would be leaving the scene in a burgandy minivan.  Upon arrival, I observed the van attempting to leave the PVA of the hotel.  The driver was detained until we completed our investigation.  Shawn Sundance Hinson stated that he had attempted to enter the hotel room of his wife to obtain court documents.  An inspection of the apartment showed several shoe prints on the door and severe damage to the lock, rendering the door useless.  Mr. Hinson`s girlfriend, Angela O`Conner, stated that Mr. Hinson was in a rage and attempted to beat the door down.  Mr. Hinson was arrested for damage to real and personal property along with domestic criminal trespass.

On Friday, June 21st, 2013, at 1057 hours, I responded to 208-A Venable Court in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Maria Mejia who advised her ex-boyfriend, Mr. Jesus Luna, was following her and threatening to kill her.  Mr. Luna was arrested and charged with misdemeanor stalking and communicating threats.  Mr. Luna was confined in the Guilford County Jail with a secured bond of $10,000.

On May 20, 2013, a juvenile assaulted his older brother during an argument.  A fight ensued and the juvenile suffered an injury; however, treated was refused from EMS who responded.The juvenile was charged with assault and referred to Teen Court.

On May 19, 2013, at approximately 2325 hours, I responded to 203 North Hoskins Street in reference to an unknown trouble. It was later reclassified as a domestic disturbance.Warrants have been obtained for the suspect at this time.

On Sunday, May 19th, 2013, I responded to 1133 Tabor Street in reference to an unknown disturbance.  Upon my arrival I witnessed several persons in front of the residence yelling at each other.  After getting those involved in the disturbance separated from each other, it was determined that a physical altercation had occurred inside which resulted in the arrest of one of the persons involved for Domestic Assault.

On May 19, 2013, at 1621 hours, we were dispatched to 2636 Guyer St. reference a 911 hang up. Upon call back, dispatchers heard a possible active disturbance.There was one arrest made reference court order violation.
On 05/19/2013 at 1536hrs I responded to the above address in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.

On 05/18/2013 at approximately 10:24pm I responded to a reported domestic disturbance at 2640 Dandelion Dr.  Upon arrival I spoke with the complainant, who advised her husband was harassing her via text messages.  The complainant also advised her husband came to her house after being told he was not welcome.

On May 18 2013 I responded to 723 Baker Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance complaint. Through investigation it was determined that a domestic related assault had occurred. Regina Jackson was arrest for assaulting Tracy Gardner.

On 05/18/2013 a domestic disturbance occurred at 206-A Taylor Ave. The verbal altercation turned physical and the male suspect fled the scene before Officers arrived. Warrants have been issued for the arrest of Lashon Ellerbe DOB 07/08/1990.
On May 17, 2013, the defendant was arrested for assaulting his girlfriend by punching her in the face.  The victim sustained bruises.

On Friday, May 17th, 2013, at 1639 hours, I responded to 829 Putnam Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I observed Mr. Antonio Perez kick out a rear bedroom window.  Mr. Perez was charged with injury to real property and released with a written promise to appear in district court.

On Thursday May 16, 2013 at approximately 10:10 pm, I responded to 202 Shadybrook in reference to assisting EMS. Upon my arrival, I spoke with Dominique Arnette who advised that Presentino Matthews assaulted her.

On 05/16/2013 I responded to a call for service at 611 W Green Dr in referece to a domestic dispute. On arrival a male answered the door, after speaking to the female and observing the apparant injuries the male was taken into custody. Photographs were taken of the injuries.

On 5/15/2013 I responded to 2227-K Shadow Valley Rd. in reference to a suicidal subject.  During the investigation it was discovered that the subject was not suicidal and a domestic assault had taken place.  The offender in the matter was arrested and charged for simple assault.

On Wednesday May 15, 2013 at approximately 8:30 pm, I responded to 1100 Biltmore in reference to an accident that had already occurred. Upon my arrival, I spoke with Janicia White. While speaking with White about the accident that occurred earlier, I witnessed William Wharton assault Tamara Nelson.

On 05/15/2013, at approximately 5:08 am, I was dispatched to 2419 Robbins St in reference to a vehicle fire.The neighbor heard the vehicle alarm, went out in attempts to turn off the alarm, and realized there was a small fire in the rear seat, the fire department responded, the fire extinguished itself prior to their arrival. The Fire Marshal arrived on scene and stated the fire was intentionally set.Lab responded, no arrest have been made at this time.
On Thursday, 5/16/13, at approximately 1545 hours, I spoke with Michelle Macadlo with the Department of Social Services regarding a sexual assault which took place on the north side of High Point.

On 05/13/2013 at 10:37 hours I responded to 1201 Blain St in reference to a domestic assault that already occurred.  Upon arrival I met with the victim that stated that her boyfriend assaulted her last night while she was driving near W Green Dr and Redding Dr.  I attempted to make contact with the boyfriend at 1201 Blain St but was unable to do so at this time.  The victim was escorted to the Magistrate`s Office where she obtained warrants for assault on female and unauthorized use of a motor vehicle.
On May 11, 2013 at approximately 2348 hours, I responded to 837 Howard Place in reference to a domestic dispute. One subject was arrested at this time.
On May 11, 2013, both parties were arrested for domestic assault after minor injuries were found on both of them and there was admittance of an assault and a witness observed it occur.

On this date, a northside resident reported that an estranged boyfriend was out their residence, appearing to be loading a firearm. The suspect was standing next to his vehicle, fumbling around with ammunition, attempting to load ammunition, in what the complainant described as a black in color, small firearm. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed that the suspect dropped .243 Cal rifle ammunition on the front sidewalk, next to where he parked his truck. He also dropped a Tecate beer can. A description of the suspect was dispatched. The complainant advised no words were exchanged, and no threats were made. The complainant stated, he just got out of the vehicle, messed with the ammunition, entered his truck and left the area.It was learned that the suspect still had active WFA for Assault, (complainant, and boyfriend being the plaintiffs in those cases), and several FTA`s. I advised them that they could obtain WFA Carrying a Firearm to the Terror of the Public, and both she and her boyfriend stated they were going to the Magistrate`s Office to obtain same.Officer Wolf was flagged down while leaving the neighborhood of the complainant. The complainant was able to advise that the suspect was at his friends house located at 1430-B Foust St. We went to that address and arrested the suspect without incident. The suspect was taken infront of a Magistrate placed on NO BOND, court date of 6/20/2013. As of 5/11/2013, 1500 Hrs. the complainant has yet went to the Magistrate to draw WFA, Carrying a Firearm to the Terror of the Public.

On this date, Officers were dispatched to 1320-2D Burton Rd. in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  After arriving, it was determined that an assault had occurred and a suspect was located and arrested.

On Friday May 10, 2013 at 2159 hours I responded to 207-C Tyson Ct in reference to a domestic disturbance occurring between Jerrell Albea and Renee Lewis who were in a dating relationship.  After further investigation, it was determined that both parties were victims of an assault after they had assaulted one another.  Both parties were arrested and placed into the Guilford County Jail under a Domestic Hold.

On 05/10/2013 at 2130 hours, I responded to 6320-2B Long Leaf Ct in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Ms. Shannon Justice who advised that her husband, Stephen Martin, assaulted her.  Mr. Martin was arrested and charged with Assault on a Female.

On this date, a northside resident reported the possible poisoning of his girlfriend. Upon police arrival an investigation revealed that the reporting party, is the current boyfriend. The complainant advised that his girlfriend informed him that her past boyfriend may have entered the current boyfriend`s residence, and poisoned a glass of orange juice which she had poured and on the counter. The complainant conveyed that his girlfriend told him that, while home, alone, she went to her vehicle, was at her car for several minutes, then returned to the apartment. The complainant was told by his girlfriend that she locked the apartment door, and when she returned it was still locked. The girlfriend told the complainant she never seen the suspect, and the residence was in the same order as it was when she left.The girlfriend, complainant, and suspect are have interaction on social media sights such as "KIK", "Twitter", and possibly Facebook. In the correspondence between the three, the girlfriend told the complainant that the suspect told her,"I poisoned you".On this date, the complainant transported his girlfriend back to Raleigh, NC., where she will be with her parents. The complainant advised that he transported her between 1000 Hrs- 1100 Hrs. 5/11/2013. The complainant advised that his girlfriend went to a medical facility, and was told that she had been poisoned.  I called the girlfriend and spoke to her about the incident. The information received is part of an ongoing investigation.
On 05/10/2013 at 1535hrs I responded to the above location in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.
On 05/10/2013, at 1535hrs, I responded to the 1400-blk of Furlough Av in reference to a Disturbance call as a result of a Hit & Run Traffic Accident.
On 5/10/2013, at approximately 0715 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I conducted an investigation and arrested Ms. Moore for assault.

On May 9, 2013, at approximately 2130 hours, I responded to 2408 Fala Street in reference to an assault. The reporting person and witness, Tasha Southerland advised that her daughter had been assaulted by her father. The suspect, Edward Westbook, was not on scene.

On May 9, 2013 Communications dispatched Officer Welch and myself to 3044 Sycamore Point Trail in reference to a Domestic Disturbance (which I later reclassified as an DVIP).  The call notes stated the complainant, Keith Rafalko, advised his daughters called him advising that their mother and her boyfriend were engaged in a domestic disturbance.  Mr.  Rafalko advised he could hear both yelling in the background when he was on the phone with his children.  It also stated in the notes that both might be intoxicated. When we arrived Officer Welch spoke with the victim, Garrett Call and the listed witness, Gwen Gregory.  I spoke to the offender, Rachel Rafalko and the children.  Probable cause existed to arrest Rachel Rafalko for DV assault.I gave Mr. Call the HPPD Victim Letter and Information Sheet and the State Victim`s Information sheet.  I also read the DV Victim script to him. Officer Welch transported Rachel Rafalko to the Police Department where she was processed.  I contacted Detective J. Thompson who served the DVIP "C" Letter on Ms. Rafalko. I then transported Ms. Rafalko to the Magistrate`s office where she was charged with Simple Assault and received a domestic hold. I recommend this case be cleared by arrest.

On 05-09-2013, at approximately 1700 hrs, I responded to 505 E Green Dr reference an assault.  Upon arrival, I spoke with the victim who advised she had been assaulted and held against her will by her boyfriend.  Photos were taken of the visible injuries.  Warrants were taken out on the suspect, who was later located hiding in woods, and trying to get people to take him to Georgia.

On 05-08-2013 at 2014 hours, I was notified by the complainant that an active 50-B had been violated by the suspect.  The violation occurred outside my presence.  I informed the complainant to seek a warrant at the Magistrates Office for the violation.    While the complainant was in route to the Magistrates Office a second violation of the 50-B occurred.  The complainant contacted our communications at approximately 2052 hours and notified them that she was being followed by the suspect.  The complainant was a few blocks away from the police department when our Officers were dispatched to assist.  The suspect managed to separate from the complainant before our Officers could render assistance.    The complainant was followed to the Magistrate`s Office by our Officers and assisted with obtaining charges on the suspect.    The suspect was later taken into custody at his residence without incident.  Before the warrant could be served, the suspect had to undergo treatment at High Point Regional Hospital for medical/behavioral health reasons.  The suspect was admitted to High Point Regional`s Behavioral Health Unit for treatment.  He was left in their care and their facility was notified to contact our department upon his release.  This will enable the warrant to be served prior to him returning home.

On 05/08/2013 I responded to 2918-B Archdale Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance at approximately 2:30 pm, on arrival the victim Sandra Hatfield had apparent assault marks on the left side of her face. The victim and a witness both stated the victims daughter had struck her multiple times in the face with a closed fist.The daughter identified as Savannah Auman resides across the street at 2921 Archdale Rd, Auman was arrested, charged with simple assault and taken before the magistrate where she was released on an unsecured $5000 bond.

On 05-08-2013 at 02:49 hours I responded to 1704 Long St. to a domestic disturbance call. Upon my arrival the victim, Tracy Werner, stated that she had been assaulted. After investigation the suspect was taken into custody and charged with assault on a female. There is no further information at this time.

On 05/07/2013 at approximately 2130 hours I responded to 312-2A Ardale Dr. in response to a domestic violence incident.  Upon arrival I spoke with Danielle Garner, the victim, who stated that her boyfriend assaulted her and left prior to police arrival.  Pictures were taken of the victim`s injuries along with a description of the suspect.
On this date I responded to a domestic assault at 805 Central Ct. Through further investigation a WFA was obtained charging Terry Fleming Jr with simple assault.

On May 5, 2013 at approximately 1744 hours, I responded to a domestic disturbance at 1804 Wade Place. Upon arrival, I spoke with Mr. Evan Gainey and a Ms. Nialoni Daniels.  As a result of my on scene investigation, Ms. Daniels was arrested for a domestic related assault.  Ms. Daniels was turned over to the High Point Jail on a domestic hold.

On 5/4/13, at approximately 1402hrs, I responded to a reported domestic disturbance on Ambassador Ct. When I arrived, the victim advised me that a female he had been dating got mad at him and vandalized his vehicle.  Both mirrors had been kicked off and both right side doors had been kicked and dented.

On May 5, 2013, at approximately 0729 hours, I responded to 203 North Hoskins Street in reference to a domestic dispute and possible breaking and entering in progress.Warrants have been obtained at this time for the suspect that was involved.

On Friday, May 3rd, 2013, at 2315 hours, I responded to 512 Richardson Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Laura Askew and Mr. Forrest White who had engaged in a verbal argument, but both parties advised no one had been assaulted.
On Friday May 3, 2013, I spoke with Robert Bacote, who advised this morning when he went outside to his vehicle he noticed the back glass had been broken.

On 5/2/13, at approximately 0604hrs, I responded to Waynick St. regarding a residential burglary in progress.  Upon arriving at the scene, it was determined that ex-boyfriend of the resident had kicked in the front door and bedroom doors in an attempt to get into the residence and assault the resident.  He was arrested without further incident.

On Wednesday May 1, 2013 at 9:44 pm a call was dispatched to 1608 N Hamilton St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival contact was made with the victim Patrick Andre Harris.  Harris had been assaulted by Misha Mae Gayten at the residence earlier in the evening.Gayten was arrested and charged with assault.  At the time of the report Gayten is being held at the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On 05/01/13 at 0308 hours, the victim reported a domestic assault to High Point Police.  The offender fled the scene prior to police arrival.  After an investigation a warrant for arrest was issued charging the listed offender with assault.  At the time of this report, the offender had not been located.  A BOL and 25 mile radius DCI message was issued requesting all units to look for the offender.

On 04/30/2013 at approximately 11:30 am I responded to a reported disturbance at 500 E. Russell St., Housing Authority.  Upon arrival I spoke with John Little.  Mr. Little said he and his fiance had been involved in an altercation earlier that morning.  As a result of my investigation Mr. Little was arrested for assault on a female.

On Monday, April 29, 2013, at 2337 hours, I was dispatched to a vandalism complaint at 100-H Woodbend Court.  I arrived on scene and spoke with the victim, Maggie Hargrave, who advised a former roommate, Joe Franklin, had came by her residence this date and was harassing her advising he was going to damage her property.  The victim stated that when she came out to her vehicle she discovered that the left side of the hood on her car had been dented in.  The victim stated she called police at that time.

On 04-29-2013, at 22:49 hours, I responded to Kivett Drive Grocery in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arriving on scene, Ms. Slaton reported her children`s father, Mr. Lattimore, had assaulted her and made threats to her.  Ms. Slaton had some of her hair extensions pulled out and a scratch across the forehead.   Ms. Slaton refused medical treatment.  Ms. Slaton went to the magistrate and took out a domestic warrant on Mr. Lattimore.  The area of Henley St and Davis Av were checked but Mr. Lattimore could not be located.

On 4-29-2013 at 12:45pm I responded to a call at 2417 Francis St. In reference to a Domestic Disturbance.When I arrived I was advised by Shanice Sumpter that her husband had punched her in the face. Tyshaunski admitted to punching his wife and was arrested.

On 29 April 2013 I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance where the male subject had been cut with a knife by a female.  When I arrived, I came in contact with the victim who stated his wife Maria had cut him with a kitchen knife.  I could see the victim was bleeding from the left side if his face.  Officer Jones stayed with the victim awaiting EMS while Officer Felde and I attempted to make contact with the offender.

ON SUNDAY APRIL 28TH 2013 AT 2324 HOURS I WAS DISPATCHED TO 1304 WORTH ST IN REFERENCE TO AN ASSAULT.UPON MY ARRIVAL I MADE CONTACT WITH THE VICTIM WHO STATED HER DAUGTER ASSAULTED HER BY PUNCHING HER IN THE FACE.  THE VICTIM HAD A BUSTED LIP AND HER LEFT EYE WAS SWOLLEN.

On this date at approximately 0023 hours, Officers were dispatched to the PVA of Walmart located at 2710 N Main St. in reference to a Domestic Disturbance taking place inside a vehicle.  After Officers arrived, the parties involved in the disturbance were located and interviewed.  As a result of the interviews and investigation, Mr. Abdoula Hussien Mebeidin was arrested for Assault on A Female and False Imprisonment.

On 04/27/2013 at about 2326 hours I was dispatched to 406 Vine St in reference to a domestic related assault.  I arrived at the scene and spoke with the complainant, Julia Oleary, who stated that between the above dates and time a known suspect assaulted her by slapping her across the face several times.  Warrants were taken out on the suspect for domestic related assault on a female.

On April 26, 2013 I responded to 634 Wesley Dr in reference to an assault complaint. The complainant reported that she had been assaulted by her boyfriend. She was assisted in obtaining a warrant and an arrest was made.

On 04/26/2013 at 1835 hours I was dispatched to 308 Vail Av in reference to a female being assaulted by her child`s Father. Upon arrival both the Victim and the Suspect were not located. The resident is the Suspect`s Grandmother and she advised that her Grandson had beat his child`s mother and left with the child on foot. She stated that the female drove away in her car.Officer Albertson and I located the Suspect at  1014 S Main St. Officer Albertson stayed at this location and talked with the subject while I went to check the welfare of the Victim. I met the Victim at the hospital and took pictures of her injuries. She had a knot on her right forehead at this time. The Victim stated that the Suspect  was in the passenger seat of her car and was angry with her because she would not let him drive her car. He hit her with an open hand on the right side of her face while she was sitting in the driver`s seat of her car. She stated that he then hit her with a closed fist to the right side of her face an unknown amount of times. The Victim stated that he also kicked her in her right side of her torso. The Grandmother of the Suspect witnessed this and pulled him away from the Victim. At this time the Victim drove away for her safety. The Suspect was taken into custody at this time and processed at the Police Department without incident. He was placed in the Guilford County Jail with a $600 Secure bond. The pictures of the Victim`s injuries were logged into to evidence at the Police Department. No further information at this time.
On 4-26-13 I responded to a report of a suicide attempt that occurred at 2510 2C Bellemeade Street.

On 4/24/13 at about 5:40 PM I responded to 110 E Fairfield for a reported assault. I located the suspect, Joe Prince, behind the store and made contact with him. I asked him if he had an altercation with someone in the last few minutes and he replied that he and his girlfriend had been arguing and she tripped over the curb and fell down. He stated that he did not assault her and that he tried to help her up. He told me that he and Ms. Safriet "had been living together as lovers for about 5 years".I was approached by the victim, Betty Safriet, and two witnesses. The victim stated that Mr. Prince had gone with her to the bank and then he refused to get out of the car when she tried to drop him off at this location. An argument ensued. When she finally convinced him to get out he pushed her down and kicked her before taking his belongings and walking away. The victim stated that she was afraid of the suspect and did not want him near her. She said that she was afraid that he would burn down her house in addition to hurting her.The witnesses, separate and apart from the victim, stated that they saw the incident and corroborated the victims statement. Neither of the victims knew either of the involved parties.Mr. Prince was arrested and charged with Assault on a Female (domestic) based on the two uninvolved witness statements. The victim trespassed him from her residence. He was transported without incident. Victim was provided with Domestic Violence assistance letter and paperwork.
On Wednesday, 04/24/2013, I responded to 404 W Lexington Av in reference to a domestic assault. The suspect fled prior to Police arrival,  however a warrant was issued.

On April 24, 2013 Satender Kaur called the Police to report a Domestic Disturbance with her husband, Jaswinder Kumar.  Officer K. Jarrell located Mr. Kumar on Skeet Club Rd. near Braddock St. enroute to this call.  I stopped and spoke to Mr. Kumar and Officer P. Welch went to the residence to talk with the victim.  Mr. Kumar stated he was going to walk to Deep River Park.  Officer Jarrell and I then went to the residence.Satender Kaur stated her husband pushed her and pulled her hair.  This was confirmed by Mr. Kumar`s own father, Garib Dass, who also resides in the home.  I gave Ms. Kaur the State Victim`s sheet and HPPD Victim`s Letter.  I also spoke to her concerning the 50B protective order process.  She said took one out on him several years ago.It was decided to arrest Mr. Kumar for Assault on a Female.  We searched the park and did not locate him.  I decided to drive down Skeet Club Rd. and located Mr. Kumar walking behind the Harris Teeter located at 1589 Skeet Club Rd.  A Parks and Rec. Officer pulled up while I was talking to Mr. Kumar.  I arrested him without incident.He was processed and placed in the Guilford Co. Jail under a Domestic Hold.I recommend this case be cleared by arrest.

On 04/24/13 at 0814 hours, High Point Police Officers were dispatched to 2700-A Annmoore Circle in reference to a reported domestic violence assault.  Officers on scene located both parties and investigated.  The listed offender was charged with Assault on a Female and logged into the Guilford County Jail on a Domestic Hold.

On 04/23/2013, at 1830 hours, I spoke with Northrop Baxley in reference to a report of a larceny of an iPad.  The incident took place on 04/23/2013 between 1000 and 1300 hours.  It is believed that a family member took the item from a hospital room where the reporting party`s mother was staying at the time.

On 04-22-2013 at 21:51 hours I responded to 603 Habersham Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arriving on scene, contact was made with Mrs. Townes and Mr. Simmons.  Both subjects admitted to damaging property inside the residence.  Mr. Simmons had scratches on his neck from Mrs. Townes scratching him. Mr. Simmons shirt was also torn down the front.  Mrs. Townes admitted to tearing Mr. Simmons shirt and said she may have scratched him.  Mrs. Townes was arrested and charged with assault.

On 05/27/2013, at 1339 hours, I spoke with Courtney Washington in reference to a report of a larceny.  Courtney advised me that on 04/22/2013, a television that she has been renting from Rent-A-Center, was stolen from her property by a former boyfriend.

On Sunday 4/21/13 at approximately 2334 I responded to 2635 Uwharrie Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I made contact with Mr. Avery Thompson (Victim). Mr. Thompson advised that his ex wife Ms. Crystal Graham (Offender) had come to his apartment very intoxicated and was let inside by his daughter.  Ms. Graham broke his living room window and destroyed his television.  Ms. Graham assaulted Mr. Thompson and then left the apartment before Police arrived.  Ms. Graham showed back up before Police left the scene and she was arrested and charged with simple assault and injury to real & personal property.

On this 04/21/2013, I was dispatched to a domestic violence call.  The vehicle involved was traveling down I-74 East bound with two subjects (male and female) assaulting one another.  Contact was made and the male and female were arrested for assault and assault on a female.

On Sunday 4/21/13 at approximately 1458 I responded to 409 Academy St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I made contact with Ms. Emily Morales (Victim) who advised that her and her husband got into a heated argument when she got home from work.  Ms. Morales advised that Mr. Benjamin Williams had pushed, choked, and hit her causing injuries to her face. Ms. Morales advised that she bit Mr. Williams in self defense on the thigh in an attempt to get him off her.  Mr. Williams left the house but was later arrested and charged with assault on a female. Mr. Williams was arrested, processed and interviewed without incident.  Mr. Williams was taken to the Magistrates Office where he was placed in the High Point Jail on a domestic hold.

On 04/21/2013 I responded to a domestic disturbance in progress on S Main St at Fraley Rd at approximately 11:30 am. The female aggressor was arrested and charged with simple assault, placed in the High Point Jail the male was checked for outstanding warrants and released with the two juvenile children.

On 04-20-2013 at 1849 hours, I responded to 377 Northbridge Court in reference to a domestic related assault.  Upon arrival I made contact with Lisa Shelly and Jerry Mcentire who are married and both reside at this address.Lisa Shelly stated that her husband had hit her on the back and after speaking to Jerry Mcentire he told me that he had hit her upside the back of her head.  I charged Mcentire with Assault on a female and he is in the High Point Jail under a domestic hold.

On 05/06/2013 at 15:17 hours I was contacted by Child Protective Services in reference to an assault that already occurred between a father and her daughter.  The case worker from Child Protective Services stated that the father and daughter had an argument about going out to lunch on 04/20/2013 or 04/21/2013.  When the daughter stated that she did not want to go, the father grabbed the daughter`s wrist and attempted to force her into the car.  The daughter sustained a fractured wrist during this incident.

On Friday 4/19/2013 I responded to 416 Macedonia Way in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I spoke with both parties involved. The argument stemmed from text messages on a cell phone. Mr. Copes became upset and threw a CD tower at Mrs. Copes. striking her in the wrist leaving redness and slight swelling of a blood vessel. Mrs. Copes also stated that she was struck by a CD tower in the right thigh but she did not see any injury to her thigh area when she looked. Mr. Copes was arrested for assault on a female and was secured in the High Point Jail on a domestic hold.

On 4-17-13 at approximately 2300 hours I responded to 200 Ardale Dr, room 123, in reference to a disturbance.  Upon arrival I spoke with the victim who stated that his girlfriend punched him in the mouth.

On 04-15-2013 at approximately 2059 hrs I responded to 2013 W Rotary Dr reference a domestic disturbance IP.  Upon arrival I met with the caller/victim who advised they had been struck in the side of the head multiple times.  Victim had bruising and some blood on the left side of the head just behind the ear.  Offender was not on scene, but warrants were sought and received.

Ms. Johnson stated that she was driving home on Hunting Ridge Dr. when she saw a black in color SUV on hunting ridge. She knows this to be a vehicle that her xboyfriend, Mr. Glymph, drives.  She saw the vehicle start down the road towards her.   She attempted to go around and the car swerved towards her.  She then stopped and the vehicle stopped in front of her. She saw that it was her exboyfriend driving.  She backed to get away from him and stuck the brick structure in the yard behind her.  She then went to Skeet Club and Buena Vista to call us.  See the related crash report for further information.

On April 15, 2013, the suspect arrived at the victim`s residence and forced his way inside without permission.  The suspect is known to the victim from a previous relationship, and left before police arrived.

On 04/15/2013 at 0529 hours, I was dispatched to 1906 Treyburn Ln in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with both parties involved Ms. Courtney Lee and Mr. Justin Davis.  Both were arrested for assault as a result of the investigation.

On 04/14/2013 at about 0335 hours I was dispatched to 809-F E Green Dr in reference to an assault.  I arrived on the scene and made contact with the complainant, Ebony Hall, who stated that her boyfriend, Derek Chapman, assaulted her during an argument.  Chapman was arrested on the scene for domestic related assault without incident.

On April 14, 2013, at approximately 0318 hours, I responded to 411 Woodbury Street in reference to a domestic dispute.  Upon arrival, I met with Angela Black.  Ms. Black stated that her boyfriend had kicked her front door in and slapped her cell phone from her hand as she was trying to call 911.  Ms. Black was not injured and warrants were taken out for her boyfriend.

On April 14, 2013 at approximately 0130 hours, I responded to a domestic disturbance call on Montlieu Avenue. Upon arrival, I spoke with the victim who claimed her boyfriend had punched her in the neck. There was a minor injury on her neck. The boyfriend was arrested.

On 4-14-13 at approximately 0049hrs I was dispatched to an assistance call at 807 Carter St.  Upon my arrival I spoke with Ms Maria Hernandez-Torres and determined this was a domestic disturbance with her boyfriend, Edgar Misael Garcia. Ms Hernandez-Torres and Mr Garcia had assaulted each other.  Due to small children being in the home Ms Hernandez-Torres was charged on citation for simple assault.  Mr Garcia was taken into custody for assault on a female and assault by strangulation.

On Saturday 4/13/2013 at approximately 2354 hours I responded to 2501 Hilburn Drive in reference to an assault with a deadly weapon. Upon arrival I spoke with Billy Shipman who took me to his wife Betty Shipman who had just shot her mother. Betty Shipman was arrested and charged with Assault With a Deadly Weapon Inflicting Serious Injury as well as Discharging a Weapon Into Occupied Property. She was confined in the High Point Jail with a $25,000 secured bond.

On April 13, 2013 at approximately 7:25pm, I was dispatched to the High Point Regional Hospital (Emergency Room) in reference to someone assaulting his child at the Emergency Room. Upon arrival, I was notified by Nurse Robert George that Mr. Lawrence Milton assaulted his younger child in the Emergency Room.  I arrested Mr. Milton and transported him to the Magistrate`s Office where he was given $10.000 secured bond. Milton was detained at the High Point Jail with a court date of May 17, 2013.

On this date I was dispatched to 306-B Henley Street in reference to a disturbance.  Upon my arrival, I made contact with Ms. Saunders.  Ms. Saunders advised her boyfriend`s mother and sister arrived at her residence and threw a rock through her window.  The suspects also damaged Saunders back screen door.

On 04/12/2013 at approximately 3:30pm, an assault occurred on Downing St.  As a result of the investigation, Sabrina Saunders was arrested and charged with Assault with a deadly weapon inflicting serious injury.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 04-12-2013 at 1252 hours, I responded to 3760 Windstream Wy., in reference to a domestic related disturbance.  It was determined that one of the individuals involved violated a domestic violence order by texting the plaintiff and making personal contact with him at his residence.    I took the offender into custody at 3760 Windstream Wy., in reference to violating an active domestic violence order.  The order was issued by a Guilford County District Court Judge on 12-10-2012.  The 50B domestic order remains in effect until 12-10-2013.    The offender was charged with domestic violence protective order violation.  She was very polite and cooperative while in my custody.  She was released to the custody of the Guilford County Jail at 1500 hours.

On 04-12-2013, at 10:45am I responded to 1215 Downing St in reference to a domestic disturbance. The reporting party stated she was assaulted by her boyfriend. Both parties struck each other and were arrested for assault.

On Friday, 4/12/13, at approximately 0730 hours, I responded to North Main Street at Skeet Club Road regarding a Domestic Disturbance involving Intimate Partners.  Upon my arrival I met with Codi Roberts who told me that she had been assaulted by her boyfriend, Jonathan Claypoole.  Roberts had visible signs of injury about her face.  Claypoole was located nearby and taken into custody without incident.  Claypoole was charged with Assault on a Female.

On 04/12/2013 at 02:21 hours I responded to 1309 Pershing St in reference to a domestic disturbance that was currently taking place between a father and son.  Upon arrival I found Mr. Scottie Dean Beck was laying on the ground in his kitchen from an apparent assault by his son Mr. Michael Dean Beck.  Mr. Michael Beck also attempted to assault his stepmother before this assault took place, where he had attempted to push her down.  Mr. Michael Beck was charged with assault on female and simple assault and signed himself out on a $1000 unsecured bond.

On April 12, 2013 at approximately 0130 hours, I responded to a domestic disturbance on McGuinn Drive. Upon arrival, I spoke with the victim who stated that her boyfriend had bitten her middle finger and twisted her ankle.  Avery Holland was arrested for Assault on a Female.

On 04-11-2013 I was dispatched to 1621 Larkin St in reference to a domestic disturbance that had just occurred.  When I arrived I spoke to the victim who said the suspect had already left.  The victim stated that her husband had assaulted her. She had visible marks on her neck from where he choked her.  Warrants were taken out and later served on the male.

On April 9, 2013, at approximately 1800 hours, I responded to 311 Kendall Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, I made contact with both victims, Mariah and Kameisha Anderson. Mariah Anderson`s boyfriend, Michael Morrison Jr, had assaulted her and left the scene before officers arrived. He was seen a short time later driving by the scene and was arrested.

On April 9, 2013, I responded to 2310-1B Bellemeade St in reference to an assault complaint. Shanika McDonald reported that her boyfriend assaulted. McDonald obtained warrants for the assault and other charges.

On Tuesday April 9, 2013, at 5:58 am, a call was dispatched to 1023 Montlieu Av in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.Upon arrival Officers made contact with Henry Lee Pemberton on the side porch of the residence.  As a result of the investigation, Pemberton was arrested on three failure to appear warrants.At the time of the report Pemberton is in the Guilford County Jail in High Point.

On 04/15/2013, at 1113 hours, I spoke with Angelisa Orr in reference to a report of a larceny.  Angelisa advised that multiple items belonging to her were stolen by her ex-husband on 04/08/2013.  Angelisa advised that her ex-husband rented a Penske truck, obtained Angelisa`s items and put them in the truck and then left High Point for Philadelphia with her personal items loaded inside.A copy of the documentation that Angelisa brought to the police department has been entered into the property room for this case.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 04/06/2013, at 21:26 hours, I responded to 106-G Briggs Pl in reference to a domestic disturbance that was currently taking place.  Upon arrival I made contact with both parties who stated that they engaged in a verbal argument.  After checking both parties records, I was advised that there was an active 50-B against the male subject.  The male subject was arrested for violation of a 50-B and placed in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On April 7, 2013, at approximately 1728 hours, I responded to 916 Asheboro Street in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, I made contact with the victim, Gwendalyn Cotton. She advised that her live in boyfriend, James Johnson, assaulted her. She had visible injuries to her face. Mr. Johnson was intoxicated and advised he did not remember the incident. He was arrested and transported to the County Building.

On this date, while patrolling this officer`s, Off-Duty location, I was made aware of an assault which had just occurred. A juvenile, on a bicycle, directed me to the victim, who was on the side of the 1230 Building. Upon contact with the victim, it was learned that the victim`s ex-boyfriend, approached her as she left her apartment to go and pick up her child from daycare. The suspect became angry when the victim refused to communicate with him. He began striking her about her head, pulling her hair, then throwing her to the ground. At a point he stopped the assault, entered his vehicle and fled the area. I circulated the area and was unable to locate him. I obtained WFA, Assault on a Female on Mr. Allred.

On 04/06/2013 at 03:56 hours I responded to 207 Griclar St in reference to a domestic disturbance that was currently taking place.  Upon arrival I made contact with Miss Griffin who said her ex-boyrfriend had started a fight at her residence with another male that was staying with her at the time. Miss Griffin and the other male on the scene Mr. Spencer were not forthcoming with information and the suspect, who is known, fled the scene prior to our arrival.
The victim reported that she was assaulted by her ex-boyfriend`s new girlfriend and her nose was broken.

On April 5, 2013, I was dispatched to 1505 Sadler Ct in reference to a domestic disturbance that had occurred. Upon arrival, I spoke to Mrs. Jackson who stated she came home and her children were outside riding their bicycles. She advised she had physical altercation with her husband. Upon talking to Mr. Jackson and son, I was informed that Mrs. Jackson was the one assaulting Mr. Jackson. Mrs. Jackson was arrested and she was taken to the police department for processing.  Mrs. Jackson was confined at the High Point Jail under domestic hold.

On 04/06/2013 at 1900 hrs, Officers made contact with the victim who had been physically assaulted by the father of her unborn baby. The assault took place on the corner of Eastchester and N.Cennetenial on the PVA of the Smile Mart.  Warrants  were  obtained for the suspect for Assault on a Female,Domestic Violence Order Violation and Battery to an unborn child.

On 4-5-2013 at 9:17am I responded to the 2100 block of Johnson St. in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.Upon arriving at the above location I made contact with the victim who advised she and the suspect were involved in domestic dispute.She stated that when she attempted to leave the scene the suspect grabbed her by the arm, and pulled her away from a vehicle she was trying to enter, causing laceration to her lower lip.

On April 5, 2013 I responded to 2717-A Central Ave in reference to a domestic disturbance call.  Upon arrival, I met with Angela Herndon (Victim).  Jason Herndon (Offender) communicated threats to Ms. Herndon.  Mr. Herndon was arrested and put on a domestic hold at the High Point jail.

On April 4, 2013 at approximately 0300 hours, I responded to a domestic disturbance call on Aileen Court. Upon arrival, I spoke with the complainant who stated that her boyfriend had grabbed her neck and scratched her neck and chest. The boyfriend was arrested.

On 04/03/2013, at 23:45 hours, I responded to 303 Oakwood St Apt A1 in reference to a residential burglary that already occurred.  Upon arrival I met with the victim, who stated the suspect was previously banned from this location and broke the side window and attempted to gain entry to the residence. This incident stemmed from a domestic disturbance in which the suspect was banned from the residence at an earlier time. The subject returned to the residence later on and damaged more property before he was located and arrested for 1st Degree Burglary and Injury to Real Property.

On 04/03/2013, at approximately 0840 hours, I responded to 1418-D E Commerce Av for a reported domestic violence incident between intimate partners.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Ms. Concetta Rainey, the victim, who stated that he ex-boyfriend, Mr. John Baker Jr., had forced his way into her apartment then left with his mother.  A warrant was issued for Breaking or Entering, and a BOL given referencing Mr. Baker`s active assault on a female charge and this current incident.
A female was sexually assaulted by a male.

On March 31, 2013 Kayla Kruger W-F-19, called Communications reporting that her brother, Kyle Kruger W-M-24, had assaulted her. The call notes also stated that her brother was intoxicated.I arrived first and the complainant`s father, Kurt Kruger, met me at the front door.  He stated everything was fine now and that Kayla`s brother, Kyle, left out the back door prior to our arrival.  I could see he had an injury on his right foot because he was bleeding through his sock.  He said Kyle had been watching the NCAA basketball games and drinking for most of the day.  The victim, Kayla Kruger, was visibly upset and crying.  The incident started when they were upstairs in her bedroom with her boyfriend.  Kurt became loud and started verbally arguing with her.  Then downstairs he slapped her on the head very hard.  She told him she was going to call the Police and he ripped her cell phone out of her hand and then somehow hit her in the chin with the cell phone after he grabbed it away from her.  Kayla had a small red place on her chin and a small cut inside her lip where the assault caused her teeth to cut the inside of her bottom lip.  Kayla said Kyle chased her around the house after the assault and she did finally push him to try to get him to stop.  Mr. Kruger stated he tried to intervene and stop Kyle and that was how he was injured.  He took his sock off and had an injury to the second toe on his right foot.  He also had a few abrasions to his left elbow and forearm.  He did say that Kyle pushed him, but did not assault him causing his visible injuries.I explained the HPPD Domestic Violence policy to Mr. Kruger and Kayla.  Mr. Kruger said Kyle would return later calm as he always does after outbursts.  He said he would probably just go to bed. I advised him to call me when I come in on Monday night so that I can arrest Kyle.I took photographs of Kayla and Kurt Kruger`s injuries.   Lab Technician, Danielle Parrott, downloaded the photographs onto the computer.Since this was a Domestic Disturbance (but not a DV IP) involving persons with a personal relationship (adult siblings) and live in the same household, I went to the Magistrate`s office and obtained a warrant on Kyle Kruger for Assault on a Female.I will clear this case when Kyle Kruger is arrested.  It can be assigned to me.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: Mr Betancourt was the driver of a vehicle stopped for a traffic violation.  Mr Betancourt had a 50B against him from a person who was also in the vehicle.  Mr Betancourt was placed under arrest and taken to the county building.  Mr Betancourt was given a domestic hold and placed in the Guilford County Jail.

On 3/30/2013, at approximately 2330 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding a disturbance. Upon my arrival I conducted an investigation and arrested xxxx for assault.
On March 30, 2013 at 2000 hours I responded to 4835 Wendover Avenue reference to an assault.
On 03/29/2013 I responded to 1307 E Green in reference to a domestic dispute. A criminal summons was issued for David Eugene Brown for assault on a female.

On 29 Mar 2013 I was dispatched to 1415 Elgin Av in reference to a domestic disturbance between a husband and wife.  When I arrived, I found the victim sitting outside in her vehicle crying.  I noticed she was also holding her 1 year old child on her lap.  The victim had redness on her face where she stated her husband slapped her.

The resident in apartment 3F reported hearing a male yelling loudly and feeling the walls shake.I learned that Ronnie Johnson was visiting the resident of the apartment, Kimberly Smith, when Smith`s boyfriend came to the apartment and assaulted both Smith and Ronnie Johnson after finding them together.  Smith received minor injuries to her face near her right eye and Johnson had a lump behind his left ear.  Smith and Johnson declined medical attention.The suspect had left prior to my arrival.  I obtained a warrant for arrest for assault on a female on the suspect.
I was dispatched to a domestic violence call involving a father and daughter.  The daughter reportedly had taken medication and was trying to harm herself.

Contact was made with Barnes where she was arrested on scene for simple assault.

On 06/10/2013 I took out warrants on Nyrobi Good reference to violating his 50B order.  The warrants have not been served at this time due to Mr. Good being in custody of DOC.

On Thursday 3/28/13 at approximately 0438 hours we responded to 808 Forrest St in reference to a Domestic Disturbance. Upon arrival we made contact with Ms. Latasha Nixon and Mr. Casey Edwards. Mr. Edwards had a bite mark on his thigh and a laceration on his ankle as a result of the assault. Ms. Nixon was arrested for simple assault and simple possession of a schedule VI.

On 03/28/2013, at 0119hours, officers responded to 204 Durand Av in reference to a domestic disturbance. Vuncannon stated that she and Simrel got into an argument that then led to Simrel assaulting her.

I could see that she had two black eyes and a small cut on her nose.Joseph Armstrong of 300-B Phillips Avenue advised that he allowed her to stay last night due to her stumbling severely from being drunk. On 03/14/2013 at 1302hours I was dispatched to 202-B in reference to a Breaking and Entering and an Assault on a Female. Upon arrival the suspect had already left the scene. The female stated that the Father of her child had came over and they were talking through the window about what he wanted because she did not want to let him inside of her apartment. The victim stated that he kicked in her door pushed her on the couch and hit her in the head with his fist. The victim was showing a knot on the left side of her forehead. The victim stated that they have a child together but they have no involvement or relationship between them. She stated that he has never lived at this apartment with her. She stated that he had left some shoes and clothes inside of her car from an earlier date that he wanted to get. The suspect got her keys and went out to her car and got his items and left the residence. She stated that she had to be at work at 1400 hours and that she would go take out warrants on the subject before work or on her break at 1600 hours. The victim stated that she did not need to receive medical treatment at this time. Photos were taken of the damage to the door and the injury to her forehead. No further information at this time.
On the listed date/time, the suspect entered the residence by breaking through a locked door.  Once inside, the suspect took the victim`s listed cellphone from her hand and left the area.
