Taylor was arrested and taken before magistrate Brannon where he was placed on a domestic hold.  Taylor was then booked into the Guilford County jail.

On 03-02-2012, at around 6:50 pm, I responded to 2321 Purdy Avenue, in reference to a domestic disturbance. Up my arrival I met with the reporting party, Mrs Aisha Pittman. Mrs Pittman advised that she got into an argument with her boyfriend, Mr Jerry Lufudu. Mrs Pittman stated that because of the argument, Mr Lufudu vandalized the above listed items on this date and time.

On 3-2-13 at 1705 hours, I was dispatched to 601-H Grayson St in reference to a domestic assault.  When I arrived, I spoke to Krystal Payne about the incident.  She advised that she and Daniel Dawkins, her boy friend, had an argument.  The argument turned physical and he punched her in the face twice.  She was transported by Guilford County EMS to High Point Regional Hospital for further evaluation due to being four months pregnant.  There is no further information available at this time.

On March 1, 2013, while enroute to assembly at the Police Dept., I heard a call dispatched to Officers B. Tennant and K. Jarrell.  I clicked enroute by mobile so that I could handle the call and let the third shift officers go home.The CAD notes (paraphrased) stated:Meet with complainant in ref. to vandalism to his vehicle...just occurred...ex girl-friend keyed his vehicle...she is still at the scene.  Female is intoxicated.  She is in a cab, but complainant is not letting the cab leave.I arrived on scene first and the complainant, Callan Jennings, was standing in the parking lot.  The suspect, Angela Harper, was seated in the front passenger seat of a Bluebird van.  Mr. Jennings stated he and Ms. Harper dated for about a year and broke up in January of 2013.  Ms. Harper beat on his apartment door the first time around 0520 hours.  He opened the door and told her to leave.  Ms. Harper was intoxicated.  She came back the second time around 0530 hours and started beating on his door again.  He opened the door and this time told her he was calling the Police.  Mr. Jennings watched Ms. Harper from his balcony window which faces the parking lot where the cab and his vehicle were parked.  He said she fumbled through her pocketbook and obtained what he thought were keys.  He watched her walk over to the right passenger side of his vehicle and "key" his vehicle.  He then came outside and told the cab driver not to leave since he had called the Police.I spoke to Angela Harper while she was seated in the cab.  She was intoxicated. She admitted she knocked on his door twice.  She and Mr. Jennings dated for a year and broke up in November of 2012.  She denied damaging Mr. Jennings` vehicle.  Much later during our conversation, she stated Mr. Jennings pushed her on the deck (stairway landing) and she fell.  She did not mention having any injuries.  I asked her why did she come over to Mr. Jennings`s apartment intoxicated, and she said because she loves him.  I explained to her that she just needed to tell the truth about the damage so that I could make a decision about arresting her or giving her a citation.  (I said this to see if she would tell the truth.) She got loud and started cursing Mr. Jennings at one point.  I spoke with the Bluebird cab driver, Abuljahfeel Altholaya.  He stated he drove her to the apartment building and she exited and then came back crying.  They had not left the complex when she told him to go back to the same building.  I asked him if he witnessed Ms. Harper damage the vehicle, and he said no because he was tired and lying back in the driver`s seat.I then asked Mr. Jennings if he pushed Ms. Harper.  Mr. Jennings denied touching her in any way. I advised him if she comes back, not to open the door, but just to call the Police.  I also advised him about obtaining a 50B order.  Officer B. Tennant gave Mr. Jennings the DV victim letter and information sheet.  I also had Mr. Jennings advise Ms. Harper not to come back to his apartment. Mr. Jennings took photographs of the damage to his vehicle and will have them for court.Officer Jarrell checked to see if Ms. Harper was wanted and she was not.  Officer Jarrell spoke to Ms. Harper who was still seated in the cab.  She told him that she wanted to report an assault and then stated that was why she "keyed" Mr. Jennings` vehicle.  He asked her if she had any injuries and she said no.  Ms. Harper started yelling that she needed to go to the bathroom.  I gave Ms. Harper a citation for Injury to Personal Property since I had not witnessed the vandalism and this was not a Domestic Violence offense in which I could make a warrantless arrest.  I then directed the cab driver to leave with Ms. Harper.I recommend this case be cleared by arrest.  I completed an arrest report.

On this date, I responded to 218-A Brentwood Street in reference to a vandalism that had already occurred.  Upon my arrival, I made contact with the victim, Ms. Mclendon.  Mclendon advised that her vehicle had been vandalized.
On 2-27-13, I responded in reference to a report of vandalism that occurred at 610 Grand Street.

On Tuesday, February 26th, 2013, I responded to 4403 Garden Club Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I spoke with an individual who stated that an argument had occurred that culminated in one person being assaulted.

On Tuesday February 26, 2013 at approximately 1115 hours, I was dispatched to 907 Enterprise Drive in reference to a domestic disturbance.Upon arrival I spoke to the victim who advised he had been assaulted by his wife.  The victim had marks on his arms.  I arrested the suspect and placed her in jail under a domestic hold.

On 02-25-13 at 1956 hours I responded to 818 Fairview St. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I encountered a large affray between approximately twenty people inside of 818 Fairview St.  Through further investigation the offender was arrested for assaulting the victim.  The two are in a domestic relationship.
On 02-25-2013 at approximately 1411 hours I responded to 1508-A Wendell Av in reference to a domestic disturbance. The offender had already fled the scene upon my arrival.

On 02/26/2013, at 1120 hours, I spoke with Chris Giannopoulos in reference to a report of a larceny from a safe at his residence.  Chris advised that the possible suspect was his girlfriend who stole the items on 02/25/2013 while Chris was out of his residence.  In total, $3000.00 worth of items were stolen from the residence.

On 02-24-2013 at 8:55am, I responded to a domestic assault at 405 Aberdeen Rd. When I arrived I spoke with Bennett who stated Taylor  (her boyfriend) had assaulted her earlier that morning. On 2-23-13 at approximately 1747hrs I responded to 921 Randolph St in reference to a domestic disturbance IP.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the caller who advised that his girlfriend had poured bleach on him and his clothes.

On Saturday, March 23rd, 2013, at 1144 hours, I responded to 2306 East Lexington Avenue in reference to harassing phone calls that were in violation of a 50B domestic violence protection order.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Kera Jeffries who advised her ex-boyfriend, Mr. Noah Smith, had been calling her continuously since the previous night which is in violation of the 50B Domestic Violence Protection Order issued.

On 02/22/2013 at 20:38 hours I responded to the emergency room at High Point Regional Hospital in reference to an assault with a deadly weapon that already occurred. Wannetta Ijames followed Natrae Walker from Cookout on N Main St until she pulled her vehicle over at 156 W Parris Av. Ijames proceeded to hit Walker with a metal baseball bat, after being struck Walker stabbed Ijames multiple times. Ijames was arrested for assault with a deadly weapon with intent to kill and Walker was arrested for assault with a deadly weapon inflicting serious injury.
On 02/22/2013 at 0510hrs I responded to the above location in reference to checking the welfare of a minor.
On Thursday, February 21st, 2013, at 2216 hours, I responded to 3244 Loftyview Drive in reference to a domestic disturbance.
On 02/21/2013, at 2054hrs, I responded to the 400-blk of Hay St in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  Both subjects were arrested and taken to the Guilford County Jail.

On this date, police were dispatched to an assault on a female, which just occurred. The caller advised communications that her boyfriend had assaulted her and that her arm was bleeding. Upon our arrival, we were met in the parking lot by the boyfriend. He advised that his girlfriend has many medical issues, and has been drinking. He advised that she would more then likely make an accusation that he assaulted her. I went in and spoke to her, as Officer Needham spoke to the male outside.The victim immediately showed me her left arm which had a open wound. She advised the suspect threw her to the ground, next to the bed, when she stated, "I`m calling the police". The victim admitted to drinking one beer, and was very coherent as I spoke to her. I asked her if she would be willing to travel with me to the Magistrate`s Office and swear out a warrant. She advised she was too sick to do that. She seemed healthy enough to me to accompany me to the county building, however I am not aware of the affects of Lupas. I advised her, that on her accusation, I was going to arrest Mr. Richardson, and the physical sign of assault. She asked if I could wait till tomorrow, after he is paid? I advised that was not an option.The suspect was brought back into the residence, and he was advised he was under arrest. The victim adamantly contested police arresting the Suspect, and told him she did not want him arrested. It is my opinion that both the suspect and Victim are financially dependent on one another, and they will not discontinue their relationship, even after the suspect goes to jail.The victim was provided a victim`s rights form, along with information to contact support groups associated in assisting in domestic violence issues.

On February 21, 2013 at approximately 0826 hours, I responded to 1600 Guyer Street in reference to a domestic violence.One person was charged by citation. The second person involved was arrested and placed in Guilford County Jail.

On Thursday February 21, 2013 at 2:56 am a call was dispatched to 837 Howard Place in reference to a domestic assault.Upon arrival contact was made with the victim Ms. Christi Ranson.  Ranson stated that her boyfriend Michael Steven Williams had assaulted her.Ranson was able to obtain assault warrants on Willams which were served at the residence.At the time of the report Williams is in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On 02-20-2013 at 0057 hours, I responded to 608 Westwood Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with the victim who stated that her boyfriend had damaged her property and assaulted her.  Warrants were drawn on the suspect and he was later arrested.

On this date, police began receiving reports of a mobile domestic disturbance. The witness`s advised that a silver vehicle with a white male, and female were traveling on the westside of our city, engaged in a violent domestic disturbance. The vehicle was described and the tag displayed on the vehicle was given. The vehicle and occupants were located at the intersection of N Centennial st and Eastchester Dr. The occupants were still involved in a disturbance.When I approached the car, it was stopped in traffic. I spoke to the driver, and immediately discovered that he  was a victim of being assaulted by the female passenger. The female had slapped and cut the victim`s face with a finger nail. The victim advised that she was striking him, and trying to remove the vehicle keys why they were mobile. The female was placed in custody for Domestic Assault. The victim/driver initially gave a fictitious name, and this was realized a short time later, when an officer familiar with the victim, arrived on scene. The victim/driver was arrested for operating a vehicle while his license was revoked. The vehicle was towed from the scene.The victim/driver was released on a written promise to appear, by the Magistrate. The suspect was placed in the custody of the Guilford County jail, on no bond, for the Domestic Assault.
On 2-18-13 I responded to 601 N. Elm St. in reference to an assault with a deadly weapon.

On this date, officers were dispatched to a southside residence reference to an assault on a female, which just occurred. Upon police arrival an investigation revealed that the assault victim had a verbal altercation with her boyfriend, of one month. The altercation escalated to a physical assault. The suspect pushed the females head against the wall, she then fell to the ground, and she advised, he stomped her in the face with his foot. The victim had a visible abrasion to her forehead, with the beginning of a lump forming. She also had a cut to her right side lip, which was visible.The suspect was identified, and police obtained WFA Assault on a Female, for the suspect.
Elizabeth Thomas called the Police in reference to a problem with a juvenile.  See Officer Narrative and Officer R. Juren`s supplemental report for more details.

On the 18th day of February, 2013 at approximately 1430 hours, I responded to 2113 Wingate Pl in reference to a domestic disturbance call involving intimate partners.Upon arriving, I made contact with the caller who led me inside of his residence and his wife was lying on the floor. Female was unresponsive and transported to the hospital.Suspect was arrested.
On 02-17-2013 at 5:08am I responded to in reference to a domestic disturbance. The reporting party stated she got into a physical argument with her boyfriend.

On 02/17/2013 at approximately 0025 hours I responded to 1012 Meredith St. in reference to a domestic violence call.  Upon arrival I spoke with the couple in question.  The male was arrested for assaulting a female.  Photos of injuries were taken and will be entered into evidence.

On February 15, 2013, I was dispatched to 602 Chandler Avenue for a disturbance.Upon arrival, I made contact with Joel Jollie, who reported that he got into a verbal argument with his girlfriend and their friends that were over drinking.  As a result of the argument, Jolly pointed a loaded .410 single shot shotgun at his girlfriend.  The two mutual friends corroborated this and I arrested Jollie for assault by pointing a gun (domestic case).Jollie was jailed under a domestic hold.

On 02-12-2013 around 1841 hours I responded to 509 Gordon Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Calvin York was arrested on scene and charged with 1st Degree Burglary and Assault by Strangulation.  This case is closed/cleared by arrest.
On February 12, 2013, at approximately 1455 hours, I responded to the 500 block of Rolling Green Road in reference to a domestic disturbance that was occurring.

On Wednesday, November 26th, 2013, I responded to the Police Department in reference to an individual requesting assistance regarding a domestic situation.  Upon my arrival I met with and spoke to an individual who spoke to me about several matters.  During our conversation, I was advised by that individual that he/she had been assaulted earlier during the year.  Information regarding that assault advised that a possible assault by strangulation had occurred.

On 02/10/2013 I responded to 610 E Kearns Av in reference to an assault. The victim had been struck in the head with a large ceremic pot and had lost quite a bit of blood. The listed suspect fled the area prior to my arrival.

On 02-10-2013, at around 2:30 pm, I responded to 610 Grand Street in reference to a vandalism. Upon my arrival I met with the victim, Mrs Renetta Campbell. Mrs Campbell advised that on the above listed dates and times, the suspect came to her house, broke out her front window with his foot, then left the residence in his vehicle.

On 02-09-2013 at 04:25 hours I responded to 309-A Henley in reference to a domestic dispute.  Upon arriving on scene I made contact with Diamond Murray.  Ms. Murray reported her baby`s daddy, Mr. Denorris Leak had punched her in the face with his fist.  Mr. Leak had left the residence prior to my arrival.  Ms. Murray refused EMS.

On 02/07/2013 at 9:47a.m. at 648 Wesley Dr. Carol Ford and Anthony Jordan were involved in a domestic dispute which turned physical. Jordan was charged with assault on a female and Ford was charged with assault with a deadly weapon.
On 02/06/2013 I was informed by Mrs. Gilyard, the assistant principal, about an assault that occurred on Bus# 1320.  An arrest was made.
On 02/05/2013, at 2011hrs, I responded to the High Point Police Department to speak with a subject regarding a Domestic Disturbance.
Subjects were in an argument after a court hearing and called the police to mediate.   One subject claimed to be assaulted but no evidence of an assault was observed.

offense: ALL OTHER SHOOTING (NO CHANCE OF INJURY) INTO OCCUPIED PROP
body: On 2/3/2013, at approximately 1830 hours, I was dispatched a call about a 50B violation. After an investigation, Mr. Smith and Ms. Edwards were arrested.
The suspect was allowed to drive a rental car that was rented by the victim.  The victim stated the subject refused to give her the keys back.  She was advised on how to seek prosecution.

On 02/04/2013 at 1522 hours, I spoke with Malaica Crawford in reference to a report of a vandalism.  Malaica advised that sometime between 2000 hours on 02/03/2013 and 1100 hours on 02/04/2013, someone opened her gas cap and poured sugar into her gas tank damaging the vehicle.  At the time of the incident the vehicle was located outside in the parking area of her residence, secured and locked.  The incident was discovered after Malaica drove the vehicle to GTCC on S.Main Street and noticed that her vehicle was not driving as usual.

On February 3, 2013 Police responded to a call at 303 Henley St in reference to a domestic disturbance. upon arrival police made contact with both a man and a woman. An on scene investigation was conducted.  Two arrests were made based on statements by both people at the scene and observable injuries.   No EMS was required.

On Saturday February 2, 2013 at 2318 hours I was dispatched to 601 N Elm St (HP Regional Hospital) reference a domestic assault that occurred at 106-F Thomas St.  I met with the victim, Corina Alvarez-Hernandez who stated that her boyfriend/childs father, Jose Luis Sanchez Rodriguez assaulted her while inside their residence.  Ms. Alvarez-Hernandez was getting checked out by hospital personnel due to being pregnant at the time of assault.  Ms. Alvarez-Hernandez had minor visible injuries around her lower neck related the assault.  I swore out warrants on Mr. Rodriguez and later arrested him for Assault on a Female where he was issued a 48 hour domestic hold by Magistrate Brannon.
On 02/02/13 at approximately 0734hrs, I responded to a reported domestic disturbance.
On this date I responded in reference to a domestic assault. During the investigation Michael Williams was arrested for assault on a female.

On February 2, 2013 at 0042 hours, I responded to a call at 1000 S Main Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I found the Victim and Offender standing on the sidewalk talking to each other.  The Victim advised that she was struck with a closed fist to her face by the Offender.  The Victim did not require first aid.  The Offender was taken into custody.

The victim, Tyler Wright, reported that at approximately 1830 hours on 2/1/2013, he and his wife xxxx got into a verbal argument over her refusing to go to work and that he wanted their relationship to end.  She attempted to damage his Xbox by throwing it on the floor and then at him, as well as physically hitting him with her hands.  The victim captured the assault on video and the suspect, xxxx, was subsequently arrested of Simple Assault and placed into the Guilford County Jail in High Point under a Domestic Hold.  Children were present for the incident and DSS was notified of the incident by telephone.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 02/02/03, at approximately 1100hrs, I responded to a reported domestic disturbance that was related to the unathorized use of a motor vehicle.

On 01/31/2013 at around 1:00 pm, I responded to 3136 E Kivett Drive, Food Lion, in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I made contact with  both parties involved, Miss Courtney Steele and Miss Heather Woodford. Miss Steele and Miss Woodford got into an argument and Miss Woodford was assaulted by Miss Steele during the argument.Miss Steele was arrested on site for assault. Miss Steel was transported to the Police Department where she was processed. Miss Steele was then transported to the Magistrates office where she was served and released.

On 01/30/2013 at about 2228 hours I was dispatched to 1811 Blain St in reference to a domestic violence issue.  I arrived on the scene and spoke with the complainant, Ashley Barnes, who stated that between the above dates and times a known suspect has been stalking her.

On Wednesday, January 30, 2013 at 0037, I responded to 2628 S Main St (Wal-Mart) in reference to a suicide call.  Upon arrival, I found the Victim already handcuffed and secured by another Officer.  EMS provided necessary care to victim and myself and another Officer escorted the victim to the hospital for further evaluation.  No further information.

On Wednesday, 01/30/2013, at approximately 0028 hours I responded to 2700 S Main Street at Murphy`s Express to speak with a witness about a Domestic Assault that had occurred earlier at Tiki`s Caberet located at 2315 S Main Street. Upon arrival at the scene I made contact with the witness to the crime, Mr. Andy Rodriguez, who advised me that his brother Jose had assaulted his girlfriend, Tiffany Wise, while at Tiki`s Caberet. While speaking with Mr. Andy Rodriguez Officers located Mr. Jose Rodriguez and his girlfriend Miss Tiffany Wise at Wal Mart at 2628 S Main Street. Both subjects had to be transported to the ER for injuries sustained during the incident. Mr. Jose Rodriguez has active warrants for Assault on a Female, Assault by Strangulation, and Assault with a Deadly Weapon Inflicting Serious Injury.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 01-29-13, at 2135 hours, I responded to 206 Old Winston Road in reference to a male and female fighting somewhere in the trailer park.No one was found outside, but contact was made with Russell Farris and Tangelina Toler in trailer 3.  Both stated that they were not involved in a fight and neither had any apparent injuries.  Both stated that it was another couple that was fighting  outside of the trailer and had left.It was later learned that Toler had a 50b order against Farris and Farris was arrested for violating the 50b around 2230 hours at 117 Welch Drive while investigating another fight call.  The 50b is valid until 09-17-2013.Farris has been placed in the High Point Jail under a domestic hold and a 48 hour contempt of court order.

On 01/28/2013 at 2319 hours I was dispatched to 905 W Green Dr Apt B in reference to a Domestic Disturbance between Intimate Partners. Upon arrival the victims were scared and upset due to the father of an unborn child was threatening and beating on the door trying to gain access inside of the apartment where the mother was located. The Offender was seen at the door by a victim with a handgun threatening them.The Offender was not at the scene at the time of arrival and the victims were not harmed. The Offender did not gain access into the apartment and they did not let him in because they feared for their safety. The victims were transported to a safe location until the offender could be located. The Reporting Party/Victim took out warrants on the Offender for Communicating Threats and two counts of Assault with a Deadly Weapon. The Offender was located at 907 Mill Av and was held in the Guilford County Jail under a Domestic Hold. No further information at this time.

On 01/27/2013 at 0044 hours I was dispatched to 505 E Green Dr at the Magistrate`s Office in reference to a Domestic Disturbance. Upon arrival I spoke with the Victim and Offender about the altercation that took place in her car at approximatley 0030 hours.  A warrant was issued for the male subject who was the offender. He was arrested, processed, and placed in the Guilford County Jail on a Domestic Hold. The Victim was given Domestic Violence information sheets. There is no further information at this time.
On 1/26/2013, at approximately 2204 hours, a call come out regarding unknown trouble. Upon my arrival Mr. Waden was arrested for assault among other charges.

On this date, Officers responded to 1010 Tabor St. in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  After arriving on scene and interviewing both parties, Ms. Moore was arrested and charged with Domestic Assault.

On 1-25-2013 I responded to the intersection of South Elm Street and Greer Ave. in reference to a robbery.  Upon arrival I spoke with Gary Young Jr. who advised two unknown subjects took money from him at gunpoint.

On 01/25/13, Officers were dispatched to a vandalism at the intersection of Norwood/N Centennial.  Upon the Officer arriving, he observed the driver side headlight lens broken and the front windshield was shattered.  The victim stated that the suspect was a person they know.  The victim responded to the magistrates office and obtained a warrant.

On January 24, 2013 at approximately 2137 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance call on Furlough Avenue.  When I arrived on scene I made contact with the caller.  She stated that her boyfriend pushed her around and would not let her leave.  The residence was cleared and her boyfriend was not located on the property.  He was located a short distance away walking down the street.

On January 22, 2013, at approximately 2313 hours, I was dispatched to domestic disturbance call on Pershing Avenue.  When I arrived, the reporting party stated that her ex boyfriend gained access to her residence and assaulted her father.

On 01/22/2012 at 2105 hours I responded to 506-A E Fairfield Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival, I spoke with the victim, who advised me that she had been in a physical fight with her sister and her mother. Further investigation revealed that the victim was pregnant and had been assaulted by both her mother and younger sister.
On January 19, 2012 at approximately 1753 hours, I responded to the 300 block of South Scientific Street in reference to a domestic assault that had already occurred.

On 01/19/2013 at 1735 hours, I responded to 301 Skeet Club Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Mr. Chad Rice who was assaulted by his wife, Mrs. Lenins-Rice.  She was arrested and charged with Simple Assault.
On Saturday January 19, 2013 I responded to the Police Department in reference to a subject wanting to report an assault that occurred earlier in the day.
On 1/29/13, Andre Fountain was charged with Habitual Misdemeanor Assault .
On 1/19/2013, at approximately 0001 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I conducted an investigation and made 2 arrests for assault.

On January 18, 2013, I responded to 2431-A Francis St in reference to a domestic assault complaint. Upon investigation, it was determined both parties engaged in a mutual affray, both were arrest for domestic assault.

On this date, police were dispatched to an assault on a female on the west side of the city. Upon police arrival an investigation revealed the victim, a white female, had been assaulted by a white male subject. It was learned that both the victim and suspect live together and are boyfriend and girlfriend. The female stated she is aware that the suspect has assaulted other females in the past, however had not assaulted her till this date. The victim had signs of assault about her face, and neck area.The victim stated the male held her down, placing his hands around her neck, and choked her till, according to her, she about lost consciousness. She had bruising on her neck consistent with being choked. Her forehead was bruised, and her eye and lip also had injury. All her injuries were photographed by the police department`s lab unit.A Felony Warrant for Arrest was obtained for the suspect for Assault by Strangulation.

On January 17, 2013 I was dispatched to 2300-L Shadow Valley Rd. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I contacted the victim, Johneisha Strickland, who advised that her boyfriend, Jassmen Johnson, assaulted her.

On January 16, 2013 at approximately 0431 hours, I was dispatched to a assault call on Granby Avenue.  When I arrived on scene, the victim stated that she got into a physical altercation with her live in boyfriend.  She stated that her boyfriend ran out of the residence prior to my arrival and took her house key, id/debit card and laptop.  Other officers attempted to locate the boyfriend but were unsuccessful.

On Monday, 1/14/13, at approximately 1015 hours, I responded to 710 Old Winston Road regarding a Domestic Disturbance involving Intimate Partners.  Upon my arrival I met with Sheree Good who told me her husband Nyrobi Good assaulted her and took some of her personal items.  Nyrobi Good had fled the scene prior to my arrival.  I obtained a Warrant for Arrest for Assault on a Female, Misdemeanor Larceny, and Injury to Real Property.

On this date, I responded to the 100 block of Avondale St. on a report of a couple involved in a disturbance. Upon arriving, I spoke to the victim and she advised she had been assaulted by the male at her home.  He denied assaulting her. I arrested him after I observed scratches on her arms.
On 01-12-2013 around 2300 hours I responded to 1717-B Leonard Avenue in reference to a possible domestic disturbance.

On 01/12/2013 at 2224 hours I responded to 231 Northpoint Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I observed Jessica Witcher flagging me down and advising that her mother had been assaulted and was inside the apartment.

On Saturday, January 12th, 2013, I responded to 4401 Essex Place in reference to an assault that had recently occurred.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the victim who stated that she had been assaulted by an individual and had shown me visible injuries.
On Saturday, 01/12/2013, I responded to 314 Hobson St in reference to an assault.
On 1-11-13 I responded in reference to a report of a domestic disturbance at 219 Baker Road.
On 01/11/2013 at 0800hrs I responded to the above address in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.
On 1-10-13 I responded in reference to a report of an assault at 904 Hickory Chapel Road.

On 01-08-2013 at approximately 11:24pm I was dispatched to 1011 N Main St Apt A1 in reference to a domestic disturbance. When I arrived the male subject had already left on foot. The female advised they were in an argument and she told him to leave.  There was a domestic protection order against the male subject and he was arrested a block from the residence.

On 01-08-2013 at 2338 hours, I responded to 800 W Kivett Dr in reference to harassment.  I met with Carlos Mendoza, who stated that he was arrested on 01-04-2013 for assaulting Tabitha Troutman.  She also took out a 50-B protection order against him.  Now he said that she is harassing him by calling and riding by and blowing the car horn.  Mr Mendoza does not have caller ID on his phone so he does not know the number she is calling from but he said he recognized her voice on the phone call.

On 1-8-13 I responded to a domestic disturbance at 1002 Charlotte Ave.  Upon investigation it was determined that both parties involved had mutually assaulted each other and were arrested for domestic violence.

On 05 Jan 2013 I was dispatched to 600-C Wise Ave in reference to a domestic disturbance with an assault.  I met with the victim who stated her babies daddy, Dytosh Pearson got angry with her and slapped her.  According to the victim, Dytosh threw her to the floor and stuck his knee in her chest holding her down while he hit her.  The victim had no real signs of injury that I could see.  I transported the victim to a friends apartment at 2527-G Ambassador Ct for a few days.  The victim does not have a place to live.I provided the victim with all of our appropriate paperwork and she stated she was going to obtain a 50B Monday morning.I have obtained a warrant charging Dytosh with Assault on a Female.  As of this time the warrant has not been served.

On Saturday, 1/5/13, at approximately 1700 hours, I responded to 119 Welch Drive regarding a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I met with Kimberly Edwards who told me her brother Barry Edwards punched her in the face before fleeing from the scene.  I transported Edwards to Moses Cone Hospital where she was advised that her face had multiple fractures.  Barry Edwards was arrested at 119 Welch Drive and charged with Assault with a Deadly Weapon Inflicting Serious Injury.
On January 4, 2013, the victim reported her ex-boyfriend violated a Domestic Protective Order by contacting her.
On Friday, 1/04/2013, I responded to 800 W Kivett Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance. An arrest was made in this case.

On January 4, 2013, at approximately 0116 hours, I responded to 208 Taylor Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance. Notes advised that a black male was beating a black female outside of that apartment building and had dragged her into to an apartment closest to the dumpsters. Officers made contact with those two subjects inside of apartment #208-A Taylor Av. The male subject, Christopher Brevard, was arrested for assault on a female and transported to jail without problems.

On January 3, 2013, the victim reported her ex-boyfriend was outside her residence after she obtained domestic violence warrants on him.  Officers responded to serve an outstanding warrants and found the defendant standing on top of a trash can under the victim`s window while holding an aluminum bat.  The defendant threatened the victim after his arrest.
On 01/03/13 at approximately 0100hrs I responded to a reported domestic assault.

On Friday January 4, 2013 at 5:22 pm a call was dispatched to 601 N Elm St in reference to an assault victim at the High Point Regional Health Systems Emergency Department.Upon arrival contact was made with the victim Ms. Laura Askew in Urgent Care Room #4.  
Askew had severe bruising from an assault that occurred between January 2, and 3, 2013 at 512 Richardson Av.As a result of the investigation arrest warrants were obtained on Forrest Eugene White for Felony Kidnapping, Assault Inflicting Serious Injury, and Interference with Emergency Communications.White was arrested and is currently in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On January 2, 2014 I was dispatched to 280 Dorothy Street for a domestic disturbance IP.Upon arrival, I learned that Michelle Pickenpack and her on-again-off-again boyfriend (and father to their daughter) Stacy Wilson, got into a verbal argument in the driveway.  As a result, Pickenpack reportedly threw a piece of road asphalt at Wilson, hitting him in the chest.  This caused a tiny scratch mark in the center of his chest.  Pickenpack reported she did this due to being pushed by Wilson (no injuries on Pickenpack).Because of Wilson`s injury, Pickenpack was arrested for domestic assault and taken to the Police Department for processing.  Wilson was given the domestic victim`s paperwork at the scene.Once at the Police Department, Pickenpack was fingerprinted and photographed by Lab Technician Mia Bartorelli and then taken before Magistrate Garber.  Magistrate Garber issued a Magistrate`s Order for simple assault and released Pickenpack on a written promise to appear in court.Both parties told me they haven`t lived together since November 2013.
On 01-02-2013 I responded to the intersection of business 85 and West Green Drive in reference to an assault.  Upon arrival I spoke with Rachel Caulder who advised she had been assaulted.

On Tuesday, January 1, 2012 at about 7:10 A.M. I was dispatched to 315 Druid Street via departmental radio in regards to domestic dispute. Upon my arrival I learned that Ms. McBee was assaulted by her child`s father.

On this date, officers responded to a domestic assault. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed that a male suspect hit his girlfriend with a "Playmate" blue and white cooler. The two subjects both admitted to have consumed alcoholic beverages. The male suspect was arrested and charged with Assault on a Female, and placed in the custody of the Guilford County Jail.

On 01/01/2013 The victim Kendall Leach was assualted by the suspect her boyfriend after an apparent argument that took place inside the apartment at 717 Russell Terrace. The suspect was arrested at the conclusion of my investigation.

On January 1, 2013, Ms McDuffie called emergency communications to report an incident. Ms McDuffie was calling communications when her phone was broken by the suspect.   Upon arrival I spoke with Ms McDuffie. She explained that the father of her children and former live in boyfriend came to her house uninvited. He then refused to leave when told to do so.   The suspect left prior to the arrival of the police.   Warrants were obtained for Domestic Criminal Trespass and Interfere with Emergency Communications.   A lookout has been broadcast.

On 12/31/2012 at 1411 hours I was dispatched to 222 Spencer St in reference to Domestic Violence between intimate partners. At the time of arrival the offender admitted to assaulting the victim with a stick. She was taken to the Guilford County Jail and was placed on a domestic hold. The victim was given Domestic Violence Victim forms. No further information at this time.
I responded to 4210 River Birch Loop, Apt. 1B, in reference to a larceny.  Upon arrival, I met with the complainant, Kevin Townsend.

On Sunday December 30th 2012 at 0445 hours I was dispatched to 913 Redding Apt A in reference to a domestic dispute. Upon my arrival I made contact with the female caller who stated her boyfriend who lives at the residence assaulted her by punching her in the face with a closed fist.  She stated the male then left the residence prior to my arrival.I observed a mark approximately the size of a dime above her right eye.  The mark was also bleeding.  I then captured two photographs of the injury.I then issued a warrant for arrest for the male subject.

On 12-29-2012 at approximately 2234 hours I arrived on scene to 1212 N College Dr in reference to a domestic assault. Through further investigation David Grolimund was charged with assault on a female.

On the 29th day of December, 2012 at approximately 1155 hours, I responded to 1420-B E Commerce Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.Both parties still were on scene when I arrived and the victim had signs of assault.Suspect was arrested and taken to jail.

On 12/29/2012 at approximately 12:27am I was dispatched to 1901 Lazy Ln in reference to a domestic disturbance. When I arrived all parties were at the residence. The male subject admitted to the assault and was charged.

On 12/28/12, at 1230 hours, An Officer was dispatched to 916 Barbee Av in reference to a vandalism to motor vehicle.  The victim stated that suspect had scratched the rims on his vehicle.  The victim stated that he knew the suspect as well.

On Friday, 12/28/2012, at approximately 0730 hours I responded to 217-17 N Lindsay Street in reference to a Domestic Disturbance. Upon arrival on the scene I made contact with the victim and reporting party of the crime, Miss Amy Lambeth, who advised that her boyfriend had assaulted her. The suspect had assaulted Miss Lambeth and then left the scene before Police arrival. The suspect was located a short distance down the street and was arrested and charged with Assault on a Female and Communicating Threats.

On this date I responded to 817 West Fairfield Road in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival, I made contact with Ms. Land.  Ms. Land advised she and her boyfriend were involved in a disturbance.
On 12-26-2012 at 2331 hours, I responded to 2804-C Moreland Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  As a result, one female was arrested for simple assault.

On Wednesday, December 26, 2012 at about 3:10 P.M. I was dispatched to 833 Hedgepath Tr. via departmental radio in regards to possible assault. Upon my arrival I spoke to Ms. Bradley and she stated that she was assaulted by her boyfriend, Brandon.

On Thursday December 27, 2012, at approximately 1058 hours, I was dispatched to 916 Barbee Avenue in reference to a vandalism.Upon arrival I spoke with the victim, who stated that someone broke his window out and scratched his vehicle.  No arrests have been made at this time.
On December 25, 2012 I responded to 1606 Pershing in reference to an assault that had just occurred.
On 12/24/2012 at 2043 hours, I responded to 421 Wright St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  As a result, the female party was arrested on scene for communicating threats.
On 12-24-12 at 0058 hours, I responded to 1421 W English Rd in reference to an assault.  When I arrived, I spoke to a female victim, who stated that she had been assaulted by her boyfriend.

On 31 Dec 2012 I was dispatched to 3025 Ingleside Dr in reference to an traffic accident with injuries.  I arrived on the scene and observed three vehicle with heavy damage blocking the entire roadway.  After identifying the people involved in the accident and speaking with them, I realized that this was likely related to a domestic violence arrest at this location just 30-45 minutes earlier.

On Sunday, December 23rd, 2012, I responded to the intersection of Johnson Street and Dayton Avenue in reference to an assist call.  Upon my arrival I met with the complainant who stated that she had been in an altercation with and assaulted by the father of her child.  The complainant also advised me that she had been staying at his residence in violation of a 50-B Domestic Restraining Order.

On 12-24-2012 at approximately 0227 hours I arrived to 2527-E Ambassador Ct in reference to a 911 hang up call for service. After further investigation Brendan Strickland was charged with assault on a female and Shantana Silavong was charged with interfering with emergency communication. Strickland was confined to the High Point Detention Facility on a domestic hold. Silavong was cited and released on scene in order to tend to two small children.

On 12-23-2012 at approximately 0043 hours I arrived to 412 E Dayton Av in reference to a domestic disturbance. through further investigation Adam Meadows was charged with assault on a female and confined to the High Point Detention Facility on a domestic hold.

On Saturday, 12/22/12, at approximately 1930 hours, I responded to 2519 Ingleside Drive regarding a Domestic Disturbance involving Intimate Partners.  Upon my arrival I met with Fang Fang Yang and her husband XXXX.  Yang told me XXXX had beaten her all day and had visible signs of injury. XXXX was arrested without incident and charged with Assault on a Female.

On 12-22-2012 at approximately 4:22am I was dispatched to 1407 Forrest St in reference to a domestic disturbance.When I arrived I spoke to a male subject who stated him and his girlfriend had been arguing.  He said she struck him while they were arguing.  The male said his girlfriend had been out all night drinking and when she came home they started to argue.  He said after she struck him she then left on foot.  The female was then located near the residence.  She admitted to striking the male and was arrested.
I responded to 4144 Tecumseh St. in reference to a domestic disturbance.

On Friday December 21st 2012 at 2200 hours I was dispatched to 701 S Elm St inreference to a domestic assault.Upon my arrival I made contact with the victim who stated her friend who she lives with, slapped her across the face repeatedly.  Physical injuries were apparent. The male subject also stated he slapped her across the face.The male subject was then arrested and charged accordingly.
On Thursday, December 27th, 2012, at 2302 hours, I responded to High Point Regional Hospital emergency room at 601 North Elm Street in reference to a child abuse.
On 12/27/12 at approximately 0900hrs I responded to a reported assault.
At about 2040 hours on 12-18-2012, I responded to 206 Taylor Ave. in reference to a domestic incident.  Lashon Ellerby was arrest for Assault on a Female and 1st Degree Burglary.

On December 18, 2012, officers responded to 1910 Whitehall St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, officers witnessed the defendant threatening his girlfriend.  The defendant was arrested and incarcerated.
On the above date and time I responded with other Officers to 120 SW Cloverleaf Pl in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Robin Teague was arrested for counts of Assault on a Female.

On 12-15-2012, at 1011 hours, I received a report of an assault at 820-F South Rd.  Upon arriving I spoke to Debbie Williams, and she stated that Robert Dunston had assaulted her.  Williams also stated that Dunston had pushed his way into her apartment and stolen several personal items from her residence.  There were no signs of assault on Williams, but warrants were obtained on Dunston for misdemeanor larceny, misdemeanor B&E and misdemeanor injury to property.While I was working on this report Dunston appeared at the magistrate`s office attempting to obtain a "restraining order" on Williams.  Officer McMillian notified me that Dunston was there so I went back to the magistrate`s office and arrested Dunston.  Dunston was taken to the PD and processed. Dunston was given a $1000.00 secured bond.

On December 15, 2012 officers were dispatched to a domestic disturbance between a male and female. The caller was uncooperative with communications in reference to the location. Officer Teschke located the male and female in the 1100 block of Day Place. After an on scene investigation both involved parties were arrested for assault. There were no serious injuries.   See the arrest sheets with the same case number for further on charges.

On 12-15-12 at approximately 0234hrs Officers responded to the intersection of Flint Av and Cassell St in reference to a domestic disturbance IP.  The victim, Ms Brandi Johnson, advised that her boyfriend, Anthony Brown, assaulted her.  Ms Johnson had visible injuries but refused EMS treatment.Mr Brown was not located.  A warrant for Assault on a Female was issued on Mr Brown.

On December 24, 2012 I received a call to respond to 4413 1A Feldspar Ct. in reference to a Domestic Disturbance where the victim, Priyanka Gulati, was at home alone and was afraid her husband would come home.  She wanted assistance in leaving the residence.  When I arrived Ms. Gulati was visibly upset and crying.  She was afraid her husband would come home while she was trying to leave with their son.  After arriving and further investigating, it was determined that Ms. Gulati was in an abusive situation.  She advised that her husband, Vikas Arora, has beaten her on numerous occasions.  I asked her when was the last time and she advised on December 15, 2012.  I asked her if she had any marks from the assault and she did. I obtained a warrant on Mr. Arora charging him with Assault with a Deadly Weapon and Assault on a Female by a Male over 18 years of age. Vikas Arora was arrested at the Police Department.  He was placed in the Guilford Co. Jail under a Domestic Hold. I recommend this case be cleared by arrest.

On 12/15/2012, at 0001hrs, I responded to 1516 Johnson St in reference to a domestic disturbance. The suspect was on the front porch striking the door with a knife, cursing and trying to get in. Once I encountered the suspect, I gave him commands, which he refused to obey, and this resulted in a physical interaction with him. After a few minutes of engaging the suspect, he submitted to the physical and verbal commands I was issuing to him. He was arrested, treated by EMS and placed in the High Point jail under a $1,000 bond.

On December 13, 2012, I responded to a disturbance involving a boyfriend and girlfriend. The girlfriend damaged the house by cracking a window with a shovel. The girlfriend was cited with damage to real property and given a court date.

On 12/13/2012 Detective Nordstrom of the High Point Police Department observed a Domestic Disturbance that occurred at 1411 E. Green Dr. in High Point North Carolina.As a result of the Domestic Disturbance, Ericka Monique Johnson was placed under arrest for Domestic Simple Assault.  Ms. Johnsonn was placed in the Guilford County Jail without a bond.

On 12/12/2012 I was dispatched to 607 Wise Av in reference to an Assault with a Deadly Weapon. Upon arrival the suspect was located and the victim was not harmed. The suspect was arrested for Assault with a Deadly Weapon.

On Wednesday, December 12th, 2012, at 0223 hours, I responded to the entrance of the Greenway at West College Drive and East Farriss Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Tonja Evans, who advised her boyfriend, Mr. Ronald Peterman, took her cell phone and refused to give it back to her.
On 12/11/12 at approximately 1257hrs I responded to a reported domestic disturbance.
On 12/10/2012 at 2358hrs I responded to the above address in reference to a Domestic Assault.
I responded to 1011-A Roberts Ln on a reported assault.  Upon arrival I spoke with the Sanders family.
On 12-10-2012, I responded to Fire Station 9 on Triangle Lake Road in reference to someone standing by to report a sexual assault that took place in Southeast High Point.
On December 10, 2012 at 0222 hours, I was dispatched to the High Point Hospital reference an attempted suicide. The patient was awake and alert.

On Sunday, December 9, 2012, at approximately 1646 hours, I was dispatched to 604 Ellwood Drive in reference to a domestic disturbance.I located the victim at 609 Ashburn Street.  The suspect had broken the window out of her vehicle and fled the scene.  No arrests have been made at this time.

On Saturday December 8, 2012, I responded to 1201 Blain St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  When I arrived I spoke with the victim, who stated that her Ex-Husband had came to the residence and damaged a vehicle which was parked in front.  The Victim also stated that her Ex-Husband grabbed her wrist and threw her down on the porch.  The Victim had minor injuries to her hands she said resulted after being thrown down and trying to fight off the suspect.  The suspect fled the scene prior to police arrival.  I determined there was enough PC for an arrest, so I have drawn warrants out for the male which are pending service.
On 12/8/2012, at approximately 1530 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I conducted an investigation and arrested Mr. Cardenas for assault.

On December 8, 2012, at approximately 1423 hours, I responded to 2921 Archdale Road in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, the defendant, Dustin Gailey, was arrested for assaulting his girlfriend.

On Saturday, 12/8/12, at approximately 0100 hours, I responded to 6040-2H Red Cedar Drive regarding a Domestic Disturbance involving Intimate Partners.  Upon my arrival, I met with Mary Beck who told me her ex-boyfriend, Christopher Turner, kicked in her apartment door and retrieved his dog.  Turner was charged with Domestic Criminal Trespass and placed in Guilford County Jail on a domestic hold.
On January 28, 2013, the police investigated a child neglect.

On 12/10/2012 at about 4:30 PM I responded to the Police Department Lobby to meet the Victim, Angela Canty. She stated that she had been involved in a domestic violence with her boyfriend on Friday and Saturday and warrants had already been issued by the magistrate.

On 12/06/2012 at approximately 2320 hours I responded to 420 Macedonia Wy. in response to a domestic violence call.  Upon arrival I spoke with Tiesha Shaw, a participant in the fight, who stated that she and her girlfriend got into an altercation over their relationship status.  Both parties were questioned and Ms. Shaw was arrested for assault.

On 16-06-2012 at 23:25 hours I responded to 3618 Densbury Dr. to a domestic disturbance call. Upon my arrival I contacted the victim, Jennifer Williams. Mrs. Williams stated that she had been assaulted by her husband David Williams. Mr. Williams was taken into custody and charged with the offense. Mr. Williams was also served with a warrant for arrest. There were no problems with the incident.

On 12/05/2012 at approximately 2320 hours, I responded to 708-D Kent St. for a reported Domestic violence assault.  Upon arrival I spoke with Kodi Hines, the victim, who stated that she was assaulted by her ex-boyfriend during an argument tonight.  A warrant was issued for the assault and Mrs. Hines was given the Domestic Violence Information Packet.

On 12/05/2012 at 1542 hours I responded to 1330 Burton Ave in reference to an assault. Upon arrival I spoke with the Victim and she stated that her unborn baby`s Father, Varren Anderson (Offender) assaulted her. She was transported to the hospital by a neighbor and a warrant was obtained for Mr. Anderson.  Mr. Anderson was arrested several hours later after being spotted in the suspect vehicle listed in this report.

On 12/04/2012 I responded to the High Point ER for a report of an assault. The victim stated that her boyfriend became upset with her while they were walking down the street and tried to take her purse. In the process, she was struck in the head and had her arm twisted. Felony warrants have been obtained against the suspect at the time of this report.

On 12-4-12, at approximately 1712hrs, officers responded to a disturbance at 907 Mill Av.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the victim, Mr Erick Battle, who advised that the mother of his son and her current boyfriend came to his residence creating a disturbance.  Both subjects were gone when officers arrived.

On 12-05-2012 at 1237 hours I received a report of an assault at 606 Washington St.  Upon meeting with the victim at her mothers residence at 610 Hedrick Av. She stated that she had been assaulted by her boyfriend.
On December 3, 2012, the defendant was arrested for Assault on a Female and marijuana was found in his possession when searched.
On December 02, 2012 at 1408 hours I responded to the 500 block of Warlber court in reference to a disturbance.

On December 02, 2012, I was dispatched to a domestic burglary call on Morris Farm Road.  When I arrived, the victim stated that her exboyfriend came into her residence through a side door and started arguing with her.  Yesterday the same suspect came into her residence, assaulted her and damaged her property.
On 12/1/2012, at approximately 2300 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival both Ms. Livingston and Mr. Byers were arrested for Domestic Assault.

I responded to a 911 hangup call at 3201 Morris Farm Drive.  Upon arrival, I noticed a plant stand was knocked over on the front porch.  The plant pot was shattered.  I could hear someone shouting from inside.  I rang the doorbell.  The complainant/victim came to the door and reported her ex-boyfriend had broken into the house  while she was inside.

On this date and time, I responded to 2429 W Green Dr to Room 118 in reference to a domestic disturbance that had just occurred.  Upon arrival I spoke with Mrs. Self who advised that her husband had assaulted her.
On November 30, 2012, at 0615 hours, I responded to 2904 Westgate Drive in reference to a assault in progress.
On November 30, 2012 at 0615 hours I responded to 2904 Westgate Drive in reference to an assault in progress.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On Thursday, November 29th, 2012, I was dispatched to 118-2F E Swathmore Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  After an investigation at the scene, Mr. Danny Betancourt was placed under arrest, for Violation of a Protective Order.

On 11/29/2012 at approximately 0010 hours, I responded to 1416-C E. Commerce Av. for a reported Domestic Assault.  Upon arrival I spoke with Kelcey Spencer, a participant in the fight, who stated that he and his girlfriend, Uralater Matthews got into a fight over ending their relationship.  Both parties were given medical treatment on scene and refused transportation to a medical facility.

On Wednesday, November 28, 2012, I was dispatched to the High Point Regional Hospital in reference to an overdose or intoxicated subject that occurred on the North Side of High Point.  I arrived on scene and spoke with hospital staff who advised that a female had come in with several children and passed out in the waiting room.  The female was asked what she had taken and had replied that her husband had drugged her.

On the date and time listed above, Officers responded to 2630 South Main Street in reference to an Affray.  Upon arrival, it was discovered that the two parties engaged in the affray were a couple.  Witnesses stated that the male subject jumped on top of the victim after he threw her down and punched her in the back of the head.  The subject left prior to Officers arriving and warrants were obtained for Assault on a Female.

On November 27, 2012, I spoke with Ms Nicollette Giordano in reference to a vandalism. The vandalism took place during a disturbance on Waterstone Ln. Ms Nicollette Giordano explained that two male suspects damaged a car belonging to Mr Stepney. During the same incident, a known suspect communicated threats to Ms Giordano. Warrants have been obtained for communicating threats on the suspect. There are no warrants for the vandalism at this time.   Two of the male suspects are unknown at this time.

On 11-27-12 at 0024 hours, I was dispatched to 109 Edgeworth St in reference to a domestic assault.  Upon arrival, I spoke to Farris Adams, the victim, about the incident.  He advise that Shanteka Cook had assaulted him.  Shanteka left prior to my arrival and could not be located.  Warrants were taken out on her for domestic assault.

I responded to 1104 Charlotte Av for a report of a domestic disturbance. When I arrived I encountered the two suspects, who were both injured, and arrested both. Due to the conflicting stories and lack of prosecution by both parties, they were released by the magistrate.

On 11-26-12, at approximately 0321 hours, I responded to the 1400 block of E Commerce Ave in reference to a domestic violence call.  Upon arrival, I spoke with the victim who stated that her boyfriend assaulted her.  Warrants were obtained for assault.
On 11/24/2012, at 2121hrs, I responded to the above location in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.
On 11-24-12 I responded in reference to a report of an assault that occurred at 1117 Carter Street.
On November 24, 2012 at 0310 hours, I was dispatched to 118-B Northgate Ct.  reference a domestic disturbance. The suspect was arrested.
On 11/24/2012 at 0149hrs I responded to the above address in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.
I responded to Ham`s restaurant, 5840 Samet Drive, in reference to disturbance.  Upon arrival, I met with the complainant who advised she was assaulted by her boyfriend.
I responded to 1709 Edmondson Pl on a reported domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I spoke with Ms Rose.
On 11/23/12 at approximately 1309hrs I responded to a domestic disturbance.
On 11/22/2012 at 2115hrs I responded to the above address in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.
On Tuesday, 11-27-12 I met with DSS Investigator Ms. Macadlo at Oakview Elementary School.  This was is regards to a Domestic Assault.See Supplemental Report for additional information.

On 12/10/2012, at 1339 hours, I spoke to Lonnelle Little in reference to a report of a larceny.  Lonnelle advised that on 11/22/2012, possibly between 1300 and 1600 hours, she was on the way back to her residence with her boyfriend from Winston-Salem after seeing some family for Thanksgiving.  While on the way back, her personal items were thrown from a window in the vehicle they were riding in and then stolen.
The subjects were involved in an argument and assaulted each other.  Both were arrested for simple assault domestic violence.
On this date, Officers responded to 1114 N Hamilton St. in reference to a Domestic Violence Call.  After investigation, an Offender was identified and charges are pending.

On 11-22-2012, I responded to 601 North Elm Street (High Point Emergency Room) in reference to an assault that took place at 2508 Eight Oaks Court.  Upon my arrival I spoke to the victim, who advised that her boyfriend (child`s father) repeatedly struck her with his fist, a gun and a picture frame.  The victim is being treated at High Point Emergency Room for her injuries.Warrants were obtained on the offender for Felony Assault with a Deadly Weapon Inflicting Serious Injury, Assault on a Female, Assault by Pointing a Gun, Assault in the Presence of a Minor and False Imprisonment.  At this time the offender has not been located.

On Thursday, November 22nd, 2012, I responded to 103 Gaylord Court in reference to a disturbance that possibly involved an individual armed with a knife.  Upon my arrival at the residence I observed three persons inside the living room engaged in a verbal dispute. I was informed by the female that she had arrived at her residence and became upset because a male that she did not know was sleeping in her bed.  The female also told me that this particular male was a friend of her husband (who was also present) and that neither one was supposed to be in her residence.  It was later determined that the husband had been staying with his wife for some time, even though she stated that she only allowed him in at times.  During the call, the female, who was irate with her husband, pushed him while they were standing on the front porch in front of Officers.  The female was arrested on the scene for Domestic Assault.

On the 22nd day of November, 2012 at approximately 0020 hours, I responded to 713 E Russell Av in reference to a DVIP call that occurred on Cable St.The victim was transported to High Point Regional Emergency Room and the suspect was the victim`s boyfriend.Warrants were obtained on the suspect and served on him later in the morning.

On 11/21/12, at 2130 hours, Officers responded to a domestic dispute at 2103-C Aileen Ct.  Upon their arrival, they met with the victim.  The victim stated that she was in an argument with the offender.  The offender pushed her and she injured her head.

On 11-21-2012 at 9:32 am, I responded to 421 Wright St., in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Both individuals at the residence were alleging that they had been assaulted during an altercation between the two.  Both individuals sustained visible minor injuries, but had conflicting versions of what took place.  Both individuals were taken into custody at the scene and charged with a domestic related assault.

On November 20, 2012 Officer Calvillo and I responded to 1412 a E Commerce Av in reference to an unknown trouble call. Upon arrival I spoke with Mr Smarr and Ms Spears. Mr Smarr was intoxicated.   Ms Spears was given a ride to the magistrate`s office. Ms Spears swore out a simple assault warrant. The warrant was served on Mr Smarr without incident.   Ms Spears was given information on the police department`s domestic violence program. Ms Spears did not require any medical attention.   See the arrest sheet for further.

On 11/19/2012 at 2243 hours I responded to 2921 E Kivett Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival, I spoke with the victim through who advised me that she had been assaulted by her husband. The suspect was arrested and taken to the High Point Jail. There is no further information at this time.

On 11-19-2012 at approximately 1830 hours I responded to the ER in reference to an assault. Upon my arrival I spoke with Angela Black. She stated she was assaulted by the subject listed above. The subject listed above was charged with assault.

On 11/19/2012 at 0150 hours, I responded to 614 E Kearns Av in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival, I spoke with the victim, who advised me that her child`s father had broken into her house through the back door and broken the front window of her house with a chair. After further investigation, the suspect was apprehended and taken to jail. There is no further information at this time.

offense: ASSAULT ON A FEMALE BY MALE OVER 18 YEARS OF AGE
body: On the 18th day of November, 2012 at approximately 2015 hours, I responded to the area of E Green Dr and Smith St in reference to a Domestic Violence call involving Intimate Partners.Upon arriving, the victim had a laceration to her forehead and she stated that the suspect had continued walking east down E Green Dr.The suspect was located behind a residence on E Green Dr next to Walnut St.
At about 1100 hours on 11-17-2012 I responded to 606 Wesley Dr. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Glynnisha Paulk was arrested on an assault charge.
On this date, Officers responded to 1134 Wayside St. in reference to a domestic assault.  After investigation, one party was arrested.

On Thursday, November 15th, 2012, at 1244 hours, I responded to 202 North Hoskins Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Mrs. Kathy Chambers in the kitchen, who advised Ms. Monica Chambers returned to the residence causing a disturbance.  I located Ms. Monica Chambers in the kitchen and placed her under arrest for second degree trespassing.  Ms. Monica Chambers was confined in the Guilford County Jail under a $500 secured bond.

On 11-15-2012 at 0749 hours, I responded to a domestic disturbance at 202 N Hoskins St.  Upon arrival I located the parties involved arguing over money.  The suspect was banned from the house and left the scene.  The suspect stole US currency as she left.  She was caught at N College Dr and Davis Av and cited for Larceny.  The money was returned to the victim.

On Wednesday, November 14, 2012 at about 10:07 P.M. we were dispatched to 924 Lakecrest Avenue in regards to a domestic dispute possibly involving a firearm. Upon our arrival I spoke to Ms. Courtney Pipkin and she informed me that her childs father took her son and left the residence without permission or authority.  i
Assault on a female in a parking lot.

On the date and time listed above, Officers responded to 341-F Henley Street in reference to an assistance call.  After further investigation, it was discovered that an assault took place on November 11, 2012 at this same location.  The caller was arrested and charged with Assault on a Female and placed in the Guilford County Jail under a Domestic Hold.

On 11/10/12, at about 2:00 AM, I responded to 2922-H E Kivett Dr for a reported domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival, I met with the Victim, Letalya Rowe, in the parking lot of the apartment. She stated that the childrens father was in her apartment. He was intoxicated and refusing to leave. She advised that he stays at the residence occasionally and visits their children, but does not live there. She stated that he was invited in, but then he became intoxicated and they began to argue. I found the suspect, Dwight Jackson, asleep in the apartment. He woke up and was advised he needed to leave by Rowe and then myself. I confirmed with the apartment manager that he was not on the lease and did not live there. Jackson was given several opportunities to leave, but he refused and was arrested for trespassing.

On 11-10-2012 at around 12:00 pm, I responded to 3000 Central Ave in reference to an assault. Upon my arrival I met with the victim, Mr Christopher Pratt. Mr Pratt advised that his girlfriend hit him in  the head with a brick and knocked him out. Mr. Pratt refused EMS. Mr Pratt had obvious abrasions to the right side of his face and right hand. Mr. Pratt advised that the marks on his hand were defensive wounds. Mr Pratt advised that he did not hit his girlfriend at all but that he only blocked her blows when she was hitting him. Mr Pratt advised that he was knocked out by he girlfriend when she hit him with a brick and had just now regained consciousness from the assault.

On 11/09/2012 I responded to 1324 Cedrow Drive in reference to a domestic dispute.  I arrived and made contact with a husband and wife.  Probable cause was established and the wife was arrested for assault and battery.

On 11-09-2012, I responded to 2429 East Kivett Drive in reference to an assault that was taking place.  Upon my arrival I spoke to the witness and the victim.  The witness advised he observed a black male assaulting a black female in the grassy area between the buildings.The victim advised that her childrens father came to this address and confronted her about information that he had received.  She advised that she told him the information was not true and he became angry and starting striking her about the face.The victim was given all of the domestic violence information sheets.  She was also transported to the High Point ER to be treated for minor injuries.  A warrant for Assault on a Female was obtained on the offender.  No further information at this time regarding this incident.

On 11-08-12 Officers Mizell, Officer Gray and Lieutenant Carter and I responded to 710-C Kent in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon our arrival I spoke to the caller, Nelson Jenks. Mr. Jenks advised that he and his wife, Katherine Jenks got into an argument over finances.Mr. Jenks stated that Mrs. Jenks smacked him with an open hand on his face and he retaliated and smacked her in the face (open hand). Mr. Jenks advised that this was the first time they laid hands on each other. Both parties were calm and appeared to have regretted hitting one another. Mr. Jenks stated that he called the police because they both did not know what to do and wanted to seek help.Mrs. Jenks spoke to Officer Gray in the kitchen and told her the same story. She admitted to hitting Mr. Jenks first. There were no signs of  injuries on either party and they both refused EMS. They both also did not want to press charges and expressed that they wanted to seek help. Both parties were given the victim resource form and the domestic violent form. Two victim information form was also filled out. Mr. Jenks was charged with Assault on a Female and Mrs. Jenks was charged with Simple Assault. Both parties were issued a citation. Lab was called out and took photos. Mr. Jenks agreed to leave and stay the night with a family member. They both kissed each other prior to Mr. Jenks leaving.

On 11-07-2012 I responded to 120 SW CLoverleaf Pl in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I was met by the victim, Ms. Garner.  She stated that she and her boyfriend, Mr. Burcham, had gotten into an argument.  He then assaulted her and she called 911.  When he pulled the phone from her hand he scratched her arms.  He was charged with assault on a female.
On 11-6-12 I responded in reference to a report of a domestic disturbance that occurred at 2429 Apt. B Francis Street.
I encountered the subjects  on a domestic disturbance call in the 1600 block of E Commerce Ave.

On 11-05-2012 at 12:28 hours I responded to 819 Central Ct. to a domestic disturbance call. Upon my arrival I contacted the victim, Lakayla Little. Ms. Little stated that she had been assaulted and had visible signs of injury. The suspect was arrested and placed in the custody of the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On 11-5-2012 at 9:30am I responded to 2002-M Stoney Creek Dr. in reference to Domestic Disturbance.Upon arriving at the above location I made contact with the victim who stated her boyfriend pushed her against the wall, causing injury to her arm.

On the 5th day of November, 2012, at approximately 0550 hours, I responded to 1416 Furlough Av in reference to a domestic violence call.The caller was screaming for help on an open line to communications.I made contact at the residence with the suspect and victim.The suspect was placed under arrest for domestic criminal trespass and misdemeanor breaking and entering.

On 11/04/2012 at approximately 1440 hours I responded to 708 Park St. for a reported domestic violence incident.  Upon arrival I spoke with Keyanna Miller, the victim, who stated that she was choked by her husband, Mr. Bernice Clayton.  The victim showed signs of injury and was cleared by EMS.  Warrants were obtained on Mr. Clayton, and a Domestic Violence packet was given to Mrs. Miller.

On Friday, November 2nd, 2012, I was dispatched to 615 Grand St. in reference to a domestic dispute that occurred on this date.  The victim stated that her boyfriend, whom she lives with, assaulted her about her body, by punching her, pushing her, and throwing items at her.  She stated that he also communicated threats prior to leaving their residence.Warrants were obtained on the suspect.

On November 2, 2012, Ms Willis reported that her former boyfriend knocked down her mailbox. The former boyfriend, who is 47 years old, then spun his tires in the street causing smoke to fill up the area.   Ms Willis is pursuing charges on her own at this time.

On this date, I spoke to the caller in front of her residence. She said she had been assaulted by her boyfriend inside their home. She said he had been drinking and choked her. We made contact with him inside and he was barely conscious.  EMS arrived and transported him to the hospital.

On Thursday, November 1st, 2012, at 1212 hours, I responded to 522-B Roy Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Janae Deslandes who advised she got into an altercation with her live-in boyfriend.

On October 31, 2012, I responded to 807 Vail Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, I made contact with all parties involved at the above residence. The complainant on this call, Brook Antonio, advised that his long term and live in girlfriend had assaulted him and damaged several things inside his residence. He was not injured.His girlfriend was identified as Joanna Martin. She was very intoxicated and was bleeding from her right thumb. She was treated on scene by EMS for a small laceration. She refused further medical assistance. She was so intoxicated she did not remember any part of the incident. She said she did not know why police were called. She had slurred speech. She could not stand on her own without using some kind of assistance to stay on her feet. Her eyes were bloodshot. A third subject, Martin`s 8 year old child was also on scene. She witnessed the incident but was not injured.

The victim reported the suspect trapped her arm in his vehicle window after an argument and she was dragged approximately 10 feet, he then released the window and left the scene.  Both parties gave conflicting stories for this incident.
On 10-31-2012 at 0848 hours I responded to a domestic disturbance at 1337 Bailey Ci.  Warrants have been obtained on the suspect.

On the 30th day of October, 2012 at approximately 2230 hours, I responded to 604 Clara Cox Way in reference to a possible domestic disturbance.After speaking with several residents I was able to locate the disturbance in apartment 3D of 604 Clara Cox Wy.There were signs of assault on the male, so the female was placed under arrest for assault and battery.

On Tuesday October 30, 2012, at 1:39 pm, a call was dispatched to 2649 Guyer St in reference to a disturbance.Upon arrival, contact was made with Zambia Jackson, Zaire Jackson, Yvonne Posten.  Posten, the mother of Zambia and Zaire, lives with her son at 2612 1C Guyer St.  Both Posten and Zaire were home when Zambia came over to the residence.  A verbal argument started between the three and carried outside into the parking lot.At some point the argument turned physical between Zambia and Zaire.  During the altercation, a windshield wiper blade was broken off from the box truck owned by American Furniture Warehouse.James Mayfield who works for American Furniture Warehouse heard the argument between Posten, Zambia and Zaire.  When Mayfield was able to actually see the subjects involved in the disturbance he saw Zaire with the wiper blade in his hand.The second witness, Tyra Chaney, heard the disturbance from her apartment.  When she looked outside she saw Zambia with an object in her hand yelling at her mother who also had an object in her hand that looked like a "book bag" to Chaney.Zambia accused Zaire of breaking off the windshield wiper blade while Zaire accused Zambia of the same.Zambia had a small cut on the side of her head, but refused EMS when asked if she needed medical attention.Posten, Zambia and Zaire were advised that they could obtain warrants if they wished for any assaults that occurred.At the time of the report it is not known who actually broke off the windshield wiper blade, and no charges have been filed.

The suspect entered the victims apartment, pushed her against the wall and later tried to choke her.  Suspect left prior to police arrival.  Warrants were obtained.  Victim refused EMS and had no visible injuries.

On 10/28/2012 at around 1539 hours I responded to 329 Ennis St for a report of an assault. When I arrived I spoke to the victim, Kaecy Andrews.  Andrews is the mother of suspect, Marcus Williams.  Andrews stated that Williams hit her in the left side of the face after an argument about cleaning occurred.  Andrews did have some discoloration to her left cheek and appeared to be a little swollen.  Andrews refused EMS.Williams was arrested for the assault on his mother and RDO.  Willams was taken before a magistrate and was given a $500.00 secure bond.  Williams was also given a court date of 11/20/2012 at 0830 hours.
On Sunday, October 28th, 2012, I was dispatched to 2909 Maggie Ct. in reference to a domestic dispute.  Charges were made.

The victim stated that her and the offender got into an argument about the offenders medication.  The victim stated that she was attempting to get the offender to take the medication and the offender refused to take it.  The offender came out of the bedroom and assaulted the victim.  First with his hands and then with a chair.  The victim was able to leave the residence and drive to her mothers residence.  She then called the police department.

On 10-27-2012 at 2023 hours while on routine patrol I heard a subject yelling for help in the Hickory Chapel area. I was driving my patrol vehicle traveling north on Hickory Chapel Rd. I came upon 308 Hickory Chapel Rd and saw the front door open to the residence. I saw the female listed above on top of the victim and the victim was yelling for help. I made entry into the residence and arrested the female subject for simple assault.

On this date, I spoke to the victim at 504 Pomeroy Pl. and she advised her ex-boyfriend assaulted her by pushing her down in the driveway. She sustained a scrape on her right leg from the fall. The suspect was not present when I arrived.

On this date, I responded to an assault call at 1704 Lamb Avenue. When I arrived, I learned that an adult female and a 13 year old girl had been assaulted by the suspect. He was not at the scene and EMS was refused by all parties. I obtained warrants on the suspect and a BOLO was issued on him. He had not been located at the time this report was finished.
