At 0301 hours on 10/27/2012, the victim called 911 to report a Domestic Disturbance at her residence.  When I arrived on scene the victim stated that she had been assaulted by an ex-boyfriend in the roadway in front of her residence.  The victim had visible injuries consistent with the reported assault and the suspect was no longer present.  Photographs of the victim`s injuries were taken and a warrant was issued for the suspect`s arrest.

On October 27, 2012 a refused caller reported a possible domestic disturbance at 1114 Camden Av. Officers responded to investigate. Eventually three people walked up to the location. After officers spoke with a man and women on scene probable cause was developed to arrest the man and women for assaulting one another. Both the man and woman were placed in jail on a domestic hold.

On November 2, 2012, I responded to 843 Willow Pl in reference to a vandalism. Mr McCall reported that a former girlfriend broke out two of his windows with a brick approximately a week ago. Nobody was home during the incident and there were no injuries.   Mr McCall is pursuing charges related to the incident on his own.

On Oct 26th 2012, I responded to an improperly parked vehicle at 305 e parkway av, Armstrong Park. upon my arrival a female approached my vehicle and asked for help, She said that she had been assaulted by a known subject and was in fear  of further abuse.The victim had visible marks to her person and the suspect was arrested and assigned a five hundred dollar bond. Subject is in the custody of Guilford County Sheriff`s Office in High Point.

On 10-26-2012, at 7:39pm I responded to 1704 Lamb Av. in reference to an assault. The reporting party did not give any specific information about the assault at this time, only that an argument occurred between the reporting party and her daughter.

On Thursday October 25, 2012 at 1407 hours Officer Inthisane and I responded to 1705 Fern Av in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon our arrival, Officer Inthisane and I could hear yelling coming from inside the residence.  The yelling was both male and female voices.  Other officers were requested. Officers Six, Thome, and Garrett arrived. Officer Inthisane and I separated both parties and interviewed them.Ms. Fryar`s story was as follows:Ms. Fryar told Officer Thome that she and Mr. Shah were arguing about the vehicle when Shah took the palm of his hand and "mushed" her face and then punched a hole in the door.  Ms. Fryar then admitted to striking Mr. Shah about the face and head.  Ms. Fryar advised that she wanted him out of her house.Mr. Shah`s story was as follows:Mr. Shah told us that he had jumped the car off with his truck.  Ms. Fryar did not allow the car to run long enough to charge the battery before she cut it off.  Mr. Shah told Ms. Fryar that the car had to run for a while to charge the battery and the she couldn`t just cut it off like she did.  Mr. Shah stated Ms. Fryar became very angry and began yelling and cursing him.  Mr. Shah told us that they went into the house arguing but that Ms. Fryar would not stop yelling and cursing at him. He got angry and punched a hole in the door.  Ms. Fryar got up in his face, yelling and screaming that she wanted him out of her house.  Mr. Shah stated he was in the doorway of the bedroom and Ms. Fryar was in the doorway. He stated Fryar was in his face aggressively yelling at him to leave.  Mr. Shah stated that he "mushed" Ms. Fryar in the face to get her out of his face and she began to hit him about the head and face.Both parties were placed in handcuffs at this time.  Both parties admitted to assaulting the other.The above named juveniles were inside the house during this disturbance.  The juveniles were left with Ms. Pandora Hocket, the grandmother. Due to the number of children at the house I did not feel that Ms. Pandora Hockett, would be able to safely attend to all the children.  Ms. Fryar was issued a citation and released at the scene to care for the children.Mr. Shah was taken to the Police Department.  Once at the Police Department Mr. Shah was processed.I attempted to contact DSS, but was unable to make contact.

On 10/25/2012 at approximately 1245 hours I responded to the 3300 block of Triangle Lake RD in reference to a suspicious single vehicle traffic accident.  Upon my arrival I made contact with a silver, 2006 Chevrolet Cobalt accompanied by Mr Travis Edwards and Mrs Ryann Edwards.  Subsequent to investigation, this incident was reclassified as AWDW and Mrs Edwards was charged with felony assault with a deadly weapon inflicting serious injury.  Mrs Edwards is currently incarcerated in the Guilford County jail under a no bond hold.

Officer Grimberg and I arrived at 3106 Rolling Rd in reference to domestic violence. Upon arrival I talked with Stephen Mabry and he stated that he and his girlfriend have been arguing. He said that this has been going on for approximately 2 months. He stated that she was in his truck and when he went to get the keys she bit him on the right hand. She was arrested on view due to the injury on his hand.

offense: ALL OTHER - HIT AND RUN (PROPERTY DAMAGE)
body: Suspect came to victims residence and and rammed his vehicle with hers.  Suspect then attempted to do additional damage to the victims vehicle by hitting the windshield.  The suspect then fled the area.
On October 24, 2012, the victim reported being assaulted by her boyfriend.  The suspect left before police arrived.

On this date, police responded to the area of the Guilford County Courthouse, reference to some type of disturbance, which the caller reported to have occurred in a court room. An investigation revealed that a male and female had left the courthouse, after being involved in some type of domestic disturbance. The male was located, and reviewing call notes, revealed that the subject may have a criminal summons. The male was located, he showed no warrants/summons in NC AWARE. I contacted the Magistrates Office, and learned that a Summons was in hand at that location. I transported the subject to the Magistrate`s Office, and the paper was served.

On October 24, 2012, a juvenile walked to the emergency room about 1am and reported being kicked out of her home.  I spoke to the juvenile who stated she had been assaulted by her mother and brother earlier in the day.I transported the juvenile home and spoke with her mother and brother who both admitted to assaulting the juvenile.The juvenile, mother and brother were all charged with assaulting each other.

On 10-22-2012, I responded to 219 Baker Road in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I spoke to the victim, who advised that his wife which he is separated from assaulted him.  The offender left the scene prior to officers arrival.  A warrant was issued for the offender for Simple Assault.

On October 22, 2012, at approximately 0143 hours, I responded to the 3600 block of East Kivett Drive in reference to assisting Officer Neilson with a domestic disturbance that he observed as he was driving down the road.

On 10-21-2012 I dispatched to 1008 Roberts Ln in reference to a disturbance.On arrival I see a male standing in the front yard talking on a cell phone, I requested the male to return to the house with me so we could talk, the male agreed.The glass in the screen door was broken, inside there was a large glass curio cabinet that was broken with glass on the floor. The male and female both stated this altercation began over money.When the male requested money the female refused to give him the cash he had given her earlier in the day. The male reached into the females pocket and took her cell phone and offered to return it in exchange for the cash. The male and female struggled over the phone, the females minor children became involved. The female`s sixteen year old son pulled the male away from his mother, when he did the male turned and struck the youth with a closed fist and then tried to choke him. The male admitted to hitting and chocking the minor and stated he was trying to defend himself.The male agreed to leave and was calling a ride in the front yard. When I search the male I found a baggy with marijuana inside his front right pants pocket.The male was checked on channel B and was negative for outstanding warrants: I placed Wright under arrest for simple assault and simple possession of marijuana.The marijuana was placed into evidence at the police department.

On this date, I spoke with the victim at his home. He advised he and his wife got into an argument over a text message. She became angry, scratched him on different parts of his body and then pointed a gun at him. She left prior to my arrival. Warrants were obtained on her and a look out was broadcast.

On 10/20/2012 at around 1915 hours I was dispatched to 1921 S Main Street for a public disturbance call.  When I arrived I was flagged down by a white female, Cynthia Forthofer, and a black male, Kelvin Ledbetter.  Ledbetter stated that he had a woman call the police because his girlfriend was trying to drive drunk.Forthofer stated that Ledbetter choked her.  I changed the nature of the call to Domestic Disturbance IP.  While speaking to Forthofer, I was able to see a red mark on the right side of her neck.I went into the business and reviewed the video surveillance type.  Based on what I viewed on the tape, I arrested Ledbetter for assault on a female.  I transported Ledbetter to the PD where he was fingerprinted and photographed.  Ledbetter was taken before a magistrate where he was given a written promise to appear in court on 11/26/2012 at 0830 hours.
On 10-20-2012 at around 4:10 pm, I responded to the center part of the city in reference to a rape.

On 10-20-12 while assisting with a domestic disturbance investigation The Offender assaulted the Victim.  The Victim placed the Offender under arrest.  The case has been referred to Guilford County Teen Court.

At 11:14 we arrived at 319 Avery Ave. in reference to a domestic violence intimate partner. Upon arrival the offender had already left the residence and we spoke with the victim. She told us that her boyfriend slapped her with an open hand on the face because he was angry that she moved his phone while cleaning. She said that this is a recurring event. There are marks on her face and her arms from present and passed physical abuse that she showed us. The victim stated that her boyfriend took her purse, phone, and house phone. The victim showed us holes in the wall where she said he tried to hit her. The victim said that she would go take out a warrant against him for assault but I advised her that we would take out the warrant against him. I also advised her that she should go live with a family member for a while. She called a family member and we waited until she appeared safe.James Edward Williams Jr has been charged with Assault on a female by Warrant and a BOL has been issued.

On 10/19/2012 I responded to 2109 Gordon Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance. When I arrived I encountered one of the parties in the middle of the road and highly intoxicated. Once she was removed from the roadway, it was determined that she was the aggressor, although both parties had assaulted each other. Both were arrested and transported to the High Point Jail and placed under a domestic hold.

On 10/19/2012 I responded to 406 Summit Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance. When I arrived I encountered one of the parties in the middle of her driveway with minor injuries. The suspect fled prior to my arrival, and warrants were taken out for his arrest.

On 10/19/12 at approximately 1632 hours, I responded to a domestic related call at the intersection of Lexington Avenue and Bridges.  Upon arrival, I spoke with the suspect and witness to the incident.  My investigation led to the arrest of Ashley Vitamvas for a domestic related AWDW.  I took out warrants on the victim to the AWDW, Raeshaun Smith, for larceny of cash belonging to Vitamvas.  The warrant is currently unserved.

On 10-19-12 at approximately 1240hrs officers responded to 311 Barker Av in reference to a public disturbance.  Upon officers arrival all parties were split up. Ms Tiffany Nickolson and her mother Ms Jamie Kirkman came to Mr Brandon Wilson`s house to collect Ms Nickolson`s belonging after a recent split.  After they arrived a disturbance started between Mr Wilson his wife, Mrs Kimberly Wilson, and Ms Nickolson and Ms Kirkman.  Damage was done to Mr Wilson`s property and he was advised of his legal options.  Ms Nickolson was able to collect some of her belonging.  Ms Nickolson and Ms Kirkman have been banned from the property.  They have been advised to call for assistance before going back to the property to collect the rest of Ms Nickolson`s belongings.

On October 18, 2012, I responded to 902 Gordon St in reference to an out of control juvenile. Upon arrival, I spoke to Mrs Ross-Adams. Mrs Ross-Adams showed me a wall and window that had been damaged by the juvenile. The juvenile left prior to the arrival of the police.

On 10/18/2012, I responded to 1423-A FURLOUGH AV in reference to a DOMESTIC DISTURBANCE that already occurred. Upon my arrival, I made contact with the victim, KUISTON NIKOLE JOHSON, who had been the victim of a domestic assault.  Upon further investigation, the male party involved, LA`QUENTON LA`JON BAKER was located near the intersection of FRANKLIN AV and HILL ST and arrested for ASSAULT ON A FEMALE BY MALE OVER 18 YEARS OF AGE and served with an outstanding WARRANT FOR ARREST (WFA) for MISDEMEANOR LARCENY.

On 10/17/2012, at 8:08pm, I responded to 2926-A Archdale Rd in response to a domestic dispute that was currently taking place. Ronald Lynn Payne Jr broke into the residence in an attempt to assault his girlfriend, Magdeline Victoria Barnes. Payne cut through a screen door to gain access to the residence. Payne was not at the premises when Police arrived. A warrant for arrest was obtained for Payne for first degree burglary.

On 10-17-2012, at 5:21 pm, I arrived at the Police Department in reference to a pornography call. The reporting party stated the incident happend in the city of High Point between 10-16-2012 and 10-17-2012.
On 10/16/2012, at 1723hrs, I responded to the above address in reference to an Assault.
On Tuesday, 10/16/2012, I responded to 2608 Carsten Av in reference to a domestic disturbance. An arrest was made in this case.
On 10/15/12 at approximately 0250hrs I responded to a reported disturbance on Ridgecrest Dr.
On Monday Oct 15 2012, I responded to 1420 B E Commerce in reference to a vandalism of a window.

On Sunday, October 14th, 2012, at 1712 hours, I responded to 600-C Anaheim Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Shequla Wright who advised her ex-boyfriend, Mr. Tyrone Pratt, refused to leave her residence when asked to do so.  Ms. Wright stated Mr. Pratt left with her gold 2000 Ford Explorer without her permission while she was calling for police assistance.
On 10/14/2012 at 0724 hours I responded to 1322 Westchester Dr in reference to a female being assaulted by her boyfriend.
On 10-13-2012 at approximately 2305 hrs I responded to 218-I N Lindsay St reference a domestic disturbance IP.  Male was arrested on scene for assault.

On 10/13/2012 I responded to 2511-E Suffolk Av. In reference to a assault.  Upon arrival I spoke with the victim who stated she was assaulted by a subject who knocked on the door, made entry into the house looking for someone and assaulted the victim in the process.

On 10/12/2012 at 11:39pm I responded to 701 E Green Dr Apt 515 in response to domestic violence. The victim Pamela Bullock had bruising around her eyes and nose. Her fiance David Sanders admitted to punching her in the face.  Sanders was placed in the Guilford County Jail under a 48 hour domestic hold.

On 10/12/12 at approximately 1619 hours, I responded to a domestic related assault at 203-D Northpoint Avenue.  Upon arrival, I spoke with the victim who advised that her boyfriend had assaulted her.  Warrants are in the process of being taken out by the victim.
Subject was located down the street from the residence that he just left.  He had two cutting tools on his person and he was upset.  The items were taken from his person for his protection.

Officers responded to 701 Carr St on a report of a domestic disturbance that occurred earlier this date.  Upon arrival officers made contact with the victim who related that she had been struck in the face twice by Charles Russell who was her live in boyfriend.  Officers contacted Russell who admitted to striking Tammy Martin in the face with his open hand earlier this date.  Based on the confession by Russell and the statement made by Martin, I placed Russell under arrest and transported him to the magistrate`s office where he was held on a domestic Hold.

On 10/11/2012 I responded to the High Point Regional Hospital in referenence to an assault the male victim had been assaulted by his girlfriend at 601-G Granby Av leaving scratch marks on his neck. Both victim and suspect were arrested on warrants.

On October 8, 2012, I responded to 1117 Adams Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.Upon arrival, it was determined the defendant assaulted the victim by pulling her hair from her scalp and pointing a BB pistol at her.  The hair was found in the roadway and the BB pistol was hidden in a bookbag.The defendant was arrested for domestic violence and charged with Assault on a Female and Disorderly Conduct.

On 10-08-2012 around 1133 hours I responded to High Point Regional Hospital Emergency Room in reference to a possible domestic related assault.  Upon my arrival the victim stated that she was assaulted by her boyfriend and that as soon as she got away from him she drove to the ER.
On 10-7-12 at approximately 2057 hours I responded to 1018 Grace St in reference to a disturbance call.  Upon arrival I spoke with the victim who stated that they had been assaulted.
On October 07, 2012 at 1824 hours, I was dispatched to 1408 Hampstead Dr. reference Domestic Assault. The suspect is known and warrants have been obtained.

offense: ALL OTHER - HIT AND RUN (PERSONAL INJURY)
body: On 10/7/2012, at approximately 1315 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding a Hit and Run with injury. Upon my arrival I spoke with Mr. Willis and took a report on what happened.
On 10/13/2012 at 1707hrs I responded to the above address in reference to reporting a Domestic Disturbance that had occurred several days prior to the report date.
On Saturday, 10/06/2012, I responded to 520 Denny St reference to a domestic disturbance. Arrests were made in this case.

On October 6, 2012, officers responded to a disturbance on Carter Street.Upon arrival, I spoke to the victim who stated her boyfriend had assaulted her and left before police arrived.After speaking with the victim who was intoxicated and refused to cooperate and speaking with witnesses who also refused to cooperate, I spoke with Magistrate Newman who refused to issue a warrant based on the lack of credible information.

On Saturday October 6, I responded to 1100 Gordon Street in reference to a Domestic. Upon my arrival I spoke with a Catherine Earnhardt, who advised while she was laying in her bed her boyfriend Norman Baker came in the room screaming at her and then she was struck in the face.

On October 6, 2012, I responded to 519 Cross Street in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, I made contact with both parties involved. The female advised she had been struck in the face by her husband. The male was in bed when we arrived.I transported the female to the Magistrate`s Office, where she obtained a warrant for assault against her husband. I responded back to the above location and arrested her husband without problems.
On 10/05/12 at approximately 2103hrs, I responded to a reported assault at Ferndale Middle School.

On 10-04-2012 at approximately 23:17 hours I responded to S. Main St. near Fraley Rd. to a disturbance call. Upon my arrival I contacted the parties involved. After investigation both subject were arrested and placed in the custody of the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold. There is no further information at this time.

On Thursday, 10/4/12, at approximately 2030 hours, I responded to 3303 Crestview Drive regarding a domestic disturbance involving intimate partners.  Upon my arrival I met with spouses, Regina and Bryant Jacobs who told me they had a verbal argument that turned into a physical fight.  Bryant Jacobs had numerous bleeding scratches about his face and neck, which were photographed.  Regina Jacobs was arrested without incident and charged with Simple Assault.

On the 4th day of October, 2012 at approximately 1911 hours, I responded to 1600 E Green Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance call involving intimate partners.Upon arriving, both parties involved had signs of injury and an aggressor was unable to be determined.Both parties were placed under arrest and placed in the High Point Jail.

On 10/04/2012 at 1827 hours I responded to 1223 N Main St in reference to child neglect. Upon my arrival, the victim was in temporary custody of Lt Sellars of the High Point Police Department. The child had been found walking in heavy traffic in the middle of main street. Parents were located a short time later and the child was unharmed. There is no further information.

On 10-04-2012 at approximately 1403 hours I arrived to 305 Park St in reference to a domestic assault. Through further investigation a WFA has been obtained charging Mitchell Blocker with Assault on a Female.

At 1200 hours on 10/4/2012, I was dispatched to a Domestic Disturbance at 3006 Manchester Drive.  The 911 caller, Douglas Parker, reported that his son, Golden Parker, was tearing up items in the front yard.  Neighbors also called to report windows being damaged while officers were en route.  Upon arrival of the initial officer, Golden Parker was observed throwing landscaping rocks at the residence and was detained in handcuffs at that time.  Golden Parker had taken gardening tools and landscaping rocks and thrown those items at the victim`s vehicle as well as the residence.  Damage sustained consisted of the following:  two shattered passenger side windows, a shattered windshield, dents and scratches covering the entire body of the vehicle registered to the victim; 7 shattered double pane windows and bent window frames, holes in the front exterior door to the residence, shattered storm door glass and bent frame, holes in the wooden siding, and a mailbox post that was broken into two pieces.  Estimated damages to the vehicle was $3,500.00 and estimated damages to the residence and mailbox was $3,100.00.

On Thursday, October 4, 2012, at 0022 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance at 206-3 Old Winston Road.  I arrived on scene and spoke with the victim, Tangelena Toler, who stated that her husband, Russel Farris, came over to her residence, knocked on the door and she let him in the residence.  The victim stated after Mr. Farris entered the residence, punched her in the face, stole her keys and fled the area in an unknown direction of travel on a scooter.

On 10-03-2012 at approximately 0808 hours I arrived to 519 N Centennial St in reference to a domestic disturbance. Through further investigation I charged Antonio Burton and Jaracca Holman with assault. Both were confined to the High Point Detention Facility on a domestic hold.

On 10-03-2012 at approximately 1017 hours I responded to 701 Woodbury St in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I spoke with Whitney Lewis who advised she had been assaulted. The offender had left the scene prior to my arrival. A warrant was obtained for assault on a female for the offender listed.

On 10/02/12, around 2340 hours, the listed victim and listed offender engaged in an argument.  Upon being ordered to leave the premises, the listed offender broke out the living room window from the front porch, by striking it with a chunk of wood.  The offender left on foot prior to Police arrival.  The listed victim was advised how to press charges on the offender.  At the time of this report, she was undecided about seeking a charge against the offender.

On Tuesday, October 2, 2012 at 2032 hours I was dispatched to 1030 Clinard Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I arrived on scene and spoke with the offender, Kenneth Laubach, who advised that he and his daughter(victim), Barbara Denny, had been involved in a verbal confrontation regarding her moving out and taking her daughter (his granddaughter) to a new environment and grabbed her about the shoulders and forcibly placed her in a kitchen chair.I responded to the victim`s new address and spoke with her and inquired what had happened.  The victim stated that her father did not agree with the relationship she was in and had physically grabbed her and threw her into a chair.

On 10/02/2012 I responded to 1536 W. English Rd. Apt. 1 for a domestic disturbance call.  Upon arrival I spoke with Shelly Toliver, the victim, who could not tell me what had caused her injuries.  Upon examination of Mrs. Toliver`s apartment and witness statements, an arrest warrant was obtained for assault for Mr. Steven Hawkins.  A lookout was given with Mr. Hawkins description.

On 10-02-2012 I responded to 310-2E Ardale Dr. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival the victim stated that she was assaulted by her boyfriend.   Upon further investigation the suspect was located and charged accordingly

On October 2, 2012 at approximately 0352 hours, I was dispatched to a report of a woman screaming in the area of 1422 South Main Street.  While enroute, Police communications updated that the suspect and the possible female were driving a car with a flat tire on Park Street.  Officer Dan Sellars and I had dealt with this couple earlier and remembered that they lived on Blair Street.Officers went to Blair Street where the female was standing in the middle of the road.  She had an obvious injury above her right eye, scratches on the left side of her neck and a swollen lip (on the left side).  We asked where her boyfriend was and she stated that he was at the house, 610 Blair Street.  She told me that they have been together for about a year.  She also went on to tell me that he did not hit her, she fell down on her front porch and that the scratches on her neck were from "rough sex".When we dealt with this couple earlier (reference a disturbance call from Walmart - 2628 South Main Street), Lucas had apparently got into an argument with an employee at the store, who in turn called the Police.  They left before we got there, with Dickens driving, northbound on North Main Street with a front left flat tire.  Officer Sellars, who stopped the car on the lot of the Salvation Army, advised me that he actually was in close proximity to Dickens to determine if she had been drinking or not and is positive that there were no injuries to her face at all.  The injuries occurred when the call came in reporting a woman screaming.Lts. Tony English, Jay Yandle and I went down the street to 610 Blair Street to attempt to make contact with Lucas.  My intention was to arrest him for domestic assault.  He came to a window and told us to get off his property.  We explained to him that he needed to come to the door and talk to us.  After about 5 minutes, he came to the door and unlocked it.  Lt. English and I arrested him at the front door and walked him to my car.  Lucas was trying to pull away, especially during search and, at first, refused to get in the back of my car.  He also smelled very heavily of alcohol.  Lucas would contend that he did not hurt Dickens, that she had hurt herself on the steps.  Of course, Dickens had told Lucas this information through the door at the house just before the arrest.  Lucas` mom had come to Blair Street and was also told by Dickens that she fell on the front steps.I transported Lucas to the Police Department for processing, barely gathering his Pistol photo.  He was quite uncooperative with processing and we decided not to attempt to fingerprint him in his intoxicated and agitated state.  I transported him to the Magistrate`s Office (along with the fill-in of Lt. Yandle) on the charges of assault on a female (domestic related).  I was given probable cause by Magistrate Newman and placed Lucas in jail under a domestic hold.While swearing in and testifying for the case, Dickens was in the lobby trying to ask questions about the case.  I instructed her that she was given all the information that she needed at the scene and that she needed to go home.  She would continue to stand at the window and ask the same questions over and over.  I explained to her that she was disrupting the proceedings and that if she didn`t leave, I was going to charge her with trespassing.  She continued and once I went towards the door, she walked out.  But, she was back a minute later.  I again asked her a couple of times to please leave so that I could finish what I was doing.  She refused, continuing to stand there.  I decided to arrest her for trespassing.  I brought her into the holding area and she was ultimately given a written promise to appear.  She walked back to her house without further problems.  It should be noted that while both were in the holding cells, Lucas would yell at Dickens that it was her fault the "cops were called" and when she would attempt to speak, he would tell her to shut up.Lucas was placed in jailed under a domestic hold.  He would continue to call Officers "cracker" and "punk ass" and that we had no reason to arrest him.  His eyes were extremely bloodshot red and he smelled heavily of alcohol.  He made threats to Officers (telling Lt. Yandle he had a bullet for him and that he was going to get me).  I added this information into his Pistol file.Dickens was given the domestic violence paperwork on the scene on Blair Street.
This report was faxed to High Point Communications, this date, by Rowan County DSS.
On 9-30-12 I responded to the intersection of W English Rd. and Chestnut Dr. in reference to a female being assaulted.
On September 30, 2012, I responded to 216 Seashire Ct, in reference to a domestic assault that had already occurred.
On September 30, 2012, I responded to 216 Seashire Ct, in reference to a larceny from motor vehicle that had already occurred. For further on this incident see incident report 2012-35466,

On September 30, 2012, I responded to 327 Hodgin Street in reference to a domestic assault. Upon arrival, I made contact with both parties involved. Each subject stated that they slapped the other person. Neither subject was injured. Both were cited and released. Male subject left the residence.
On 9/30/12 at approximately 1345hrs, I took a report regarding a domestic related assault.

On the above date and time I responded to 402 New St. in reference to a domestic dispute.  Bobby Kiser was found to be apparently unstable and was transported to the HPRHS ER for an involuntary commitment.  Mr. Kiser`s wife advised that he had been in possession of a handgun and that she did not want to keep it.  Ms. Kiser advised that the gun belonged to another person, possibly named Sam or Scott.  She had no other information on the owner.  The gun was taken and logged into property.   Per ATF trace, the registered owner can pick it up.
Both subjects were arrested for violation of 50-B order.

On Saturday September 29, 2012, at approximately 1450 hours, I was dispatched to 1301 Furlough Avenue in reference to an unknown trouble.Upon arrival, I spoke with the caller who advised her boyfriend had broken the window out of the screen door after an argument.  No arrests were made at this time.

On 09/28/12 at about 7:30 PM I responded to 932 Randolph St Apt B for a reported domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I met with the victim, Shamara Hunter, who stated that her sometime boyfriend, Rocky McDuffie Sr. had assaulted her. I observed visible injuries to her face including a large knot on her right temple and cracked and bleeding lips. I also saw blood on the couch and floor in the living room. Hunter refused EMS but stated that she wanted to prosecute McDuffie. Hunter stated that McDuffie came into her house shortly after she returned home from her mothers. He demanded to know who the man he had seen at her house earlier in the day was. She told him it was her brother but he did not believe her. Hunter stated that McDuffie punched her repeatedly in the face with a closed fist and then kicked her in the stomach after she fell to the ground. Hunter stated that she ran to find a phone and eventually ended up at her mother`s house where she called 911. She then returned home to wait for police.Lab responded for photos. A warrant for assault on a female was issued by Magistrate Garber. McDuffie could not be located at the time of this report.

On 09-27-2012 I responded to 619 Martha Pl in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I was met by Mr. Gragg.  He stated that he and his girlfriend had gotten into an argument about her leaving and she had assaulted him.  He had visible marks on his neck from where she had scratched him.

On this date I responded to 230-D Brentwood Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival, Officer Six was already on scene and speaking with Mr. and Mrs. Jackson.  I began speaking with Mr. Jackson and he advised he and his wife were involved in a verbal altercation.

On this date I responded to 1807-C Fern Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The victim Ms. Houston advised she had been assaulted.  The suspect Mr. Scurry had left the scene.  Officer Sizemore advised he observed the subject running through Carson Stout.  Mr. Scurry was captured without incident.

On 09-26-2012 at 3:53 am, I responded to 148-A Old Mill Rd., in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with the victim who advised that she had been assaulted by her husband several times.  The first incident occurred at 216 Hedgecock Rd. at approximately 3:00 am and the second incident occurred at 148-A Old Mill Rd. at approximately 3:45 am.  The husband was located and subsequently charged with assault.

On 09-24-2012, at around 10:40 pm, I responded to 207 Apt H Taylor Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival, I met with the victim, Mrs Brittany Belser. Mrs Belser advised that her child`s father, Mr Tremane Wall, came to her residence, tried to kick in the back door, then vandalized her vehicle by kicking it and jumping on top of the hood. Mr Wall was not present on scene upon my arrival. I advised Mrs Belser to take out warrants for Mr Wall. Lab Tech Squires arrived on scene and processed the vandalism.

On September 24, 2012 at 2058 hours, I was dispatched to 306 Woodbrook Drive for a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival and after investigation of the incident, an arrest was made for assault with a deadly weapon and assault on a female.  One party was jailed and the other e-cited at the house to stay home with the 12-year old.

At 1148 hours on 9/24/2012 I was dispatched to a kidnapping call at 3892 Banbridge Drive.  Upon arriving on scene, Karen Torrella advised that she was the temporary guardian of her 2 year old grandson, and that the biological mother took the child and left in an unknown direction of travel.  After investigating paperwork on hand, it was determined that there was no current court documents preventing the biological mother from taking the child.  A lookout was provided regarding the welfare of the child and Torrella as well as the biological father were advised on civil options for pursuing the matter further.  Photocopies of paperwork provided as well as a photo of the child were entered into the High Point Police Department as evidence.

On this date, I spoke to the victim who advised he and his girlfriend got into an argument. He advised she was accusing him of cheating on her and became angry and assaulted him. Lab responded to take photos of his injuries. Warrants were obtained on the suspect.

On the above date and time I responded to 1017-A Richland St. in reference to a domestic incident.  Resident Stacy Martin advised that Herman Rorie had become angry and broke her front door by punching it with his fists.  The front door was cracked and in the center and significantly damaged.
On 9/22/12, at approximately 1456hrs, I responded to a reported vandalism in progress on Edgeworth St.

On 9/21/2012 at about 10:00 PM I responded with other units to locate a dark colored dodge durango that had left the scene of an assault. Ofc Parvin advised over the radio that he had witnessed an assault by a male on a female and both of the subjects were in this vehicle. Upon locating the vehicle Ofc Parvin confirmed that the occupants were the same as involved in the assault. He stated that during an argument the male, identified as Marcus Jones, had pushed the female, identified as Shelby Fowler, with both hands causing her to stumble backwards. Jones was arrested and transported without incident. He was charged with assault on a female. It was domestic related because the parties live together and are in an intimate relationship.
On 09/21/2012, I responded to 305 Prospect St.  Upon my arrival multiple subjects were involved in a disturbance.  As a result, one subject was taken to jail on domestic related charges.
On 9/21/2012, at approximately 1740 hours, I was dispatched a call regarding a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I arrested Ms. Ingram for domestic assault.

On Thursday, September 20th, 2012, at 2121 hours, I responded to 502 Steele Street in reference to a vandalism.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Mr. Michael Griffin, who advised the front exterior window facing Steele Street had been broken.  I observed both panes of the window broken out.

On 09-19-2012 at approximately 2310 hrs I responded to 221 Dorothy St.  Upon arrival I met with the caller in the front yard.  It was determined the caller was the suspect, same was arrested on scene for assault.
On September 19, 2012 at 0931 hours I responded to the 2900 block of McLauren Ct. in reference to a public disturbance.

On 09-18-2012 at 23:20 hours I responded to 300 Oakwood Street Apartment 2B in reference to a  domestic disturbance. Upon arrival on scene I made contact with both parties. On Tuesday, September 18, 2012 I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance at 2301 apartment K Shadow Valley Road. The victim stated as she was preparing dinner the offender was knocking on the door and was let into the house.  The victim stated at that point words were exchanged and the offender threw an item at her and attempted to strike her via closed fist, scratching her on the right side of her face.I examined the victim`s face and did locate and observe a scratch mark about her right side of her nose.The offender was arrested and taken to the magistrate`s office where probable cause for the arrest was found.

On 09-17-2012, at 1:59pm, I responded to 1311 East Green Drive in reference to a Domestic Disturbance. The victim stated her and her boyfriend got into an argument and he assaulted her. On 09/16/2012 at around 9:45 pm, I responded to Baker Rd at Hwy 29/70 in reference to an assault. Upon my arrival I met with the victim Mrs Natasha Brown. On Monday, September 17, 2012 at approximately 1240 hours in the northeast area of High Point, NC, it was reported to me that a juvenile student had been assaulted over the weekend.This incident is still being investigated.  No arrest have been made at this time.

On 09/10/12 at 0026 hrs. I responded to 3713 Oak Chase Dr. in reference to an assault.  Upon arrival I spoke with victim #1, Mrs. Mayra Herrera who had an obvious laceration to the back of her head and several scratches on her face.  Mrs. Herrera was highly upset and was initially unable to explain what had happened.  Guilford County EMS arrived and began to treat the victim.  The victim was transported to Moses Cone Med Center at 2630 Willard Dairy Road for treatment.     I spoke with Ms. Herrera and asked her what happened and she stated that she was assaulted by her husband during an argument.  Mrs. Herrera stated that her husband assaulted her by striking her in the face with his fist, kicking her in the stomach, and hitting her in the head with a large belt buckle.     I obtained a warrant for arrest on the suspect, who had fled the scene, for Felony Assault With a Deadly Weapon Inflicting Serious Injury and Assault on a Female.  A BOL was put out on the suspect.  Photographs were taken of the victim`s injuries and the victim`s shirt was logged in as evidence.  I provided all domestic violence forms to the victim.
On 09/27/2012, I spoke to a female subject at the police department in reference to a larceny.

On the 9th day of September, 2012 at approximately 0320 hours, I responded to 211 Hay St in reference to a domestic violence intimate partner call.Upon arriving, I made contact with the witness who stated that there was a male inside the residence making threats to the female inside and her children.As officers maintained positions outside of the residence the suspect exited the residence and was taken into custody for domestic criminal trespass.

On this date, I was dispatched to the ER in reference to a domestic assault that took place at 2501 Dallas Avenue. However, she was admitted to hospital for unrelated matters. On 9/2/12 at approximately 0446 hours, I responded to 620-21B N Hamilton Street in reference to a domestic-related assault.  Upon arrival, I spoke with the victim who advised that she had been assaulted by her boyfriend, Muhammad Abdul-Salam.  Abdul-Salam was arrested and placed into jail on a domestic hold for assault on a female and communicating threats.

On 09/02/12 at 0344 hrs. I responded to 3441 Lilliefield St. in reference to a domestic disturbance IP with a reported assault.  Upon arrival I was met in the street by the male suspect who repeatedly told me to "take me to jail, I assaulted her."  I asked the suspect what happened and he advised me that he had gotten into an argument with his girlfriend because he had been drinking and that he assaulted her after she asked him to leave.  The suspect advised that he pushed her on both hands and that he broke her right hand.  The suspect also advised that he took her to the hospital for treatment after the assault.     I then spoke with the victim, Ms. Erica Rios, about the incident.  I noticed that she did have a hospital ID bracelet on her right wrist and that her right hand was red and slightly swollen.  Ms. Rios initially stated that she hurt her wrist at work and that she was not assaulted by the suspect.  Ms. Rios stated that she only wanted the suspect to leave but did not want him arrested.  The suspect continued to say that he had assaulted the victim and advised me to "just take me to jail so I can get out of here."  I further questioned the victim and, after giving conflicting stories of what happened, she admitted that the suspect did push her and hurt her hand.  She stated that it happened sometime between 0100 hrs. and 0200 hrs. at their residence of 3441 Lilliefield Ln.  The victim did state that her hand/wrist was not broken but only sprained and she did not require any type of cast or brace.  The victim continued to ask that the suspect not be arrested and did not wish to provide a written statement about the incident.     The suspect was placed into custody and transported to the police department for processing.  Copies of all domestic violence paperwork were provided to the victim by Officer C. E. Wade.  The suspect was charged with domestic assault on a female and underage consumption of alcohol and was placed into the custody of the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold and has a court date of 10/08/12.

The victim stated that between 0015 hours and 0030 hours on this date, she and the offender got into an argument over the use of her vehicle.  The offender assaulted the victim in the front yard of her residence.

On Friday, August 31st, 2012, I was dispatched to 115-2B Chestnut Dr. in reference to a domestic disturbance.

On Thursday, August 30, 2012, at 1438 hours, I observed the vehicle listed in this report southbound on N Centennial St in the Kirkman Park school zone.  The vehicle was traveling 40 MPH in the 25 MPH school zone.  I stopped the vehicle and identified the driver as Zepeda-Quintero.  The front seat passenger and vehicle owner, Paul, was the front seat passenger.  There were two small children in the back seat.  Zepeda-Quintero was cited for driving while his license was revoked and speeding in a school zone.  Paul confessed that she knew Zepeda-Quintero was not licensed and she was cited for allowing an unlicensed driver to drive her vehicle.        A DCI check revealed that there is a domestic violence protection order against Zepeda-Quintero and the protected person is Paul.  By being in the presence of Paul, Zepeda-Quintero was in violation of the order.  I arrested Zepeda-Quintero and photographed and fingerprinted him at the police department.  He was placed in the High Point jail under a domestic hold.
On 8/30/2012, at approximately 0340 hours, I was dispatched to a 911 hang up. After an investigation, Mr. Watson was arrested for Assault on a Female.
On Wednesday, 08/29/2012, I responded to 533 Roy Av in reference to an assault. An arrest was made in this case.

On this date, police were dispatched to an assault, which already occurred. This assault was classified as being domestic, and a WFA was obtained for Assault on a Female, and a BOLO was issued for the suspect.
On August 28, 2012, the defendant was arrested for Smple Assault as a result of domestic violence.  The defendant was incarcerated under a Domestic Hold.

On 08-28-2012 I responded to 1007 Wilson Place in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I spoke to all parties involved and based on my investigation I placed the male party, Keith Easterling, under arrest for domestic Assault on a Female.  Also during the investigation I found more evidence and I charged Mr. Easterling with Felony Possession of Schedule I.  He was placed in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On 8-28-12, myself and other officers responded to a reported domestic dispute at 1214-B Adams St.  The caller, Rodney Watkins, had told Communications that Adrienne Townsend had turned on the gas in his apartment and was threatening to set it on fire.  When I arrived on the scene, there were already Fire and Police units at the residence.  Upon entering the residence, I could smell that either gasoline or kerosene had been spilled out in the residence.  Mr. Watkins stated that his girlfriend, Adrienne Townsend, had poured gasoline inside the residence and threatened to set the apartment on fire.Ms. Townsend was sitting on a couch in the living room of the apartment.  I observed a disposable lighter sitting on the floor in front of her between her feet.  I asked Townsend about the incident, and she stated that she did pour gasoline inside the residence.  I placed Townsend under arrest, and a search of her person located a small bag of marijuana in her right front pants pocket.  The scene was processed, with photographs taken of the location.  The lighter and a gas can that was found in the living room were collected as evidence.  Townsend was processed and charged with Attempted First Degree Arson, Communicating Threats, and Misdemeanor Possession of Marijuana.  She was placed in the custody of the Guilford County Jail under a $10,000 secured bond.

On 08/28/2012 at about 1:45 AM I was dispatched to 2506-A Friends Av for a 911 hangup. A second hangup was recieved while I was en route followed by a 911 call from the occupants of 2506-B to report a disturbance and someone being stabbed next door. Officer Wolf arrived in the area first and encountered a gold in color Ford Taurus displaying NC tag ALW-6666 at the intersection of Brentwood and Friends Av. He signaled the vehicle to stop and found that the victim, Dontrelle Jenkins, had been stabbed and was in the front seat. A passenger in the back seat, K`Shawn Moore-Baker, was detained as a possible suspect and a kitchen knife was located in the backseat where he was sitting. EMS responded and transported the victim to the hospital. K`Shawn made statements indicating he had stabbed his brother during a fight. He was arrested and transported without incident and a warrant for AWDWISI was issued. Lab responded to the scene and processed both the residence where the incident occurred and the vehicle.

On this date, a southside resident reported a disturbance involving her, her new boyfriend, and her ex-boyfriend. The complainant advised that her male friend arrived at her residence, and within fifteen minutes of his arrival, her old boyfriend began calling her boyfriend`s phone, "threatening to kick his ass". Shortly there after, the ex-boyfriend was beating on her residence door, threatening to., "kick his ass". At some point of this, the complainant advised she heard what sounded to be a gun shot behind the residence.The suspect was not located, and this investigation continues.
