On August 19, 2012, I was dispatched to 913 Skeet Club Rd. in reference to a possible breaking and entering.  I contacted the resident, Brianna Johnson, who advised that her ex-boyfriend, Dexter Glymph, got into her house somehow, and got in a fight with a guy that she had in the house with her.

On Sunday August 19, 2012 I responded to 3441 Lillifield Ln in reference to a domestic disturbance.  When I arrived I spoke with the victim in this matter Mrs. Rios and the offender Mr. Romero-Cuevas.  As I knocked on the door I was meet first by Mr. Romero-Cuevas who stated that he had assaulted Ms. Rios by pulling her hair.  While Mr. Romero-Cuevas was admitting guilt to the assault Ms. Rios was denying that any assault had taken place.  I then asked to speak with Ms. Rios alone and I had her step out onto the front walkway.      When I spoke with Ms. Rios she stated that they had gotten into an argument over some twitter posts that Mr. Romero-Cuevas was making and that he did not pull her hair but admitted that he had pushed her at one point, but did so in a manner that was not forceful but to merely move her out of his way.  I examined Ms. Rios for injury but could not find any bruises or redness.  Ms. Rios`s hair was disheveled but could not find any clumps missing or injury to her head.  Ms. Rios stated that there have been assaults in the past and that the charges were dropped during that incident.      I then spoke with Mr. Romero-Cuevas who admitted to me that he had pulled Ms. Rios hair while they were arguing over the phone twitter messages.  Mr. Rios stated that he also pushed Ms. Rios but also stating that it was not in an assaultive manner but to merely move her out of his way.  Mr. Romero-Cuevas stated that after he had pulled her hair he called for police to turn himself in.      I then placed Mr. Romero-Cuevas under arrest for assault on a female even though no physical injury could be seen or was alleged by the victim.  I have Mr. Romero-Cuevas confessing to the assault recorded on my ICOP in car camera.  Mr. Romero-Cuevas was transported to the county building where he was placed under a domestic hold and placed in the High Point jail.      While in transport to the magistrates office Mr. Romero-Cuevas made the statement while in the backseat of my patrol car that he didn`t actually assault Ms. Rios and that he was just saying  that to get away from her.  He then made the statement that there was probably a different way of handling that.  This was the first and only statement of this manner.      At this time this case is closed cleared by arrest.  The only evidence in this case is the ICOP recording which will be logged in as evidence.
On August 18, 2012 at approximately 1916 hours, I responded to 1475-F West Avenue in reference to a public disturbance. It was later reclassified as a domestic disturbance.

On August 17, 2012 I responded to a domestic disturbance that took place near the 400 block of Hobson St. Upon arrival I spoke with Ms Howarda. Ms Howarda said that she had been struck once in the face by a man. The man left the scene prior to the arrival of the police. Ms Howarda and the man know each other.   Ms Howarda did not sustain any serious injuries. The case is under investigation.

On August 20, 2012, officers responded to the 1204 Tipton Street about a domestic disturbance.  While present, the defendant admitted to slapping the victim on a previous date and assaulting the victim before police arrived.  The victim confirmed both assaults and the defendant was arrested for 2 counts of Assault on a Female.

On 8/17/2012 at around 1515 hours I responded to 116 Hoskins St for a report of a domestic assault between father and son.  When I arrived I spoke to Larry Brown who stated that his son, Malik Brown, had gotten into a scuffle over him being disrespectful.  Larry stated that Malik dented the top of the pickup truck in the driveway while messing around.  When Larry confronted Malik, Malik got mouthy with father.  Malik and Larry started to push each other around.Malik stated that his dad started the fight when he was disrespectful.  Malik said that he was defending himself from Larry, his father.Both subjects had signs of assault and a primary aggressor could not be determined.  Based on the totality of the circumstances I advised warrants to both parties.
On this date I responded in reference to an assault call.  During the investigation a warrant was obtained for Dominique Cruz-Garcia for Assault with Deadly Weapon.

On Friday August 17th 2012 around 0735 hours I responded to 3630-A Laurel Bluff Ci. in reference to a domestic disturbance. One of the involved parties had left prior to my arrival. Upon arrival I spoke to Tierrah Jackson. She stated that had been in an argument and an assault had occurred.

On 8-15-2012 at 10:39pm I responded to 701 Woodbury St. in reference to Domestic Disturbance.Upon arriving at the above location I made contact with the victim who stated the suspect grabbed her by the neck, pulled her hair out, and scratched the back of her neck.Photographs were taken of victim injuries.

On this date and time, I responded to 318 Amhurst Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Ms. McBean who advised that she and her boyfriend of four years had been in an altercation.

On August 13, 2012 I responded to Juanita Hills in reference to a public disturbance.  When I arrived officers had already made contact with the victim.  The victim had obvious brusing on her face and small cuts on her hand.  The suspect had already left before officers arrived on the scene.  Officers attempted to locate the suspect at a near by address.  The suspect was not found. A warrant will be issued for Assualt on a Female and Injury To Real Property.
On 8/13/12 at approximately 0255hrs I responded to a reported domestic disturbance.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 08-12-2012 I responded to 2429 W Green Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival Officer Bowick was already on scene. He was speaking with Mr. Lord, and as he was telling me the description of Ms. Martin she walked into the hallway we were in.  Ms. Martin stated that she had been getting her clothes off of the fence line when she saw another female in Mr. Lord`s room. This made her upset and she began yelling at Mr. Lord.  Mr. Lord stated that Ms. Martin threatened him while she was holding a knife.  Ms. Martin was arrested for violation of a 50B order.

On August 12, 2012 at approximately 0456 hours, I was dispatched to an assault call on Northpoint Avenue.  According to the caller 3 black males were walking through the parking lot while she was smoking a cigarette.  One of the black males approached her and struck her in the face with her fist.

On Sunday August 12, 2012 I responded to 417-B White Oak Street in reference to an Assault with a Deadly Weapon. Upon my arrival I spoke with the victim Edward Covington, who advised his girl friend Niesha Torrence, had struck him in the head with a hatchet.
Victim claimed to be assault by a acquaintance while consuming alcohol.  Victim is under age and can not legally consume alcohol.

On August 11, 2012 at approximately 0059 hours, I responded to the 3000 block of Loftyview Road in reference to a domestic disturbance that had already occurred.Both parties involved were arrested at this time.

I responded to 2011 Eastchester Drive in reference to residential burglary.  Upon arrival, I met with the complainant/victim, Derrick Howell.  Howell stated someone made entry to his residence sometime between 0830 and 1750HRS this date and took the 32" flat screen television and remote from the living room.  Howell stated the suspect entered through a side window by removing the portable air conditioning unit from the window sill.  The suspect took the television and exited through the back door.  Howell stated when he arrived home, he started to put the key in the back door lock, but found the door was ajar.  Howell stated the front screen door was opened slightly, but the front door was still locked. .
On 8-9-12 I responded in reference to a report of a domestic disturbance at 201 Brinkley Place.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 08-09-12 at 0627 hours I responded to a domestic disturbance at 610-D Hawthorne Avenue.  The Victim stated that the Offender was violating an ex-parte order that was issued on 08-08-12.  The Offender was arrested and placed in the Guilford County Jail.

On 08-09-2012, at 0129 hours, I responded to a reported domestic disturbance at 2019 N Main St.  Upon arriving, I spoke to Meredith Jones and she stated that her ex-boyfriend, Wesley Kersey, had broken into her apartment at 1003 N Main St.  I gave Jones a ride back to her apartment at 1003 N  Main St., and upon arriving Kersey was sitting on the curb outside of her apartment.  Kersey admitted to having gone back into the apartment after Jones had put him out.  Kersey  was arrested for misdemeanor breaking and entering.

On 08-08-2012 at 7:57 hours Tonja Evans reported she was staying at 400 South Main Street with Ronald Peterman.  While in the room, an argument ensued and Peterman threw Evans onto the bed and punched her two to three times in the ribs and choked her with his hands.  Evans was trying to call 911, but Peterman grabbed her phones and threw them against the wall.
On 08-08-2012 at approximately 0105 hours I arrived to the police department in reference to a domestic assault. Through further investigation Andrew Mitchell was charged with Assault on a Female.

On 08-07-2012 I was dispatched to 206 A Taylor Ave in reference to a disturbance inside of the apartment. When I arrived no one was at the location. After being at the location for a few minutes a car pulled up with three black females and two babies in it.  One of the females was the resident of the above location.  She stated her and her boyfriend had been fighting and she was going to take warrants out on him.  The female had been hit in the face.While on scene subject was seen in the parking lot and arrested.

On 8-7-2012 at 7:33pm I responded to the 2000 blk of Leonard Av. in reference to report of Assault.Upon arriving at the above location I made contact with the victim who advised his ex girlfriend struck his right leg with her car.

On the 8th day of August, 2012 at approximately 1145 hours, I responded to 701 Woodbury St in reference to a domestic assault that had just occurred.Upon arriving, I spoke with the victim, Ms Whitney Lewis, who stated that her boyfriend, Mr Nickolian York, assaulted her by spraying her with pepper spray/mace.York was not on scene when I arrived.Warrants will be obtained against York for assault on a female.

On 08/06/2012, I responded to 810 WORTH in reference to a DOMESTIC DISTURABANCE that had been on-going for the last several hours. Prior to this incident, the HIGH POINT POLICE DEPARTMENT (HPPD) had responded to this address twice on this date to settle a dispute between SARAH BENNETT BAILEY and her ex-husband, JEROME BAILEY. During one of earlier incidents (Case #:2012224379), SARAH BENNETT BAILEY had trespassed her husband from the property. At 2143hrs, I responded back to the residence and observed JEROME BAILEY exiting 810 WORTH ST and walk to a neighbors house. Because JEROME BAILEY had been tresspassed in my presence, and the fact that he has/had been living separate from his ex-wife, he was arrested for DOMESTIC CRIMINAL TRESPASS in violation of G.S. 14-134.4(A).

On 08/06/2012, at 1415 hours, I responded to 2903-B Esco Pl in reference to a public disturbance. Upon my arrival, I spoke with the victim, who advised me that the suspect had broken into her house and assaulted her. Warrants were obtained on the suspect.

On 08/06/2012, at approximately 0207 hours, I responded to 2311 Purdy Avenue in reference to a 911 hang up.  I made contact with the caller/victim, Ms. Misty Collins.  Ms. Collins stated her ex boyfriend, Mr. Dwayne Buchanan, had gotten into her residence.  Mr. Buchanan was told by Ms. Collins earlier in the evening to not return to the residence in front of me.  Mr. Buchanan was found hiding in a closet.  Mr. Buchanan was arrested and turned over to the High Point Jail under a domestic hold.

On 08-05-2012, at approximately 9:54pm, I was dispatched to 1707 Welborn in reference to a Domestic Disturbance involving intimate partners.   When I arrived, I was met by the victim who at first did not want to report the assault.  However, after being convinced by her sister, she reported she was assaulted by the male suspect who lives at this address.

On 08/05/2012 I responded to 2521-D Suffolk Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I arrived and made contact with the subjects involved.  Both subjects had visible, minor injuries.  Their testimonies were completely different and each accused the other of being the primary aggressor.  Probable cause existed to arrest both parties and arrests were made without incident.
On 8/5/12, at approximately 0127hrs, I responded to a reported domestic disturbance.
On August 04, 2012 at 2326 hours I responded to the 200 block of Woodbury street reference an assault.

At about 1900 hours on this date I was flagged down in the 1900 block of S. Main St. by Maria Grant.  She reported to me that her husband, Gerald had struck her in the face.  Mr. Grant was arrested and charged with Assault on a Female.

On Saturday August 4, 2012 at 6:20 pm a call was dispatched to 200 N Centennial St in reference to an assault with a deadly weapon.Upon arrival contact was made with the victim Brian Dewon Quick and the suspect Towano Dellaresse Bolton behind the laundry mat at 200 N Centennial St.Quick had a laceration on left side of his neck, his left upper chest, right arm and right lower back from a box cutter.Quick advised that he and Bolton had been drinking all day and got into an argument.  The argument escalated to the point where Bolton brandished a box cutter, and cut him.Bolton was arrested and charged with Assault With A Deadly Weapon Inflicting Serious Injury and currently in the Guilford County Jail with a $2,500.00 secured bond.Quick was transported to the High Point Regional Health Systems Emergency Room for treatment.  At the time of the report Quick has been released from the hospital.

I responded to Piedmont Pwy near Regency Rd in reference to an assault in progress in a motor vehicle, described as a black or dark gray Mercedes.  The caller stated the car stopped on Piedmont Pwy and the female was assaulting the male subject.  The caller further stated the male was not hitting back.  Upon arrival, I found a black Mercedes Benz 4d stopped in the left turn lane from Piedmont Pwy to Sheraton Ct.  There was a male and female subject in the median.
On August 03,2012 at 1519 hours, I was dispatched to High Point Hospital Emergency Room reference an assault that occurred on Guyer St. The suspect is known and a warrant has been issued.

On 8/3/12 at about 11:40 AM I responded to the Kangaroo station at 2608 S Main St for a report of child abuse. When I arrived I met with the suspect, Devin McLendon. She stated that her 9 year old son Fabian had been caught stealing at Wal-Mart and she was disciplining him. Several witnesses stated that Devin was beating the child with a closed fist in a very excessive manner. I saw the child and saw no visible signs of injury. All three of the children with Devin appeared healthy and were dressed appropriately.

On this date, I responded to a domestic disturbance between the caller and her live in boyfriend. She advised he came home drunk from a bar and started arguing and waking up the children. She advised he communicated a threat toward her prior to my arrival. She refused my assistance in obtaining a warrant on him for the crime.
Kadisha Belk reported information about a sexual assault involving a juvenile.

On 07/31/2012 at 1206 hours I responded to 811 Hendrix St in reference to an attempted suicide. Upon my arrival, the victim was responsive and being treated by EMS personnel. I spoke with the reporting party, who advised his wife had taken approximately 20 pills of pain medication. The victim was taken to High Point Regional Hospital for treatment.
On 8-2-12 at approximately 1534 hours I received a child abuse call.

On 07/30/2012  at approximately 03:47 am, I was dispatched to 701 S Elm St in reference to a domestic disturbance.On arrival I met with a female who had visible signs of assault, the suspect was arrested and placed in the High Point Jail under a domestic hold.Photos`s were taken of the females injuries.

On 7/30/2012 at around 2320 hours I was dispatched to 1220 Delk Drive for a domestic disturbance.  When I arrived I spoke to Carmen Reyna-Jimenez.  Carmen stated that her husband Francisco Elorza-Juarez had hit and choked her.  Carmen had no signs of being assualted.  Francisco on the other hand had scratches to the face and chest.  Based on all evidence at hand Officers arrested Carmen Reyna-Jimenez for assault.

On 07/30/2012 I responded to 1475-D West Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival it was determined that a vandalism and assault had occured.  Zoiwana Mills was arrested for vandalism and Johnny Gamble was arrested for assault on a female.

On Sunday July 29, 2012, I responded to 1717 Brooks Avenue in reference to a Domestic Assault. Upon my arrival, I spoke with Mamie Gayten, who advised that last night the father to her child, Ricky Haywood, came over. Gayten advised after about four hours Haywood became very upset and then assaulted her. Gayten also advised Haywood attempted to strike her with a 2x4 piece of wood.

Police responded to a reported disturbance at 605-E Grayson St.  Upon police arrival the victim advised she was choked and punched in the face by the suspect who was her ex-boyfriend.  The suspect left the area and was not located.  Warrants were obtained.

Responded to domestic dispute at above location.  Upon arrival, spoke with complainant, who advised that he was assaulted by his girlfriend.  Victim had minor injuries to face.  Suspect was arrested on scene.
On Sunday July 29, 2012 I responded to 910-A Richland St. in reference to an assault that had just occurred.

On this date, Officers were dispatched to 220 E Peachtree Dr. in reference to a domestic assault that had occurred.  Upon arrival, Officers determined an assault had occurred and the Offender was arrested.

I responded to 4315 Cedarcroft Ct Apt 3D in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I met with the complainant/victim.  He was standing on the sidewalk in front of the building.  Lt. W. Heaviland had arrived shortly before I did and was speaking with the complainant/victim.

On July 27, 2012 I responded to 2321 Purdy Av in reference to an assault complaint. The victim, Shantana Roberts stated that her husband assaulted her. She was transported to the county building where she obtained a warrant for assault on a female and communicating threats.

I responded to 1313 Mcguinn Dr. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  While enroute I was advised by Police Communications the male suspect had left on foot.  Upon arrival, I met with the complainant/victim.

On July 25, 2012 I responded to 2360-2A in reference to a domestic violence complaint. I contacted the victim, Ebony Reid, who stated that her ex-boyfriend had assaulted her. Reid took out warrants for the assault.

On July 25,2012 at 2057 hours, I was dispatched to 2012 Dallas Av. reference an assault. The victim knows the suspect. I obtained warrants on the suspect, no arrest has been made at the time of this report.

O July 25, 2012 a cinder block was thrown through a sliding glass door at this apartment.  When I arrived there was a big hole in the middle part of the glass.  It did not appear anyone had entered the apartment.  The apartment complex maintenance man arrived and cleaned up the glass and was going to repair same.  I took photographs of the cinder block inside the apartment and the door without glass.  Officers had responded several times earlier in the morning to this address.

On 07/24/2012 at approximately 1756 hours I responded to 2102 Francis ST in reference to an active domestic disturbance between sisters.  Upon my arrival I made contact with Mrs Elizabeth Piccolo and her sister, Mrs Allison Byerly, who advised that they had been engaged in a physical confrontation which stemmed from a verbal argument.  Subsequent to investigation, Mrs Byerly was arrested and charged with simple assault.  There is no witness information.

On 07-24-2012 at 17:44 hours, Mr. Ron Mintz (Reporting Party) observed a gold in color Toyota Camry traveling on Eastchester Drive, and the male driver was assaulting the female passenger.  Mr. Lucas Anthony Powers (Offender) was stopped on a suspect vehicle traffic stop in reference to the domestic dispute.  Mr. Lucas Anthony Powers was detained and upon further investigation, he was arrested for assault on a female involving Lauren Aileen Penny (victim), drinking beer/wine while driving, and misdemeanor child abuse.  Mr. Powers was place in High Point Jail under no bond because of the domestic assault on a female.

At approximately 11227 hours on 7/24/2012, the suspect and victim both called 911 to report an assault involving the other.  When I arrived on scene there were no vehicles in the driveway and the front door to the residence was slightly ajar.  While waiting for an additional officer, victim Underwood pulled into the driveway with his 8 year old son.  While speaking with Underwood, the suspect arrived on scene and admitted to the assault.  The suspect, Peterson, was arrested for Simple Assault Domestic Violence and transported to the Guilford County Jail.

On 07/23/12, at 2345 hours, Officers were dispatched to a Domestic Dispute at 1715 Leonard Av.  Upon Officers arrival, they met with both the suspect and the resident.  They were arguing over the suspect not residing there, and that he was not welcome at the residence.The suspect left the area and then returned to the property.  Officers were dispatched again to the property and observed the suspect in the front yard of the victims residence.  The suspect was then placed under arrest for Domestic Criminal Trespassing.

On July 23, 2012 I responded to the parking lot of the Hardees on N Main St in reference to a report of a domestic assault that had already occurred. Upon arrival I met with a victim. The victim refused all offers of assistance, The suspect was not on scene. The victim did not have any serious injuries. The suspect is unknown at this time.

On 07-23-2012 at 8:57 pm, I responded to 601 N. Elm St., in reference to a domestic related assault that occurred at 601-A Chestnut St.  The victim had visible injuries that were sustained from an assault by her husband.  I obtained a warrant on the alleged offender for assault on a female.  The warrant was served and the offender was released to the custody of the Guilford County Jail.

The victim called 911 around 1104 hours on 7/23/2012 and reported being assualted.  Hargrave stated that Jones and his sister, Jackson, came over to her residence in an attempt for Jones to get the children he has in common with Hargrave.  After they arrived on scene, Hargrave told the two to leave the property.  While leaving the property, both Jones and Jackson assaulted Hargrave and then left the scene before police arrival.  A 12 yr old juvenile witnessed the assault.  Warrants were issued on Jones and Jackson for the assault.

On 7/22/2012 I responded to 2529-F Ambassador Ct. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival it was determined a domestic assault had occured.  Mr. Roderick Caudle was taken into custody for assault on a female.

On Sunday July 22, 2012, at 0634 hours, I responded to 3615 Akers Ct in reference to an unknown trouble call. Upon my arrival and after further investigation, it was discovered that Mark Cassidy forcefully broke into the residence of his ex-girlfriend, Tara McNeill.  Cassidy was placed under arrest for misdemeanor breaking & entering.  Less than $500 damage to front door/locks on residence.

On 07/22/2012 I responded to the address above for an assistance call. The caller changed to a domestic with an assault when we encountered the other party who assaulted the victim while we were there. The suspect was arrested at the scene and placed in the High Point Jail.

On 7/22/12 at approximately 0043 I responded to 924-F Lakecrest Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with the victim and several other involved parties.  My investigation led to the suspect, Richard Wall, having warrants taken out on him for kidnapping, assault by strangulation, assault on a female, interfering with emergency communication, and communicating threats.  Wall has not been arrested as of this date.

At about 2330 hours on 07-21-2012 I responded to 1217-B Cloverdale St. in reference to a disturbance.  I encountered Tamisha Mackey and Reco Truesdale engaged in a fight.  Both parties were arrested and charged with domestic related offenses.

On 07/23/2012, at 1910, I spoke with a victim of a larceny from 1416 Furlough Av over the phone from the Police Department. The victim advised that on 07/21/2012 around 1700 hours, a pair of his earrings and a DVD player were stolen from his residence. There is no further information at this time.

On 07-20-2012, I was dispatched to 4161 Piedmont Parkway to Bank of America in reference to an assault. I spoke with the victim, Elizabeth Pennell, who stated that her ex boyfriend, Timothy McDonald, was waiting in the parking lot at Bank of America where the victim works when she came back from lunch . At that time, Mr McDonald came over to the victims vehicle and opened the drivers door . Ms Pennell got out of her vehicle and Mr McDonald started to yell at her about not going out to lunch with him today. Then Mr McDonald reached back into the car and picked up Ms Pennell`s pocketbook and took out her cell phone, and then punched her in the neck and pulled off a necklace she was wearing and told her she should have gone out to lunch with him today. After the incident, Mr McDonald walked over to his vehicle and left, Ms Pennell walked inside and called security and waited until I arrived. Ms Pennell stated she and Mr McDonald had dated for some time and lived together until a few weeks ago when she ended the relationship with him over his temper, and that he had assaulted her in Madison at their home . After talking with Ms Pennell, I advised her about our domestic policy and that I would be taking warrants out on Mr McDonald for Assault on a female and also Misdemeanor Larceny, which I did, and they are in NC Aware. Also Officer Dix made contact with Mr McDonald and advised him about the warrants that were on him and he advised he would try to come and be served later tonight. At the time of this report he had not been served.
On 7/20/12 at approximately 0730hrs I responded to a reported assault.

On 07-19-2012 at 2307 hours I responded to a domestic disturbance (IP) at 1319-B Dartmouth Av.  Upon arrival I made contact with the victim who had injuries caused by her boyfriend, Mr Parker.  Mr Parker had already left the scene.  I obtained a warrant on Mr Parker who was later arrested by Officer Brown.

On this date and time, I responded to 601 H Grayson St in reference to a domestic disturbance that had just occurred.  Upon arrival, I spoke to Ms. Craft who advised that her boyfriend Mr. Covington had assaulted her.

On 07-18-2012 around 1736 hours I responded to 423 Player Drive in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The victim, Erika Brown, advised that her boyfriend, David Brown, broke her car stereo.   David met me at the front door and told me that Erika was outside and that I could follow him through the residence.  When I first saw Erika it was apparent that she had been crying.  Her face was red and she was wiping her eyes.  David was calm.  I asked Erika to walk with me away from David into the backyard  so that we could talk.

On 07-17-2012, I responded to 400 S Main St in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival, I saw Ms. Drown and Mr. Greene outside in the PVA.  See Officer Dekker`s report for details on the domestic. While on this call, Ms. Reid informed me that the door to the room they are staying in had been damaged.  I looked at the door and saw that it was off of its hinges and appeared to be cracked on the side where the hinges are.  Ms. Reid stated that she could not say who had slammed the door and both parties involved are saying that the other did the damage.
On 7-17-2012 I responded to 2429 West Green Drive in reference to a assault.  Upon arrival I spoke with Maggie Hunt who advised she had been assaulted.

On this date, Officers were dispatched to a Residential Burglary where the Offender is possibly known by the victim.  Several items were taken from the residence during the incident.Lab Responded and obtained evidence.
On July 17, 2012, the victim reported her ex-boyfriend communicated a threat and damaged personal and real property inside her apartment.  The suspect left before police arrived.

On 07/17/2012 I was dispatched to a domestic assault at 2144-A Chester Ridge Dt. When I arrived, I encountered the victim out, who had visible swelling to her left eye and check. The offender was very agitated when we arrived, he was yelling, and became combative when we tried to arrest him. Once we were able to handcuff, he calmed down and admitted to striking the victim, but stated that it was only after she struck him first.

offense: DRUG LAW SALE OTHER DANGEROUS DRUGS
body: On 07/17/2012, the HPPD`s Vice Narcotics Unit initiated a drug investigation on Lynn Von Lee. A UNDERCOVER OPERATIVE (UO) purchased .4 grams of crack cocaine from Lee on 07/17/2012 and .2 grams of crack cocaine on 08/22/2012. Felony arrest warrants are pending on Lee.

On 07-16-12 at approximately 10:30 p.m. I responded to 1507 Cedrow Drive in reference to a domestic disturbance related matter.  Upon my arriva,l I spoke with the Victim.  The Victim stated the Offender trespassed on her property after he had been told not to come back to the residence.  A warrant for arrest was obtained on the Offender.

On Sunday, July 15th, 2012, I was dispatched to a traffic crash that occurred on W. Green Dr. in front of Tomlinson Pl.  This Officer quickly realized that this was a domestic dispute between the two drivers, resulting in an Assault with a Deadly Weapon.

On 07/15/2012, I responded to 1012 SALES ST in reference to a single car motor vehicle collision that just occurred. Upon my arrival, I made contact with the victim, JOSE CARLOS CORREA-ROMERO, who ultimately advised that he had been assaulted by his girlfriend, MARISOL MAGALLAN just prior to the incident.       At the time of this report, a WARRANT FOR ARREST (WFA) for SIMPLE ASSAULT has been issued against MAGALLAN but it HAS NOT been served.

On 07/14/12 at 0328 hours, the victim called High Point Police and reported a domestic assault.  Officers responded and met with the victim.  The victim was not injured.  HPPD Officer assisted her in seeking warrants.

On 7-14-2012 at 1:23am I responded to 513-B E. Commerce Av. in reference to Domestic Disturbance.Upon arriving at the above location I made contact with the victim who stated she was assaulted by her husband.

On 07-13-2012 at approximately 19:04 I responded to a domestic assault at 1139 Wayside St.  Upon arriving on scene I spoke to the victim who stated the offender had slapped her across the face with an open hand causing her to fall across the couch.  Warrants were obtained on the offender.
On July 13 2012, I responded to 218 Woodbury St for an assault call. The Victim stated that his girlfriend hit him multiple times. The suspect was charged with simple assault. DV forms provided.

On July 13 2012, I responded to an assault call at 203 E Kivett Dr. The victim stated that her boyfriend bit her while attempting to get his belongings out of her car. Suspect was not on scene at arrival, a warrant was taken out for assault on a female.

On July 13, 2012, I was dispatched to 701 Carr St to investigate a possible arson attempt. The victim stated that her ex-boyfriend broke into her house and tried to set a shirt and blanket on fire.The suspect is a black male between 45-50 years old.

On 07/12/2012 Officers responded to 705 Wise Av in reference to a Domestic Disturbance. The suspect struck the victim with an open hand on the left side of her face causing visible swelling to her face. The suspect was arrested on scene.

On Wednesday, July 11, 2012, at about 5:45 PM, We were dispatched to 312 Druid Drive via departmental radio in regards to a domestic disturbance. Upon our arrival, we learned that the listed suspect, the victim`s estranged husband, intentionally crashed his vehicle into the victim`s vehicle and fled the scene.

On 7/11/12 at about 3:30 PM I responded to 606 Wesley Dr for a reported domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I met with the complainant, Roxanna Womack. She stated that she and her live in girlfriend, Glinnisha Paulk, had just had a fight. Roxanna said that after an argument Glinnisha left the residence walking. Roxanna followed her carrying a wooden toy rifle about 3 ft long. About a block a way Roxanna stated that Glinnisha suddenly jumped on her, pushed her to the ground and began choking her. Roxanna stated that she grabbed the toy gun and struck Glinnisha in the back of the head to get her off. Roxanna could not explain why she carried the toy gun to confront Glinnisha. She indicated that she used her right hand to swing the rifle.Glinnisha had already left to go to the hospital. After speaking to Roxanna I met Glinnisha in the ER. I observed a 1/2 to 1 inch cut on the back right side of her head that was bleeding. Glinnisha stated that after an argument with Roxanna she left to avoid a fight. Roxanna followed her with the toy gun. About a block away near the intersection of Hines and E Green she stated that Roxanna struck her with the gun in the arm. Glinnisha turned around and confronted her but Roxanna backed down. Then when Glinnisha turned back around Roxanna hit her in the back of the head with the toy gun causing the injury. Before receiving treatment Glinnisha left the hospital.I determined that due to the location of the injury the incident could not have occurred the way Roxanna had said. I also could not see any indication of the alleged strangulation on Roxanna`s neck. After consulting with the Magistrate a warrant was signed charging Roxanna with Simple Assault.
On July 11, 2012, at approximately 1037 hours, I responded to Glenn Meade Drive in reference to a domestic disturbance.
On 7/11/12, at approximately 1013hrs, I responded to a domestic disturbance on E. Commerce Av.

The victim, Holli Shipwash, came to the Police Department with her father-in-law, Steven Shipwash, to report an assault that occurred on Monday, July 2, 2012.  Officer M. Prevost was originally assigned the case and I had it re-assigned to this unit.

On this date myself and Ofc. Hilliard responded to the Pegram/Hall St. area in regards to an assault. After we arrived on scene we located the subject, Chris Collins, in the wooded area near the 1100 block of Pegram Av.  Collins was bleeding from the face and had a large contusion around his right eye, which had a large amount of swelling and had swollen shut.  Collins was in the company of Jamie Fowler, who identified herself as Collins` wife (a claim that could not be verified).  Both subjects were extremely intoxicated.  Collins was transported the High Point Regional by EMS personnel to receive treatment for his injuries.

On Sunday July 1, 2012 I responded to the area of Centennial Street at Montlieu Avenue in reference to a Domestic Disturbance. The caller advised there was two vehicles on the side of the road and the drivers were in some type of disturbance and appeared the male subject had struck the female.

On July 1, 2012, at approximately 0841 hours, I responded to 510-A Flint Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, I made contact with Mr. McCall and Ms. McFadden.  Mr. McCall was at this location (ex-girlfriend`s residence/McFadden) to get an AC unit and telephone from Ms. McFadden that he gave to her. Mr. McCall was told that if she did not want to give it back that he would have to take her to civil court. He was not happy with those instructions and stated he would not leave without his property.  Ms. McFadden banned Mr. McCall from her premises in front of me and other officers. He was warned that if he did not leave he would be arrested for trespass. He left the property in his vehicle, but parked on the public roadway right in front of her residence. Mr. McCall did eventually leave, but returned about 30 minutes later when officers had left the area. At approximately 1008 hours, he returned and entered Ms. McFadden`s residence without her permission. He assaulted and injured her property while inside her house. Warrants were obtained and Mr. McCall was arrested at his residence at approximately 1117 hours. He was given a domestic hold for his charges.

On this date, I spoke to the victim and she advised she had been assaulted by her boyfriend and he ran as the police pulled up. The victim suffered a split lip but refused EMS. A warrant was obtained on her boyfriend by this officer and a BOLO was issued.
On July 1, 2012, I made contact with the reporting person, Jose Lopez-Gonzalez, at the police department. He wanted to report an assault against his child that occurred in High Point.

On 09/14/2012 at 1140 hours, I spoke with Elizabeth Johnson in reference to a report of a bigamy.  In speaking with Elizabeth she advised me that she had discovered that her husband was married to two other women at the same time she was married to him.  She advised that she had documentation by way of marriage certificates showing the same.

On June 29, 2012 I was dispatched, along with Officer Chuck Bartlett, to 213 Dorothy Street for a disturbance.Upon arrival, we made contact with the complainant, Auntrell London, who reported that her and her ex-boyfriend had gotten into an argument over a set of keys and he reportedly slapped her.  He then left with some friends prior to our arrival.  I developed probable cause to apply for and receive a NCAWARE warrant for the suspect for assault on a female.

On 05/08/2013 at 1515 hours, I spoke with Susan Langford in reference to a report of a fraud, identity theft.  Susan advised me that on 06/29/2012, her son used her information to purchase and obtain a vehicle from Peter`s Auto Mall in High Point.  This transaction was done without the victim`s knowledge and was discovered on 11/27/2012 at which point the incident was reported to the Winston-Salem police department.

Officers responded to 2304 Geddie Pl on a reported disturbance.  Officers arrived and located Brenda Martinez, Guillermo Urbina and Gerardo Morales in a physical altercation.  Officers intervened and determined that Morales and Martinez had been in a long term relationship that ended in December of 2011, and produced  six children.  Martinez is now living with Guillermo Urbina and his daughter.  Morales came over this evening, violating a Domestic Violence restraining order, entered the residence by breaking the window out to the children`s bedroom on the east wall of the residence.  Once inside Morales struck Martinez and Urbina with a  30 inch metal pipe numerous times about the shoulders and back areas.  Martinez and Urbina were able to pin Morales in a corner as the children called and took the pipe away from him.  Morales was arrested for First Degree Breaking  and Entering, Assault with a Deadly Weapon with Intent to Kill, Identity Theft, Violation of a Domestic Restraining Order, and  Communicating Threats, and two Order for Arrests for Failing to Appear in court.  Morales was held on a Domestic Hold and will go for first appearance in the morning.

On Wednesday, 06/27/2012, at approximately 2157 hours I responded to 288 Dorothy Street in reference to a Domestic Disturbance. On this date, I responded to a domestic dispute between the caller and her boyfriend. Once there, I learned he allegedly assaulted her. No signs of an assualt were visible and she refused to prosecute. She only wished to leave and was allowed to do so.

On Thursday June 14, 2012 at 1518 hrs I met with Ms. Chelsea Nichols  at 3411 E Kivett Dr who wished to report an assault that occurred at 3207 Buckingham Ct on this date between 1200-1300 hrs involving her childs father, Mr. Edward Abrams-Ward.

On 06/13/2012 officers responded to the intersection of Sharon and Wise on a report of a male assaulting a female.  Officers arrived on scene and located a large crowd that was dispersing, however did not locate any active assault.  Officers searched the area and were advised that a white female had run from the area with a tank top on and no other clothes after being assaulted.  Officers located the female, Samantha Rogers, at the intersection of Vail and S Main St, with numerous lacerations, bite marks and bruises.  Rogers related that Franklin Moore McNeil and her had been in a dating relationship for the past five years; tonight when she went to pick up her personal clothes he struck her several times in the face and upper body, bit her on her left check, forearm and neck and had lacerations to her face and legs.  During the assault McNeil dragged her from 919 Randolph to the intersection of Sharon and Wise and ripped her shorts off.  Rogers was able to run away and hide from McNeil when he saw police approaching.  Rogers was walking home when she was stopped by police at Vail and S Main Street.  Rogers was transported to the HPRHS ER where she was treated for her injuries and crime lab took pictures of her injuries.

On 06/13/2012, I responded to 204 Gordon St in reference to a domestic disturbance. The victim stated that her son, the offender became violent and upset when denied money for gas. On 6/11/2012 I responded to 910 Beaumont Ave for a Phillip Underwood banging on the front door of the residence.  When I arrvied Phillip Underwood had already left the scene. On 06-10-2012 at 1917 hours, I responded to 3306 N Main St in reference to a domestic assault.  Two arrests were made and both parties were placed into the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.
Ms Barnes and her juvenile engaged in a heated verbal argument which resulted in the juvenile smashing a car windshield and eventually throwing a punch at Ms Barnes.
On Saturday, June 9th, 2012, at 0702 hours, I responded to 610 Manley Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.

On 06-09-2012 I responded to 2429 W Green Dr in reference to a refused caller stating that Ms. Kristina Short had been assaulted in room 228. She stated that Mr. Kidd had cut her.Mr. Kidd was arrested and charged with Assault with Deadly Weapon Inflicting Serious Injury.
On 6/8/2012, at approximately 2230 hours, I responded to a domestic disturbance call. Upon my arrival Mr. Parker was arrested for Assault.

On this date, a southside resident reported a burglary to her residence. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed the victim was away for the weekend, upon her return, she discovered the burglary. The suspect(s) first attempted entry through a rear window, damaging the screen on same. The suspect(s) then kicked a panel out of the wooden, rear door, reached through, and unlocked the door from the inside. Once inside, the suspect(s) ransacked the residence. On 06/05/2012, around 0439 hours, I was dispatched to 411 Woodbury St in reference to an Assault with a Deadly Weapon call. Officer P. Welch and I responded to a Domestic Disturbance at GBF, Inc.  The complainant was Takita Tatum.  She told Communications that her boyfriend, Derwin Jones had assaulted her, but he had already left the scene.Ms. Tatum and the listed witnesses stated Derwin Jones assaulted Ms. Tatum in the parking lot of GBF, Inc. where they all work.  Mr. Jones came over to the car that Ms. Tatum and Ms. Wood had pulled up in.  He opened the car door and put his hands around Ms. Tatum`s neck and began to choke her.  Mr. Jones stated that he was going to kill her.  Ms. Wood and the other listed witness, Dannette Green, had to pull him off of her.  
I had Officer Welch give Takita Tatum the HPPD Victim Information Sheet, NC State Victim Information Sheet and HPPD DV Letter.  He also read her the Domestic Violence Victim Script.   Ms. Tatum inquired about a restraining order and we advised her on how to obtain a 50B order at the clerk`s office.Ms. Tatum had a small scratch on the left side of her neck and I could see a couple of red marks on her chest.  I obtained photographs of same.  These photographs were downloaded into the computer by Lab Technician, Mia Bartorelli.  After obtaining warrants on Derwin Jones for Assault by Strangulation and Assault on a Female, I called the Greensboro Police Department Communications to have officers go by Derwin Jones` residence of 2815 N. O`Henry Blvd., Apt. C in Greensboro, NC.  Greensboro Officer Holbrook called me and advised he had Mr. Jones under arrest and was enroute to the Guilford County Magistrate`s office in Greensboro.  I contacted Officer Holbrook back and he stated Mr. Jones received a written promise to appear.  He said Mr. Jones admitted in front of the magistrate that he choked her the victim.I recommend this case be cleared by arrest.
Officer were dispatched to 603 Granby on a reported assault.  Both parties responded to the magistrates office to seek prosecution and both parties were arrested for assault.

On 5-30-12 I was asked to investigate the claim on child abuse involving a student at Penn Griffin School of the Arts.  After a thorough investigation an arrest was made and the child was placed in a safe residence for the evening.  The other families were not injured in any way, and the victim received treatment for her injuries that were not life threatening. There is no further information available at this time.

On 05-30-2012 I responded to 2628 S Main St in reference to a possibly violation of a 50B order. Upon my arrival Mr. Hutchinson was pointed out to me by Ms. Peoples.  I confirmed that there was a 50B on him and that Ms. Judy Hutchinson was the protected party.  I placed Mr. Hutchinson under arrest for violation of the 50B.  He gave me no problems.

On this date myself and Ofc. Hilliard responded to 1102-A Campbell St. for what initially was reported as a break in.  Upon our arrival we encountered Mr. Harper and Ms. Bryant at the residence.  Ms. Bryant said that she was dropping off their daughter at the residence while she went to work, and that Mr. Harper did not answer the door.  Mr. Harper said that he found Ms. Bryant in his apartment, and that an altercation ensued.  Mr. Harper had a cut to the right side of his head that was bleeding.  Ms. Bryant claimed that she had been bitten and that her hair had been pulled out, but neither myself or Ofc. Hilliard did not observe any injuries on her where she indicated that he had assaulted her.  Bryant was taken into custody for Simple Assault, and placed in the Guilford Co. Jail under a Domestic Hold.  See Officer Narrative for further.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 05/29/12, at 1245 hours, Officers were dispatched to 521 Warbler Ct for a domestic argument.  Upon Officers arrival, they observed a black male walking down the stairs of the front porch.  The male stopped in the driveway and spoke with Officers.  The subject was arrested on scene.

On 05-29-2012 at 0802 hours, I responded to 153 W Parris Avenue in reference to a simple assault.  Upon arrival, I spoke to Megan Arnold who stated that she was assaulted by her 16 year daughter.The offender was gone prior to my arrival and her location is unknown.  Arnold did not have any visible injuries and did not ask for medical treatment.Arnold stated that she is going to the magistrate`s office to obtain a warrant.
On 05-28-2012 at 2058 hours, I responded to 1805 Tower Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  When I arrived, I spoke to Jamie Flowers.  She stated she was assaulted by her exboyfriend.
On this date, I responded to 211 Hay St in reference to a domestic dispute between a female and a male subject.  Upon arrival, the male subject fled the scene possibly via the back door.
I arrived at 607 Arch St in reference to a domestic between the father and the son.  No injury or assault took place.  A firearm was confiscated from the residence.

I was dispatched to 421 Wright Street for a reported domestic disturbance.Upon arrival, I made contact with Vada Pigg and Ricky Honeycutt, who were both highly intoxicated.  In talking with them, it was determined that they got into a verbal dispute over dinner that led to Honeycutt throwing a figurine at Pigg, but due to his intoxication, she was easily able to dodge it (according to Pigg).  Pigg was then reported by Honeycutt to throw the figurine back at Honeycutt, hitting him on the upper rear right shoulder area (two iPhone photographs logged into HPPD Lab and black and white copies attached to case file).I arrested Pigg for the injury to Honeycutt`s shoulder and Honeycutt was given the domestic violence paperwork.  Pigg was transported to the Magistrate`s Office.
On 05/27/2012 I responded to 1610 Brockett Av Apt. A in reference to a domestic disturbance. When I arrived signs of injury were observed on both parties. Both parties were arrested for assault.

On 05/26/2012, I responded to 213 JAY PL in reference to a domestic disturbance in progress. Upon my arrival, I made contact with the victim, MARIA DELOURDES AVILA, who advised that the father of her unborn child, JOSE ADALBERTO LOPEZ-GALLEGOS had assaulted her with his fists and household objects.  Upon further investigation, LOPEZ-GALLEGOS was arrested and charged with ASSAULT ON A FEMALE (14-33(C)(2)) and ASSAULT ON AN UBORN CHILD (N.C.G.S. 14-23.6(A)); LOPEZ-GALLEGOS was arrested without incident. It should be noted that ASSAULT ON AN UBORN CHILD (N.C.G.S. 14-23.6(A)) is not a charge currently available for selection in this departments Records Management System (RMS).

On 05/26/2012 at 2120hrs I responded to 508 Richardson Av for a report of a domestic disturbance. When I arrived the two parties were in the street yelling at each other. Due to call notes stating that there was a black handgun involved both parties were detained. It was discovered that the suspect had taken the hand gun from inside the house, put it in her purse, and placing it along with her two young children in the back seat of a taxi. She was charged with two counts of child abuse, and carrying a concealed weapon. Further charges are being pursed at the time of this report.

On 05-26-2012 at approximately 2040 hours I arrived in the parking lot of 120 E Swathmore Av. Upon my arrival I was advised by Officer Mustian that an assault had occurred and that Mr. Lawson needed to be placed under arrest. I placed Mr. Lawson under arrest for domestic assault. Mr. Lawson was charged with assault on a female and placed in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On 5/26/2012 at around 1600 hours I arrested Christopher Jordan for violating the 50-B against him.  Jordan made contact with Courtney Bone-Jordan (petitioner) by cell phone and also by following her around the Leonard/ Walnut area.   Christopher admitted in this officer`s  presence prior to being arrested that he was trying to get hold of Courtney to arrange when he could visit with his son.  Courtney also stated that Christopher followed her around while she was walking on Leonard Ave near the store.  Courtney stated that she tried to flag an officer down but was unsure if they saw her.  Courtney stated that she then went into the house on Smith St to get away from Christopher. Christopher Jordan was held on a domestic hold at the GCSO High Point jail.  Christopher was cooperative with this officer but was more concerned more about the day he was getting out and where Courtney was staying.

On 05-26-2012 at 1025 hours, I responded to 109-E Woodbend Ct in reference to a domestic disturbance between Kenneth Tucker and Ashley Robbins.  Tucker and Robbins reside at that address together and have a child together who was not present at the time of the incident.Robbins was assaulted by being slapped on the arm and being pushed into the side of a parked car.  Robbins was not injured.The on call apartment manager, Thomas Hunt, witnessed part of the incident.I took Tucker into custody and charged him with assault on female.  He has been processed and placed into the High Point Jail under a domestic hold.

On 05/26/2012, at about 0834 hours, I was dispatched to 409-E Taylor Av in reference to a vandalism.  I arrived at the scene and spoke with the complainant, Annie Adams, who stated that her boyfriend, the suspect, broke out the window to the above listed vehicle.  Adams stated she is the owner of the vehicle.  The suspect fled the scene prior to my arrival.
On 5/26/12 at 0303hrs I responded to a reported domestic disturbance on W. English Rd.
On Friday May 25 2012, I responded to 1308-A RC Baldwin in reference an assault that had just occurred.

Lt. Greg Dupke and I responded to 1316 B Eaton Pl.   The complainant, Brock Morton, called Communication to report that he was in a disturbance with a, Tracey McCall, and he told Communications that she hit him in the face with an IPad.   After further investigation, Tracey McCall, was arrested and charged with Simple Assault.   She was given a $1,000.00 unsecured bond.I recommend this case be cleared by arrest.

On May 25, 2012, at approximately 0330 hours, I was in my police vehicle working on a report in the parking lot of 201 Eastchester Drive. I witnessed the defendant assault his girlfriend just feet away from my vehicle. He was immediately arrested. The victim was not injured.The defendant was identified as Matthew D. Hohn.
On 5-25-12 I responded in reference to a report of a domestic disturbance that occurred at 2604 Patrick Avenue.

On Thursday May 24, 2012, at 7:10 pm, a call was dispatched to 1430 Futrelle Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.As a result of the investigation, Jason Randolph Cress was arrested and charged with misdemeanor assault on a female.At the time of the report, Cress is in the Guilford County Jail.

On this date, Wednesday, May 23, 2012, at approximately 1928 hours, the reporting party summoned police in reference to a disturbance between him and his in-laws. The disturbance was in reference to a property related matter. There was no crime to be reported and no arrests were made.

On Wednesday May 23, 2012 I responded to 3639 Laurel Bluff Cir in reference to the victim in this matter reporting that her ex-boyfriend having come inside her house and damaging her property.  According to the victim this is the most recent in a series of  incidents involving this same ex-boyfriend showing up at her residence or other locations and damaging her property or harrassing her.  When Police arrived on the scene this date the suspect had fled the scene.  The victim stated that she was going straight to the magistrate to take out warrants and a 50 B against this subject.  No assault occurred on this date.  The victim stated that she and her ex used to live together fitting the criteria for a domestic relationship.  This report needs follow up through the DV Task Force.  The victim was given a copy of the DV victims sheet.
On 5-22-12, at approximately 1951 hours, I responded to 651 Wesley Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with the victim, who stated that a subject damaged his vehicle.

On 05/20/12 at 1530 hours, a domestic disturbance occurred at the listed address.  During the incident, the listed victim was assaulted by the offender with a knife.  The victim was not seriously injured and the offender was arrested on site.

On 5/20/2012 I responded to 816 Dogwood Ci in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon investigating the matter, it was determined that both subjects involved had assaulted each other.  Both were charged with the domestic assault.

On the 19th day of May, 2012 I responded to 1000 Richland Av in reference to a domestic disturbance involving intimate partners.Upon arriving, I spoke to both parties involved, Mr Tyler Pratt and Ms Angel Horne.Pratt had a deep scratch on his forehead and stated that Horne assaulted him while he was asleep.Horne was placed under arrest for the assault and also an outstanding OFA/FTA. Also Pratt was placed under arrest for an OFA/FTA.

On 5/19/2012 I responded to 513 North Hoskins reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, the victim stated that she was assaulted by her boyfriend.  Victim was assisted with taking out warrants.

On 05/18/2012 I responded to 610-D Hawthorne St. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the victim who stated her husband assaulted her.  The victim had apparent signs of injury.  A warrant was taken out for the suspect.  Upon locating suspect he had evident signs of injury.  The female party was then also charged for assault.

On 05-18-2012, at approximately 9:47pm, Officer Nixon and I were dispatched to 102 Wood Valley Ct. Apt. E in reference to a Domestic Disturbance involving intimate partners.   The female involved stated she and her husband got into an argument when he came home drunk and wanted to leave with the vehicle.  The female said she took the keys from her husband and that is when the altercation took place.

On 5/18/2012 at 2003hrs I responded to 2418 E Lexington Av for a report of a disturbance. When I arrived I encountered the victim and the witness standing next to her vehicle in the driveway. The witness was holding onto a baseball bat and both parties were distraught. After a brief conversation with the two I made contact with the suspect in the house, who gave his side of the events. Based on the injuries the victim suffered, the suspect was arrested, transported to the magistrate`s office and given a $1,000 unsecured bond.

On 05/18/2012, I responded to 1298 VERNON in reference to a domestic disturbance that just occurred. Upon my arrival, I made contact with the victim, BETTY TOMS BRIDGES who advised that she had been assaulted by her fianc_/boyfriend of seven (7) years, CHARLES MAY JENKINS SR. Upon conclusion of the investigation, JENKINS SR was arrested and charged with assault on a female - he was arrested without incident.

On 05/18/2012 at approximately 0227 hours, I was dispatched to 411 North Centennial Street in reference to an unknown trouble.  As a result of the call, a Mr. Eddie Davis was arrested for assaulting a Ms. Amy Plowman.  Mr. Davis and Ms. Plowman live together in a dating relationship.  Mr. Davis was processed at the High Point Police Department and taken before Magistrate Landen.  Mr. Davis was turned over to the High Point Jail under a domestic hold.
On 5/18/12 at approximately 2336hrs I responded to a reported domestic disturbance on W. Rotary Dr.

On 05-17-2012 I responded to 813-A Mobile St in reference to a disturbance. While I was enroute communications advised that a female caller(later found to be Amy Todd) was screaming that her boyfriend was at the house creating a disturbance.
On 5/16/12 at approximately 2358hrs, I was on routine patrol when I heard a loud disturbance coming from the 900 block of W English Rd.
Officer`s met the victim at the police department.  She claimed the suspect assaulted her by slapping her with an open hand.  The suspect was not located.

On 05/16/2012 I responded to the Open Door Shelter located at 400 N. Centennial Street in reference to a fight.  I arrived and made contact with several subjects.  The investigation determined that there was probable cause to arrest Tommy Harper for trespassing and assault on a female.

On 5/16/12 at about 7:30 AM I responded to 123 Thomas St in High Point for a reported domestic. Upon my arrival I met with the victim, Miranda Gainey. Gainey stated that she had been assaulted by the suspect, Terradarrias Bohannon. Gainey told me that she is eight weeks pregnant with Bohannon`s child. I saw visible injuries to Ms. Gainey`s face. EMS was called and transported Ms. Gainey to the hospital to be checked out. Mr. Bohannon was not on scene upon my arrival.
On this date and time, I responded to 913 A Redding Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance that had just occurred.

offense: ALL OTHER - HIT AND RUN (PROPERTY DAMAGE)
body: On May 15, 2012 I received a call via telephone in reference to a hit and run that occurred in the PVA of 2628 S. Main St. (Walmart).  Upon speaking with the victim, Tina Rich she informed me that her vehicle was struck by another vehicle while she was inside the store.

On 05/15/2012 at 1222 hours, I responded to 1040 E Lexington Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Mr. Bryce Stanback and Ms. Etascia Legrande who had assaulted each other in the parking lot.  Both parties were arrested for assault.
On May 14, 2012 at approximately 2138 hours, I responded to 811 Langford Avenue in reference to a domestic assault that had already occurred.
On 5-14-12 I was dispatched to 1611 Prospect St (Bizzy Bee Grocery) in reference to a domestic disturbance.

On 05/182012 at about 0836 hours I was dispatched to The High Point ER located at 601 N Elm St in reference to an assault.  I arrived at the scene and spoke to the victim, Tyrina Boswell, who stated that the father of her children, the suspect, assaulted her by punching her in the face and slapping her across the face.  Boswell had her front tooth knocked out during the assault.
On 13 May 2012 I was dispatched to 3504 Alamosa Dr with Officer Sherrill in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Further investigation revealed that this was actually a child abuse.

On 05/13/2012 at 0448hrs I responded to 809 Tryon Av for an unknown trouble. When I arrived I found the suspect and the victim inside the house. The suspect was intoxicated and the victim had a large red whelp on her right cheek. The suspect was arrested and charged with assault on a female. He has been placed in the High Point Jail under a domestic hold.

On 5-12-2012, at 10:45pm, I responded to 206 Friendly Av. in reference to Residential Burglary.Upon arriving at the above location, I made contact with the victim, who stated the suspect entered her residence through an unlocked window at the front of her residence.

On 5/12/2012 at around 2223 hours I was dispatched to 1457 West Ave Apt B for a report of a disturbance.  When I arrived, Shatera Williams and several juveniles appeared very upset.  Williams stated that Derick Williams, cousin to Shatera, came over to the house.  An argument between other parties started which caused Derick to get mad.Shatera Williams stated that Derick started to throw ceramic plates and cups against the kitchen wall.  The ceramic items broke against the wall, one of the pieces of ceramic hit an 11 year old in the right cheek bone. The juvenile struck is cousin to Derick and lives in the same household.Derick Williams was charged with assault on a minor under 12 years of age and trespassing.  Williams has been banned by HPPD Housing Authority Officer A. Robbins.  Williams was taken before a Magistrate and given a $500.00 secure bond.  Derick was turned over to the custody of the GCSO without further incident.

On 05/12/2012, around 0912 hours, I was dispatched to 1009 Leonard Av, Police Department, in reference to a Domestic Disturbance at 603-S2 E Commerce Av.  Upon arrival at the Police Department, I spoke to the victim, Mr. Kermit Moses, who advised that he and his girlfriend had gotten into a verbal argument and that he had been assaulted.  High Point Communications then received a call from High Point Regional Hospital stating that the female party, Ms. Sheena Coles was at the Emergency Room seeking treatment.  I then responded to the Emergency Room and made contact with Ms. Coles.

On 05/11/12 at 0405 hrs I responded to 5000-1H Samet Dr. in reference to a Domestic Disturbance IP.  Upon arrival I spoke with victim #1, Ms. Dori Gonzalez.  Ms. Gonzalez stated that during the times of occurrence that she was involved in an argument with her boyfriend and that he assaulted her by punching her once in the left side of her chest.  Ms. Gonzalez had a noticeable injury to that area.  Mr. Munn was placed into custody and charged with assault on a female.     I photographed the victim`s injury and also audio recorded her statement about the incident.  Officer S. Shackleton provided all three domestic violence forms to the victim.

On Thursday, May 10, 2012 at approximately 2340 hours I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance at 722 Forrest Street.  I arrived on scene and heard a loud disturbance from the interior of the residence.  I announced that it was the police and entered the residence.  I spoke with the victim, James Howell, who stated that he and the suspect, Kimberly White had been involved in a verbal confrontation over another woman, and the suspect grabbed him by his left shoulder ripped his shirt and scratching his shoulder.  The victim advised the suspect then picked up a golf club and threatened to strike him with it.I spoke with the suspect who stated that she had grabbed him and also threatened him with the golf club.  The suspect was arrested and transported to the magistrates office.

On 05/10/2012, around 1400 hours, I was dispatched to the High Point Hospital Emergency Room, 601 N Elm St, in reference to an assault.  Upon arrival, I made contact with the victim, Ms. Shirley Murphy, who advised that she had been assaulted by her boyfriend at 909-B Park St.  Ms. Murphy advised that the assault occurred on 05/09/2012 but was just now notifying police.
On May 08,2012 at 2119 hours, we were dispatched to 906 Putnam St reference a domestic dispute between mother and daughter.The suspect was arrested without incident.
On 05-08-2012 at approximately 0014 hrs I responded to 913-A Redding Dr reference a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival one subject was arrested on scene for assault.
At about 2150 hours, on this date, I responded to 1204 E Green Dr. in reference to a case of arson.  Theresa Glasper was arrested and charged with 1st degree arson.

On 05/07/2012 at 1759 hours, I responded to 1165-2H Glenstone Trail in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Mr. Paul Streba who advised that he choked his girlfriend and pushed her down while they were arguing.

On Thursday, May 10th, 2012, at 0347 hours, I responded to 2602 Ty Circle in reference to a domestic dispute.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Sunnie Stamper who advised her boyfriend, Mr. Aaron Harrison, assaulted her on Monday, May 7th, 2012.

On 5-6-2012 I responded to 1006-A Anderson Place in reference to an assault that had already occurred.  When I arrived I spoke to the caller and then spoke to the victim.  During my investigation I determined this was a domestic related call.  However the victim was uncooperative.

On this date, a southside resident reported that their grandchild vandalized their personal vehicle. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed that grandparent and grandson had an argument which escalated into the grandson going outside, and punching the rear end of the complainant`s vehicle, inflicting approximately $100.00 worth of damage. The suspect inflicted open cuts to his right hand, while committing the vandalism, this required medical treatment. The suspect was cited, and released, for the vandalism.
On May 6, 2012, at approximately 1006 hours, I responded to 532 Roy Avenue in reference to a vandalism that had already  occurred to a vehicle.

On 05-05-12 at 1541 hours I responded to 1102 Camden Avenue in reference to an investigate call.  A refused 911 caller stated that a seventeen year old female was locked in the home against her will.  During the investigation it was determined that the Victim was twenty years old and the Fiance of the Offender listed in this report.  Adult Social Services was notified.

On 05/05/2012 at 0408hrs I responded to 705 Wise Av for a report of an active domestic disturbance. I encountered the suspect who stated that the victim busted the side mirror to his vehicle. The victim was across the street, and after I examined both parties` injuries, they were arrested and placed in the High Point Jail

On 05-05-2012 at 02:18 hours I responded to 1027-A True Lane to a domestic disturbance call. Upon my arrival I contacted the victim, Bridgett Greene. Ms. Greene stated that she had been assaulted with minor injuries apparent. The suspect was located and charged with the offense. There is no further information at this time.

On Friday, May 4, 2012 at approximately 0235 hours I responded to 327 Louise Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I arrived on scene and spoke with the victim, Angela Barnett, who stated that her boyfriend, Charles Hawkins, came home and entered her bedroom and punched her in the left forearm, stole her twenty dollars that was on the floor and fled the scene.I inquired from the victim what had started the confrontation.  The victim stated that Mr. Hawkins was upset because he had to go to court on this date for a DWI charge.The victim did have markings on her left forearm where she advised that the suspect struck her.  The victim`s statement was recorded by Officer Broos, photographs were taken of her injuries, and the victim was provided with domestic violence forms.

On 05/03/2012, at 1645 hours, I responded to 1411 E Green Dr in reference to a vandalism. Upon my arrival, I spoke with the victim, Mr. Pearson, who advised me that Ms. Tolliver had broken out his back window to gain entry into his residence. After being advised to leave, she came back to the premises and regained entry to the home. A warrant was issued for her arrest. No further information at this time.
On 05-03-2012 I responded to 284 Beddington Street in reference to an assault

On May 3, 2012, at 1016 hrs, I responded to 2427-F Francis St in reference to vandalism to Ms. Smiths vehicle that was parked in the parking lot overnight.  Ms. Smith advised the damage occurred overnight, and she suspected her childs father to be the suspect.  Ms. Smith advised she was going to obtain warrants on him for this crime.  No further to report at this time.

On 05/03/2012, around 0919 hours, I was dispatched to 653 Wesley Dr in reference to a vandalism to motor vehicle.  Upon arrival, I made contact with the complainant, Ms. Felicia Bridges, who advised that her vehicle had been damaged.  I also spoke with Mr. James Harrington, victim, who also stated that his vehicle had been damaged.
On this date, I was dispatched to 308 Hickory Chapel Rd in reference to a public disturbance that had already occurred.

On Thursday May 3, 2012 at approximately 1800 hours Deidri Bethea arrived at the police department requesting to speak with an officer regarding a domestic situation involving her twenty two year old daughter and two year old son.Lieutenant Sellars took a statement from Deidri Bethea. The investigation is ongoing.There is no further to report at this time.

offense: DRUG LAW POSSESSION HEROIN OPIUM DERIVATIVES
body: On 05-02-2012 at 0928 hours I responded to a domestic call at 616 Caudell Pl.  Upon arriving I spoke to Rico Little, who was in an argument with his girlfriend Evelyn Hodge.
On 5-1-12, at approximately 2244 hours, I received a domestic disturbance call at 412 Player Dr.  One person was arrested for non-related offenses.

On Tuesday, May 1, 2012 at about 6:33 P.M.  I was dispatched to 101 Northgate Ct, apt J via departmental radio in regards to a domestic dispute. Upon my arrival Ms. Piazza stated that her boyfriend pushed her and held her inside her apartment by force against her will.
On 5-1-12, I responded in reference to a report of a residential burglary that occurred at 1005 Apt. B Roberts Lane.
On May 1, 2012 I responded to 1419 Furlough Av in reference to an assault. Trenice Miller reported that Jamel Soltau had assaulted her. A warrant was taken out on Soltau.

On Monday, April 30th, 2012, at 2220 hours, I responded to 527 Oakland Place in reference to an assault.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Alonte Boyce who advised Mr. Ryan Flowers assaulted her by spitting on her, hitting her with his fists in the face, and hitting her in her lower back with a rock.
On 4/30/2012, at approximately 1846, I was dispatched to an assault call at 1501 S Main St. Upon My arrival I met with Ms. Shue and Mr. Lloyd who both had injuries and were both charged with assault.

On Friday, May 4, 2012 at approximately 1229 hours, I was working as a School Resource Officer at the Dean B. Pruette SCALE Academy at 900 West English Road when I was contacted by the victim, Aiska Tillman, who stated that she was assaulted by her juvenile son on 4/30/12.After speaking with the Juvenile Court Counselor, the juvenile was charged with simple assault.

On Monday, April 30th, 2012, at 0303 hours, I responded to 505 East Dayton Avenue in reference to an assault and a larceny.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Brenda Guerrero who advised her husband, Mr. Adan Lopez Munoz, assaulted her and left the residence taking her cell phone and wallet containing $50 in cash.

On Sunday, April 29th, 2012 at 2351 hours, I responded to 1810-A Guyer Street in reference to a domestic dispute.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Joyce Cecil and Mr. David Anderson Jr.  Ms. Cecil advised Mr. Anderson broke several of her items in her residence and communicated threats to her.

On April 29, 2012, I responded 533 Roy Av. in reference to a domestic dispute.  Upon my arrival, I contacted the victim, Cristina Gallardo.  Ms. Gallardo informed me that she and her boyfriend, Antonio Cuadra had an argument and he assaulted her and fled the scene on foot.

On 04/29/2012 at 1909 hours, I responded to 404 Clover Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Katie Hill who advised that she was assaulted by her husband, William Hill.  Mr. Hill was arrested a short time later at the residence.

On 4-29-2012 I responded to an unknown trouble on Redding Drive.  When I arrived I made contact with Ms. McManus who advised she was asaulted by Mr. Butler.  Mr, Butler came back to the scene and advised he was assaulted by Ms. McManus.  Both were arrested for the assults and placed in the Guilfrod County Jail under a Domestic Hold.
I responded to 815 Joines St on a reported shots fired call.  Upon arrival I spoke with Krystal Smith and the other victims.
On April 29, 2012, at 0124 hours, we were attempting to serve a warrant on Ambassador Ct. and discovered a burglary. The suspect is known.

On Saturday April 28, 2012 I responded to the corner of Crestwood Circle and Greensboro Road in reference to a possible assault. Upon my arrival I observed a black female later identified as Sharon Pearsall, hitting a black male later identified as Loyce Young. while attempting to arrest Pearsall, she began to resist and again struck Young.
On Saturday April 28, 2012, I responded to the High Point Police Department in reference to a Motor Vehicle Theft that had just occurred, and an assault, that took place at 234 Windley Ave.
On April 28, 2012, at 1307 hours, I responded to 3600 block of Laurel Bluff Circle in reference to a vandalism.

offense: ASSAULT ON A FEMALE BY MALE OVER 18 YEARS OF AGE
body: On the 27th day of April, 2012 at approximately 1655 hours, I responded to 527-A Smith St in reference to a domestic disturbance.Upon arriving, I spoke with the victim, Ms Harriet Hayes, who had an outstanding order for her arrest (2012-14985). Hayes was taken into custody and the offender, Mr Anthony Johnson, stayed at the resident as I served Hayes with her order for arrest.A witness to the domestic disturbance, Ms LaDonna Johnson-Lucas, stated that Mr Johnson assaulted Hayes prior to my arrival.I took a warrant out on Mr Johnson and he was served with same for assault on a female.

On the listed date/time Officer Griffiths and I responded to 808 Lakecrest Av., Apt. 907 in reference to an unknown trouble.  As I arrived it was obvious that a domestic disturbance was taking place at an upstairs apartment.  The victim had obvious signs of being assaulted.See Supplemental report for additional information.

On 04/27/2012 at approximately 6:00 am I responded to a 911 hang-up at 701 S Elm St apartment 405.On arrival there was a couple in the grass area in front of the apartment complex engaged in a verbal altercation.During the investigation the female, identified as Nikkia James assaulted the male by hitting him in the back and head.The female then assaulted both officers on the scene.James was arrested and charged with Simple assault and two counts of assault on a Law Enforcement Officer, and placed in the high Point Jail under a $5500 secured bond with no further incident.

On 4-26-12 at approximately 1552hrs I responded to 415 Cedar St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the victim, Melissa Davis, who advised that her boyfriend, Daren Ruffin, had assaulted her.Davis was transported to the magistrate`s office where she was able to obtain a warrant for Assault on a Female on Ruffin.  Ruffin was then located and arrest for the same.

On 4/27/2012 I responded to 2514-B Ambassador Ct in reference to a disturbance.   Upon my arrival, the main parties involved in the disturbance had left the scene.  Witnesses who remained at the scene were interviewed.

On Wednesday, April 25, 2012 at approximately 2200 hours I was dispatched to 1436 Deep River Road in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I arrived on scene and spoke with the victim, Jasmen Williams.  The victim stated that her boyfriend, Preston Short, had came over to the residence to get his hair clips and pushed her in the process.  I did not see any signs of injuries on the victim, however advised her if she wished to pursue charges I would drive her to the magistrate`s office.  I provided the victim an escort to the magistrate where warrants were issued for the offender, Preston Short.

On 04-25-12 at 2000 hours I responded to the two hundred block of Windley Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I located the disturbance at 234 Windley Street and came in contact with the Victim on the front porch.  The Offender ran out the back door upon my arrival.  The Offender was located at 216-A Windley Street and arrested.

The victim stated that between the times listed on this date he was assaulted by the offender.  The incident started as an argument but soon escalated to be physical.  The victim stated that he was pushed and struck by the offender with his fists.The offender was arrested and charged with Simple Assault.

On 4-24-12 at 2315 hours, I was dispatched to 1608 N Hamilton St in reference to a public disturbance.  A neighbor had called and reported two subjects yelling and arguing in the front yard.  The reporting party also stated that one subject was assaulting the other.  Misha Gayten was involved in an argument and then a physical altercation with Patrick Harris.  Ms. Gayten was arrested for domestic assault.
