On 4-24-12 at approximately 1905hrs officers responded to 307 Vail Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon our arrival Ms Jennifer Ross was located in the front bedroom.  Ms Ross advised that she and her boyfriend got into an argument that turned physical.  Ms Ross was transported to the hospital by EMS.Her boyfriend was not on scene when officers arrived.  Charges have been filed against him.
At about 0345 hours on this date I responded to 1409 apt C E Commerce Ave. in reference to a domestic dispute.  Bridgette Greene advised that she had been assaulted by her boyfriend.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 04-23-12 at 1238 hours the Victim called 911 stating that the Offender whom she has a domestic violence protective order against had followed her from the court house to the bus station at 201 W. Broad Avenue.  I came into contact with both subjects at 1246 hours.  The Offender was arrested for violating a domestic violence protective order.
On Sunday, 04/22/2012, I responded to 413 N Ward Av in reference to a domestic disturbance. An arrest was made in this case.
I initiated a domestic violence call at 910-B Richland St.  One subject was arrested for related offenses.
I responded to 223 Friendly Ave on an unknown trouble call.  Upon arrival I spoke with Ms Trujillo-Chapan.
On 4-21-12 at approximately 0045 hours I responded to 1509 Franklin Ave in reference to a domestic violence call.  A subject was arrested on related offenses.

On 4-20-12, at approximately 0221hrs, officers responded to 513-H E Commerce Av in reference to a public disturbance.  Upon our arrival, we spoke with the victim, Tiara Morgan, who advised that her ex-boyfriend, Jamaal Duff, kicked in her door after she refused to let him in.  Duff was also in violation of a 50-B protection order.Duff was located at his residence and was charged with a 50-B violation, 1st Degree Burglary, and Injury to Real Property.  He was placed into the High Point Jail.

On 04/19/2012,I responded to 209 Murray in reference to vandalism. The listed suspect threw a large rock through the victim`s window and then fled the scene after an argument. The Victim and suspect are currently in a dating relationship.
On 4/19/2012 I responded to 710-M Westchester Dr. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival the victim was assaulted by her mother.  The mother was charged with simple assault.

On 4-18-12, at approximately 2332hrs, I responded to 306-H Brentwood St in reference to a vandalism.  Upon my arrival, I spoke with the victim, who advised that her friend`s boyfriend came by and set fire to some hair at her front door.  He had left prior to my arrival.A warrant for Attempted First Degree Arson has been issued on the boyfriend.

On 4/18/12 at approximately 1212 hours, I responded to 3835 Beverly Hills Drive in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Claude Draughn was arrested and placed in jail on a domestic hold for assaulting his spouse, Lisa Draughn.  Mrs Draughn`s injuries were minor and did not require medical treatment.

On 4/17/2012 I responded to 2504 Woodruff Av. in reference to a domestic disturbance where an assault had taken place.  The victim sustained minor injuries and the suspect was arrested and taken into custody.

On Tuesday, April 17, 2012 at approximately 1251 hours I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance at 1407 Forrest Street.  I arrived on scene and spoke with the offender, Christopher Delapaz, who stated that he and the victim, Kimberly Spencer, had been involved in an altercation over money issues.  The offender stated that he got upset and he cut himself with a knife on his forearms.  The offender stated that the victim was standing at the front door and he shoved her down.  The victim stated the same events and confirmed that the offender shoved her down.  The offender was arrested and transported to the magistrates office.
On May 06, 2012, at 1400 hours, I spoke with Ms. Brown reference a fraud at 1009 Leonard Avenue.

On 4/16/2012 at around 1343 hours I was dispatched to 914 Forrest St for an assault.  When I arrived I spoke to the victim, Jacoa Greene.  Greene stated that Collian Little, boyfriend, placed his hands around her neck, struck her in the face cutting her cheek and threw her around the room ripping her outer shirt.Greene was crying and appeared shaken up by the incident.  Greene stated that Little left the resident after the assault.Greene had a laceration to the left side of her cheek which was sustained during the assault.  Based on Greene`s statement and having signs of assault I obtained a warrant for Little for assault on a female.
On 04/16/12 at approximately 1106 hours, I spoke with the Department of Social Services in reference to a sexual assault that occurred in the northern part of High Point.

On 04/18/2012 I responded to the High Point ER in reference to an assault which took place over a 24 hour period. When I arrived I spoke to the victim, who was so desperate to escape the abusive relationship, she had verbally communicated that she wanted to kill herself. After agreeing to seek help through the Hospital staff she recounted the horrific events that had taken place. I was able to obtain suspect information, and apprehend him later in the afternoon. He has been placed in the High Point jail under a domestic hold, with more serious charges pending.

On 04-15-2012 at approximately 1059 hrs I responded to 601 N Elm St, High Point ER, reference assault.  On scene it was discovered it was a domestic assault.  Victim was not cooperative, and would not provide information.
On 04/15/2012, I responded to 204 Belle Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.

Officer P. Welch and I received a call for a domestic disturbance and the call notes stated it was a domestic dispute between an Angela Petty, the caller and xxxx, a roommate who used to be the complainant`s boyfriend.  The male was intoxicated.  Subject used to have a gun, but it is not there now.  Complainant advised he pushed her and threw her on the ground. I spoke with Angela Petty and her mother, Angela McElveen inside while Officer Welch spoke to xxxx outside.  After investigating, it was decided to arrest xxxx for Assault on a Female.  He was placed in the Guilford County Jail under a Domestic Hold. Angela Petty received the Victim`s letter, the State and HPPD Victim Information Sheet and I read the victim`s script to her. I recommend this case be cleared by arrest.

On 4/14/2012, at approximately 2300 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival, I met with Ms. Napper who advised she had been assaulted by Mr. Burns. Mr. Burns was arrested for assault.
On 4/14/12 at approximately 1853hrs I responded to a reported domestic assault.
I responded to 409 Spring Rd on a reported domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Ms Thomas.

On Saturday, April 14th, 2012, at 0639 hours, I responded to 1431-A West Avenue in reference to an assault.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Jackie Douglas who advised she hit Mr. Alexander Easterling with a shoe.

On Saturday, April 14, 2012 at about 4:49 A,M, we were dispatched to 808 Lakecrest Avenue apartment 1309 via departmental radio in regards to a domestic dispute. Upon our arrival we discovered that Ms. DeBoy was assaulted by her husband.
While sitting in my patrol car in the front parking lot of the police department, I witnessed an assault that started in the PD parking lot and continued onto the street.

Officer P. Welch and I responded to a call from Dominic Haynes in reference to his ex-girlfriend, Amber Moogk, trying to get into his apartment.  At about the same time we were arriving on the scene, Communications stated the suspect had "keyed" the victim`s vehicle and was leaving the scene in a green Lexus.  When we arrived we did not see the Lexus.  Officer Welch proceeded to speak with Mr. Haynes while I looked for the vehicle.  I did not locate same.  When I returned to the parking lot, Officer Welch was on Mr. Haynes` cell phone with Amber Moogk.  (She called Mr. Haynes and Officer Welch answered.)  Ms. Moogk told Officer Welch that she was at home, but when he asked her about knocking on Mr. Haynes` door at 0430, Ms. Moogk admitted she had  been in the area so she decided to knock on his door because she needed a place to stay.  Officer Welch asked her to come back and talk to us and that she needed to check on warrants later.  She asked why and he informed her that there would be a warrant for damage to the vehicle and she asked what proof did he have and Officer Welch told her that we had a witness.  She did not return to the scene while we were there. Mr. Haynes stated Ms. Moogk kept calling him and then came over and knocked and banged on the door.  He watched her from his window "key" the gold Volkswagen Passat he had been driving.  The Volkswagen belongs to a friend.  Mr. Haynes said Ms. Moogk went back and forth to her vehicle and would come back to the Volkswagon and "key" it some more.  She left just prior to our arrival.  The Volkswagen Passat had definite fresh scratches on the 4 doors, both front and rear quarter panels and the trunk lid area.  Mr. Haynes stated he had to be at work early this morning and would definitely go to the magistrate`s office later this afternoon with Belma Ceric, the person who drives the Volkswagen that he had borrowed.  We informed him to also talk to the magistrate about trespassing since he had told Ms. Moogk not to come back and about harassing phone calls.

Officer Welch and I responded to a domestic disturbance between a mother and daughter. The call notes stated a 14 year old had assaulted her mother by pulling her hair when the mother was trying to punish her.  The daughter got upset and the mother was trying to gain control.

On 04-12-12 at 0115 hours I responded to 513-H E. Commerce Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I met with Victim #1 and Victim #2.  Both subjects stated that the Offender assaulted them.  Victim #1 obtained an arrest warrant on the Offender for assault on a female.  The Offender was arrested at the Magistrate`s Office without incident.
On this date I responded to the above location in reference to an assault.  Upon arrival I made contact with the caller and other officers on scene located the suspect and placed him under arrest.

On 04-10-12 at 0120 hours I responded to 2302-A Shadow Valley Rd. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the Victim and the Offender.  The Offender had moved out of the residence earlier in the evening, was told to not come back by the Victim, and warned by the Police that he would be arrested for domestic criminal trespass if he came back.  The Offender was arrested without delay and placed in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.
On this date I responded to High Point Hospital in reference to a rape victim.  During the investigation the suspect was identified and arrested.
The victim stated that she was assaulted by the offender.  The victim stated that during an argument the offender became upset and struck the victim in the face with his hand.
On 04-08-2012, I received a call via communications to respond to 508-A Newton Pl in reference to an assault with a deadly weapon call that had already occurred.  No one was injured in this incident.

On 04/08/2012 I responded to 722 Forrest St. in reference to a domestic.  Upon arrival I made contact with the victim who was assaulted.  Mr. James Howell was arrested with domestic assault and was placed in Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.
On April 07, 2012 at approximately 1956 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance on 808 Shamrock Road.  When I arrived the victim stated that his girlfriend tore his clothes.

Officers responded to 910-B Sharon St on a reported domestic disturbance.  Upon the officers arrival the suspect had left the scene flee with the victims cell phone.  The victim told officers they were in an argument and the suspect assault her by choking her until she briefly lost consciousness.  She further advised he held her down and bit her in multiple places and struck her with his fist.  Warrants were issued but are un-served at the time of this writing.
On April 7, 2012 I responded to 606 Wesley Dr. in reference to an assault complaint. Through investigation it was determined that Glynnisha Paulk assaulted Roxxana Womack.

On 04-07-2012, I responded to 1101 Anderson Place in reference to a domestic disturbance.  When I arrived, I spoke to the victim, who told me the suspect had already left the scene.  Prior to the suspects departure, she busted a window on the house and the windows to his vehicle.

On 4/5/2012 at approximately 1936 hours, Officers were dispatched to the intersection of N Centennial St and Charlotte Av in reference to an assault in progress.Upon arrival, Officers met with the victim who advised she had been assaulted.  The offender, Mr. Rogers-Stubbs was arrested on scene booked into the High Point Jail for Assault on a Female.

On April 5, 2012 I responded to E. Green Dr. at Cable St. in reference to a disturbance.  Upon my arrival I made contact with the victim, Sheila Little.  Ms. Little stated that Steven Moore her ex-boyfriend stole her purse and fled the scene on foot.  Mr. Moore was later located and arrested for the offense.
On 04/05/2012 I responded to 513 Flint Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The suspect was later arrested without incident.
On 4/4/12 at approximately 1810hrs I responded to a reported assault.

On April 4, 2012, I was dispatched to 124 Manor Dr. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I contacted the victim, Stacy Johnson, who advised that the father of her child, Damion Childers, assaulted her.

On 04/03/2012 at 2302 hours I responded to 308 N West Point AV in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I spoke with the victim, Mrs. Markita Fountain, who advised me that her husband, Mr. Andre Fountain had hit her across the face and above the lip following an argument. Mr. Fountain fled the scene and was not located. A warrant was issued for his arrest for Assault on a Female and for Communicating Threats.
On this date, I responded to a domestic call involving Douglas Robinson and Selena Brown.  Mr Brown was told to leave the property but refused.

Ms. Brooks stated that she and her boyfriend, Christopher Hairston, had an altercation in which Hairston forced her to the ground and struck her in the head with his fist.  Ms. Brooks was at Thomasville Medical Center where she had received treatment for minor injuries she said occured during the incident.  I obtained a warrant on Hairston for Assault on a Female.

On April 2, 2012 I was dispatched towards the 1100 block of Country Club Road for a reported disturbance in a moving car (described as a red Nissan).  Officer Jeffrey Crouse (Traffic 6) actually stopped the vehicle a short time later on the lot of 1810 Westchester Drive.  After interviewing both the male driver (Patrick Smith) and the female passenger (Meredith Scott), I decided to arrest both for assault.  Both were taken to the Police Department for processing, then to the Magistrate`s Office where they were ultimately placed in jail.  Smith also had a failure to appear that was served on him.

On 04/02/2012 I responded to 1609 Cedrow Av for a report of a domestic disturbance. I spoke to the victim who stated that when her estranged husband came to pick up their child, he became upset that she would not take a few minutes to talk to him. When she would not listen, the suspect grabbed her by her left arm and started to shake her to get her to listen. She was able to free herself, and push him out the door. The suspect left the scene prior to my arrival. EMS was not dispatched to the scene.

On 04/1/2012 I responded to 1405 Guyer St. in reference to a 911 hang up.  Upon arrival it was a domestic disturbance and assault had occured.  The issue was investigated and charges were made accordingly.

On 04/01/2012, at approximately 0445 hours, I responded to 2601 Triangle Lake RD in reference to a domestic disturbance involving intimate partners.  Upon my arrival, I made contact with the resident, Mr Kim Davis, who advised that his son`s girlfriend, Miss Jameka Robinson, had forced entry into the home via a bedroom window and was still inside the residence.  Subsequent to investigation, Miss Robinson was arrested and charged with one count of misdemeanor breaking and entering and one count of injury to real property.

On March 31, 2012 at approximately 1500 hrs, K-9 Officer Mustian and I responded to 2401 Robbins St in reference to a Domestic assault that had just occurred. During the investigation I determined that the suspect had struck the victim in the face causing a serious injury. The suspect had then left the scene before our arrival.
On Friday, March 10, 2012, at approximately 2043 hours, I was dispatched to 3977 Fountain Village Lane in reference to a domestic issue.
On 3-30-12, at approximately 1204 hours, while on uniform patrol I responded to 205 Seashire Ct in refernce to a trespass call.  A subject was arrested for offenses committed on scene.

On Friday March 30, 2012, at 12:08 pm, a call was dispatched to 339-C Henley St in reference to a domestic disturbance.Upon arrival, contact was made with the victim Ms. Jess Marie Baez-Rodriguez.  Baez-Rodriguez was complaining about being struck in the back of the head, but refused EMS.As a result of the investigation warrants were obtained on Jose Miguel Hernandez-Cruz for assault on a female.At the time of the report Hernandez-Cruz has not been arrested.
On 3-30-12 I responded to the 300 block of Meadow Pl. in reference to a domestic disturbance.

On 03-29-2012 I responded to 422 Burgle Place in reference to an assault that was taking place.  When I arrived I spoke to all the parties involved.  The male party had an obvious bite wound on his chest.  The female party was arrested for assault.
On 3-29-12 I responded in reference to a report of an assault that occurred at 3904 Colony Drive.
On Thursday, 03/29/2012, I responded to 417 White Oak St in reference to a domestic disturbance. Arrests were made in this case.
On March 28, 2012, police responded to a domestic assault in which the victim refused to prosecute and there were no visible signs of injury.
On March 28, 2012 at approximately 1605 hours, I responded to 1121 Young Place in reference to a domestic disturbance. It was later reclassified as an assault.

offense: ALL OTHER FILING FALSE POLICE REPORT
body: On March 28, 2012, I received a call at 2004 hours to assist Lynestra Glover at the Amtrak train station in going to the Women`s Shelter. Communications had already spoken to the Women`s Shelter and Ms. Glover had been approved.  After speaking with her, it was determined that her live-in boyfriend, Maurice Watson, had communicated a threat to her and assaulted her earlier in the day.  I transported her to the Magistrate`s office where Magistrate Brannon issued warrants for Assault on a Female and Communicating Threats with a Domestic Hold.  Then I transported Ms.  Glover to the Women`s Shelter.  It was later determined that Ms. Glover lied about the domestic assault.  The address was bogus, and she made up the offender`s name.  I charged Lynestra Glover with Filing a False Police Report and she was placed in the Guilford Co. Jail under $250.00 secured bond. I recommend this case be cleared by arrest.
On 3-28-12, I responded in reference to a report of an arson that occurred at 2410-1B Bellemeade Street.

On 03/25/2012, I responded to the POLICE DEPARTMENT located at 1009 LEONARD AV in reference to a domestic disturbance in progress. Upon my arrival, I made contact with the victim, RONALD RAY WILSON who advised that he had been assaulted by his lover, DELOIS SMITH while driving on N. COLLEGE DR. Upon further investigation, DELOIS SMITH was arrested for SIMPLE ASSAULT; she was arrested without incident.

On Sunday, 3/25/12, at approximately 1515 hours, I responded to 2303 Van Buren Street regarding a domestic assault involving intimate partners.  Upon my arrival I met with Belen Castro and her three children.  Castro told me that her ex-boyfriend and the father of her children, Leo Medrano came to her house and forced his way inside.  Castro said Medrano punched her in the face multiple times.  I met with Castro at the magistrate`s office and assisted her in obtaining a Warrant for Arrest against Medrano for Assault on a Female.  I arrested Medrano at 1920 Brentwood Street soon after.  Medrano was held on a domestic hold.

On 03/25/2012 I responded to 1511-d Waverly St. in reference to a domestic disturbance.   Upon arrival I made contact with suspect and victim.  Victim had injuries and suspect was charged accordingly.

On Saturday, March 24, 2012 at approximately 1752 hours I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance at 640 Ansley Way.  I arrived on scene and spoke with the victim, Linda Good, who stated that she and her boyfriend, Freddie Pugh, had been involved in a verbal disagreement and the offender, Freddie Pugh, grabbed her and threw her onto the pavement which caused her to receive abrasions to both palms of her hands, and complained of a possible hip injury.I spoke with the offender who stated that he and the victim had got into a argument and the victim threw a wooden planter into his window on the residence breaking the same.  The offender stated he grabbed the victim at that point and threw her to the ground.The offender was arrested for assault and transported to the magistrates office and was placed in jail.

On 03/23/2012 at 2332hrs I responded to the above address in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  When I arrived the victim stated she had been assaulted by her boyfriend who was inside the residence.  The victim did not have any signs of assault and went to the Magistrate`s office to obtain warrants for Assault on a Female.  Officers responded back to the residence where the suspect was arrested.  The victim did not need EMS or medical attention.

On 03/23/2012 at 2014hrs I responded to 512 Player Dr in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  The victim advised his estranged wife came to his friends residence and shocked him with a stun gun.  I met with the suspect at the High Point Police Department where she was arrested for misdemeanor Asault with a Deadly Weapon.  The victim refused EMS or recieving any medical treatment.

On 03-23-12 at 1354 hours I responded to 2408 E. Lexington Avenue in reference to assisting EMS.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the Victim.  The Victim stated that she took several muscle relaxers in an attempt to kill herself.  The Victim was transported to High Point Regional Hospital by Guilford County EMS.  The incident was reclassified as a Suicide Attempt.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 03/23/2012 at 1253 hours police responded to 405-B Taylor in reference to a domestic disturbance. Officers made contact with the victim and reporting party, Myshana Campbell, who advised Officers that her ex-boyfriend had been to her residence in violation of a domestic protection order. The suspect was located at his residence, arrested, and taken to High Point Jail. The subject is on a domestic hold for the violation of the 50-B domestic order.
On 03/23/12, at 1520 hours, the victim reported that the two listed offenders vandalised the inside of her residence.  The victim is in a relationship with one offender, and they live together.

On this date, I responded in reference to a vandalism to auto that occurred overnight.  During the investigation, the suspect, Jeremy Closser, was identified and was charged with Injury to personal property.

On Thursday March 22, 2012 I responded to 904 Gordon Street in reference to an assault. Upon my arrival I spoke with Heather Gray, who advised her and her boyfriend Willie Shaw had gotten into an argument over Facebook. Gray said Shaw began to punch her in the stomach and he then hit her in the mouth. Gray was escorted to the magistrate`s office where she took out charges on Shaw for assault.
On 03/22/2012 I responded to 332 Ennis St in reference to a domestic assault.  Upon further investigation one subject was arrested on assault related charges.
On March 22, 2012 at 1543 hours, I was flagged down on Centennial St. reference a domestic assault. The suspect has been arrested.

On 03/22/2012 at about 11:11 AM I responded to 905 Hickory Chapel Rd for a reported domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I located both parties at 904 Hickory Chapel Rd. They were separated and waiting for my arrival. I observed visible injury on Enrique which I attributed to an intentional act by Rebbecca. I spoke to the residents at 904 but none of them would admit to calling and stated that they didn`t see anything. Lab responded for photos. Rebbecca was arrested and transported without incident to the PD where she was processed before being transported to the magistrates office.

On 03-20-2012 I responded to 625 Spring Garden Circle in reference to a domestic assault.  Upon my arrival I spoke to the offender, who advised that he assaulted his girlfriend during an argument.  I spoke to the victim, who confirmed that she had been assaulted.  The offender was placed under arrest and charged with Domestic Assault on a Female.  He was confined in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On 03/20/2012, Officers responded to 618 Cable St on a reported stabbing.  Upon the officer arrival it was discovered the victim left the residence and was discovered a short ways away, with two stab wounds to his back.  The offender was located at 618 Cable, where evidence existed to make an arrest.   This incident was Domestic Disturbance with intimate partners.
At about 1230 hours, on this date, I responded to 505 E Green Dr. in reference to a sexual assault that occurred at an unknown location.
On 03/19/2012, I responded to the Magistrate`s Office to a domestic disturbance.  Upon further investigation, both subjects were arrested and placed in the High Point Jail.

On 03-19-2012 at 0244 hours, I responded to an address in the northeast section of the city in reference to an assault.  When I arrived, the victim stated that she was assaulted by her boyfriend with a knife and by strangulation.

On 03/18/2012 I responded to 212 Montlieu Av in reference to a Domestic Disturbance. The victim was assaulted with a closed fist by the suspect leaving visible signs of injury to the left side of his face.

On 03/18/2012 I responded to 411 Pine Grove Dr In reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I made contact with the victim.  The victim had signs of assault, suspect was later caught and arrested.

On 03/18/2012 I responded to 1223 Carolina Street in reference to a Domestic Disturbance. Both parties assaulted one another leaving visble signs of injury. Both parites were arrested as the assualts appeared mutual.

On 03/17/2012 I responded to 917 Grant St. in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I spoke with the victim who stated her boyfriend had just assaulted her.  The boyfriend had already left the scene and warrants were sought.

On 03/16/2012 I responded to 2005 Mcguinn Dr. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  It was reported that a subject`s father was shooting at him. The scene was made safe and charges were made accordingly.

On 3/16/2012 at around 1607 hours I was dispatched to 406 Hobson Street for unknown trouble that was changed to possible domestic assault between Melissa Davis (victim) and Daren Ruffin (suspect).When I arrived I spoke to Davis, Davis stated that Ruffin had hit her in the mouth two times.  Davis had minor injury to her upper lip and bottom lip.   I spoke to Ruffin who stated that he has hit Davis in the past but did not hit her this day.  When I asked how Davis got the fat upper lip and cuts to the bottom lip he replied, "I do not know".  Ruffin said that they had been arguing because he wanted to break up with Davis, but Davis did not want to let him go.I placed Ruffin under arrest for assault on a female and transported him to the county building.  Ruffin went before Magistrate Garber and was given a Written Promise to Appear in court on 4/20/2102 at 0830 hours.

On 03/16/2012, I responded to 2001 APEX PL in reference to a DOMESTIC DISTURBANCE IP in progress. Upon my arrival, I made contact with the reporting party PEARLIE CLARK BARNES who advised that she had gotten into an argument with her husband NATHANIEL BARNES while inside of the residence. Upon conclusion of the investigation, it was determined that while there was no probable cause for an arrest to made, a handgun was removed from the residence at the request of the reporting party.

On March 16, 2012, at approximately 0034 hours, I responded to 1100 Prospect Street in reference to a domestic dispute. Upon arrival, I made contact with all parties involved in the parking lot. The defendant, Thomas Blackistone, advised his estranged wife/victim (Jama Blackistone) followed him to the bar and began pushing him. He stated she pushed him for about 15 minutes until he pushed her back causing her to fall to the ground. The victim had both elbows scrapped and a bump on her head. She refused medical treatment. The defendant was arrested and transported to the Magistrate`s Office.
On 3-15-2012 at 2304 hours I responded to a report of an assault at 216-A Windley St.  Upon arrival I spoke to Christina Green and she stated that her boyfriend Michael Ferree had assaulted her.

On 3-15-12 at approximately 1226hrs officers responded to 1701-H Oneka Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon our arrival we were met by the male party involved outside of the residence who initially advised it was only a verbal argument but then advised he was assaulted.Neither party had visible marks, however the female party was taken into custody for resisting a public officer.

On Thursday March 15, 2012 Officer Mizell and myself responded to 144 Asbill Avenue in reference to a Domestic. Upon our arrival Officer Mizell spoke with the caller Amber Pegram and I spoke with her boyfriend Derrick Wilson. After speaking with both subjects Pegram was placed under arrest domestic assault.

On 03-14-2012 I was dispatched to 3971 Elizabeth Glen Way to a domestic call. Upon arriving I spoke with the victim who stated she and her boyfriend had gotten into an argument and the victim was assaulted . The suspect had left before I arrived and after speaking with the victim she had recieved a small cut on the bridge of her nose which did not require medical treatment .  I  obtained a warrant for assault on a female on the suspect  Jaishon Banks which had not been served at the time of this report.

On 03-14--2012, I responded to 1006 Anderson Pl in reference to an armed subject.  When I arrived, I made contact with Mr. Mayfield and Ms. McInnis.  There was no assault, however Mr. Mayfield did throw Ms. McInnis` phone across the roadway while she was attempting to call the Police.  Mr. Mayfield was arrested and charged with Interefence With Emergency Communication.

On 0314/2012 I responded to 312-A Henley Street in reference to an assault.  I arrived and made contact with the victim who advised her boyfriend assaulted her.  I escorted the victim to the magistrate`s office and warrants were obtained.  The suspect has not been located at this time.
On 03/14/12 at approximately 0512hrs I responded to a reported domestic disturbance.
On 03-13-2012 at 2349 hours, I responded to 1447 N Hamilton St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  One arrest was made for assault on a female and interfere with emergency communication.
On 3-12-2012 I responded to 1021 Richland Street in reference to an armed subject chasing a female with a knife.  The suspect was located inside the residence and arrested.

On 03-11-2012 at approximately 1853 hrs I responded to 606 W Lexington Ave reference a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I met with victim who advised what happened, and that the suspect had fled the scene.  Warrant was sought and received for the suspect reference domestic assault.

On 3/11/12 at about 12:00 PM I responded to 820 Hopewell St for a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I found all the parties on scene. I spoke to each of the individuals and determined that the suspect and his mother had been arguing. During the argument she attempted to discipline him and the suspect assaulted his mother leaving visible injury. I took him into temporary custody and contacted DSS on call. Charges were filed via a Juvenile petition and the child was released to a responsible party at the direction of DSS on call.
On this date I responded to a domestic disturbance at 1003 Cherokee Dr.  As a result of the investigation, Stephanie Hawks was arrested and charged with simple assault.
On 03/10/12, at 1517 hours, the victim reported a vandalism to her vehicle.  The vehicle was parked unattended at 5815 Samet Drive at the time of the incident.

On 3-8-2012 at 4:24pm I  responded to 517-G E. Commerce Av. in reference to Domestic Disturbance.Upon arriving at the above location I made contact with the victim who advised the suspect assaulted her during an argument.

On 03-08-2012, I was dispatched to 2122 Carlisle Way in reference to a domestic disturbance.   When I arrived, it was obvious a disturbance of some sort took place at this location.  As a result of the investigation, both parties involved in the altercation were arrested.  The male party was arrested and charged with Assault on a female and placed in the High Point Jail under a domestic hold.   The female party was cited and released for simple assault.

On this date, officers were dispatched to a moving domestic disturbance. Upon arrival into the area the suspects were last seen, contact was made with four adults, and one infant. Subsequent to investigation, two of the four adults were taken into custody for Domestic Violence. Both subjects were charged with assault, taken infront of a Magistrate, and placed in the custody of the Guilford County Jail on NO BOND.
On Sunday March 4, 2012, I responded to 300-A Meredith St. in reference to an assault that had just occurred.
On O5Mar12, this detective was made aware of a 50B warrant that had been taken out. See detective`s followup for details.

On 03-03-2012, I spoke by phone with the victim, Ms. Allen, who stated that the temporary  license tag on her vehicle had been stolen. Ms Allen stated she is moving and had her vehicle in the driveway at 4301 Bradbury Way while she placed items in her vehicle. As Ms. Allen was getting ready to leave, she noticed the tag on her vehicle was missing, she stated she knows the tag was on her vehicle when she got to the home. I had the tag entered into NCIC this date and a BOL was put out for the tag.

On Saturday, March 3, 2012 at approximately 0136 hours I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance at 5020 Apartment 3C, Samet Drive.  I arrived on scene and spoke with the victim, Ashley Beck, who stated that she and her boyfriend, Corey Slade, had been involved in a confrontation over Mr. Slade thinking that she was cheating on him.  The victim stated the confrontation turned physical and the suspect, Corey Slade, hit her in the face with a red in color plastic drinking cup and simultaneously punching her at the same time.The offender was arrested after a physical confrontation with police and was transported to the magistrate`s office and placed in jail.

On 03-02-12 at 1941 hours I responded to 2200 Westchester Drive (Food Lion) in reference to a domestic disturbance IP.   Upon my arrival I met with Ms. Wiggins (Victim).  Ms. Wiggins stated that her live in boyfriend and father of her children, Gene Oxendine (Offender) assaulted her at 330 Hodgin Street.  A warrant for arrest was obtained on Mr. Oxendine for assault on a female.
The arrested juveniles engaged in a fight on the campus of High Point Central at dismissal time.  Both were charged with affray.  Clear by arrest.

On Thursday, 03/01/2012, at approximately 1521 hours I responded to 204 Venable Court in reference to a Domestic Disturbance. Upon arrival at the scene I made contact with the victim and reporting party of the crime, Miss Lisa Gardner, who advised me that her boyfriend had assaulted her. The suspect was located at the residence and arrested for Assault on a Female. The suspect was placed in High Point Jail under a Domestic hold.
On 5-9-2012 I took a report of a sexual assault that occurred in High Point.

I was dispatched to 2010 Almina Place for a reported disturbance in the street.  Upon arrival and as a result of an investigation, an arrest was made for domestic assault.  The suspect, Jose Juan Torrez Gallegos, was taken to the Police Department and processed, then taken before Magistrate Brannon where he was placed in jail under a domestic hold.

On 02-28-12 at 1849 hours I responded to 119 Dorothy Street in reference to a domestic disturbance IP.  Upon my arrival I met with the Victim at the Citgo on the corner of W. English Road and Dorothy Street.  The Victim had visible signs of injury from an assault.  I accompanied the Victim to the Magistrate`s Office where she obtained a warrant for arrest on the Offender for assault on a female.  The Offender was arrested shortly thereafter.

On 02/28/2012 I responded to a location outside of  the city for a report of child abuse that occured in the northern part of High Point. I spoke with the victim and reporting parties about the incident.
On February 26, 2012, I responded to a domestic at 706 Richland St.
On February 26, 2012 at approximately 1428 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance between husband and wife.  When I arrived the wife had assaulted the husband in two places on his body.

On 2-26-12, at approximately 0502 hours, I responded to 1421-B Furlough Ave in reference to a domestic violence call.  Upon arrival, the victim stated her brother assaulted her and the suspect was arrested for assault.

On 2-25-2012 I responded to 419 Player Drive in reference to a domestic disturbance.  When  I arrived I spoke to the caller, Mr. Tucker and the victim, Ms. Mickle.  Ms. Mickle had been assaulted by her mother, Ms. Casey, who fled the scene prior to police arrival.  Ms. Casey was located at her residence and arrested for assault.  She was placed in the Guildford County Jail.
On 2/25/12 at approximately 1100hrs, I responded to a reported domestic assault.
On 2/24/12 at approximately 1319hrs I was dispatched to respond to a reported sexual assault in the Southwest portion of the city.

On Thursday, 2/23/2012, at approximately 2130 hours, I responded to room 133 of the Travel Inn motel at 2429 W. Green Drive regarding a public disturbance.  Upon my arrival, I heard screaming coming from the room and made entry.  I immediately detained Jeb Kidd and met with Christina Short who was bleeding from her face.  EMS arrived and cleared both Kidd and Short who refused to go to the hospital.  I arrested Kidd who was charged with Assault on a Female, and cited Short who was charged with Simple Assault.  Kidd was placed in Guilford County Jail on a domestic hold.

On this date officers responded to 3800 block of Beverly Hills Dr in reference to a naked female running in the area.  During the investigation, a female, was located hiding behind a house suffering from an assault. Warrants were obtained for the suspect`s arrest.
On February 22, 2012 I responded to 206 Taylor Ave apartment C in reference to a domestic assault that occurred. During the investigation both parties were charged with simple assault.
On 02/22/2012 I responded to a domestic dispute at 2326 Brentwood St.  The Offender had struck the Victim across the face twice.  The Offender was arrested and charged with Assault on a Female.

On Wednesday, 2/22/12, at approximately 0230 hours, I responded to 1219 Turney Court regarding a Domestic Disturbance involving Intimate Partners.  Upon my arrival, I met with Lajuana Sellu who told me that her husband, Victor Sellu had assaulted her and left the house prior to our arrival.  Sellu had visible scratches on both her forearms and photographs of same were taken.  Victor Sellu was arrested by Officer Parvin following a traffic stop and transported to the police department where I took custody of him.  Sellu was charged with Assault on a Female and Interfering with Emergency Communication and was held in the Guilford County Jail on a domestic hold.

On Tuesday, February 21st, 2012, I responded to 3612-A Walden Lane in reference to an assault that had already occurred.  Prior to my arrival I was advised by Police Communications that a male had been stabbed in the arm by his wife.  Upon my arrival, it was determined that a male resident had been stabbed by a female that had left prior to Police arrival.

On 02/21/2012 I responded to 1744 Stoneybrook Dr in reference to a suicidal subject.  Upon arrival I made contact with the victim who stated she took pills to hurt herself.  She was then taken for mental evaluation.

On Monday, February 20th, 2012, at 0017 hours, I responded to 209 Murray Street in reference to an assault.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Geraldine Williams who advised Mr. Derick Williams assaulted her.
On Sunday Febuary 19 2012, I responded to 1212 B E. Commerce Dr. in reference to an Assault that had occurred at 114 Greensboro Rd. at some point in the early morning.

On 02-18-2012 I responded to 1515 Pershing Street in reference to a disturbance.  When I arrived I made contact with Mary Shufford and Ricky Alston.  Both stated they were assaulted by the other and both had obvious signs of being involved in an assault.  Shufford and Alton are engaged and living together.  Both were arrested for assault and placed in the Guilford County Jail.

Complainant stated that she was at 307 Oakwood St. at a friend`s residence when her ex-boyfriend, Antwan Harper, began arguing with her and struck her in the right side of the head with his hand.  The complainant did not have any apparent injuries.  The complainant went to the magistrate`s office to swear out a complaint, and the magistrate issued a WFA on Harper for Assault on a Female.  Myself and Ofc. Hillard and Lt. Dupke attempted to serve the warrant at Harper`s residence, but it did not appear that anyone was home at the time.  A BOL for Harper was broadcast through the police mobile network.

On this date, a southside resident came to the police department, and reported an assault by his mother of his child. Upon police arrival an investigation revealed that the victim got into a verbal altercation which escalated in him being bitten, and scratched. A  warrant was obtained and the female suspect was arrested for the violation. She was taken infront of a magistrate, placed in the custody of the Guilford County Sheriff`s Department on no bond. After further investigation, the victim was later cited for Assault on a Female.
I responded to 2401 Delaware Pl on a reported domestic disturbance involving a hand gun.

On 2/18/2012, at approximately 1945 hours, I was dispatched to the Emergency Room of High Point Regional Hospital reference Domestic Violence. Upon my arrival I met with Ms. Miller who had obvious facial bruising. She advised that she had an argument with her husband that had gotten physical where she was head-butted by him. Mr. Miller was arrested for Assault on a Female.

On 02/15/2012 Officers responded to 807 Eastchester Dr on a reported Domestic Violence incident with intimate partners.  Upon the on scene officers investigation it was determine the suspect assaulted the victim and an arrest was made for simply assault.

On 02/14/2012, I responded to 904 JEFFERSON PL in reference to a domestic disturbance that had just occurred. Upon my arrival, I made contact with the victim, KELVIN DONNELL THORNE who advised that he was just assaulted by his son, GIOVANNI ALIJIDAE THORNE during an argument. Upon conclusion of the investigation, GIOVANNI ALIJIDAE THORNE was arrested and charged with simple assault; he was arrested without incident.

On 2-15-12 officers responded to 200 Ardale Dr with a DSS worker in reference to reported child abuse.  Upon our arrival contact was made with Ms Lonnica Fleming and Mr Ramon Mason.  The DSS worker advised Ms Fleming that her children could not be around Mr Mason until further investigation into their case.  Ms Fleming was able to seek shelter with her children at her mother`s house in the city.

On the 13th day of February, 2012, at approximately 1915 hours, I responded to 818 W Fairfield Rd in reference to a trespasser.Upon arriving, Timothy Fields was found in an outbuilding on the property after he had previously been trespassed. Fields was charged with first degree trespass and also breaking and entering.

On 02-13-2012, at 1:19 am, I responded to 315 Hodgin St., in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The resident advised that at approximately 1:15 am, an ex-boyfriend forced entry to the residence.  The ex-boyfriend left before my arrival, therefore warrants were obtained for misdemeanor breaking and entering.

On February 12, 2012 I was dispatched to 411 Pine Grove Dr. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I contacted the caller, Brian Idol, who advised that his girl-friend, Erica Bolton, had assaulted him.
On February 11, 2012 I responded to 914 Amos St. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  After arriving at the scene Chrystal Johnson was arrested for simple assault.
On Friday, 02/10/2012, I responded to 115 Chestnut Dr in reference to an assault with a deadly weapon. An arrest was made in this case.

On this date, police were dispatched to a southside residence reference to a domestic assault. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed that a boyfriend and girlfriend were in a verbal altercation. The verbal altercation escalated to an assault, by the male, on the female. Warrants for arrest were drawn for Domestic Assault on Female on the male suspect.

At about 2020 hours, on this date, I responded to 2103 E Green Dr. in reference to a disturbance.  Upon arrival, I ascertained that Martha Bailey and her son, John Payne had been in a heated argument, during which Bailey stabbed Payne in the back with an ink pen.  Bailey was arrested and charged with Simple Assault.
The arrested subject was seen throwing down an item in the Junior parking lot.  Upon further investigation it was determined the item was Marijuana.  An arrest was made.

At 1747 hours on 2/7/2012, I responded to 1418 Valley Ridge Drive in reference to a Domestic Disturbance IP call.  Upon arriving on scene, the suspect had already left the area, but was located at another location.  While speaking with the suspect, the victim left her residence and obtained a warrant at the Magistrate`s office for communicating threats.  The suspect was arrested and placed into the Guilford County High Point Jail under a Domestic Hold.

On 2/7/2012, at around 1202 hours, I responded to 1150-D Roberts Lane for a report of a B&E that occurred this date.  Catrice Gray stated that her ex boyfriend left messages on her voice mail stating that he was going to break into the house and destroy the property.  Gray left and when she returned found her house broken into and destroyed, no items were taken.
The listed suspect was arrested for assaulting the listed victim.  There were no injuries.

On the 6th day of February, 2012 at approximately 2130 hours, I responded to 603-O E Commerce Av in reference to a domestic assault that had just occurred.Upon arriving, the victim had an eye that was swelling and the suspect had left prior to our arrival.The suspect was identified and the victim obtained warrants against same.

On 02/07/2012, 2350 hours, Officers were dispatched to a domestic dispute at 1628 Tracer Place.  Upon Officers arrival, Officers met with both parties involved and a witness to the incident.  Officers were able to determine most of the facts of what had happened between the two parties.  The victim did not want to press charges on the suspect.

On 02/06/2012 at 0849hrs I responded to the address above for a report of a domestic disturbance, with AWDW on the victim. I spoke to the victim who stated that he and his wife got into an argument while she was leaving for work. When he came out side she hit him with their car and left. He suffered minor injuries and refused EMS. Warrants have been taken out on the suspect.

On 2/5/2012 Officers responded to 741 Celtic Crossing Dr in reference to a domestic assault.  During the investigation, Wesley Zimmerman was arrested and charged for Assault, Assault on female, and Domestic Criminal Trespass.

I was dispatched to the above location in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I spoke to the victim who stated that she was assaulted by her husband.  The victim was not injured and no medical attention was needed.

On 02/05/2012 at approximately 0457 hours I responded to the police department located at 1009 Leonard AV in reference to the report of a domestic assault.  Upon my arrival I made contact with the reporting party and victim, Mrs Suzette McWilliams, who advised that at or about 0145 hours she had been assaulted by her boyfriend, Mr David McCoy, at their home residence of 606 Manley ST.  Mrs McWilliams stated that she had been struck in the face by Mr McCoy and that she had also been struck several times about the body with a golf club.  I escorted Mrs McWilliams to the county building where she obtained an arrest warrant for Mr McCoy for assault with a deadly weapon and communicating threats.  Mr McCoy was arrested shortly before 0600 hours and is currently under a forty-eight hour domestic hold in the High Point jail.

Upon my arrival I made contact with the involved parties, Mrs Selina Brown and Mr Douglas Robinson, at the end of the driveway.  No charges resulted from this investigation.

On the 4th day of February, 2012 at approximately 2200 hours, I responded to 1109 Winslow St in reference to a domestic disturbance between mother and daughter.Upon arriving, I spoke with the mother, Ms. Erica Bowman, who stated that her 17 year old daughter struck her and also put a knife to her throat.The 17 year old daughter had already left the scene, but Erica went to the Magistrate`s Office to obtain Involuntary Committment Papers on Jamia.The 17 year old daughter was located and transported to the High Point Regional Hospital.

On Tuesday, February 7th, 2012, I was dispatched to 1312 Providence Av. in reference to a vandalism to a vehicle that occurred some time between 1800 hours on 2/4/2012 and 1000 this date.  The vehicle was left parked in the driveway in front of this residence.

On 02/04/2012 at 1344hrs I responded to 2438 Williams Av for a call of a black male beating a black female. When I arrived the subject had fled the scene but was caught a short distance from the house. The victim suffered injuries to her face, and was transported to the ER. The suspect was placed in the High Point Jail under a domestic hold.
On Sunday, February 12th, 2012, I was dispatched to 612 Williamsburg Terrace, in reference to a possible child abuse.

On 01/31/2012 at 0926 hours I responded to 2102 Francis St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I made contact with the victim who stated the suspect had assaulted her.  The victim had visible injuries.  The suspect had fled the scene prior to police arrival.  A warrant for his arrest was drawn.  The warrant has not been served at this time.

On 01-29-2012 at 2335 hours, I responded to 6020-3A Red Cedar Drive in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I spoke to Holland Tonkin who stated that she and her daughter had been assaulted by her boyfriend while he was visiting their residence.Warrants have been obtained for the arrest of James Walsh for Assault by Strangulation, Assault on a female and Assault on a minor under 12.  A BOL has been broadcast and his residence and place of employment have been checked.

On 01/29/2012 at 1725hrs I responded to the above address in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  Sandra Morgan was arrested for assaulting her boyfriend.  Ms. Morgan was taken to the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.  The victim refused EMS.

On 01-29-2012 at approximately 1833 hrs I arrived to Forrest St and Norwood Av in reference to a reported domestic disturbance. Through further investigation Stanley Burgess was charged with first degree kidnapping, common law robbery, and assault on a female. Burgess was confined to the High Point Detention Facility under a $500,000.00 secured bond.

On 29 Jan 2012 we were dispatched to this residence in reference to a domestic disturbance.  When we arrived, we met with the caller/offender out in the street in front of the residence.  He explained that he and the victim had gotten into an argument and she refused to leave.  Officer Shackleton and I spoke with the victim and noticed red scratches on her neck area with some if the bleeding slightly.  When we asked her what happened, she replied that Purdy had pushed her and grabbed at her several times causing these injuries.  Purdy was arrested and charged with assault on a female.

On 01/28/2012 at approximately 2235 hours I responded to 1002 Pineburr RD in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I made contact with the reporting party and vicitm, Mrs Lacinda Tuttle, who advised that she had been assaulted by her husband, Mr Kenneth Tuttle.  Mr Tuttle had fled the residence prior to HPPD officers arrival.  Mrs Tuttle was transported to the magistrate`s office where she obtained an arrest warrant for domestic assault.  A BOL has been issued in reference to Mr Tuttle.

On 1-28-12 at approximately 0440hrs officers responded to 527-A Smith St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon officers arrival it was determined after speaking with Mr Michael Johnson that the disturbance occurred earlier in the morning at approximately 0022hrs.  Ms Shemeka Bland was the female party involved that was not on scene when officers arrived.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On the 28th day of January, 2012 at approximately 0011 hours, I responded to 3339 Wiliton Way in reference to a disturbance.The victim, Ms Celeste Watkins stated that a Mr. Mark Jones pointed a gun at her.I have not taken any charges out at this time.

On this date, a southside resident reported a vandalism committed by his ex-girlfriend. Upon police arrival, the victim advised his ex-girlfriend was knocking on the door, when he failed to open the door for her, she became angered, and started vandalizing his motor vehicle. His car was parked to the west side of his residence. There were keying marks around the entire vehicle, requiring repainting to fix same. The victim stated, he was going to draw warrants for the vandalism, and this report was produced for insurance purposes.

On Wednesday, January 25, 2012, at about 9:45 P.M., I was dispatched to call the listed caller. I spoke to Ms. Watts, and she stated that an unknown person removed her license plate from her vehicle without permission or authority.

On 01/25/12 at about 8:30 PM I responded to a reported domestic disturbance at 3904 Colony Ridge Ct. Upon my arrival I met with the victim who stated he had been in a physical altercation with his older brother. The victim had several apparent minor injuries that were consistent with his account of the events. The suspect was not on scene and could not be located at the time of this report. Photos were taken of the victims injuries. A warrant for simple assault was issued.
On 1-25-12 I responded in reference to a report of a domestic disturbance at 706 E. Kivett Drive.

On January 25, 2012 at approximately 1719 hours, I was dispatched to an assault call involving two young people walking down East Hartley Drive.  When I arrived the victim was crying and the suspect was walking behind her.

On 1-25-12 at approximately 1131 hours I responded to 607-G Granby Ave in reference to a domestic violence call.  Upon arrival I spoke with the complainant who stated that there was a fight between her and her boyfriend.

On Monday, January 23, 2012 at approximately 1920 hours, I was dispatched to 3819 Eagles View Court in reference to a domestic disturbance.The suspect, xxxx, was later arrested for domestic assault on a female.Digital photographs were logged onto the Police Y Drive.

Ms Carter witnessed her vehicle being damaged by her boyfriend after an argument the night before. The windshield on Ms Carter`s vehicle was smashed and several dents and paint chipping scratches were gouged into the sides. Ms Carter obtained warrants which were served a short time later.
I responded to 2901-A Sherrill St on a reported domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Mr. Pegram.

On the date/time listed I was dispatched to 527 W. Ward Av to a Disturbance.  Upon arrival I made contact with the victim.  She had obvious signs of being assaulted.  Her shirt was torn almost off, she had bruises & scratches on her face, chest, & arms, and she was very upset.  Further investigation revealed that the assault took place at 514 W. Ward where the victim & suspect live as boyfriend-girlfriend.We went to 514 W. Ward but were unable to make contact with the suspect.See Supplemental report for additional information.
The listed suspect was arrested for assaulting the listed victim.  The listed victim was transported to High Point ER reference minor injuries.
The listed suspects were charged with assaulting each other.  There were no major injuries.

On Saturday, January 21st, 2012, I responded to 1710 Waverly Street in reference to harassing telephone calls.  Upon my arrival, I was informed by the complainant that she had received a couple of harassing calls from a known person.

I responded to 2303 Francis St in reference to an assault that had taken place at an address on Jay Pl.  Complainant advised that her boyfriend came in the residence and began assaulting her for no reason.  She escaped and ran to her parents residence and called the police.

On 01/20/2012 at 1108hrs I was dispatched to 2420 N Main St for a report of a domestic disturbance. The reporting party stated that there was a Hispanic male dragging a white female through the PVA and trying to force her against her will into a green Dodge Durango which was parked to block the drive-thru lanes. When I arrived the suspect fled on foot back to his vehicle and left the scene attempting to run me over. He was caught as he pulled into the driveway of the victim`s house. He has multiple charges including AWDW on LEO, 2nd degree kidnapping, stalking, and numerous driving charges. He was placed in the High Point Jail under $100,000 bond.

On this date police units responded to 414 Otteray Avenue in reference to an assault.  Upon our arrival it was determined that both parties involved had assaulted each other.  Both Parrott and Lloyd were charged with assault in the matter.

Officer P. Welch and I responded to a possible domestic disturbance.  The caller refused and stated they heard yelling and a baby crying.  The caller stated it was the apartment next to Apt. G.  We arrived and spoke with the victim, Kimberly Williams.  She stated her ex-boyfriend, Robert York, had assaulted her.  He pulled her hair and knocked her against the wall causing an abrasion on the left side of the forehead and a swollen lip.  Mr. York had left the scene prior to our arrival.  We passed a black male on a cell phone near Guyer St. and Ambassador Ct. which we later found out was Mr. York.  Mr. York kept calling Ms. Williams while we were at the scene.  Officer Welch spoke with him on the telephone and asked to meet with him.  He did not want to meet.  Mr. York told Officer Welch that she had assaulted him. See his supplemental report for details about that conversation.  I also spoke with Mr. York while at the scene because he kept calling.  At that time, he would not give me his address or agree to talk in person.  I obtained photographs of the victim`s injuries.  These photographs were placed in the computer file in the lab.  I gave Ms. Williams the State of NC Victim Information Sheet and the High Point Police Department Victim Information Attachment Form.  I also explained to Ms. Williams the process for taking out a 50B order at the Clerk`s office. Robert York was later arrested.  I recommend this case be cleared by arrest.
On 01-18-2012 at 1648 hours, I responded to 503 Cable St in reference to a domestic disturbance with an assault.  One arrest was made for assault on a female.
I responded to 270 Beddington St on a reported assault.  Upon arrival I met with Ms Brown.
On 1/17/12 at approximately 1806hrs I responded to a reported domestic disturbance.
On Monday, 01/16/2012, I responded to 215 Dorothy St in reference to a domestic disturbance. Arrests were made in this case.

On 1/15/2012, at approximately 2330 hours, I was dispatched to the campgrounds at 3415 N Centennial St in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I met with Mr. and Ms. Smith who advised they had been drinking and arguing. Mr. Smith was arrested for Assault on a Female and interfering with the use of 911.
On January 15, 2012, I responded to 422 Burge Pl, in reference to a fight inside of the residence.
On 01/15/12 at approximately 1744hrs I responded to a reported domestic assault.
On Sunday January 15, 2012 I responded to the High Point ER, in reference to an Assault that had occurred at 1205 Furlough Ave.
On 01-14-2012 at approximately 0235 hours I responded to 207-B Herbert Pl in reference to a domestic disturbance. Through further investigation Christopher Mingo was charged with assault on a female.

I was dispatched to 115-4A Chestnut Drive for a reported assault in progress called in by a refused neighbor.Upon arrival, Officer Shackleton ran after the suspect, who ran out the side door (west behind the Chestnut Drive residence) and I assisted the victim awaiting EMS response due to her injuries.  Other Officers arrived quickly, set up a perimeter and a track was established within a few minutes.The suspect was located a short distance away and arrested for the assault (as well as an outstanding warrant for assault on a female from earlier on January 13, 2012).EMS checked the victim out and determined that she just had scrapes, scratches and bruises; ultimately clearing the scene.

On 01-13-2012 at 2014 hours, I responded to 115-4A Chestnut Street in reference to a disturbance.  When I arrived, I spoke to Bonnie Temple.  She stated that she had an argument with her boyfriend and he had left walking on foot.
On this date, 01/12/2012, I responded to 204-A Taylor St. to attempt to locate a wanted subject.  During the investigation, the suspect, Dominique Terry, was arrested for Violation of 50B.

On Wednesday, January 11, 2012 at approximately 0102 hours, I was dispatched to a harassment call where a female victim stated that her ex-husband was sending her numerous text messages threatening to kill her and her new boyfriend.The suspect, Phillip Rancer, was later placed under arrest for communicating threats.
On 01-08-12, I responded in reference to a report of a domestic disturbance that occurred at 912-B Grace Street.

On 01/18/2012 at approximately 0323 hours, Officers responded to 1420 Furlough Avenue in reference to a Domestic Disturbance in progress.   Upon arriving, the victim reported that her boyfriend, Mr. Wiley, assaulted her.   Mr. Wiley advised that he did not strike Ms. Quick and that she in fact scratched him on his face.  Mr. Wiley had marks on his face consistent with a recent assault, and Ms. Quick was arrested for assault.  Mr. Wiley was also arrested for an outstanding Order For Arrest for Failure To Appear.

On 01-07-12 Officer Moss and I responded to 308-A Henley in reference to an assault that already occurred. Warrants for Assault on a Female were obtain on Keith Dumas. The victim, Pammy Pouncy refused EMS.
On 1-7-12, at approximately 1846 hours, while on uniform patrol, I responded to 916 Asheboro St in reference to a nature unknown call.  A subject was arrested on assault charges.

No arrests have been made at this time.

On 01/07/2012 at 0236hrs I responded to the High Point ER in reference to an Assault.  The victim was assaulted by her boyfriend and was treated for her injuries and released.  A warrant for Assault on a Female was obtained for the suspect.

On 01/06/2012 at about 0750 hours I was dispatched to 204-A Taylor Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I arrived at the scene and spoke with the complainant, Wanneta Ijames, who stated that her ex-boyfriend, the suspect, Dominque Terry came over and assaulted her.  Ijames agreed to go the county building and take out warrants on Terry.  Ijames has an active 50B against Terry at this time.
On 01-6-2012 at approximately 2343 hours I responded to 1511-D Waverly St in reference to a domestic disturbance. Through further investigation Kathy Mcdowell was charged with simple assault.

On Tuesday January 3, 2012 at 2337 hours I responded to 203 E Springfield Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance between boyfriend and girlfriend.  Upon my arrival, I observed from outside the residence at the front door the suspect, Mr. Chase Carter assaulting his girlfriend, Ms. Nikki Rozier.  Mr. Carter was taken into custody and transported to the Guilford County Jail in High Point where he was held on a domestic hold.

On Thursday January 3, 2013 at 5:21 pm a call was dispatched to 2633-C Suffolk Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.Upon arrival contact was made with the victim Ms. Kaleena Green.  Green stated that she had been assaulted by her boyfriend after an argument.HPPD Lab Technician Pryor was dispatched to take photographs of Green.
On January 3, 2013 I responded to 1299 Vernon Pl. in reference to an assault that had occurred.

On Sunday January 1, 2012, I responded to 811 Granby Ave., in reference to a Residential Burglary that had just occurred

On January 01, 2012 at approximately 0343 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance on Saint Stephens Court.  When I arrived on scene, the victim met me at the road in his vehicle and stated that his girlfrend assaulted him.
On January 1, 2012 at approximately 0231 hours, I responded to 710 Cliffside avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance. One subject was arrested for an assault on a female.

On January 1, 2013 I spoke with Ms Thomasson in reference to a domestic assault. Ms Thomasson reported that her boyfriend struck her in the mouth. Ms Thomasson had a tooth knocked out as a result of the injury.   Ms Thomasson was taken to the hospital to be checked out as a precaution.   The suspect left the area on foot prior to the arrival of police.   A warrant for assault on a female and a lookout has been broadcast for the suspect.
On 02/01/2013 I responded to a reported sex act against a child.  I made contact with the Department of Social Services.

On 12-31-2011 I was dispatched to 4405 Essex Ct in reference to a domestic assault. Upon arriving I met with the victim Ms Kesha Warren who stated that her boyfriend Lloyd Daniel Davis had been at her home and that they had gotten into an argument over Ms Warrens facebook account. Mr Davis stated he was not getting enough attention according to Ms Warren and that after arguing for a short period Mr Davis picked up a glass flower vase and threw it at Ms Warren striking her in the right hand causing small cuts, EMS was called to the scene to treat the cuts to Ms Warrens hand . After throwing the vase Mr Davis took Ms Warrens vehicle which was parked in the driveway and left the scene before I arrived a check of the area failed to locate the suspect. Ms Warren also advised me that her 7 year old daughter was in the den when the assault took place and heard the argument but did not see the assault. After leaving the scene I took out warrants on Lloyd Davis for Assault on a Female and Unauthorized  Use of a Motor Vehicle and put out a BOL for the suspect and the vehicle. The victim was advised about taking out a 50 B for her protection and given our domestic violence information sheet.

At about 1600 hours, on 12-31-2011, I encountered Laquita Murphy and Nathaniel Ward in the park behind Morehead Recreation Center, they were engaged in physically assaulting each other in the presence of Murphy`s 2 year old child.  Murphy and Ward were arrested and charged with assault.
On December 31, 2011 at approximately 0201 hours, I responded to 901 Amos street in reference to a domestic dispute.One subject was arrested in reference to an assault that had occurred.
On December 30, 2011, the victim reported being assaulted and raped.

On 12-30-2011 Ms. McCrackin stated that her boyfriend, Mr. Benitez, had assaulted her during the night.  She had obvious signs of assault on her neck and chest.  Pictures of her injuries will be logged into evidence.

On 12-29-2011 at 2346 hours, I responded to 1011 N Main Street in reference to a domestic dispute.  When I arrived, I spoke to Jamie Ellison.  She stated that she had been in an argument with her boyfriend.I carried Ms Ellison to the magistrate office and she filled out an affidavited stated that Mr Mitchell had assaulted her by pushing her down. The magistrate issued a warrant for assault on Mr Mitchell. I then transported her back to 1011 N Main Street. Before the end of my shift, I received a call that Mr Mitchell had returned to the apartment.  I responded and located him and arrested him for the warrant.

On Thursday, December 29th, 2011m at 2102 hours, I responded to 2504-G Amabassador Court in reference to an assault.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Mr. Kevin Whitaker who advised his step-son assaulted him.

On 12/29/11 at 1831 hrs. I responded to 2335-1F Copperstone Dr. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I spoke with VI-1, Mrs. Kali Moncaleano.  She stated that during the times of occurrence that she went to her estranged husband`s apartment to remove some of her property from the residence.  Mrs. Moncaleano stated that she had located a receipt for a television and had it in her hand and that she was assaulted by Mr. Moncaleano as he was trying to take the receipt from her.  She stated that Mr. Moncaleano pushed her down onto the floor into a child`s bed and then took the receipt from her.I then spoke with IO-1, Mr. Juan Moncaleano.  Mr. Moncaleano stated that he and Mrs. Moncaleano have been separated for approximately two months and that she came over to his apartment on today`s date to get some property.  Mr. Moncaleano stated that he had the receipt for the television and that Mrs. Moncaleano was trying to take it from him.  Mr. Moncaleano stated that Mrs. Moncaleano jumped on him in an attempt to take the receipt from him and bit him on the arm.   Mr. Moncaleano had visible bite marks on his right arm and scratch marks on his left shoulder and there was a broken child`s bed in the rear bedroom.  Mr. Moncaleano`s injuries were photographed. Neither party wanted to press charges and wanted to separate for the night.  Both parties were arrested and charged with assaulting each other.  Lab Tech Parrott photographed and fingerprinted both individuals.  They were placed in the custody of the Guilford County jail under a domestic hold.  Court date for both is 02/03/11.

The victim and offender were involved in an altercation at the above location.  The altercation was over the custody of their grandson that is listed as Involved Otherwise.  The offender assaulted and pushed the victim outside of the restaurant.

Recruit Chriscoe acted as primary officer.On Thursday, December 29, 2011 at approximately 2:08am, I responded to 622 Hickory Chapel Rd in reference to a domestic related call.  I spoke with the victim and she advised me she was assaulted by her boyfriend.  My investigation led to an arrest.  The suspect was charged with Assault on a Female and was placed in the High Point Jail under no bond.

On 12/28/2011 I responded to 1710 Waverly St. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I made contact with the victim who stated she was assaulted by her husband.  Assistance was given in taking out warrants.

On 12/26/2011 at about 1253 PM I was dispatched to 519-B Cross St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I arrived at the scene and made contact with the complainant, Miquel Watts, who stated that he husband, Ronnie Oliver assaulted her and then left the scene.  Watts stated that she was in a heated argument with Watts when he assaulted her by scratching her face.  Oliver was not present when arrived.  Warrants were obtained on Watts for domestic related assault.

On 12-25-2011 at approximately 1702 hrs I responded to 421 Wright St reference a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival both subjects had assaulted each other, and were arrested on scene.  Only minor injuries observed.
On 12-25-11 I was dispatched to 810-B Park St. in reference to an assault.
On December 24, 2011, at 1852 hours, we were dispatched to 2884 Waterstone Loop reference a verbal domestic dispute.No arrests were made.
On 12/23/2011, I responded to 1515 Willard Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.

On this date, police were dispatched to an assault in progress. Upon police arrival an investigation revealed that a boyfriend girlfriend got into a verbal altercation. The altercation escalated into a physical altercation with both parties having visible wounds. The female advised that the male placed a handgun to her head and threatened to kill her. When the male was taken into custody he had a semi-automatic pistol in possession. He was subsequently arrested for Assault by Pointing a firearm and Assault on a Female. He was placed into the custody of the Guilford County Jail on no bond.

On December 23, 2011 at approximately 0220 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance Meadowside Terrace.  When I arrived, the wife of the residence stated that her husband needed to leave or she would kill him.
On 12-22-2011 at approximately 2000 I responded to 206-A N West Point Ave reference a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I witnessed assault, suspect was arrested on scene.

On Thursday, December 22, 2011 at approximately 0235 I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance complaint at 824 Cummings Street.  I arrived on scene and spoke with the victim, Malachia Jones, who stated that he had observed a dark in color vehicle traveling down the road.  The victim stated he went outside and the offender, Latonya Spann, jumped out of the car and began to assault him.  The victim stated that the offender bit him along the right forearm and scratched him along the left side of his head.  The victim did have visible injuries from the assault.  The victim stated the offender also damaged his mothers, Lydia Griffin, vehicle via breaking the radio antenna of Ms. Griffin`s 1993 Oldsmobile and fled the scene on foot.

On Thursday, December 22, 2011 at approximately 0006 hours I was dispatched to 1006 Apartment B Anderson Place in reference to a domestic disturbance complaint.  I arrived on scene and spoke with the victim, Monica Barlow, who stated that a black male whom she used to see and her got into an argument and he struck her in the head with his fist and fled the scene.  The victim was seen by EMS reference to a contusion on the left side of her forehead and requested to be transported to the hospital.

On December 21, 2011 I responded to 1507 E Commerce Ave in reference to a domestic assault that had occurred. Upon my arrival I noticed that Officer Shackleton and Officer Delong were speaking to a thin black female. During the investigation Ms Collins was arrested for assault.

On 12-20-2011 at around 1036 hours I was standing in the parking lot of 101 Coltrane St facing S Main St, when I saw a black female and male walking south on S Main St.  The two were arguing at each other, but from where I was standing I could not make out what was being said.  I could hear loud yelling and alot of hand movement. I stood and watched the two continue walking south on S Main St. for about a 100 yards still arguing, and then the black female open handed hit the male in the face.

On 12/20/2011, at approximately 0105 hours, Officers were flagged down by an individual on W. Ward Avenue near Cassell St. who advised an individual he knew, knocked him down and stole his cell phone.  Warrants were obtained on the suspect.

On Sunday, 12/18/11, at approximately 2045 hours, I responded to 318 Amhurst Avenue regarding domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I met with Brian Johnson who had visible signs of assault and told me his girlfriend Alecia McBean had punched him in the face.  McBean was arrested for simple assault.
On December 17, 2011 I was dispatched to 1251 Watermark Ct. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  A witness called and advised that she heard an argument and then heard three shots fired.
On 12/17/2011, a female called the Police and reported she had been assaulted on Waterloo Dr. in High Point.

On December 17, 2011, officers responded to 417 Nathan Hunt Drive in reference to a reported domestic assault.  Upon arrival, the complainant reported her boyfriend struck her in the face after stealing her money.  A witness was later located who explained the complainant repeatedly assaulted her boyfriend and vandalized his vehicle after he refused to give the complainant money.A warrant was obtained on the complainant for Simple Assault and Filing a False Police Report.The warrant is outstanding.

On Saturday December 17, 2011 at 1:05 am a call was dispatched to 1511-D Waverly St in reference to a domestic disturbance.Upon arrival contact was made with Mr. Timothy McDowell and his wife Kathy, her son Buck Carlton and his friends Amanda Daniels and Timothy Johnson.Mr. McDowell did not want his step-son Buck and his friends Amanda and Timothy at his house, because they had been drinking and smoking crack.  Mrs. McDowell said it was ok for her son and his friends to be at her apartment and wanted her husband to leave.No one was assaulted and Mrs. McDowell eventually agreed to leave with her son and his friends.Mr. McDowell was given a copy of the NC Domestic Violence Information Sheet as well as a Family Services of the Piedmont business card.  Mrs. McDowell left the residence without taking a copy of the NC Domestic Violence Information Sheet.

On December 16, 2011 I responded to 300-2H Ardale Dr. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I made contact with both parties involved, Mitchell Chapman Jr. and Nakysha Bridges.  After an investigation at the scene both parties were arrested for assault.

On 12-15-11, at 1742 hours, I responded to 1412-C Davis Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The call notes stated that the Offender was kicking in the front door to the residence.  I drove with lights and siren to 1412-C Davis.  Upon my arrival, the Offender had already fled the scene in a vehicle.  The scene was processed for evidence.  A warrant for attempted first degree burglary was issued on the Offender.  The incident was reclassified as a residential burglary.

On December 14, 2011 Cristin Overstreet called the Police to report that her live-in boyfriend, Darrell Hart, B-M-40, had assaulted her.  Officer J. Antignano and I responded.  Darrell Hart left in a silver Honda Accord, ZNZ-5300, prior to our arrival.  I obtained photographs of the victim`s injuries and photographs of the apartment in disarray.
