I gave Ms. Overstreet a copy of the State of NC Victim Information Sheet and the High Point Police Department Victim Sheet.  Warrants were obtained on Darrell Hart for Assault by Strangulation and Assault on a Female.  A Lookout was given.

On 12-14-2011 at 3:09 am, I responded to the emergency room of High Point Regional Hospital, located at 601 N. Elm St., in reference to an assault with a deadly weapon.  I made contact with the victim who had minor injuries.  The victim advised that approximately 12:30 am, this date, he was cut with a knife by his live in girlfriend.    The offender was located at their place of residence and taken into custody.  The offender was charged with misdemeanor assault with a deadly weapon and placed in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On 13 Dec 2011 the victim and witness whom live together were both in bed asleep when they were awakened by someone beating on the front door.  The victim went to the front door and found Natasha Reese a former girlfriend very drunk and very angry.  The victim stated that he told Ms. Reese to leave but she would not.  The victim stated that Ms. Reese then slapped him and scratched him on the arms and chest with her finger nails.  I examined the victim for injuries and found several minor scratches still bleeding as he said.  It should be noted that as I was pulling up on the call one door down, I observed Ms. Reese swinging her hands / fists at the victim who pushed her away and closed the front door.I arrested Ms. Reese and charged her with Simple Assault.  The magistrate placed her in jail under a domestic hold.
On 12-11-2011 I responded to 240 Beddington Street in reference to an unknown trouble. Two subjects were taken into custody during this time.

While working off-duty at Spring Valley Apartments, I was approached by a resident, Ms. Coachman.  She advised that her ex-boyfriend, who is also banned from the property, had kicked open her front door and fell asleep in the walk-in closet located in her bathroom.  She advised that they have two children together.  She advised that she stressed to him that he could not be on the property at all since he was banned, or she could be evicted from the complex.  She advised her sixteen year old daughter was the only one home at the time. Officer Lemons and myself located Mr. Tanner lying on the closet floor.  Mr. Tanner was intoxicated.  He was arrested without incident and was transported to the magistrates office.  He was charged with Misdemeanor Breaking and Entering and Second Degree Trespassing.  He was given a written promise to appear by Magistrate Brannon.

On 12-10-11 at around 11:20 pm, I responded to 1417 Apt B, West Avenue, in reference to a domestic assault. Upon my arrival I met with the victim, Mrs Devin Covington. Mrs Covington advised that her estranged husband, Mr Tavares Covington pushed his way into her house and assaulted her and her child. Mr Covington had an active 50 B against him.Before clearing the above call I was advised of an active disturbance at 1411 Apt B West Avenue. Mr. Covington was found at this location actively assaulting Mr TeDerrell Rippy and had also assaulted Mrs Thomas Thompson. Mr. Covington was arrested on site. Mr. Covington was taken to the Police Department where he was processed. Mr Covington was then taken to the Magistrates office were he was served with: 3 counts of  felony assault by strangulation, 3 counts of assault on a female, 1 count of simple assault. 2 counts of  felony first degree burglary, 1 count of domestic criminal trespass, 1 count of 50 B violation, 1 count of  felony stalking, and 1 count of resisting a public officer.Mr. Covington was taken to the jail and placed on a domestic hold with no bond.

n 12/10/2011, I responded to the HIGH POINT GYMNASTICS ACADEMY located at 3530 N. MAIN ST in reference to a domestic disturbance that already occurred. Upon my arrival, I made contact with the victim who advised that her husband had assaulted her in the parking lot; several witnesses in the parking lot confirmed the victim`s story. At the time of this report, STEPHEN PAUL CRADDOCK has been charged with assault on a female but has not been arrested.
On 12/10/2011, I responded to 304 Fourth Street in reference to an assist EMS call.  Upon arrival, it was discovered that a domestic assault occurred.

I responded to 4210-1B River Birch Loop in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The caller, who lived in the same building, stated they could hear a young male screaming.See Officer Narrative for details.

I responded to 229 Grand St. in reference to a domestic dispute.  The complainant, Ms. Dow, stated that her boyfriend, Kevin Stover, had assaulted her.  Stover had left prior to my arrival.   I escorted Ms. Dow to the magistrate`s office.  After conferring with the magistrate and speaking to the victim, I obtained a warrant on Stover for Assault by Strangulation.

On 12-07-2011 I came in contact with the victim, Ms. Brown in the lobby of the Police Department at 1009 Leonard Av.  Ms. Brown had advised that she had just gotten into a fight with her boyfriend, Mr. Kerr.  Ms. Brown advised Mr. Kerr assaulted her and during the assault he choked her causing her to lose her breath.  Warrants were taken out on Mr. Kerr and he was arrested for Assault By Strangulation and Communicating Threats.  Mr. Kerr was placed in the Guilford County Jail.

On 12/06/2011, this unit was dispatched to 918 Howard Place in reference to a Domestic Disturbance. When I arrived I spoke with Katina Clark who is the mother of the parties involved. Ms. Clark advised that her son and daughter (Niesha Wall) got into a fight over her daughters child. Ms. Clark advised that both parties involved were fighting each other before her son left the residence prior to my arrival.

On 05 Dec 2011 I was dispatched to 2150-F Chester Ridge Dr in reference to a domestic assault.  After assessing the situation an looking at the physical evidence, Mrs. Webster was arrested and charged with Simple Assault.

On 12-05-2011 at approximately 1618 hours I responded to 904 Richland St in reference to a domestic assault that occurred at 1000-A Richland St. Upon arrival I spoke with Niesha Watkins who advised her ex-boyfriend Kendrick Taylor assaulted her at the above location. A WFA was obtained for assault on a female for Kendrick Taylor.

On 12/05/11 at approximately 0004 hours, I responded to the High Point Regional Hospital emergency room in reference to a domestic related assault which occurred at 1110 Maplewood Avenue.  The call resulted in the arrest of Brian Thomas for assault on a female and assault by strangulation.  The victim was treated and released from the emergency room.

On Sunday, December, 4, 2011 at approximately 2241 hours I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance that occurred at 603 Apartment O, E Commerce Avenue.  I met with the victim, Markita Thomasson, at the magistrate`s office.  The victim stated that she and her boyfriend, Andre Fountain, had gotten  into an argument over ex`s and that he had struck her about the face.  The victim did have visible injuries on the left side of her face which consisted of a large abrasion on the left side of her forehead.

On 12/04/2011 I responded to 2625 Woodruff Av in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I made contact with the victim who was sitting on the front porch of the house and informed me her boyfriend had assaulted her.

On this date, 12/3/2011, I responded in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I spoke with the victim, Ms. Lewis, who stated she had been involved in a dispute with her ex-boyfriend.  The suspect had left prior to my arrival.  Warrants were obtained on the suspect for Assault on a Female.

On 12-2-2011 at 9:18pm I responded to 1016 Asheboro St. in reference to Domestic Disturbance.Upon arriving at the above location I made contact with the victim who advised her boyfriend choked her during an argument, and then fled the scene.Photographs were taken of the victim`s injuries.
On 01-20-2012 I made contact with the Department of Social Services who advised that they were given a complaint of a sexual assault that occured in High Point.

On 11/30/2011, I responded to 711-H South Scientific Street in reference to a residential burglary.  I arrived and made contact with Ms. Gray who advised an unknown subject attempted to enter her residence through a front bedroom window.  The suspect was unable to gain entry into the residence.No arrests have been made at this time.
On 11-19-11, at approximately 2259 hours, I responded to 308 Woodbury St, in reference to a domestic violence call.  Subjects were arrested on assault related charges.
On 11-29-2011 I responded to 511-A East Commerce Drive in reference to an assault.  Upon arrival I spoke with Natasha Ledbetter who advised she had been assaulted.

On this date, I responded to 505 E Green Dr (Magistrates office) and met with Ms Kendra Gibson (VI).  Ms Gibson was there attempting to obtain a warrant on her boyfriend for simple assault.  She told the magistrate that her boyfriend strangled her and the magistrate called the police reference a possible felony charge.

On 11-25-2011 at 7:54 am, I responded to 709-B Chandler Av., in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The victim advised that she had been assaulted by her boyfriend, who left before my arrival.  There was visible evidence that an assault occurred.  The boyfriend was located and subsequently charged with assault.

On 11-24-2011 I responded to 1607 E. Commerce Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  When I arrived parties were in the street yelling. The victim had left and went to another location on the same street.  The victim showed signs that an assault occurred however he was uncooperative. No charges have been filed.

On 11/24/11 at 0157 hours I responded to 209 Welch Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.  While in route Officer Bowick and I saw the suspect vehicle leaving and stopped it.  Suspect was arrested and charged with assault on a female and drug paraphernalia.

On this date I responded 2223 Plainview Drive in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The complainant advised the suspect Mr. Sides had already left.  Upon my arrival, I made contact with the victim Ms. Hoover.  Ms. Hoover advised her boyfriend Mr. Sides had assaulted her.

On 11-23-2011 I was dispatched to a distrubance at 1409 E. Commerce Ave Apt C.  When I arrived I made contact with Ms. Greene and Mr. Granum who were in a loud, verbal argument.  During the argument Ms. Greene punched Mr. Granum in the head in my presence.  Ms. Greene was arrested for assualt and placed in the Guilford County Jail under no bond per the Domestic Hold requirments.
On Tuesday, 11/22/2011, I responded to 601 N Elm St in reference to a domestic disturbance. An arrest was made in this case.
On November 22, 2011, at 1530 hours, I was at 2710 North Main Street, Wal Mart in reference to a shoplifting.
On November 21, 2011, at 1100 hours, I was dispatched to 1122 Tabor St. reference vandalism to a motor vehicle. The suspect is known by the victim.
On November 20, 2011 at 2000 hours I responded to the 3800 block of Johnson Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.

offense: ASSAULT WITH DEADLY WEAPON INFLICTING SERIOUS INJ.
body: On 11-20-2011 at approximately 0140 hour`s officers responded to a domestic disturbance at 1002 Grant St. A male subject had been stabbed by his girlfriend in the upper portion of his left arm.The male was treated at the hospital and released and the female subject was arrested for assault with a deadly weapon inflicting serious injury.

On 11/19/2011, at 2215 hours, Officers were dispatched to a Larceny of a telephone at 207 Herbert Ave apt B.  Officers learned that it was an argument between the Complainant and her ex-boyfriend.  Complainant advised that the ex-boyfriend grabbed her hair and hit her in the face.  The complainant also advised Officers that the other victim was hit by the car that he was trying to leave in.

On 11-19-2011, at 1714 hours, I responded to 901 Panther Dr in reference to a disturbance.  This is the Student Center at HPU. When I arrived, I spoke to security guard, Jason Macy. He stated that a visitor, non-student, was visiting a female student in room 203.  They got into an argument and he damaged a cabinet by breaking the door.  The subject, Timothy Wright, stated that he did break the door because they were arguing.I issued Mr Wright a citation for the damage to the property and released him.

On 11-18-2011 at approximately 2055 hours I arrived to 1913 Apex Pl in reference to a domestic disturbance. Through further investigation a WFA was obtained for Allen Burt Pierce for assault on a female. At this time the WFA has not been served.

The listed victim advised that the listed suspect stabbed her after an argument.  She advised that they are boyfriend and girlfriend.  The suspect fled the scene prior to police arrival.  The victim was transported to the ER with non life threatening injuries.
On 11/17/2011 I responded to 904 Enterprise.  Upon arrival it was determined that an individual was assaulted with a knife and sustained minor injuries.

On 11-17-2011 at around 1:30 pm, I responded to 1507 Graves Avenue in reference to an assault. Upon my arrival I met the victim,  Mrs Deosha Welch lying in front of 1509 Graves Avenue. Mrs. Welch advised that the suspect, Zquira Godfrey broke down the door at 1507 Graves Avenue, came into the house and assaulted her.Mrs. Welch was transported by EMS to High Point Regional ER were she was treated and released. Mrs. Godfrey was found later that night and taken to jail on her warrants.

On Tuesday, November 16th, 2011, I responded to 1106 North Hamilton Street in reference to a disturbance at the residence where it was alleged that a female destroyed property inside.  Upon my arrival I met with the complainant who informed me that a female visitor had damaged items in his residence.  I later spoke with the female who advised me that she was assaulted during this incident.

On this date, officers were dispatched to a domestic disturbance. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed that an assault had occurred. The male involved was arrested, taken in front of a magistrate, and placed in the custody of the Guilford County Jail with no-bond.
On November 15, 2011, the defendant was arrested for domestic-related assault and was incarcerated under a domestic hold.

On 11-15-2011 I responded to 209 Timberwood Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I was met by the reporting party, Mrs. Ferguson.  She stated that her husband, Eric Ferguson, had assaulted her son by grabbing him by the neck leaving scratch marks on his neck.
I responded to Parkside Family Medicine, 1236 Guilford College Rd, Ste 117, in reference to harassment involving an employee and her boyfriend.  Upon arrival, I met with the complainant.

On this date and time, I responded to 206-B N West Point Av in reference to an assault that had already occurred.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Mr. Diaz who advised that his girlfriend had punched him in the mouth.

On Sunday November 13, 2011 at approximately 0232 hours, I was dispatched to 1502 Boundary Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.Upon arrival I observed the suspect assault one of the victims and immediately arrested him.  Another victim also took a warrant out on the suspect for assault.  I served this warrant on the suspect as well.  He was placed in jail under a domestic hold.

On 11-13-11 at 0314 hours I responded to 3916 Banbridge Drive in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the Victim and one involved Other party.  The Victim stated that the Offender assaulted her in the afternoon hours of 11-12-11.  The Victim obtained an arrest warrant on the Offender.  The Offender was arrested approximately two hours later.

On 11/11/2011, at approximately 2132 hours, I responded to a domestic call at 618 South Road. Upon my arrival, I came in contact with the victim, Miss Celeste Watkins. Miss Watkins advised me that her boyfriend assaulted her prior to Police arrival. Miss Watkins boyfriend, Travis Scott, struck her several times and then followed her across the street to 617 South Road where he forced entry in through the front door to attack Miss Watkins again. The suspect, Mr. Scott, was arrested and charged with Assault on a Female and Misdemeanor B&E and is being held under no bond for a domestic hold.

On 11-09-2011 I responded to a domestic disturbance at 2209 Waynick St. upon my arrival I contacted the residents involved. I was advised by the female victim that she was assaulted by her husband. She showed no signs of injury and was informed that she could obtain a warrant at the magistrates office. I accompanied her at the magistrate`s office where a warrant was obtained and returned to the residence to serve the male subject where he was arrested on the warrant.
On Tuesday, 11/08/2011, I responded 1314 Eaton Pl in reference to a domestic disturbance. Arrests were made is this case.

On this date, a Red Bird cab driver reported a disturbance at a southside residence. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed that a domestic assault had taken place. The male involved was arrested. He was transported to the Magistrate`s office, charged with Assault on a Female, and placed on a Domestic Hold.

On 11-07-2011 I responded to the PD in reference to an assault that had occurred at 3010 Ingleside Dr.  Upon my arrival I was met by the victim, Ms. Short. She stated that her boyfriend had assaulted her by putting his hand on her mouth and pressing down, leaving marks around her mouth. And he then strangled her, causing her to be unable to breath for a few seconds.
On Monday November 7 2011, I responded to 1002 Pineburr Rd, in Jamestown in reference to a domestic disturbance.
On November 7 2011, I responded to the Travel Inn room 318, on W. Green Dr. in High Point in reference to an assault that had just occurred.
On Sunday, 11/06/2011, I responded to 277 Dorothy St in reference to a domestic disturbance. An arrest was made in this case.

On 11-10-11 at 0000 hours I responded to 513-D E. Commerce Avenue in reference to a domestic assault that occurred on 11-06-11 at 0500 hours.  The Victim said she was assaulted by the Offender.  The Victim was transported to the Magistrate`s Office where she obtained an arrest warrant on the Offender for assault on a female.

On 11-05-11 at 0348 hours I responded to 318 Fourth Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the Victim and the Offender.  The Offender was arrested on an outstanding warrant.  He was also charged with assault on a female.

On 11-05-2011 I responded to 1303 W Green Drive in reference to an assault.  Upon my arrival I made contact with the victim Yoselin Rodriguez that had a nose bleed.  Ms. Rodriguez advised that her boyfriend struck her in the face before fleeing out the back door.

On 11-4-2011 at approximately 1100 hrs I responded to 228 Edgeworth St reference assist EMS.  Upon arrival I met with the caller who advised they had been assaulted.  Upon further investigation the caller was arrested on scene for assault.

On Thursday, November 3rd, 2011, I was dispatched to 3114 Wayne Av in reference to a fraud.  The fraud occurred at approximately 1220am hours this date.  The fraud was committed by illegally obtaining credit card information and using same to purchase merchandise (ie paid a Verizon bill and paid toward a Securus account).  It is unknown when the credit card information was obtained.

On Thursday, November 3rd, 2011, at 0114 hours, I responded to 2516-B Suffolk Avenue in reference to an assault.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Latoya Williams who advised her ex-boyfriend, Mr. Jujuan Lockett, assaulted her.

On November 3, 2011, I responded to the south east section of High Point in reference to a sexual assault. Upon arrival at this location, I made contact with DSS worker, Dan Reppert. He needed police to stand by while he interviewed members of the house hold where the assault occurred. And, he needed police to document the assault.

On November 2, 2011 I responded to the 900 block of Baker Rd in reference to a domestic violence call. Upon my arrival I was met by the victim Ms Dominique Mccorkle in a parking lot. Mccorkle stated that Napper had struck her in her face and then choked her before fleeing the scene.

On this date, I was dispatched to the police department`s front lobby to speak with a lady about an assault. When I arrived, I spoke with April Gidderon who advised she and her boyfriend were arguing and she tried to leave. She stated he blocked her way from exiting the house and grabbed her. She told me she cut him with  a razor on the arm in order to get away.I went to the house where this occurred and met with the boyfriend and other people who were present. He had taped his wounds and while awaiting EMS to respond he advised of a different story. I placed Gidderon under arrest  and charged her with Assault with a Deadly Weapon Inflicting Serious Injury.

On 01 Nov 2011 Officer Buben and I were dispatched to a domestic disturbance at this location.  After speaking with the complainant Mr. Thompson, we learned that he wanted his girlfriend to leave his residence .  I attempted to speak with the offender who had retreated to the bathroom, locked the door and filled the tub with water.  The offender removed her clothes and got into the tub.  When I knocked on the door asking the offender to speak with me, she opened the door and stood there naked.  I asked the offender to wrap a towel around herself or put some clothes on so we could talk.  The offender refused to do this and walked out of the bathroom and into a bedroom to continue our conversation.  I was finally able to convince the offender to gather her things and leave.  After she was dressed, and had gathered her things, the offender walked into the livingroom area.  At this point she charged Mr. Thompson who was seated on the sofa.  The offender pinned him to the sofa and began slapping and punching him.  Officer Buben and I pulled her off but she charged again.  I delivered a half SPEAR with my right forearm to the upper right chest and collar bone area of the offender.  This knocked the offender off of her feet and onto the loveseat.  At this point, Officer Buben and I handcuffed the offender.  The offender was processed and transported to the magistrates office.  The offender was charged with Simple Assault  and placed in jail under a domestic hold.Clear by Arrest.

On 10-31-2011, at approximately 11:40pm, I was dispatched to 1603 Woodside Ave. in reference to a domestic disturbance that was in progress.   When I arrived on scene, several officers were already speaking with both parties involved.While walking up to the residence, I observed a white female sitting on the front porch to 1603 Woodside Ave.   It was obvious the female was impaired by alcohol because she was being very loud and belligerent toward Officer Crouse.  Recruit Plount and I then walked inside the residence and observed a white male sitting on the couch that was just inside the front door.   The male had a large knot just above his left eye from a recent assault.   Officer Leach was talking with the male who identified himself as Mr. Gordon Arnold II.Officer Dodson was in the rear of the residence talking with two other individuals that were both lying in the bed.    I then walked back out to the living room and started to talk with Mr. Arnold.  Mr. Arnold was obviously impaired as well from alcohol and admitted to being drunk.    Mr. Arnold said he and his wife got into an argument and she assaulted him.   I asked how he got the large knot above his eye and he said, "The bitch hit me with a lamp".  I then asked where the assault took place and he said in their bedroom.    Mr. Arnold then pulled up the sleeve to his shirt and revealed a bite mark to his right tricep.   Mr. Arnold said sometime during the struggle, Cyanne bit him on his arm.  While talking with Mr. Arnold he kept saying that his good friend was Terry Green with our department.I then went out to the front porch where Officer Crouse and Mrs. Arnold (Cyanne) were talking.  I started to ask Cyanne what took place and all she would do is shout obscenities and would not answer any of my questions.  I asked Mrs. Arnold if she was assaulted and all she would do is say look at my knee.   Her right knee had some minor scraps to them.  The entire time talking with Cyanne she was uncooperative and would not answer any questions.Based on the severity of the injuries to Mr. Arnold and Cyanne not cooperating with any questions I was asking, I then placed Cyanne in handcuffs and informed her that she was under arrest.   Once handcuffed, I had Cyanne sit back in the chair on the front porch, so I could go back inside and speak with Mr. Arnold.  Officer Crouse remained outside with Cyanne.I asked Mr. Arnold which was his bedroom and he said it was the last one on the right as you go toward the end of the hall.   I walked to the back bedroom where the struggle took place.   Once inside the bedroom, it was obvious a struggle took place.   There was a lamp lying on the floor in front of the bed.   A broken light bulb was shattered all over the floor.  I noticed a table that was tipped on its side in the bedroom as well.Officer Leach assisted with digital photos of Mr. Arnold`s injuries while on scene.While sitting on the front porch in handcuffs, Cyanne started to get verbally abusive.   Officer Crouse then asked for the keys to my patrol car and escorted her to my patrol car and secured her in the rear seat of my patrol car.  While sitting in the backseat of the patrol car, Cyanne started to hyperventilate.  Officer Crouse asked if she was on any medications and she said she has COPD and asthma.   Officer Crouse then rolled down the back window to allow some cold air in.   Cyanne started to control her breathing after a few minutes.   Officer Crouse called for EMS to the scene reference her breathing problems.  HPFD arrived shortly after, by this time, Cyanne had her breathing under control and started to curse at the HPFD.   EMS was cancelled.Mrs. Arnold (Cyanne) was then transported to the High Point Police Department to be processed.   Once inside the Police Department, Cyanne started to calm down and wanted to give her side of the story.   While sitting on the bench in the processing room, Cyanne pulled up the sleeves to her shirt and showed the marks on her biceps from where Mr. Arnold grabbed her.  There was bruising that had already set in.Cyanne went on to say they were all in the back yard drinking having a good time when she had enough to drink and went inside the house.  She said she went to her bedroom and started to clean up when Gordon walked into the bedroom and started to yell at her.   When she went to lie down in the bed, she said Gordon jumped on her and held her down.  She said she kicked him in the "balls" to get him off.  Cyanne said once he got off of her, she tried to run away.   That is when he grabbed her and threw her to the floor.   He once again got on top of her and was holding her down.  This is when she said she grabbed the lamp that was on the night stand next to the  bed and struck him in the head several times to get him off of her again.   Once she struck him in the head, he fell off of her and she ran out of the bedroom.  This is when her roommate called 911.I spoke with the roommate Cheryl Delk who said she went to bed and was inside the bedroom when she heard the fight take place.  She said she didn`t see anything and only heard the loud shouting.Mrs. Arnold was arrested and charged with Simple Assault.  She was taken before Magistrate Newman and placed in the High Point Jail under a Domestic Hold.    Mr. Arnold was cited for Assault on a Female and given a citation.

On Monday, October 31st, 2011, I was dispatched to 1500 E Green Dr. in reference to a domestic dispute.  The caller, Shariff Shah, stated that his girlfriend, and the mother of his six (6) children, needed to leave the residence until he could get his people to come and get his items.

On 10-31-2011 at approximately 1208hrs I responded to 513 Chestnut Dr in reference to an assault that had already occurred.  The victim advised that at approximately 1030hrs this morning her ex boyfriend forced her by knife point to drive around the city before coming back to the residence and assaulting her.Warrants for Kidnapping and Assault by Strangulation were taken out on the ex boyfriend.

On 10-30-2011 I responded to 308 Brentwood Street in reference to an assault on a female in the parking lot.  When I arrived I made contact with the victim, Ms. Chandler.  She advised she and her male friend got into an argument.  The male fled the scene when officers arrived. Ms. Chandler was not very cooperative. No arrest were made at the scene.
On October 30, 2011, the victim reported by assaulted by her boyfriend.  The victim had facial injuries and the suspect left before police arrived.  A warrant was obtained.

On this date I responded to 1606 Lakeland Point in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival, I made contact with XXXX.  XXXX advised that he had been assaulted by XXXX.  Both parties had injuries and both parties were arrested.
On Saturday, 10/29/2011, I responded to 701 Kennedy Av in reference to a domestic disturbance. Arrests were made in this case.

On 10-29-2011 I responded to a 911 hangup at 1017 E. Kearns Avenue.  When I arrived I could hear arguing inside.  I made contact with Mr. Brown who had an obvious long scratch under his neck that was bleeding.  I spoke to Ms. Eames and she advised she scratched Mr. Brown.  Ms. Eames was arrested for Simple Assault that is Domestic Related and placed in the Guilford County Jail with No Bond.
On October 28, 2011 a local therapist called to report a threat made by a client toward his wife.  The suspect had threatened to kill his wife.

On 10/28/2011, I responded to 815 Hendrix Street in reference to a domestic violence incident.  Dispatch stated that the caller`s estranged husband forcefully broke into the residence.  Several officers arrived on scene and entered the residence.  The suspect was located and arrested without incident.

On 10/27/2011 at 0933 hours, I responded to 1451 Kingsway Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Ms. Monte Harrington who advised that her boyfriend broke the window to her residence and assaulted her.  Mr. Joseph Oduntan fled the scene prior to our arrival.  I obtained warrants on Mr. Oduntan for Assault on a Female and Vandalism.

On 10/25/2011 I was dispatched to 324 Louise Ave for domestic assualt.  When I arrived Timothy Richardson was communicating threats towards a juvenile.  Richardson was arrested for Resisting a Public Officer and an Assault on a Juvenile.  Richardson was given a $20,000 bond and taken to the High Point Jail.

On Wednesday, October 26, 2011, at approximately 1500 hours, I was dispatched to a residential burglary complaint at 1028 Apartment A Richland Street.  I arrived on scene and met with the victim, Samantha Little.  The victim stated that on 10/25/2011 at approximately 1230 - 1300 hours, she returned to her residence and observed that the front door had been kicked in and observed a black male run out of the front door and get into a gray in color Chevy HHR and flee the scene.

I responded to 3117 Wayne Ave in reference to a domestic violence call that was still in progress upon my arrival.  A juvenile black male was believed to be assaulting the occupants of the residence.  No one was hurt during the incident.
On October 23, 2011 at approximately 0401 hours, I was dispatched to domestic disturbance on Lakecrest Avenue.  When I arrived, both parties had injuries and both parties were arrested for assault.

On 10-23-11 at approximately 0829hrs I responded to 907 Denny St in reference to a vandalism that had occurred within the past few hours.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the victim who advised that the tires on his two vehicles had been cut and one of the two vehicles had been keyed.  The victim knew the suspect and provided their information.

On October 23, 2011, police officers responded to the victim`s residence in reference to a domestic assault.  The victim had been strangled and punched by the suspect who left before the police arrived.  Warrants were obtained on the suspect, boyfriend, for felony strangulation and misd. assault inflicting serious injury.
On 10-23-2011 I responded to 1319-B Dartmouth Av in reference to a assault.  Upon arrival I spoke with Laquana Ratliff who advised she had been assaulted.
On 10/22/11 at approximately 2302hrs I responded to a reported domestic disturbance.

On 10/22/2011 at 0742 hours, I responded to 3709 Queenswood Ln in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Mrs. Nikki Hong who advised that her husband, Mr. Upyo Hong, assaulted her and fled the scene prior to our arrival.  I obtained warrants for Mr. Hong`s arrest for Assault on a Female.

On 10-21-2011 I responded to 204-D Taylor Ave. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  When I arrived on the scene I came in contact with Ms. Campbell who stated the father of her child just assaulted her.  He was no longer at the residence when I arrived and he was standing at Taylor Ave. and Grayson St.  Officer Shultz contacted Mr. Spence until I was able to after speaking with Ms. Campbell.  Ms. Campbell stated Mr. Spencer came into her residence after she invited him to and they began to argue.  Mr. Spencer began to call Mr. Campbell names and she along with Ms. Glasgow did not approve.  They asked Mr. Spencer to leave and when they did he "mushed" Ms. Campbell in the face.  Ms. Glasgow stated the incident occurred in the living room and then ended in the bushes outside the front door.  I noticed Ms. Campbell`s knees were skinted up and her dress was loose and it had grass all over the front.  While continuing to interview Ms. Campbell she stated she did not want to talk anymore and became very irrate with me and the questions I was asking.  At the time I was having her walk me through what exactly happened and where it happened.  She did not cooperate with me any longer and would not allow me to take photographs of her injuries to her knees.  Mr. Spencer had a Domestic Violence Protective Order on him Ms. Campbell activated on him.  The paper had been served and it was active at the time of my contact with him.  I arrested him for the violation and the assault on Ms. Campbell.  He was placed under a 48 hour hold at the High Point Jail.

On 10-21-11 at 1221 hours the above listed vehicle was pulled over during a traffic stop.  The Victim was driving the vehicle.  The Offender was in the front right passenger seat of the vehicle.  The Victim had an active domestic violence protective order on the Offender.  The Offender was arrested.

While working off duty at Spring Valley Apartments I responded to 511 E Commerce Avenue Apartment D.  The victim Ms. Smith was advising that her boyfriend had kicked open the back door of her apartment and had knocked several holes in the wall of the apartment.  The suspect Mr. Cobb was apprehended after a foot chase.  He was charged with Misdemeanor breaking and entering, first degree trespassing, injury to real property, communicating threats, and resisting arrest.  He was placed in jail under a $1500.00 secure bond.

On 10-20-11 at 1108 hours I responded to 600 Mint Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I met with the Victim and Offender.  The Victim was arrested for violating a domestic violence protective order and assault on a female.  The Offender was arrested for simple assault.
On October 19, 2011 at approximately 2204 hours, I responded to 1405 Lynwood terrace in reference to a domestic disturbance.

On October 19, 2011 at approximately 4:00pm I responded to 2303 E Green Dr in reference to a public disturbance. Through investigation it was determined that a domestic assault had occurred. The suspect, Brandon Harris, was taken into custody for assaulting Jackie Jacobs.

On 10-19-11 at 1506 hours I responded to 2306-A Little Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the Victim and the Offender.  Both subjects were arrested for assaulting one another.  The Victim was also arrested on a simple assault warrant that the Offender had obtained on 10-06-11.

On 10-19-2011 I responded to 505 East Green Drive in reference to a vandalism.  Upon my arrival I made contact with the victim, Ruby Kasubinski who advised that her vehicle has been vandalized over night.

On 10/18/11 at approximately 1657 hours, I responded to 136-H Old Winston Road in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Georikus Sims was arrested for domestic assault on a female and an outstanding FTA.  Sims was placed in jail on a domestic hold.
On 10-18-2011 at approximately 1500 hours I responded to 1213 Ragan Av in reference to a domestic disturbance. Through further investigation Cory Borders and Stefanie Moore were charged with assault.

On 10-16-2011 at approximately 1214 hours I responded to a domestic disturbance call at 2101 N Main St. at Starbucks Coffee. Upon my arrival I contacted Erin Wagoner who advised that her Ex-boyfriend, Jack Ross was in the parking lot unwilling to leave. Ms. Wagoner stated that she informed Mr. Ross that he was stalking her. Ms. Wagoner stated she was scared because Mr. Ross would not leave her alone. Mr. Ross was arrestted for misdemeanor stalking.

On this date, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance at 606 Manley Street. Once there,  I learned that a female had been assaulted by her spouse and there was probable cause to arrest him for the crime. He was arrested and charged with domestic assault, processed at the police department and jailed with no bond. The female suffered minor injuries.

On October 15, 2011 at approximately 0230 hours, I was responding to the area of Pershing in reference to a call coming in about a black male pointing a gun to a black females head and told her to get in the car.

On October 14, 2011 I responded to 120 SW Cloverleaf Dr. in reference to a domestic related call.  After arriving and speaking with all parties involved Magan Day was arrested for an assault on her boyfriend, Jason Freedman.
On 10/14/2011, at approximately 2000hrs, I responded to a reported burglary on Chestnut Dr.

On October 14, 2011 I was dispatched to 3903-2C Pallas Wy. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I contacted the victim, Latricia Lyons, who advised that her boy-friend, William Lorick, hit her with her cell phone.

While on patrol I was flagged down by Ms. McCoy.  Ms. McCoy was at High Point Regional Hospital where she had just recieved treatment for an assault that had occurred overnight.  Ms. McCoy advised she was assaulted by her boyfriend, Mr. Chambers.  Ms. McCoy had broken bones from the assault and warrants were obtained on Mr. Chambers for Assault Inflicting Serious Bodily Injury.
On 10-12-11 at approximately 1844 I responded to Depot Pl for a domestic disturbance call.  Upon arrival I spoke with the victim who stated she was assaulted and a subject was arrested for the same.
On Wednesday, 10/12/2011, I responded to the 2300 block of Edgewood Dr in reference to a public disturbance. An arrest was made in this case.
On Wednesday October 12, 2011, I responded to 605 Apt C Granby Ave, in reference to several assaults that occurred at the residence.

On Wednesday 10/12/2011, Officer Ramey and I were dispatched to an unknown trouble call at 1402 Cook St.  Communications advised that a female had stated "send the police" and that they heard a male voice in the background but before they could get further the phone line was disconnected.   After making contact with the resident at this location, Ms. Buffington, it was determined that a domestic assault had taken place and that the suspect had fled out the back door prior to our arrival.Ms. Buffington was given a family services card and was provided a North Carolina domestic violence information sheet.  Officer Ramey transported her to the magistrates office to obtain warrants.There is no further information at this time.

On Tuesday, October 11, 2011, at about 12:40 P.M., I was dispatched to 2710 N. Main Street via deparmental radio in regards to shoplifting. Upon my arrival, I spoke to the loss prevention officer, Mr. Hicks, and he stated that an unkonwn male walked out of the store with merchandise with out paying for it.

On Tuesday, October 11, 2011, at about 8:15 A.M., I was dispatched to 102 Wood Valley Court via departmental radio in regards to a domestic disturbance. The dispatched called also stated that the estranged husband was attempting entry into the residence. Upon my arrival, Ms. Quinones stated that her estranged husband entered her apartment without permission or authority, by means of the bedroom window.

On 10-8-11, at approximately 1710hrs, officers responded to 918 Howard Place in reference to a assault with a deadly weapon.  Upon officers arrival, it was determined that no one had been injured.  One of the parties were advised to get his belongings and leave the property and not return.  This subject left while officers were still on scene, but returned a short time later after officers left.  He was taken into custody for trespassing.

On 10/07/2011 approximately 2000 hours I responded to a domestic violence call. Upon my arrival at 2630 Willard Dairy Rd., Moses Cone Medical Center, I contacted Nurse Andrea Adkins. Ms. Adkins advised she had been in the offender`s room, when she assaulted her husband.
On 10/07/2011 I responded to 301 Player Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon further investigation one suspect was arrested for Domestic Assault & Battery.
On 10-07-2011 at approximately 0100 hrs I responded to 421 Wright St reference assist EMS.  While there the subject being treated assaulted their spouse.  Subject was arrested on scene.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 10-06-2011, I responded to 2850 S Main St in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival, I was met by Mr. Guyer. He stated that his exgirlfriend had pulled up beside him and threatened him with physical harm.  He also stated that she was riding with her mother who had a 50B against her.
On 12Oct11, this detective spoke with a victim in reference to a stalking case that has been occurring in the S.E. part of the city.

On 10/04/2011 I responded to 117-1A East Swathmore Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.   I arrived and made contact with the caller who advised that a relative injured her own child.  The juvenile child had noticeable marks and the offender was subsequently arrested.

On this date I responded to 509-A Richardson Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival, I made contact with Ms. Gainey and Mr. Safford.  Ms. Gainey had been assaulted.  Mr. Safford was arrested and taken to the police department.

On Sunday, October 2, 2011 at approximately 2018 hours I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance at 527 Smith Street Apartment A.  I arrived on scene and spoke with the victim, Mary Avent, who stated that she and her boyfriend, David Hudson, were involved in a verbal altercation and the offender, David Hudson struck her twice in the head with a wooden stick causing minor injuries.  The offender was arrested for assault and placed in the High Point Jail under a domestic hold.

On the 1st day of October, 2011 at approximately 1120 hours, I responded to 401 White Oak Street in reference to a argument between mother and son.Upon arriving, the mother stated that her son pushed her down. Both parties` stories differed and there were no signs of assault. The mother was told to obtain a warrant at the Magistrate`s Office.The mother did obtain warrants against her son for assault on a female and injury to personal property.

On October 1, 2011, I responded to 601 N Elm Street, High Point Emergency Room, in reference to an assault. Hospital staff had called police because one of their patients was claiming to have been assaulted by her husband. Upon arrival, I made contact with the female patient, Erica Lymon, in urgent care room #1. Erica Lymon advised she was assaulted last night (09/30/11) at approximately 1800 hours by her estranged husband. The alleged assault occurred at 1635-B West Rotary Drive, his residence. She did not contact police to report the assault or take out any charges on him. She stated he has assaulted her in the past and they have worked through it without having police called. She said her head was hurting because her husband punched in the head and face area multiple times. And, that is the reason she came to the ER to have it checked out. Erica Lymon failed to mention the second incident that occurred last night (10/01/11) around 0243 hours at the same location. Police received a call from her husband advising that Erica Lymon was causing a disturbance by using a hammer to break down his door and window. Officers responded but Erica Lymon was had already left the area. He was advised to take out charges on her. After Erica Lymon was discharged from the ER, I took her into custody for her warrants. She was transported to the County Building without problems.

On 09-28-2011, I responded 72 Clinton Av in reference to harassing phone calls. Upon my arrival, I was met by the reporting party, Mrs. Grant. She stated that her husband, Mr. Jeffery Grant, had called her numerous times during the day in violation of a 50B order.

On 09/28/2011, at 1651 hours, I responded to 2028 Briarcliff Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Mrs. Tania Dewitt, who advised that her husband, Mr. Rayvond Dewitt, violated the terms of his 50-B Domestic Violence Order.  Mr. Dewitt left prior to my arrival.

On 09/27/2011 I was dispatched to 1003-18 N Main St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The victim was transported to High Point Regional to be treated for her injuries.There is no further information at this time.

On September 27, 2011,  at approximately 1139 hours, I was dispatched to a larceny from motor vehicle on Lakecrest Avenue. When I arrived, the victim stated that someone entered her vehicle and removed several items.
On 9-26-2011 I responded to 329 Wheeler Av. in reference to a vandalism.  Upon arrival I spoke with Jessica Mcheimer who advised her boyfriend had damaged her door.

On 9-25-2011 I responded to 1107 Asheboro Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  When I arrived I spoke to the complainant, Mr. Fannon who advised he had been assaulted by his wife, Ms. Jones.  Mr. Fannon had an obvious red bruise on his arm.  I also spoke to Ms. Jones, she advised she had not been assaulted and did not have any bruises or signs of assault.Ms. Jones was arrested for Assault and Battery.  She was placed in the Guilford County Jail under a Domestic Hold.
On 9/25/11, at approximately 0747hrs, I responded to a reported domestic disturbance.

On September 24, 2011 I responded to a domestic violence call at 307 Sunset Dr. Upon my arrival I spoke with the victim that had been assaulted. She advised she had been choked and threw upon the ground by her boyfriend. I located the offender inside the residence and arrested him.

On September 27, 2011 while on duty at 1920 McGuinn Dr., Andrews High School, I was notified of a domestic assault that occurred on September 23, 2011 at 1519-F Woodside Ave.  An arrest has been made.

On 9-22-11 at approximately 1907hrs officers responded to 1100 Blain St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon officers arrival the victim was contacted in his bedroom where he advised that his girlfriend jumped on him and assaulted him before leaving the residence.

On 9-22-11, at 0313 hours, I was dispatched to 1722-E N Hamilton St in reference to a residential burglary that had already occurred.  I spoke to Melissa Smith, the victim, about the incident.  She advised that she came home to find the front and rear door to her apartment open.  The apartment was cleared and nothing was found to be missing.  There is no further information available at this time.
On Tuesday September 20, 2011 I responded to 1901 Brentwood Street in reference to a fight between several females and one male.

On 09-19-2011 at 0346 hours I responded to 208 Elmhurst Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I met with the victim who stated that she was assaulted by Mr Alphonso Hoy.  A warrant for Assault on a Female was obtained for Mr Hoy.

On Sunday, September 18, 2011 at about 6:14 P.M.  I was dispatched to 2220 Copperstone Drive, apartment 2A via departmental radio in regards to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I observed that the Ms. Thomas was a victim of an assault.
On 9/18/11 at approximately 1030hrs I responded to a reported domestic assault.
On 09-17-2011, at 2239 hours, I responded to 808 Putnam St in reference to a vandalism.

On 09/17/2011 at approximately 0305 hours I responded to the intersection of Pineburr RD and Edinburgh DR in reference to a noise violation.  It was originally reported by a refused caller that it sounded as if subjects were partying in the street.  While in enroute to said location communications advised that they had received an additional call advising that a male and female subject were engaged in a domestic disturbance in the same vicinity in the roadway.  I made contact with one of the involved parties, Mrs Ashley Johnson, in front of 1003 Pineburr RD.  Subsequent to investigation, Mr Edward Michael Duncan, has been charged with assault on a female.  Warrant service is pending.

Officers responded to 2434 Williams Av on a reported domestic assault that had occured.  Officers located Dean Parks in the front yard bleeding from the back of his head.  Parks related that his nephew hit him with a closed fist and open hand in the face and head.  Parks nephew, Ashton Lane Smith was located at the residence and was arrested for assault inflicting serious injury and held on $500 bond.  Parks was transported to High Point Regional ER where he was treated for his injuries.

On September September 17, 2011 I received a call from Randolph Hospital in reference to an assault.  I spoke with a nurse at the hospital who put me in contact with the victim, Tonya Owle.  Ms. Owle stated that on this date she was at Wal-Mart on S. Main St. and saw an ex-boyfriend of hers and she stated a short time later she was assaulted.

On this date, I responded to a disturbance call at 2220 Chambers Street. The caller advised that a man and woman were engaged in same in the front yard. Upon arrival, both male and female advised they had been assaulted by the other one. I observed scratches on both parties and could not determine who the aggressor was. I placed both parties under arrest for domestic assault. Both were jailed under no bond.

On 09-15-2011 at 1822 hours, I responded to the police department to meet with a subject in reference to a domestic disturbance.  When I arrived, I spoke to Angelica Bishop.  She stated that she had been assaulted by Milton Henry, her live-in boyfriend and father to her child.  She stated that when she got home around 1600 hours yesterday ( 09-14-2011), Mr Henry was upset that she was out with her friends.  They were arguing when Mr Henry assaulted her. Ms Bishop stated that she did not call yesterday because she was hoping Mr Henry would move back to Michigan, where he is from.Warrants were obtained on Mr Henry for assault on female and assault by strangulation.  He was arrested and placed in Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On 9/14/2011 at around 1420 hours I was dispatched to 305 Cedar Street for an assault call where the suspect just fled.  The suspect was Antone Edwards.  Edwards came over to the house and started an altercation which lead to two people being assaulted.  Edwards fled the scene before officers arrival.EMS responded for a juvenile having a hurt finger.  Both the juvenile and her mother Trivessa White refused treatment.Edwards and White were in a relationship about a year ago but do not share a household or children in common.White stated that she was struck in the head several times, but there was no signs of an assault.  There could have been minor injuries that this officer was not able to see.

On 14 Sept 2011 I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance with a possible assault that had occurred.  When I arrived, the victim was standing in her apartment door crying.  The victim had an obvious contusion on her forehead from being hit.  The victim was six months pregnant and had been kicked in the stomach by the offender.  Guilford County EMS was dispatched and the victim was transported to the emergency room.

On September 14, 2011, Jennifer Boyles called to report a vandalism to her 2002 white Ford Ranger Truck, and to her aquarium.  She stated that the suspect poured bleach into the aquarium on September 13, and poured sugar into the vehicle gas tank between September 13-14.

On 09-12-2011 I responded to 2607 E. Kivett Dr. in reference to a domestic disturbance between intimate partners.  When I arrived on the scene I came in contact with Jean Burris who was standing in the front yard yelling at a male inside the residence.Ms. Burris was very sweaty and she had a noticeable scratch under her right eye that was bleeding.  She stated her and her boyfriend, Salifu Agubuga, just got into a physical fight prior to my arrival.  Ms. Burris stated Mr. Agubuga was upset because she was talking on the phone with another male subject.  He took the phone from her and broke it over his knee.  At first she stated directly after he broke the phone she began to "swing" at him.  At that point she changed her story stating Mr. Agubuga began to punch her in the head and during this she made her way to the bed room where she closed the door on him to get away.  This is when she called 911 for assistance.  During my interview of Ms. Burris she never stated how Mr. Agubuga`s thumb was injured.  When I asked her about it she stated it happened when he was beating on the door to get in the bedroom.When I spoke to Mr. Agubuga he stated Ms. Burris was on the phone with another male subject and she was taunting Mr. Burris by not letting him know who she was talking to.  Mr. Burris stated he grabbed the phone from her and she began to hit him about the entire body.  As he was defending her off she was able to bite him on the left thumb causing a small laceration.Both parties were arrested for the assaults on one another and taken before Magistrate Billips and given a domestic hold.
On September 10, 2011, at 2030 hours, I responded to the 700 block of Idol street in reference to a disturbance.

On 09-11-2011 I responded to 1604 Brentwood Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I made contact with Delores Wallace and Gary Parker. Wallace and Parker both had obvious signs of an assault. Wallace and Parker both said they assaulted one another and both were arrested.  Wallace was arrested for Simple Assault and Parker was arrested for Assault on a Female.  Both went before a Magistrate and were placed in jail under Domestic Holds.
On 9/10/11 at approximately 2307hrs I responded to a reported domestic disturbance.

On 09/10/2011 I responded to 235 Montlieu Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I arrived and made contact with the victim who advised that her boyfriend assaulted her.  I made contact with the boyfriend and placed him under arrest based on physical evidence and personal testimony.

On 09/10/2011 at 2100 hours, I responded to 1618 Stoneybrook Dr in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Ms. Billie Willis and Mr. Brian Bracy who had been involved in a disturbance.  Mr. Bracy was arrested and charged with Assault on a Female and Simple Assault.
On 09-10-2011 I responded to 1290 Burton Av in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival Ms. Sturdivant advised that her son had assaulted her.

On 09-10-2011 I responded to 318 Amhurst Av in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I was met by the victim, Ms. McBean. She advised that her boyfriend, Mr. Johnson, had assaulted her. She had visible marks on her from the assault. I arrested Mr. Johnson for assault on a female.I took photos of Ms. McBean`s injuries.

On Saturday September 10, 2011 I responded to 326 Louise Ave in reference to a domestic disturbance between two females at this location.  After speaking with both females I placed both under arrest for assault.
On this date and time, I responded to 2608 E Kivett Dr in reference to a dog that had been killed.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Mrs. Erwin who advised that she came home and found her dog dead.

On 9-9-11 at approximately 0454hrs I responded to 313-E Henley St in reference to a disturbance.  Upon my arrival I was able to speak with the victim who advised that her boyfriend and the father of her child had hit her in the face.The suspect was charged with Domestic Assault on a Female.

On Friday, September 9th, 2011, at approximately 0247, I was dispatched to 1803 Brentwood St. in reference to a domestic assault.  Upon arrival I observed a black female waving me down, she was located at 1811 Brentwood St. She stated that her ex-boyfriend, Otis Allen, had drug her out of her friend`s bed by her hair, pulled her into the yard, and beat her.  Mr. Allen was running down the street toward me with a cut hand.  After further investigation, I was able to determine that in addition to the domestic physical assault, Mr. Allen broke several windows at the victim`s residence.Mr. Allen was charged with Assault on a Female, Injury to Real Property and Communicating Threats.

On 09/08/2011 at approximately 2100 hours I responded to 907-1A Belmont DR in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I made contact with the involved parties, Mr Bryson Burch and Mrs Nicole Woods.  Both parties advised that they had been engaged in a verbal argument which had progressed into a physical altercation.  Subsequent to investigation, both parties were arrested for domestic assault violations.

On 09/09/2011, at approximately 0005 hours, I responded to a call at 1515 Willard Ave. When I arroved, I found Mr. James Mayen Standing outside of his house in only his boxer shorts. His girlfriend, Ms. Yakuaita Lyles and her daughter, Ms. Nialoni Daniels reported how Mr. Mayen had been acting strangly, thrown bullets into the street, and broken fixtures in the house. Ms. Daniels further reported that Mr. Mayen had drug her out of the house, and had marks on her from the assault. EMS responded, and Mr. Mayen was arrested for assault on a female.
On 09-07-2011 at approximately 0108 hours I responded to 230-A Brentwood St in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I spoke with Kerise Archer who advised she had been assaulted.

On Tuesday, September 6th, 2011, I was dispatched to 3237 Derby Cl at approximately 2145 hours, in reference to an attempted suicide.  The adult white female was transported by Guilford County EMS, to High Point Regional for medical evaluation and treatment.

On 09/05/2011, at approximately 2237 hours, I responded to 315 Hodgin Street in reference to a Domestic Disturbance and Larceny that occurred there earlier in the day. Upon arrival at the scene I made contact with the victim and reporting party of the crime, Miss Bre Jackson, who advised me that her ex-boyfriend assaulted her and stole some of her belongings. Miss Jackson advised me that she was in an argument with her ex-boyfriend at around 1200 hours and he punched her during the argument. Miss Jackson also advised me that her ex-boyfriend gained access into her house while she was at work and took some of her property. Warrants will be obtained on the suspect in this disturbance.

On 05 Sept 2011, I was dispatched to 135-A W. Hartley Dr in reference to a burglary.  When I arrived, I met with the victim in the parking lot in front of her apartment.  The front glass window was smashed and specific items were removed.  The lab was called and the scene was processed.
On September 4th 2011, I responded to the Moses Cone health Center on Willard Dairy Rd., in reference to an assault that had occurred 2 hours earlier at 809 E. Commerce Ave.

On 09-03-2011 I was sitting in the PVA of 110 E Fairfield Rd when a black female and black male approached me.  The female stated that she had been assaulted by her boyfriend at their apartment. She had a scratch on her wrist and her shoulder.  Mr. Walters was arrested and charged with assault on a female.
On September 02, 2011, at 1323 hours, I was dispatched to 2405 Woodruff Av. reference a domestic dispute.The call was a verbal dispute between sisters.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 08/31/2011, at approximately 2232 hours, I responded to 205 Seashire CT in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival, I made contact with the reporting party, Mr Harold Leverne Crawford, Mrs Vivian Simmons, and Mr Harold Terrell Crawford in the living room area of the home.  The disturbance was reported as being only verbal in nature and subsequent to investigation, Mr Harold Terrell Crawford was arrested for a 50-B protective order violation.

On Wednesday, August 31, 2011, I was dispatched to 912-B Grace St., in reference to a possible domestic dispute.  Upon arrival officers could hear a verbal argument inside.  Mr. Martin Payne answered the door and allowed officers to enter.  I went to the back of the apartment to speak with the other party, his wife, in reference to the disturbance that the neighbors were reporting.Mr. Payne was arrested on scene for a violation of a active 50-B order.
On 08-31-2011 at 0056 hours I received a report of an assault on Patsy Harvey.  Upon investigation Harvey stated that her boyfriend had bitten her on the knee.

On 08-30-2011 I responded to 270 Beddington St. to a domestic disturbance call. Upon my arrival I contacted the victim, Melissa Brown. Ms. Brown stated that she had been assaulted by her boyfriend with visible injuries. The suspect, Willie Pope, was located and charged with the offense.

offense: ALL OTHER SHOOTING (CHANCE OF INJURY) INTO OCCUPIED PROPERTY
body: On 08/30/2011, at approximately 0340 hours, I was dispatched to 333 F Henley Ave in reference to an armed person. Upon my arrival I meet with Mr. Tony Gaddy, Mr. Maurice Dunlap, and Ms. Courtney Jordan. It was reported that Mr. Christopher Jordon had shown up at the residence looking for Ms. Jordon and fired a handgun at the building in an effort to get revenge on Ms. Jordon for pervious court action.
On today`s date I was dispatched to the above location in reference to domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I made contact with both parties involved in the parking lot of the apartment complex.

On 08/28/2011, at approximately 2100 hours, I was dispatched to 1107 E Lexington in reference to a domestic assault. Upon my arrival I meet with Ms. Lakeya Wright. Ms. Wright stated that her exboyfriend Mr. Maurice Collins had hit her after an argument in the parking lot. Mr. Collins admitted to striking Ms. Wright and was arrested for Assault on a Female.

On 8/282011 at around 0817 hours I responded to a domestic disturbance at 3216 Forestview Drive.  When I arrived I met with a female, Fonda Davis, who stated that her husband, Jason Davis, was inside the house throwing items around.  Fonda stated that Jason had been out all night drinking and came home.  An argument ensued from a cell phone call to Fonda`s cell phone and Jason started to throw items such as a tote (storage container), a flash light and an air freshener canister at her.Based on speaking to both parties and the evidence at the scene Jason was arrested for domestic assault on a female, being found to be the primary aggressor.  Jason Davis was held on a domestic hold and taken to the High Point Jail without incident.
On 08-28-11 at 0145 hours I responded to 603 Denny Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I met with the Victim.  The Victim stated the suspect assaulted her and ran away.

On Friday, 08/27/2011, I responded to the police department in reference to a domestic disturbance that occurred on Sherrill Av. There is suspect information and this case is open for further investigation.
On 08/27/2011, I responded to 1021 Montlieu Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.

Myself and Ofc. J. Antignano responded to 511 Chestnut Dr. for a domestic dispute.  Once there we found Antwan Harper sitting on the front porch.  The complainant, Heather Bryant, stated that Harper did not reside at the residence and was refusing to leave.  Harper said he did live there (although he has a Forestview Dr. address).  Harper and Bryant have been in a relationship before and have a child in common.  Harper was leaving the residence on foot, but as he was walking away he shouted that he would "burn her house down".  Ofc. Antignano and I immediately arrested Harper for Communicating Threats.Harper was processed and taken before Magistrate Kokajo.  Mag. Kokajo placed Harper under a domestic hold, and I placed Harper in the custody of the Guilford County Jail.

I responded to 800 South Rd. in reference to a domestic dispute at that location.  According to call notes, a female on a moped was riding by the residence and causing a disturbance.  Upon my arrival I spoke to Mr. Powers, who advised his ex, Marchette Johnson, was riding by his house cursing him.  Mr. Powers also stated that he had a 50-B protection order against Ms. Johnson.  I checked our Records division and confirmed the 50-B.  Johnson had left the area prior to my arrival.  I spoke to Magistrate Kokajo about the matter and obtained a warrant on Johnson for Domestic Violation Protective Order Violation.  A BOL on Johnson and the moped was given to Communications.

On Saturday, August 27, 2011 at about 12:46 A.M. I was dispatched to 2429 W. Green Drive via departmental radio in regards to a domestic assault. Upon my arrival I spoke to Ms Harmon and she informed me that her boyfriend pushed her to the ground causing her to injure her left wrist.
On 08-26-2011 at 2358 hours I responded to 1211 Dorris Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I made contact with Robert and Bobby in the living room of the residence.

On August 26, 2011 I responded to 1813 Brentwood St in reference to a vehicle accident. Upon further investigation it was determined that a domestic related assault had occurred. Brandie N. Bridgers was charged with assault with a deadly weapon.

On 08-25-11 at 2255 hours I responded to 325 Fourth Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the Victim and the Offender.  The Offender was arrested for assault on a female.

On the date and time listed above, Officers responded to 318-B Coltrane Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Officers spoke to the victim who advised that her and her husband got into an argument.  The husband had left prior to Officer arrival.  Officers discovered old bruises on the callers chin.  She advised that her husband elbowed her in the chin and pulled her hair a few days earlier.  She was escorted to the Magistrates so that she could obtain a Warrant for assault from that incident.  A BOL was issued for the husband and the caller was given a Victim`s Rights Form.

On this date I responded to a domestic dispute at 207-A Edgeworth St.  Officers Gray and Krawiec were already on the scene when I arrived.  The victim stated that Mr. Foster had struck her in the face with his hand.  The victim, Ms. Clay, did have a slight injury to her right eye, with broken blood vessels in the eye itself apparent.  Mr. Foster was arrested for Assault on a Female.  Photographs of Ms. Clay`s injuries were taken at the scene.  Foster was processed and taken before the Magistrate, where he was placed in the Guilford County Jail under a Domestic Hold.

On 08-24-2011 I responded to 701 Woodbury Street in reference to an assault that had already occurred.  When I arrived I met with Ms. Lewis who had obvious bruising on her face and arm.  Ms. Lewis informed me that she had just been assaulted by her boyfriend, Mr. York.  Mr. York had already left the scene prior to my arrival.  Warrants were obtained for Mr. York for assault and violation of 50-B order.  At the time of this report the warrants had not been served.

On Tuesday, August 23, 2011 at approximately 2346 hours, I was dispatched to 201 Lansdowne Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The call was later reclassified as an assault.The suspect, Timothy Wayne Guyer, was arrested for domestic assault on a female and habitual misdemeanor assault.Magistrate Kokokjo placed Guyer in jail under a domestic hold.

On August 23, 2011, at approximately 2158 hours, I responded to 204 Venable Court in reference to a domestic dispute. Upon arrival, I made contact with the victim, Lisa Gardner, and the suspect Daniel Manzano.Gardner advised she was assaulted by her boyfriend, Manzano. She had a fresh scratch mark to her right cheek. She refused medical treatment. Photographs were taken of her injuries. Manzano was arrested for assault on a female.

On Friday, August 27, 2011 at about 9:44 P.M. I was dispatched to 6239 Mary Lee Way via departmental radio in regards to a domestic dispute. Upon my arrival I spoke to Ms. Salim and she informed me that her husband kicked her on the left side of her ribs.
On September 04, 2011 at 1900 hours I responded to the Police Department to speak with Ms. Murphy about a family situation.

On 08-21-2011 at 0702 hours I received a report of an assault  from Alamance Regional Hospital charge nurse Andrea Hall.  Upon returning the phone call I spoke to Lesslie Buchanan,another ER nurse, who stated that Theresa Lea came in complaining that her arm was hurting and that her boyfriend had pushed her down causing the injury.

On August 19, 2011 at approximately 0028 hours, I responded to the intersection of Brockett Avenue around Morgan place in reference to a fight. It was later reclassified as a domestic assault. An arrest was made at this time.
On 8-18-11 I was dispatched to 1290-1A Burton Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.

On 08/19/2011 at 1134 hours, I responded to 131-3B James Rd in reference to an assault that occurred at 1418 Welborn St.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Ms. Stephanie Shaw who advised that her nephew, was assaulted by his father.  There will be further investigation into this case.  No charges have been filed at the time of the report.
On August 17, 2011, at 1757 hours, I was dispatched to the Police Department reference  harassment / threats.The call was domestic related and the suspect is known.
On August 17, 2011, the defendant was arrested for a domestic-related assault after striking the victim in the face.
On 08/15/2011, at 0317hrs, I responded to the above address in reference to a disturbance.  The suspect vandalized the victims property.  No arrests have been made at this time.

On 8-14-11 at 1728 hours, I was dispatched to 1309 Chestnut Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.  When I arrived, I spoke to Rebeka East and Drexel Hodgin about the incident.  Mrs. East had an obvious injury from an assault.  Mr. Hodgin was arrested without incident.  There is no further information available at this time.

On 08/13/2011 at 2355hrs I responded to the the above address in reference to an Assault.  Both subjects involved were charged for Assault.  EMS responded to the scene and treated both subjects for injuries but they were not taken to the hospital.

On Tuesday August 16, 2011 contact was made with Mr. Luther Lord who reported his 14 year old son missing.Lord advised that his son has been missing since Saturday August 13, 2011.The juvenile was entered into NCIC as missing and a look issued through Communications.

On 08/13/2011 at 1400 hours, Officers responded to a fraud at 2627-E Suffolk Ave.  Upon their arrival, officers met with the victim, which stated that she knew the suspect and had proof of the credit card transactions.  She advised Officers of who the suspect was and where he could be located.  The suspect was located and spoke freely with officers about the situation.  The suspect was arrested for the transaction for the day of 08/13/2011.Other incidents are still under investigation.

offense: ASSAULT ON A FEMALE BY MALE OVER 18 YEARS OF AGE
body: On the 13th day of August, 2011 at approximately 1:30am, Officer Griffiths and I responded to 4505 Crowne Lake Ci. Apt1F, in reference to a domestic assault that had already taken place. Upon arrival, the female party involved had apparent injuries from what appeared to be an assault.The offender was then arrested and taken to the High Point Jail.

On 08-11-2011 I responded to 634 Park St. in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I spoke with Ms. Henderson and her daughter.  Ms. Henderson`s daughter stated that her mother had assaulted her.
A sexual assault of a juvenile occurred in the Northwest section of High Point.
Officer Inthisane and I, Officer Lemons, responded to a domestic disturbance at 1412-A Davis Av.  After my investigation I arrested Carlesias Dumas and Howard Dumas for assaulting each other.

On Wednesday August 10, 2011, at approximately 0737 hours, while responding to another location for a domestic disturbance, I discovered the suspect had also forcefully entered 1415-B West Avenue to pursue his victim.Upon arrival, I spoke with victims and witnesses who stated that Famous Arsenio Mason had broken into two different locations and assaulted multiple people.  Mason was arrested a few hours later and placed in jail.

On Wednesday August 10, 2011 at approximately 0737 hours I was dispatched to 1467-B West Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.Upon arrival I spoke with victims and witnesses who stated that Famous Arsenio Mason had broken into two different locations and assaulted multiple people.  Mason was arrested a few hours later and placed in jail.

On Tuesday August 9, 2011 at approximately 0712 hours, I was dispatched to 341-F Henley Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.Upon arrival I spoke with the victim who stated that she had argued with her boyfriend about leaving and he had assaulted her. No arrests have been made at this time.

On Monday, August 08, 2011, at approximately 12:40am, Lt. Gamble spoke with Ericka Johnson via public service reference a vandalism.  The vandalism took place at 527 Flint Ave, the home of Ericka Johnson.  Based on Lt. Gamble`s investigation, he obtained a warrant for arrest for Mr. Brendan Lamar Johnson for Injury to Real Property.  The warrant was entered into NCAWARE.
On 08/07/2011 at 0230hrs I responded to the above address in reference to an Assualt.  The victim had minor injuries and refused EMS.  The suspect was arrested and placed in the Guilford County Jail.

On 08/06/2011 at 0157hrs I responded to the above address in reference to an Assault.  The victim had a minor laceration on his left shoulder and the suspect was arrested and placed in the Guilford County Jail.

On 08/06/2011 at 12:10 hours, while on routine patrol, I observed a dispute in the front yard of 1108 Guyer St.  The subjects were separated to determine a solution.  The offender was arrested after determining what had happened.The suspect was transported to the magistrates office and placed on a domestic hold.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On 08-04-2011 at 1227 hours, Jenny Mills reported that the father of her child, Jamaal Burgess, was at the Triad Child Developmental Center where her son attends daycare and was violating a 50B order that she had in her possession.I found Mr Burgess inside the daycare and verified that there was an active 50B order in effect restricting him from being at the daycare that his son attends.I charged Mr Burgess with violating a Domestic Violence Protection Order and he is currently being held in the High Point Jail on a domestic hold.

On August 3, 2011 I responded to 131 Spring Garden Circle in reference to a domestic disturbance call. Upon arrival I contacted Jason Cobb and Sheena McRae. Through investigation it was determined an assault occurred and Cobb was later taken into custody.
Just after 1800 hours on this date, I responded 508 Richardson Ave. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Denika Rice was arrested and charges with violating a Domestic Violence Protection Order.

On August 3, 2011 I was dispatched to the Police Department in reference to an assault by strangulation.  I contacted the victim, Ashley Phillips, who advised that her boy-friend strangled her during an argument.
On Wednesday, 08/03/2011, I responded to 601 N Elm St in reference to an assault that occurred at another location. This case is open for further investigation.
On 08-02-2011 I responded to 513 Flint Av in reference to a vandalism. Upon my arrival Ms. Jessica Hayes, and Ms. Deborah Hayes advised that Mr. Terrence Sparks Jr. had damaged their door.

On this date I responded to 1615-A Brockett Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival, I made contact with Ms. Gidderon and Mr. Pemberton.  Both subjects advised they were romantically involved and they had been assaulted by each other.  Both subjects had visible signs of assault and with further investigation both subjects were arrested.

On Sunday, July 31, 2011 at about 10:44 A.M. I was dispatched to 1813 Futrelle Drive via departmental radio in regards to a suicide. Upon my arrival at 10:54 P.M. I met with fire fighters from squad 4 and they informed me that they had the deceased body of white male inside the residence. They further stated that in appears that body suffered a self inflicted gunshot wound. Upon my entry into the residence and my observations it appears to be a self inflicted wound as the cause of death at this time.

On 07/29/2011 around 2226 hours Officers responded to a domestic disturbance at 308 Hickory Chapel Rd.  Officers arrived on scene and made contact with Mark Ferguson who had previously been banned from the property by POII Knight, and Sharon Temple.  Officers determined that a domestic assault had occured when Ferguson had struck Temple in the left eye with a closed fist.  Officers arrested Ferguson, charging him with Assault on a Female, Domestic Criminal Trespass and Communicating threats.  Ferguson was held on a domestic hold.

On the 28th day of July, 2011 at approximately 0645 hours I responded to 4401 Crowne Lake Circle Apt 1E in reference to a domestice disturbance.Both parties had sustained injuries that were apparent.Both parties were then arrested.
On 7-27-11 I responded to High Regional Hospital in reference to a disturbance.
On July 26, 2011 at 2054 hours, we were dispatched to 3749 Deerfield St. in reference to a public disturbance.The one person was arrested on scene without incident.

On this date I responded to 304 Morgan Place in reference to an assault in progress.  Upon my arrival, I made contact with the victim Ms. Brown.  Ms. Brown had visible injuries.  Mr. Thompson was arrested and taken to the police department in reference to processing.
I responded to 3000-B Roberts Ct on a reported burglary.  Upon arrival I spoke with Ms Terry.
