When I arrived, the victim stated that she told her son to leave her house yesterday afternoon and he left.  When she woke up this morning, her son was sitting in the living room area.  She asked him how did he got in and he stated that he broke in.

Officer A. Simerson and I responded to a domestic call where Branka Stanivukovic stated to Communications that her boyfriend, Simon Ford, beat her and that she was bleeding and needed an ambulance.  Officer Simerson arrived first and made contact with Ms. Stanivukovic at the intersection of Aberdeen Rd. and Beverly Hills Dr.  She was sitting in a black BMW SUV, NC WWJ-8028.  She was not bleeding.  We obtained information from Ms. Stanivukovic and she was transported by ambulance to the Moses Cone Emergency Department on Willard Dairy Rd.   Officer Simerson and I then spoke with Mr. Ford and Matthew Broach, a witness, at 3822 Beverly Hills Dr.Branka Stanivukovic was charged with Simple Assault and released on a $500.00 dollar unsecured bond.I recommend this case be cleared by arrest.
On Sunday, 07/24/2011, I responded to the 2700 block of Annmoore Ci in reference to a domestic disturbance. There is suspect information and this case is open for further investigation.
On 7-24-11 at approximately 0100 hours I responded to 118 E Swathmore Ave Apt 1F in reference to a domestic disturbance call.  A subject was arrested for assault.
On 07/23/2011, I responded to 1006 North College Drive in reference to a domestic assault.

On 07-23-2011 at approximately 2038 hrs I responded to 513 Chestnut Dr reference domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I spoke with the victim who advised they were struck in the face.  When I inquired further the victim would give me no information about how it happened, or who did it.  The victim would also not let me take a picture of the injury.

On July 23, 2011, the defendant was arrested for Domestic Criminal Trespass after being told to leave his ex-girlfriend`s residence repeatedly and in the presense of the police.  The defendant left and returned while the police were still present.

On 07-22-2011 at approximately 2221 hours I arrived at 205 Seachire Ct in reference to a domestic disturbance. Through further investigation it was determined Harold Crawford Jr violated a domestic violence protective order. Harold Crawford was charged with same and confined to the High Point Detention Facility.

On 07/21/2011, I responded to 239 NORTHPOINT AV in reference to a domestic disturbance in progress. Upon my arrival, I made contact with the victim who advised that she was assaulted by her boyfriend, MICHAEL ANTHONY BYERS during an argument.Upon further investigation, MICHAEL ANTHONY BYERS was arrested and charged with assault on a female.

offense: ASSAULT ON A FEMALE BY MALE OVER 18 YEARS OF AGE
body: On 7/21/2011 around 1825 hour`s officers responded to 808 Lakecrest Av on a reported domestic disturbance.  Officers arrived on scene and made contact with Heidi Love, who reported being assaulted by her boyfriend, Bryan David Garrett.  Photographs were taken of Loves injuries and a warrant was obtained on Garrett.

On Wednesday July 20th 2011 around 1848 hours I responded to 1430 Futrelle Dr. in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I spoke to Jason Cress. He stated that he had been assaulted prior to our arrival. Jason did have a red mark on the right side of his face.

On 08/07/2011, at approximately 0730, Officers were dispatched to 808 Putman St in reference to an alarm.  Upon arrival, Officers noticed the front door appeared to be damaged.  Investigation is still on going.
On 07/20/2011 at approximately 0030, I responded to a domestic disturbance.  Listed suspect was arrested and charged accordingly.  There were no serious injuries.
On Monday July 18, 2011, at approximately 1548 hours, I was dispatched to 801 Arlington Street in reference to a harassment call.

On this date, officers were dispatched to a victim of an assault, standing by at a southside business. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed that the female was assaulted by her boyfriend at another location. The assault resulted in the bruising of her upper arm. The suspect would later be arrested, and charged with domestic assault. The suspect would be placed into the custody of the Guilford County Jail on NO BOND.
On July 18, 2011, at approximately 1201 hours, I was dispatched to a vandalism on Franklin Street.  When I arrived, the homeowner stated that someone damaged his front door.
On July 17, 2011, the defendant was arrested for assaulting his girlfriend.

I responded to 1449-B West Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I met with the complainant, Latonya Spann, and her mother, Gloria Dingle.  Spann and Dingle stated they had been at a party on Winslow Avenue earlier this evening.  They met the victim, Aaron McCullough, at the party.  While he was talking with Spann and Dingle, the suspect, Malachia Alje Jones, approached Spann and began confronting her about McCullough.
On 7-17-11 at approximately 0149 hours I responded to 602 E Kearns Ave in reference to a domestic call.  Upon arrival I spoke with the victim who stated that her boyfriend assaulted her.
On 7-16-11 I was dispatched to the intersection of South Rd at English Rd. in reference to a domestic disturbance.

On this date, officers were dispatched to an assault with a knife. Upon police arrival, and investigation revealed that the victim, is the boyfriend of the suspect. An altercation occurred relating to the suspect accusing her boyfriend of infidelity. The suspect then produced a knife and began to slash at the victim. The victim was cut before he, and a mutual friend, of both victim and suspect, could disarm her.The suspect was arrested and charged with Assault with a Deadly Weapon Inflicting Injury. The suspect was placed in the custody on no bond, due to domestic related offense.

On 07/16/2011 at 1525 hours, I responded to 1307 Bradshaw St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Mr. Tyrone Chavis and Ms. Heather Garrett who were involved in a disturbance.  Mr. Chavis was arrested for Assault on a Female and Ms. Garrett was arrested for Domestic Criminal Trespass and Simple Assault.

On 07/16/2011, I responded to the High Point Regional Hospital in reference to an assault.  I arrived and made contact with Mr. Archie.  He advised that he got bleach flung into his eyes during an argument with his girlfriend, Ms. McCall-Pryce.  I interviewed Ms. McCall-Pryce and she advised that she and her boyfriend got into a verbal altercation which resulted in bleach being flung on both parties.  Based on physical evidence and interviews, I decided not to press charges on either subject.
On July 16, 2011, the defendant was arrested for assaulting his sister.

On 07/13/2011 at approximately 1830 I was dispatched to 601 Cork Tree Way. Upon my arrival, I met with Ms. Katrillia Quick and Ms. Cynthia Quick. After making contact with all involved parties and DSS, we were advised that the matter would be investigated by DSS tomorrow.
On 07/12/2011 I responded to 1143 E Lexington Av. in reference to a possible child neglect.  This matter was further investigated and D.S.S. responded.

On July 11th, 2011 at 2241 hours, I was dispatched to 314-B Ennis Street for a domestic disturbance.Upon arrival, and with fill-in assistance by Officers E. Berrier and T. Mills, we spoke with the two parties involved, Linda and James McLeod.  It was ultimately determined that the two were arguing and the argument became heated to the point where there was shoving between the two.  According to Ms. McLeod, the argument was over communication issues and according to Mr. McLeod, the argument was over money.Ms. McLeod reported that the two have been married since November 2010 and have argued often since.  They were supposedly separated, but both were still residing at 314-B Ennis Street.During the scuffle, Ms. McLeod sustained a minor scratch to the right side of her neck and the right side of her chest.  Mr. McLeod sustained scratches to his upper chest, both arms and his shirt was ripped.  I took digital photos of the two`s injuries and logged the photos in as evidence.  In looking inside the residence, particularly the living room, there was a damaged glass "DAD" figurine that was reportedly thrown by Ms. McLeod at Mr. McLeod and a jar of hair gel broken that was thrown during the argument as well.There was a four-year old child at the residence during the altercation, but was reported to be in her room at the time.  Ms. McLeod`s father came to assume responsibility of the 4 year-old before both Mr. and Ms. McLeod were arrested for domestic assault and taken to the Magistrate`s Office.Mr. and Ms. McLeod was taken before Magistrate Kokajko (Officer Berrier transported and jailed Mr. McLeod while I handled Ms. McLeod).  Both were given domestic holds.

On 07/11/2011 at 1130hrs, I responded to the above address in reference to a Domestic Disturbance.  The victim had signs of assault and was taken to the ER.  The suspect was no longer at the scene and charges have been obtained for the suspects arrest.

On this date I responded to 3117 Wayne Ave in reference to a domestic disturbance between family members.  When I arrived, I met with the mother Ms. Renika Hamilton who stated her son, Jamarius Hamilton assaulted her with a hammer.  Ms. Hamilton had a minor laceration on her left forearm/wrist that she stated occurred from her son striking her.  Ms. Hamilton did not need medical treatment at this time.  Ms. Hamilton swore out warrants on her son Jamarius.  I arrested Mr. Jamarius and transported him to the Guilford County Jail in High Point where he was issued a $500.00 secured bond.

On Monday, 7/11/11, at approximately 2020 hours, I responded to the High Point Police Department at 1009 Leonard Avenue regarding an assault reported by Courtney Hayes.  I met with Hayes who told me that her boyfriend, Rodney Flowers had assaulted her by slapping, pushing, choking, biting her throughout the day.  Hayes said that Flowers stole her cell phone and refused to allow her to leave or make a phone call.  I obtained a Warrant for Arrest against Flowers for Assault on a Female.

I responded to 1921 Middlewood Ct. in reference to an assault.  Upon arrival, I met with the complainant/victim, Kenneth Godwin, W/M/81.  Godwin stated he was assaulted by his wife.  See Officer narrative for further details.
On Sunday, 07/10/2011, I responded to 202 Shadybrook Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance. An arrest was made in this case.
On 7-9-11 at approximately 0441 hours while on uniform patrol I responded to 407 White Oak St in reference to a domestic violence call.   A subject was arrested for assault charges.

On this date, officers were dispatched to a southside residence, reference to an assault. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed that a girlfriend and boyfriend had an altercation over a cellular phone, which led to a physical confrontation. The female had a 1/4" fingernail scratch over her right breast. The female advised this had occurred when her boyfriend pushed her. The boyfriend admitted the assault.The male was arrested for Domestic Assault, and placed into the custody of the Guilford County Jail, on no bond.
I responded to 1013-D Roberts Ln on a reported assault.  Upon arrival I spoke with Ms Gainey.

On this date and time, I responded to 601 N Elm St and the High Point Regional Health System Emergency Department in reference to an assault that had already occurred.  Upon arrival, I spoke with a female who advised her husband had assaulted her.

On 07-07-2011 around 1727 hours I spoke to the victim in reference to an assault that occurred at 518 Denny Street on 07-06-2011 around 1830 hours.  The victim was transported to the police department for further investigation and processing.  The suspect was located and was charged with assault on a female and violation of a domestic violence protective order.

On Wednesday, 7/6/11, at approximately 0925 hours, I responded to 603-E E. Commerce Avenue regarding a domestic disturbance.  A description of the suspect was broadcast over the radio, and I surveyed the surrounding area but was unable to locate said suspect.  I met with Inetta Sealey at 603-E E. Commerce Avenue who told me her boyfriend, Tyrone Carter had assaulted her by strangulation.  I transported Sealey to the Magistrate`s Office where she obtained a Warrant for Arrest for Assault on a Female and to the Clerk of Court`s Office where she applied for a Domestic Violence Protective Order.

On 07/06/2011 at approximately 0343 hours I responded to 2907-A Esco PL in reference to an investigate call.  Upon my arrival I made contact with Mrs Tanya Aughtry who advised that her ex-boyfriend, Mr Christopher Wilson, had broke into the residence, assaulted her, damaged personal property and would not allow her to leave the residence.  Subsequent to investigation, Mr Wilson was arrested on several charges including assault on a female.
The listed suspect assaulted the listed victim.  The suspect was arrested and the victim suffered minor injuries.

On July 4, 2011, at approximately 2340 hours, I was flagged down by Crystal Coe in the 600 block of North Main in reference to an assault. She advised that her husband (Lee E. Coe) had assaulted her and was in the area. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate him. I took out a warrant for Mr. Coe that same night.Mr. Coe was located at his friend`s house (600 Hawthorne Av) the same night at approximately 0056 hours (7/5/11). He was arrested for the above assault without incident. He was processed at the police department and transported to the Magistrate`s Office. He was given a domestic hold.

Officers responded to the residence of the victim who reported a rape that had occurred at her residence on 07/04/2011.  Evidence was collected from the scene and detectives notified of the incident, suspect is known to the victim and all information forwarded to Detective Hosier for investigation.

On 07/04/2011, around 1737 hours, I was dispatched to 110 E Fairfield Rd, Food Lion Store #1290, in reference to a shoplifting call.  Upon arrival, I made contact with Mr. Teddy Hall, Food Lion Loss Prevention, who advised that he had observed, Ms. Shacora Roebuck, conceal merchandise in her purse and then attempt to take the merchandise from the store without paying.  Ms. Roebuck was taken into custody and charged with shoplifting.

On 07/04/2011, I responded to 207 BRINKLEY PL in reference to a domestic disturbance that occurred at 835 PINE CIRCLE DR. Upon my arrival, I located the involved parties near the intersection of NEWELL ST and RANKIN PL. Upon further investigation, one of the parties, JAMES EDWARD BRICE was determined to have assaulted the victim; BRICE was arrested and charged with misdemeanor assault with a deadly weapon in the presence of a minor.

On 07-03-2011 at approximately 2041 hours I responded to 508 Player Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance. Through further investigation Bernard Breeden was charged with violating a domestic protective order. He was confined to the High Point Detention Facility on a domestic hold.

Ms. Nwabueza reported that her baby`s daddy (Mr. Henard) came to her grandmother`s residence at 1108 Anderson Pl. and assaulted her.  She said he punched her in the face and grabbed her.  She showed a couple of marks and scratches on her face and back.  The left side of her face was slightly swollen as well.  Ms. Nwabueza said that she did want to press charges against Mr. Henard.  She said that she would drive herself to the Magistrate`s Office and that her mother would ride with her.  Neither Ms. Nwabueza nor Mr. Henard live at the address on Anderson, but that is where this incident took place.
On 07-03-2011 I responded to the 2100 block of N Centennial Street in reference to a domestic disturbance in the roadway.  Upon my arrival I made contact with David Williams and Lisa Womack arguing.

On the date and time list above, Officers made contact with Victim (1) who advised Offender (1) struck him in the head with a vase.  Offender (1) was arrested and charged with Assault.  She was placed in the Guilford County Jail under a Domestic Hold.  Photographs were taken of Victim (1)`s cuts.

On July 02, 2011 at 1813 hours I responded to 925-A South Rd in reference to an assault.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the victim Ms. Fontaine Pacheco.  She stated that her brother the offender pushed her and she called 911.

The victim stated that at approximately 1500 hours she was assaulted by the offender (her son) at their residence.  The victim stated that the offender and the witness were in an argument over a drink.  The victim stated that she stepped in and defended the witness.  The offender then assaulted her.  The offender fled the scene prior to my arrival.I obtained warrants for the offender for Assault by Strangulation and Assault on a Female on the offender.  A BOL was issued for the offender.
At about 1200 hours, I responded to 602-B Richardson Ave in reference to Rosa sorto having a gun pointed at her by an unknown person.

On 07/02/2011 at 0045 hours, I responded to 2227 Shadow Valley Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, I spoke with Ms. Flora Mohamed who advised that her ex-husband, Mr. Samuel Euaby, came to her residence and caused a disturbance.  Ms. Mohamed had an active 50-B protective order against Mr. Euaby.  Mr. Euaby was arrested and charged with a 50-B violation.

On 07/01/2011 I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance at 804-B W Willis Av.  I was able to speak with the victim and obtain suspect information.  The suspect had already left the area when I arrived and was unable to be located by other officers.

On Thursday, June 30, at about 4;50 A.M.  I was dispatched to 720-L Westchester Drive via departmental radio in regards to a domestic assault. Upon my arrival I  spoke to Ms. Tabatha Bolin and Keri Bolin outside the residence. Tabatha stated that her fiance assaulted by punching her in the head several times and pointed a knife at her. Keri also stated that her mother`s fiance pointed the same knife at her in a threatening manner.

On 06/28/2011 at approximately 2300 hours I responded to 1204 East Green Drive Room number 4 in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I met with Mr. Henderson Jerome Miller who advised that he had been assaulted by Ms. Tammy Bladwin. As a result of the investigation, Ms. Bladwin was arrested and charged with assault.

On the 27th of June I was dispatched to 800 South Road for a disturbance call.  When I arrived there were several people standing in the front yard.  I noticed two immediately that needed medical attention, Ms Johnson and Mr Powers.  Johnson and Powers stated they were the two in the initial argument and assault.  EMS arrived on scene where Johnson was treated and released on sight.  However, Powers injuries were more severe and required treatment at the hospital.  Johnson was arrested after being treated at that time for assault and damage to personal property.
On 06/27/2011 I responded to the E.R. in reference to an assault.  I made contact with the victim who stated that her x-boyfriend assaulted her by punching her.

On today`s date, I was dispatched to a domestic call at 1727 Gavin Dr.  The caller advised he had been assaulted and the other party had left prior to police arrival.  The suspect was located and arrested shortly after the incident.

On 06/25/2011 at about 11:30 PM I was dispatched to 805 Langford Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I arrived at the scene and spoke with the complainant, Kenneth Horne, who stated that his ex-wife, Evelyn Horne assaulted him during an argument.  Evelyn Horne was then arrested for the domestic related assault without incident.

On 06-25-2011 I responded to the ER in reference to an assault. Upon my arrival I was met by the victim, Ms. Westray. She advised me that her boyfriend, Mr. Ellerbe, had assaulted her several times causing the cut above her left eye.
On June 24, 2011, the defendant was arrested for assaulting his girlfriend.

On June 24, 2011 at approximately 1937 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance call on Montree Court.  When I arrived the mother had a large cut above her right eye.  She stated that her daughter struck her.  I located the daughter upstairs and arrested her for assault.

On Friday, June 25, 2011 at about 8:04 P.M.  I was dispatched to 808 Lakecrest Avenue, apartment 1306 in regards to a domestic disturb via departmental radio. Upon our arrival Ms. Staylor stated that that live-in boyfriend assaulted her.

On June 24, 2011 at approximately 1654 hours, I was dispatched to a domestic disturbance call on Mall Loop Road.  When I arrived, Mr. Smith was seen running outside flailing his arms.  As I approached I saw him run to the trunk of his vehicle.  It appeared that Mr. Smith was attempting to pop his trunk to retrieve something.  When I approached him he backed away from his trunk and started waving his arms in an erratic manner.  I detained him and went inside to talk to the store manager and victims.
On Friday, June 24, 2011 at approximately 0230 hours, I was dispatched to 1026 Meadowbrook Boulevard in reference to a domestic disturbance.

On Tuesday, 06/21/2011, I responded to 1631 W Rotary Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance that occurred at an address on Tipton St. Suspect information was obtained and an arrest was made in this case.
On Tuesday June 21, 2011 at 1451 hours I responded to 402-B Anaheim St. in reference to a disturbance involving 2 juveniles.
On 6/21/11 at approximately 1429hrs I responded to a reported domestic disturbance.

On 06/21/2011 at approximately 0337 hours I responded to 631 Paramount ST in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I made contact with the victim and reporting party, Miss Natasha Price, who advised that her ex-boyfriend, Mr Ricky Haywood JR, had made entry into the residence, threatened to beat her, and then assaulted her by striking her twice with a football cleat before fleeing the residence on foot.  Warrants for Mr Haywood`s arrest were obtained for the following charges:  assault on a female, misdemeanor breaking and entering, interfering with 911, and misdemeanor larceny.

On 6-20-11 at approximately 2328hrs I responded to 404 Junior St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I observed Ms Michelle McFadden and Ms Danielle McFadden on the front porch engaging in an argument.  As I approached Ms Danielle McFadden was seen hitting Ms Michelle McFadden over the head with a bucket.  Ms McFadden resisted when I went to place her under arrest.Ms McFadden was charged with Simple Assault, Assault on a Law Enforcement Officer, and Resist Delay Obstruct.
On this date, I responded to an domestic violence call between a male and female.  The male subject was arrested for assault on a female.

At 2206 hours on 6/19/2011, the victim called 911 to report that she had been assaulted by her boyfriend in the 100 block of South Main Street.  The suspect fled the scene upon police arrival and was captured two blocks away running from the area.  The victim had a minor rash on her right elbow from where the victim stated the suspect grabbed her, and also had a swollen upper lip on the left side where the victim stated she was punched by the suspect with his closed right fist.  After further investigation, this incident was unfounded, since the injuries reported by the victim occurred earlier in the day by a separate suspect and had already been reported to police.

On this date, I was dispatched to the High Point Regional Hospital regarding an assault with a deadly weapon.  The assault and location was unknown at the time.  A black male had been stabbed on his upper body by a subject he was acquainted with.  The injuries were not life threatening.
On June 19, 2011 at 1600 hours I responded to the north east section of High Point in reference to a domestic disturbance.

On Sunday, 6/19/11, at approximately 1430 hours, I responded to the corner of Park Street at Wise Avenue regarding a domestic disturbance.  Kesha Carter and her two children flagged down officers on a traffic stop and told them she had been assaulted by her boyfriend at 1029 Asheboro Street.  Carter showed me very minor injuries and I took photographs of same.  I spoke with Carter`s boyfriend at 1029 Asheboro Street who advised that Carter was intoxicated and the aggressor of the argument and that she pushed him and he pushed her back.  A neighbor at 1031 Asheboro Street confirmed that Carter was the aggressor and said that he did not witness any punching or further assault on Carter.  Both Carter and her boyfriend were advised to seek warrants and possibly domestic violence protective orders.

On 06/18/2011 at 2000hrs I responded to the above location in reference to an Assault.  Both suspects were at the scene upon Police arrival and arrested.  There were minor signs of Assault but EMS was not needed at the scene.
On 06-17-2011 at 1531 hours, I responded to 207 Brinkley Street in reference to neglect of a family member.

On 06-17-2011 I responded to 2429 W Green Dr in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival Officer Griffiths was already on scene. There was a broken window in room 128 with blood on the ground and in the room.
On Thursday, 06/16/2011, I responded to 1008 Campbell St in reference to a domestic assault. Both parties were present upon arrival and an arrest was made in this case.
On 6-16-11 I responded in reference to a report of unknown trouble at 308 Hickory Chapel Road.

On 06-16-2011 at 1107 hours I responded to a domestic disturbance at 505 E Green Dr.  The victim came to that magistrate`s office to obtain warrants on the suspect for an assault that occurred at 604 Rolling Green Dr.  The suspect was arrested and placed in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On June 16, 2011 at approximately 0104 hours, I was dispatched  to a domestic disturbance at 3736 Roling Road.  When I arrived the victim stated that they were assaulted by the suspect.  While the victim was speaking the suspect returned to the residence.  The suspect was then placed under arrest.

On 06-15-2011 I responded to 2916-H E. Kivett Dr, The Oaks At Silver Ridge, in reference to a domestic distrbance.  When I arrived I spoke to Ms. Wright and Mr. Lindsey about the situation.  Upon further investigaton Mr. Lindsey was arrested and charged with an Assault on a Female.  Mr. Lindsey went before the Magistrate and recieved no bond and was placed in the Guilford County Jail .
On Saturday, June 11th, 2011, at 0004 hours, I responded to 108 Fisher Avenue in reference to an assault with a deadly weapon inflicting serious injury.

On 06/10/11 at 2007 hours, HPPD Officers responded to 4001 Peregrine Ct.  Probable cause was developed to arrest the listed offender and during arrest proceedings, the offender attempted to strike the listed officer with a closed fist.  Appropriate force was used to effect the arrest of the listed offender.

On 06-09-2011 at approximately 1352hrs I responded to 2410 Van Buren ST in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I made contact with the victim, Ms Debra King, the witness, Mr Lester Ring, and the suspect, Mr Danny Lawson. All subjects encountered at the scene were residents at the address.                Ms King, Mr Lawson`s sister, reported to me that Mr Lawson had become extremely intoxicated earlier on this date, and had then become aggressive and belligerent. After Ms King and Mr Lawson had begun to argue, he wrapped one of his arms around her neck in a reverse head-lock, and then grabbed her about her neck with his other hand. Mr Ring, Ms King`s and Mr Lawson`s uncle, then intervened to defend Ms King and became engaged in an affray with Mr Lawson. The disturbance ended shortly before my arrival. Ms King had some redness around her neck, but advised that she had never felt unable to breathe nor close to losing consciousness during the assault. Both Mr Ring and Mr Lawson had facial cuts and bruises from their affray.                Officer Berrier responded to the scene to collect photographs for evidence. All involved parties declined EMS response.                Mr Lawson was placed under arrest at the scene without incident and charged with assault on a female at the Magistrate`s Office. Mr Lawson was subsequently transported to HPRHS, treated, and then admitted to the High Point Jail on a secured $300.00 bond.               There are no other suspects or witnesses.

On Wednesday, June 8, 2011 at approximately 1034 hours, I was dispatched to 503 Forrest Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.Upon arrival I spoke with the victim who stated that he had been struck by his girlfriend.  The suspect was arrested and placed in jail under a domestic hold.

On Tuesday, June 7, 2011 at approximately 1115 hours, I was dispatched to 624 Woodlawn Road in reference to an unknown trouble call.Upon arrival I discovered it was a domestic disturbance with an assault.  The suspect was arrested and placed in jail on a domestic hold no bond.

On June 7, 2011 at approximately 0817 hours, I responded to the intersection of Kivett Drive and Brentwood Street in reference to a domestic dispute in the roadway.Upon arrival I discovered the victim had been assaulted.  I arrested the suspect and took him to jail.
On June 06, 2006 at 1957 hours, I was dispatched to 206 -(6) Old Winston Rd. in reference to an assault. The suspect is known.

One this date, officers were dispatched to a domestic disturbance. Upon police arrival, an investigation revealed an assault had occurred. The aggressor was arrested and charged with Domestic Assault. The defendant  placed into the custody of the Guilford County Jail on No-Bond.

On Monday, June 6, 2011 at about 1:39 P.M. 	I was dispatched to 2207 E. Lexington Avenue via departmental radio in regards to a domestic dispute. Upon my arrival I spoke Ms. Burney and stated that her son shoved her into the wall and scratched her left upper and lower arm.

offense: ALL OTHER ALL OTHER CRIMINAL OFFENSES
body: On June 5, 2011 I responded to 503 Marion Ct. in reference to a domestic situation in which Mrs. Deer called police for a 50-B violation in which her husband Mr. Ken Mabor was at her residence.Mrs. Deer advised that she left the home at approximately 1700hrs to wash the families clothes and returned just after 2200hrs. Upon arrival, Mrs. Deer stated that she found Mr. Ken Mabor in the home and asked him how he got inside and to leave. Mrs. Deer stated that her children let him in the home because he told them he did not have anywhere to go.  When Mr. Ken Mabor would not leave the residence Mrs. Deer called the police without his knowledge.
On 6-5-11 I was dispatched to 702 Kennedy Av. in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I spoke with Tiana King who stated that her husband, Karl King had assaulted her.
On June 5, 2011 at 0139am I was dispatched to 1201-B W Green Dr reference to an assault taking place.  Through the investigation one person was arrested and charged.
On 06-04-2011 at 2313 hours, I responded to the intersection of East Commerce Avenue and Park Street in reference to an assault.

On this date I responded to the above location in reference to a domestic disturbance.  The caller stated that she had a protection order on her husband and that he showed up at her residence and was inside.

On 6/2/2011 at around 1630 hours I was dispatched to 210 N Centennial Ave for a rolling domestic disturbance.  When I arrived I saw a hispanic male trying to get a little hispanic girl to come with him and an adult hispanic female crying holding a baby.  The male was detained, Ricardo Del-Aguila.  Del-Aguila stated that he and his girlfriend, Norma Alvarez were arguing about relationship problems. Del-Aguila was cited for driving without being licensed and 2 counts of failing to secure a child under 4 in a proper child seat.  There were no signs of an assault.  Del-Aguila was released from police custody.

On 06/03/2011 at 0335 hours, I responded to the above address in reference to a disturbance.  The complainant at the scene advised his estranged wife had assaulted him.  The complainant refused medical attention.  The complainants wife was arrested.
On 06-03-2011 I responded to 519-A Cross Street in reference to a domestic disturbance. One subject was arrested for assault.

On 06-09-2011 at 0856 hours, Lisa Matthews reported that she had found a tracking device on her vehicle and that she was being harassed by her estranged husband.  I observed a Trail brand tracking device attached to the trailer hitch of Matthews vehicle.

On 06/01/2011 at 2045 hours, I responded to High Point Regional ER in reference to an Assault.  The victim is being treated and nurses stated he will be released.  The victim did give any suspect information.

On 06/01/2011, I responded to 3751-3C BRACKNELL DR in reference to a domestic disturbance in progress. Upon my arrival, I made contact with the victim, SAMUEL JOSEPH HERRON who advised that he was struck in the face by his roommate and brother, JAMES HARVEY HERRON III. Upon further investigation, JAMES HARVEY HERRON III was arrested for simple assault after it was determined that he had assaulted the victim inside of the apartment.
On June 1, 2011, the defendants who are boyfriend and girlfriend were arrested with assaulting each other.  The boyfriend was also charged with breaking the windows out of his girlfriend`s car.

On 05-30-11 at 0948 hours I responded to 115 Avery Avenue in reference to a runaway juvenile.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the Reporting Party.  I searched for the runaway juvenile but did not locate him.  The runaway was entered into NCIC.

On 05-29-2011 at approximately 2049 hrs I responded to 204 Venable Ct reference a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I met with the victim who advised she was assaulted.  One subject was arrested on scene for assault.

On 05-29-2011 I responded to 2635-A Uwharrie Rd in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon my arrival I saw two small children running on Fairfield Rd away from Uwharrie.  As I turned the corner I saw the victim. Mr. Thompson, flagging me down while carrying his youngest child.  Mr. Thompson stated that his baby`s momma had broken into his house and assaulted him and his girlfriend. She then stole his car and tried to run over him and his girlfriend.

On 05/29/2011 at approximately 0302 hours, I was dispatched to 1022 Tabor Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I made contact with a Mr. Brandon Lawson and a Ms. Brittany Short.  As a result of my contact with them, Ms. Short was arrested and charged with a domestic related assault.

On this date I responded to 403 Idol St. in regards to a domestic dispute/assault.  I spoke with the parties involved, and determined probable cause existed that an assault did occur.  I placed the offender, David Anderson, under arrest for Assault on a Female.  While searching Mr. Anderson subsequent to the arrest, I located a plastic bag of marijuana in his right front pants pocket.  Anderson was charged with Assault on a Female and Misdemeanor Possession of Marijuana.  Anderson was placed in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.See Officer Narrative for further.

On Thursday, 5/26/11, at approximately 1520 hours, I responded to 903 Mill Avenue regarding a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I met with Toshia Poplin who told me she was arguing with her fiance Aaron St. John who had been holding her down and refusing to let her leave the residence.  There was a large visible rash on Poplin`s back which she advised came from St. John holding her down onto the steps of the front porch.  St. John was arrested and charged with simple assault and was held in the Guilford County Jail under a domestic hold.

On Wednesday, May 25th, 2011, I was dispatched to 511-A E. Commerce Av. in reference to a domestic assault that had just occurred.  The suspect, Derrick Letanna Manning, assaulted the victim by grabbing her hair, and punching her in the face.  The suspect left on foot prior to my arrival.Warrants were obtained on the suspect for Assault on a Female, Domestic Criminal Trespass, Misdemeanor Breaking and Entering and Injury to personal property.

On Friday May 25, 2012, at approximately 1033 hours, I was dispatched to 402 Montlieu Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance.Upon arrival, I spoke with the victim, who stated that his ex-girlfriend had entered his residence while he was out, using a key she had stolen on another day.  The subject was located in the area and arrested on multiple felony charges and multiple warrants as well.

The victim came to Piedmont Centre Family and Sports Medicine this morning for a follow up visit.  While the victim was being examined she made statements to her nurse (IO2) that she had possibly been assaulted.  The victim was being treated for a variety of medical issues and was being transported to Moses Cone Hospital to be admitted for her medical conditions.  The admisson to the hospital was not a result of the alleged assault.
On 5/24/11 at approximately 0310hrs I responded to a reported domestic disturbance.

On 05-23-11 at 0853 hours I responded to 1026 Meadowbrook Blvd. in reference to a runaway juvenile.  Upon my arrival I spoke with the Reporting Party.  The Reporting Party stated the Offender was last seen on 05-22-11 at 2300 hours.
On this date I responded to 800 Lake Ave, in reference to an assault.  The victim`s stated that they had been assaulted by the suspect.  Suspect was arrested and placed in the Guilford Co. Jail.
On 5-22-11 Amber Payton reports that she was the victim of an assault which occurred at 4120 Stonemill Drive.

On 05/21/2011 at approximately 0511hrs, I responded to 517-D E. Commerce Ave. in reference to a domestic disturbance. When I arrived on the scene the resident of the apartment advised me that her boyfriend kicked in her back door. While on the scene, I also discovered that the resident`s boyfriend had been assaulted as a result of the incident.

On 5/19/11 at approximately 2328 hours, I responded to a domestic dispute at 237-E North Point Avenue.  The dispute led to the arrest of Campbell and Farris for domestic assault.  Campbell was also charged with possession of marijuana.
The listed suspect forced entry into the listed victims house and assaulted same.  No serious injuries were incurred and as of this writing the suspect has not been located.

On 05-16-2011 at approximately 1807 hours I responded to 310 Windley Av in reference to a domestic disturbance. Through further investigation Sharequa Griffin was charged with simple assault and confined to the High Point Detention Center on a $100.00 secured bond. She was also served with a WFA for injury to personal property at 505 E Green Dr.

On 05-16-2011 at 1645 hours, I investigated a domestic disturbance with an assault that had occurred at the above listed location at approximately 1535 hours.  The female involved in the disturbance has been charged with simple assault and damage to personal property.  She was released on a $5000.00 unsecured bond and on condition that she not make contact with the listed victim.

The victim advised that she was assaulted by her juvenile son between 1330 hours and 1340 hours on 5/16/2011.  The juvenile court counselor for the juvenile was contacted by telephone and advised on the incident.  A Juvenile Petition was completed.

On Monday, March 16th, 2011, I responded to Laurel Springs Apartments in reference to a reported domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival I met with and spoke to an individual who stated that he had been assaulted by a family member.

On 05-16-2011 I responded to 1009 Winslow Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  When I arrived I spoke to the victim, Erica Bowman who had a busted lip.  Her busband, Jonathan Bowman was the suspect.  Mr. Bowman was arrested and charged with Assault on a Female.  He was placed in the Guilford County Jail under a Domestic Hold.

On 5-15-11 I was dispatched to 722 W English Rd. in reference to a domestic dispute. Upon my arrival I met with Makita Tillman. Tillman stated that she had been assaulted by her boyfriend, Nikulus Gray. Gray left prior to police arrival.

On May 14, 2011, at 1953 hours, I was dispatched to 506 Radford St, High Point, along with EMS in reference to a domestic assault.  Upon arrival, I spoke with several people present.  I learned that a fight had occurred between Whitney Cunningham and the father of her children, Victor McRae.  They have at least three children together, Cunningham is pregnant with another child of McRae`s, and they live together.  I determined Cunningham to be the aggressor in the altercation.  Cunningham was arrested and charged with a simple domestic assault on McRae.  Cunningham was also served with an order for arrest for felonious failure to appear in Rockingham County.  There were three children under the age of ten years in the presence of this fight.
On May 13, 2011 I was dispatched to 2138-F Chester Ridge Dr. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I contacted the victim, Stacy Laughlin, who advised that her boy-friend assaulted her.
On May 13, 2011 I was dispatched to 3727 Single Leaf Ci. in reference to a domestic disturbance.  I contacted the victim, Joycelynn Luster, who advised that her husband had assaulted her.

On this date I responded to 515 Cable Street in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon my arrival, I made contact with the victim Ms. Green.  Ms. Green had obvious signs of injuries.  The suspect Mr. Little was still on the scene.  Mr. Little was arrested and taken to the police department.

On Thursday, 5/12/11, at approximately 0430 hours, I responded to 722 Fairview Street regarding a domestic disturbance.  I met with Marcus Little and Lyntra Campbell who had gotten into a physical altercation.  Little was arrested without incident and brought to the police department where he was processed for fingerprints.  Little was charged with felony Assault by Strangulation.

On 05-12-2011 at 0039 hours I responded to 407 White Oak St in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I made contact with both parties involved who stated that they had gotten into a physical altercation.  Both parties were arrested and placed in the Guilford County Jail on secured bonds.

On 05-12-2011 at approximately 0030 hours I responded to 616 Arch St in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival I was advised by Charles Myres that his vehicle was vandalized and that he was assaulted.
On this date, I was dispatched to an unknown trouble call at 1340 Burton Avenue. Upon arrival, I spoke to the caller who advised she had been assaulted by an ex-boyfriend. She refused EMS.

On 05-10-2011 at 2017 hours I responded to 823-B Leonard Av in reference to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival I met with Ms Greene.  Ms Greene stated that her and her daughter had gotten into a physical altercation.  Ms Greene`s daughter had fled to the police department where Officer Delong came in contact with her.  Due to the inconsistencies in stories, no charges have been made at this time.

On 5-10-11 at approximately 1759hrs while enroute to a call I observed an assault on a female at 202 N Hoskins St.  The victim advised that the male suspect struck her several times in the face.Warrants for Assault on a Female were taken out on the suspect who fled the scene.
The listed suspect robbed the listed victim of the listed items.  He was arrested without incident.

On Monday May 9th 2011 around 2000 hours I responded to Youth Focus on Northpoint Av. in reference to an assault. Upon arrival I made contact with Hazel Glasgow. She advised that she was assaulted at O`Reilly Autoparts at 1912 N Main St.

On 05/09/2011 at approximately 0016 hours I responded to the intersection of Montlieu AV and Ellwood DR in reference to a female screaming for help.  Upon my arrival I made contact with Mr Kwame Redfern and Miss Anna Paengrord in the roadway walking S bound on Ellwood DR from Montlieu AV.  Subsequent to investigation it was determined that the subjects had been engaged in a domestic disturbance and Mr Redfern was arrested and charged with assault on a female.

I responded to 237 Northpoint Av, Apartment E, in reference to a stabbing.  While enroute, I was advised the suspect was still on scene.  Upon arrival, I met with the witness/complainant, John Smith Jr.  Smith told me the victim was in the bedroom.  I asked where the suspect was.  Smith stated she ran out the door when they heard the sirens.  I went to the back bedroom.  The victim was lying on the bed, awake and alert.  See officer narrative for further details.

On April 14, 2011, I responded to 206 - E Taylor Avenue in reference to a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, I made contact with both subjects inside of their apartment. On Tuesday April 05, 2011 at 1124 hours Officer Moss, Lemons, and I received a call of a residential burglary in progress at 1412-C Davis Av.  High Point Communications received a call from Ms. Grace Williams reporting that her boyfriend was attempting to kick the front door of her apartment in.  All three officers were in route to the apartment when Ms. Grace advised High Point Communications that the suspect fled the scene in a silver Honda Civic occupied by the suspect and two other black male occupants.  Officer Lemons and I noticed a vehicle matching the description leaving the area.  The vehicle was turning off Edmondson Pl. south bound on College Dr.  Officer Lemons and I conducted a high risk traffic stop on the vehicle while Officer Moss responded to the scene to gather further information and check on the reporting party.The suspect was the person in the vehicle Officer Lemons and I detained.The scene was processed by Officer Moss.  Photographs of the scene were taken by Officer Moss.
